Chapter: Bismillah at the beginning and praise at the end

728- On the authority of Omar bin Abi Salamah, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “Praise God and eat with your right hand, and eat from what follows you.” agreed.

729- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “When one of you eats, let him mention the name of God Almighty, and if he forgets to mention the name of God Almighty at the beginning, let him say: In the name of God, the beginning and the end.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith. 730- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God say: “If a man enters his house, and mentions God Almighty when he enters and when he eats food, Satan says to his companions: You have no place to stay or Dinner, and when he entered and did not mention God Almighty when he entered, Satan said: Have you spent the night and spent the night? And if he did not mention God Almighty when eating, he said: Have you spent the night and dinner? Narrated by Muslim. 731- On the authority of Hudhayfah, may God be pleased with him, he said: When we attended a meal with the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, we would not lay down our hands until the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would begin and put his hand down. One time we were preparing food with him, and a maid came as if she was being pushed, so she went to put her hand in the food, and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, took her by the hand, then came. A Bedouin seemed to be being pushed, so he took it by the hand. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “The devil considers food permissible if the name of God Almighty is not mentioned on it. And he brought this slave girl to make himself permissible for her, so I took her hand. Then he brought this Bedouin to make himself permissible for him, so I took his hand, and by the One in whose hand is my soul, his hand is in my hand with their hands.” Then he mentioned the name of God Almighty and ate. Narrated by Muslim.

732- On the authority of Umayyah ibn Makhshi the Companion, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was sitting, and a man was eating, and he did not say the name of God until not a morsel of his food remained. He raised it to his mouth and said: In the name of God, the beginning and the end. The Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, laughed, then said: Satan continued to eat with him, so when he mentioned the name of God, he vomited something. In his stomach. Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Nasa’i.

733- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was eating food with six of his companions, then a Bedouin came and ate it in two bites, and the Messenger of God’s prayers and peace said: Peace and blessings of God be upon him: “If He had named Him, He would have been sufficient for you.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith.

734- On the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him, that when the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would raise his table, he would say: “Praise be to God, great praise, good and blessed, neither sufficient nor sufficient.” On the authority of our Lord.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 735- On the authority of Muadh bin Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: Whoever eats food and says: Praise be to God who fed me this, and provided it for me without any help or help from me. Strength, he will be forgiven for his previous sins.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith. Chapter: There is no shame in food and it is desirable to praise it

736- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: “The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, never criticized food. If he desired it, he ate it, and if he disliked it, he left it.” Agreed upon.

737- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, asked his family about Adam, and they said: We have nothing but vinegar. So he called for it, and he began to eat and say: “How good is the vinegar, how is the vinegar?” Vinegar.” Narrated by Muslim. Chapter on what someone who prepares food while fasting says if he does not break his fast

738- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “If one of you is called, let him respond. If he is fasting, let him pray, and if he is not breaking his fast, let him eat.” Narrated by Muslim.

The scholars said: meaning. “Let him pray” means let him pray, and the meaning of “let him feed” means let him eat. Chapter: What someone says when someone is invited to eat and someone else follows him

739- On the authority of Abu Masoud Al-Badri, may God be pleased with him, he said: A man called the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, for food that the fifth of five had prepared for him, and a man followed them, and when he reached the door, the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said Peace and blessings of God be upon him: “This man has followed us, so if you wish, you may give him permission, and if you wish, he may return.” He said: “Rather, give him permission, O Messenger of God.” agreed. Chapter on eating from what follows and admonishing and disciplining those who eat it poorly

740- On the authority of Omar bin Abi Salamah, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I was a boy in the lap of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and my hand was wandering around the page, and the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “O boy, may God Almighty bless it.” And eat with your right hand and eat from what follows you.” Agreed upon.

His saying: “to wander” with the kasra of the ta’ and then a double yā’ under it, means: it moves and extends to the sides of the page. 741- On the authority of Salamah ibn al-Akwa’, may God be pleased with him, that a man ate with the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, with his left hand, and he said: “Eat with your right hand.” He said: “I cannot.” He said: “No, you can.” Only he prevented him. Pride, so he did not raise it to his mouth. Narrated by Muslim. Chapter on the prohibition of performing the Qur’an between two dates and the like

If he eats in a group without the permission of his companion

742- On the authority of Jablah bin Suhaim, he said: We had a bad year with Ibn al-Zubayr, and we were provided with dates. Abdullah bin Omar, may God be pleased with them both, was passing by us while we were eating, and he said: Do not compare, for the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was passing by us. He, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade pairing, then he said: “Unless the man asks his brother’s permission.” Agreed upon. Chapter on what someone who eats and is not satisfied says and does

743- On the authority of Wahshi bin Harb, may God be pleased with him, that the Companions of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: O Messenger of God, we eat and are not satisfied? He said: “Perhaps you will separate.” They said: Yes. He said: So gather together over your meal, and mention the name of God. May you be blessed in it.” Narrated by Abu Dawud 

		 		 	

Chapter: Enjoining eating from the side of the bowl and forbidding eating from the middle

744- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Blessing descends in the middle of the food, so eat from its edges and do not eat from its middle.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith. 745- On the authority of Abdullah bin Busr, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, had a bowl called: Al-Ghara’, which was carried by four men. When they sacrificed the sacrifice and prostrated in the forenoon, that was brought. The bowl, meaning it had been spread out in it, so they gathered around it, and when they had gathered, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, knelt down and a Bedouin said: What is this sitting? The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: God made me a generous servant, and did not make me a stubborn tyrant. Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Eat from around it, and leave its upper part.” He will be blessed therein.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission.

“Her peak” is the highest: with a kasra in the dāl and a ḍamma. Chapter on the dislike of eating while reclining

746- On the authority of Abu Juhayfa Wahb bin Abdullah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “I do not eat while reclining.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

Al-Khattabi said: The one who is reclining here: is the one who is sitting, leaning on a seat underneath him. He said: He meant that he does not sit on the seat and cushions, as someone who wants to eat a lot of food does, but rather sits with the desire to It does not settle, and it eats slowly. This is what Al-Khattabi said, and others indicated that the one who is reclining is the one who is leaning on his side, and God knows best.

747- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: I saw the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, sitting cross-legged and eating dates. Narrated by Muslim.

“Al-Muqa’i” is the one who sticks his buttocks to the ground and raises his legs. Chapter on the desirability of eating with three fingers

The desirability of licking the fingers and the detestation of wiping them before licking them, the desirability of licking the bowl, taking the morsel that falls from it and eating it, and the permissibility of wiping it after licking with the forearm, foot, etc.

748- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “If one of you eats food, he should not wipe his fingers until he or she has licked them.” Agreed upon. 749- On the authority of Ka’b bin Malik, may God be pleased with him, he said: I saw the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, eating with three fingers, and when he was finished, he licked them. Narrated by Muslim.

750- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, ordered the licking of the fingers and the dish and said: “You do not know what the blessing is in any of your food.” Narrated by Muslim. 751- On his authority, the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “If a morsel falls from one of you, let him take it and wipe off whatever dirt is on it and eat it, and do not leave it to Satan, and let him not wipe his hand.” with a napkin until he licks his fingers, for he does not know what his food is blessed with.” Narrated by Muslim. 752- On his authority, the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Satan is present to one of you at everything that concerns him, until he is present to him when he eats, so if a morsel falls Let one of you take it and remove any dirt that is on it, then let him eat it and not leave it for Satan. When he is finished, let him lick his fingers, for he does not know in which food his food is blessed.” Narrated by Muslim. 753- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: Whenever the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, ate food, he licked his three fingers and said: “If a morsel of one of you falls, let him take it and remove any harm from it. And let him eat it, and not leave it to Satan.” And he commanded us to remove the bowl and said: “You do not know in which of your food the blessing is found.” Narrated by Muslim. 754- On the authority of Saeed bin Al-Harith that he asked Jabir, may God be pleased with him, about performing ablution from what has touched fire, and he said: No, in the time of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, we did not find such food except for a few, but if we did find it, we would not have it. Handkerchiefs except for our palms, forearms, and feet, then we pray and do not perform ablution. Narrated by Al-Bukhari. Chapter on having many hands over food

755- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God Almighty be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The food of two is sufficient for three, and the food of three is sufficient for four.” Agreed upon.

756- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “The food of one is sufficient for two, the food of two is sufficient for four, and the food of four is sufficient for eight.” Narrated by Muslim. Chapter on the etiquette of drinking and the desirability of breathing three times outside the vessel

It is disliked to breathe into a vessel and it is recommended to turn the vessel to the right, then the right after the beginner

757- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to sip three drinks. agreed.

Meaning: breathing outside the vessel. 758- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Do not drink one thing like a camel would drink, but drink two or three, and be drunk when you drink, and give thanks.” If you are raised.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

759- On the authority of Abu Qatada, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, forbade breathing into a vessel. Agreed upon.

Meaning: it is breathed into the same vessel. 760- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was brought milk that had turned gray with water, and on his right was a Bedouin, and on his left was Abu Bakr, may God be pleased with him. He drank, then gave it. The Bedouins said: “The right hand, then the right hand.” Agreed upon.

His saying: “gray” means: he is confused. 761- On the authority of Sahl bin Saad, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was brought a drink, and he drank from it, and to his right was a boy, and to his left were old men, so he said to the boy, “Do you permit me to give These? The boy said: No, by God, I would not prefer my share of you to anyone, so the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, took it in his hand. agreed.

His saying: “He took him down,” meaning: he put him down, and this boy is Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both.

		 		 	

Chapter: It is disliked to drink from the mouth of a water bottle or the like

It is clear that it is disliked and not prohibited

762- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, forbade the circumcision of waterskins. That means: their mouths should be broken, and one can drink from them. Agreed upon.

763- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, forbade drinking from someone in a waterskin or waterskin. Agreed upon.

764- On the authority of Umm Thabit, Kabsha bint Thabit, sister of Hassan bin Thabit, may God be pleased with him and her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, entered upon me, and he drank from someone in a hanging waterskin while standing. So I got up and cut it off. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi. He said: A good and authentic hadith.

But she cut it off: to preserve the position of the mouth of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. And you will be blessed by it, and protect it from vulgarity. This hadith is interpreted as an explanation of permissibility, and the previous two hadiths are an explanation of what is best and most complete, and God knows best.

		 		 	

Chapter: It is disliked to blow on a drink

765- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, forbade blowing on a drink, and a man said: I see the dirt in the vessel? He said: “Throw it away.” He said: Why can’t it be quenched with one person? He said: “Then open the cup when it is in your mouth.” It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: A good and authentic hadith. 766- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, forbade breathing into a vessel, or blowing into it. It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: A good and authentic hadith.

		 		 	

Chapter: Explaining the permissibility of drinking while standing

Explaining that it is more complete and better to drink while sitting

It contains the previous hadith of Kabsha (see Hadith No. 761).

767- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I gave the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, water to drink from Zamzam, and he drank while standing. Agreed upon.

768- On the authority of Al-Nazzal bin Sabra, may God be pleased with him, he said: Ali, may God be pleased with him, came to Bab Al-Rahba, drank while standing, and said: I saw the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, do as you saw me do. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

769- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: During the time of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, we used to eat while walking, and drink while standing. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good and authentic hadith.

770- On the authority of Amr bin Shuaib, on the authority of his father, on the authority of his grandfather, may God be pleased with him, he said: I saw the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, drinking, standing and sitting. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good and authentic hadith.

771- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, that he forbade a man from drinking while standing. Qatada said: So we said to Anas: What about eating? He said: That is more evil or malicious. Narrated by Muslim.

In his narration, the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, discouraged drinking while standing.

772- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “None of you should drink while standing, so whoever forgets, let him vomit.” Narrated by Muslim. Chapter on the desirability of people drinking the last drink

773- On the authority of Abu Qatada, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “The last of them is given to drink by the people,” meaning: to drink. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good and authentic hadith.

		 		 	

Chapter on the permissibility of drinking from all pure vessels

Other than gold and silver

The permissibility of drinking with the mouth from river or other sources without a vessel or hand, and the prohibition of using a gold and silver vessel for drinking, eating, purification, and other uses.

774- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: I attended prayer, So the one who was near the house got up and went to his family, and a group of people remained, so the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, brought a basin made of stones, and the basin was too small to spread in it. He palmed it, and all the people performed ablution. They said: How old were you? He said: Eighty and more. Agreed upon. This is Bukhari’s narration.

In a narration by him and Muslim: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, called for a vessel of water, and a cup of water containing some water was brought to him, so he put his fingers in it. Anas said: So I looked at the water gushing out from between his fingers, so I guessed who had performed ablution between seventy and eighty.

775- On the authority of Abdullah bin Zaid, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, came to us, and we brought out water for him in a Safar basin, so he performed ablution. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

“Al-Safar” is suffixed with a ḍād, and it is permissible to break it, and it is an-Nahāḥ, and “Al-Tawar” is like a cup, and it is with a double ta’ from above.

776- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, entered upon a man from the Ansar, and with him was a companion of his, and the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “If you have water “He spent the night tonight in a difficult situation, otherwise we will be miserable.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. “Al-Shin”: the closeness.

777- On the authority of Hudhayfah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, forbade us from using silk and brocade and drinking from vessels of gold and silver, and said: “It is for them in this world, and it is for you in the Hereafter.” “Agreed upon.

778- On the authority of Umm Salamah, may God be pleased with her, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever drinks from silver vessels only brings the fire of Hell into his stomach.” Agreed upon. In a narration by Muslim: “The one who eats or drinks from vessels of silver and gold.”

And in his narration: “Whoever drinks from a vessel of gold or silver will only cause fire from Hell to boil in his stomach.”

باب استحباب الثوب الأبيض

وجواز الأحمر والأخضر والأصفر والأسود وجوازه من قطن وكتّان وشعر وصوف وغيرها إلا الحرير

قال اللَّه تعالى:{ يا بني آدم قد أنزلنا عليكم لباساً يواري سوآتكم وريشاً، ولباس التقوى ذلك خير } .

وقال تعالى: { وجعل لكم سرابيل تقيكم الحر وسرابيل تقيكم بأسكم } .

779- وعن ابنِ عبَّاس رضيَ اللَّه عنْهُما أنَّ رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال: الْبَسُوا مِنْ ثِيَابِكُمُ البَيَاضَ ، فَإِنَّهَا مِن خَيْرِ ثِيابِكُمْ ، وَكَفِّنُوا فِيها مَوْتَاكُمْ » رواهُ أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن صحيح.

780- وعن سَمُرَةَ رضيَ اللَّه عنه قال : قالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : «الْبَسُوا البَيَاضَ ، فَإِنها أَطْهرُ وأَطَيبُ ، وكَفِّنُوا فِيها مَوْتَاكُمْ » رواهُ النسائى ، والحاكم وقال : حديث صحيح .

781- وعن البراءِ رضيَ اللَّه عنه قال : كانَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مَرْبُوعاً وَلَقَدْ رَأَيْتُهُ في حُلَّةِ حمْراءَ ما رأَيْتُ شَيْئاً قَطُّ أَحْسَنَ مِنْهُ . متَّفقٌ عليه .

782- وعن أبي جُحَيْفَةَ وهْبِ بنِ عبدِ اللَّهِ رضيَ اللَّه عنهُ قال : رَأَيْتُ النَّبِيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم بمَكَّةَ وَهُوَ بِالأَبْطَحِ في قُبَّةٍ لَهُ حمْراءَ مِنْ أَدَمٍ فَخَرَجَ بِلالٌ بِوَضوئِهِ ، فَمِنْ نَاضِحٍ ونَائِلٍ ، فَخَرَجَ النبى صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وعَلَيْهِ حُلَّةٌ حَمْرَاءُ ، كَأَنِّى أَنْظرُ إِلى بَيَاضِ ساقَيْهِ ، فَتَوضَّأَ وَأَذَّنَ بِلالٌ ، فَجَعَلْتُ أَتَتبَّعُ فَاهُ ههُنَا وههُنَا ، يقولُ يَمِيناً وشِمَالاً: حَيَّ عَلى الصَّلاةِ ، حيَّ على الفَلاَحِ . ثُمَّ رُكِزَتْ لَهُ عَنَزَةٌ ، فَتَقَدَّمَ فَصَلَّى يَمُرُّ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ الكَلْبُ وَالحِمَارُ لاَ يُمْنعُ. متَّفقٌ عليه . «العَنَزَةُ» بفتح النونِ نحْوُ العُكازَة .

783- وعن أبي رِمْثة رفاعَةَ التَّميْمِيِّ رضيَ اللَّه عنه قال : رأَيت رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وعلَيْه ثوبان أَخْضَرانِ . رواهُ أَبو داود ، والترمذي بإِسْنَادٍ صحيحٍ .

784- وعن جابر رضيَ اللَّه عنه ، أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم دَخَلَ يَوْمَ فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ وعَلَيْهِ عِمامةٌ سوْداءُ . رواهُ مسلم .

785- وعن أبي سعيد عمرو بن حُرَيْثٍ رضيَ اللَّه عنه قال : كأَنى أَنظر إِلى رسولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وعَليْهِ عِمَامَةٌ سَوْدَاءُ قدْ أَرْخَى طَرَفيها بَيْنَ كتفيْهِ . رواه مسلم .

وفي روايةٍ له : أَن رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم خَطَبَ النَّاسَ ، وعَلَيْهِ عِمَامَة سَودَاءُ .

786- وعن عائشة رضي اللَّه عنها قالت : كُفِّنَ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم في ثلاثة أَثْوَابٍ بيضٍ سَحُوليَّةٍ مِنْ كُرْسُفٍ ، لَيْسَ فيهَا قَمِيصٌ وَلا عِمامَةٌ . متفقٌ عليه .

« السَّحُوليَّةُ » بفتحِ السين وضمها وضم الحاء المهملتين : ثيابٌ تُنْسَب إِلى سَحُولٍ : قَرْيَةٍ باليَمنِ « وَالكُرْسُف » : القُطْن .

787- وعنها قالت : خَرَجَ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ذات غَداةٍ وَعَلَيْهِ مِرْطٌ مُرَحَّلٌ منْ شَعْرٍ أَسود رواه مسلم .

« المِرْط » بكسر الميم : وهو كساءَ . « والمُرَحَّل » بالْحاءِ المهملة : هو الذي فيه صورةُ رِحال الإِبل ، وَهيَ الأَكْوَارُ .

788- وعن المُغِيرةِ بن شُعْبَةَ رضي اللَّه عنه قال : كُنْتُ مع رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ذاتَ ليلَة في مسيرٍ ، فقال لي : « أَمعَكَ مَاء ؟ » قلت : نَعَمْ ، فَنَزَلَ عن راحِلتِهِ فَمَشى حتى توَارَى في سَوادِ اللَّيْلِ ثم جاءَ فَأَفْرَغْتُ علَيْهِ مِنَ الإِدَاوَةٍ ، فَغَسَلَ وَجْهَهُ وَعَلَيهِ جُبَّةٌ مِنْ صُوفٍ ، فلم يَسْتَطِعْ أَنْ يُخْرِجَ ذِراعَيْهِ منها حتى أَخْرَجَهُمَا مِنْ أَسْفَلِ الجُبَّةِ ، فَغَسَلَ ذِرَاعيْهِ وَمَسَحَ برأْسِه ثُمَّ أَهْوَيْت لأَنزعَ خُفَّيْهِ فقال : « دعْهمَا فَإِنى أَدخَلْتُهُما طَاهِرَتَينِ » وَمَسَحَ عَلَيْهِما . متفقٌ عليه .

وفي روايةٍ : وعَلَيْهِ جُبَّةٌ شامِيَّةٌ ضَيقَةُ الْكُمَّيْنِ .

وفي روايةٍ : أَنَّ هذِه القصةَ كانت في غَزْوَةِ تَبُوكَ .

		 		 				 	

باب استحباب القميص

789- عن أُمِّ سَلمةَ رضي اللَّه عنها قالت : كان أَحَبَّ الثِّيابِ إِلى رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم القَميصُ . رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

		 				 	

باب صفة طول القميص والكمّ والإِزار

وطرف العمامة وتحريم إسبال شيء من ذلك على سبيل الخيلاء وكراهته من غير خيلاء

790- عن أَسماء بنت يزيدَ الأنصارِيَّةِ رضي اللَّه عنها قالت : كان كُمُّ قمِيصِ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إِلى الرُّسُغِ . رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

791- وعن ابن عمر رضي اللَّه عنهما أَنّ النبى صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « مَنْ جَرَّ ثَوْبَهُ خُيَلاءَ لَمْ يَنْظُر اللَّه إِليهِ يَوْم القِيَامَةِ » فقال أَبو بكر : يارسول اللَّه إِن إِزارى يَسْتَرْخى إِلا أَنْ أَتَعَاهَدَهُ، فقال له رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إِنَّكَ لَسْتَ مِمَّنْ يَفْعَلُهُ خُيَلاءَ ».

رواه البخاري ، وروى مسلم بعضه .

792- وعن أبي هريرة رضي اللَّه عنه أَنَّ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « لا ينْظُرُ اللَّه يَوْم القِيَامة إِلى مَنْ جَرَّ إِزَارَهُ بَطراً » متفقٌ عليه .

793- وعنه عـن النبى صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « مَا أَسْفَلَ مِنَ الْكَعْبَيْنِ مِنَ الإِزار ففي النَّار » رواه البخاري .

794- وعن أبي ذرٍّ رضي اللَّه عنه عن النبى صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « ثلاثةٌ لا يُكَلِّمُهُمُ اللَّهُ يَوْمَ القِيَامةِ ، ولا يَنْظُرُ إِلَيْهم ، وَلا يُزَكِّيهِمْ ، وَلهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَليمٌ » قال : فقَرأَها رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ثلاث مِرَارٍ . قال أَبو ذَرٍّ : خابُوا وخسِرُوا مَنْ هُمْ يا رسول اللَّه ؟ قال : « المُسبِلُ ، والمنَّانُ وَالمُنْفِقُ سِلْعَتَهُ بِالحَلفِ الكاذِبِ » رواه مسلم .

وفي روايةٍ له : « المُسْبِلُ إِزَارَهُ » .

795- وعن ابن عمر رضي اللَّه عنهما ، عن النبى صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : «الإِسْبَالُ في الإِزارِ ، والقَمِيصِ ، وَالعِمَامةِ ، منْ جَرَّ شَيئا خُيَلاءَ لَم يَنظُرِ اللَّه إليهِ يوْمَ القِيَامةِ» رواه أبو داود، ُوالنسائى بإسنادٍ صحيح .

796- وعن أبي جُرَيٍّ جابر بن سُلَيم رضي اللَّه عنه قال : رَأَيتُ رَجلاً يصْدُرُ النَّاسُ عَنْ رَأْيهِ لاَ يَقُولُ شَيئاً إِلاَّ صَدَرُوا عنه ، قلتُ : من هذا ؟ قالوا : رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم . قلتُ: عَليكَ السَّلامُ يا رسولَ اللَّه مَرَّتَيْنِ قال : «لا تَقُل علَيكَ السَّلامُ ، علَيكَ السلامُ تحِيَّةُ الموْتَى قُلِ : السَّلامُ علَيك » قال : قلتُ : أَنتَ رسول اللَّه ؟ قال : «أَنَا رسول اللَّه الذي إِذا أَصابَكَ ضَرٌّ فَدعَوْتَهُ كَشَفَهُ عنْكَ ، وإِذا أَصَابَكَ عامُ سنَة فَدَعوْتَهُ أَنبتَهَا لك ، وإِذَا كُنتَ بِأَرْضٍ قَفْرٍ أَوْ فلاةٍ ، فَضَلَّت راحِلَتُكَ ، فَدعوْتَه رَدَّهَا علَيكَ » قال : قلت : اعْهَدْ إِليَّ . قال : « لا تسُبَّنَّ أَحداً » قال : فَما سببْتُ بعْدهُ حُرّا ، ولا عبداً ، وَلا بَعِيراً، وَلا شَاةً « وَلا تَحقِرنَّ مِنَ المعروفِ شَيْئاً ، وأَنْ تُكَلِّمَ أَخَاك وأَنتَ مُنْبسِطٌ إِليهِ وجهُكَ، إِنَّ ذلك مِنَ المعرُوفِ . وارفَع إِزاركَ إِلى نِصْفِ السَّاقِ ، فَإِن أبيتَ فإلى الكَعبين ، وإِياكَ وإِسْبال الإِزارِ فَإِنَّهَا مِن المخِيلةِ وإِنَّ اللَّه لا يحبُّ المَخِيلة ، وإن امْرؤٌ شَتَمك وَعَيَّركَ بمَا يَعْلَمُ فيكَ فلا تُعيِّرهُ بما تَعلَم فيهِ ، فإِنَّمَا وبالُ ذلكَ عليهِ » رواه أبو داود والترمذي بإِسنادٍ صحيحٍ ، وقال الترمذي : حديثٌ حسن صحيح .

797- وعن أبي هريرة رضي اللَّه عنه ، قال : بينما رَجُل يُصَلِّى مُسْبِلٌ إِزَارَه، قال له رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « اذهَب فَتَوضأْ » فَذهَب فَتَوضَّأَ ، ثم جاءَ ، فقال: «اذهبْ فَتَوضَّأْ » فقال له رجُلٌ : يا رسول اللَّه . مالكَ أَمرْتَهُ أَن يَتَوَضَّأَ ثم سَكَتَّ عنه ؟ قال : « إِنه كانَ يُصلِّى وهو مُسْبلٌ إِزارهُ ، إِن اللَّه لا يقْبلُ صلاةَ رجُلٍ مُسبِلٍ » .

رواه أبو داود بإِسنادٍ على شرط مسلم .

798- وعن قَيسِ بن بشرٍ التَّغْلبيِّ قال : أَخْبَرنى أبي وكان جليساً لأبي الدَّرداءِ قال : كان بِدِمشقَ رَجُلٌ من أَصحاب النبى صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقال له سهلُ ابنُ الحنظَليَّةِ، وكان رجُلاً مُتَوحِّداً قَلَّمَا يُجالسُ النَّاسَ ، إِنَّمَا هو صلاةٌ ، فَإِذا فرغَ فَإِنَّمَا هو تسبيح وتكبيرٌ حتى يأْتيَ أهْلَهُ ، فَمَرَّ بِنَا ونَحنُ عِند أبي الدَّردَاءِ ، فقال له أَبو الدَّردَاءِ : كَلِمةً تَنْفَعُنَا ولا تضُرُّكَ ، . قال : بَعثَ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم سريَّةً فَقَدِمَتْ ، فَجَاءَ رَجُلٌ مِنهم فَجَلسَ في المَجْلِس الذي يَجلِسُ فِيهِ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، فقال لرجُلٍ إِلى جَنْبهِ : لَوْ رَأَيتنَا حِينَ التقَيْنَا نَحنُ والعدُو ، فَحمَل فلانٌ فَطَعَنَ ، فقال : خُذْهَا مِنِّى . وأَنَا الغُلامُ الغِفَارِيُّ ، كَيْفَ تَرى في قوْلِهِ ؟ قال: مَا أَرَاهُ إِلا قَدْ بَطَلَ أَجرُهُ . فسَمِعَ بِذلكَ آخَرُ فقال : مَا أَرَى بِذَلَكَ بأْساً ، فَتَنَازعا حَتى سَمِعَ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقال : « سُبْحان اللَّه ؟ لا بَأْس أَن يُؤْجَرَ ويُحْمَد » فَرَأَيْتُ أَبا الدَّرْدَاءِ سُرَّ بِذلكَ ، وجعلَ يَرْفَعُ رأْسَه إِلَيهِ وَيَقُولُ : أأَنْتَ سمِعْتَ ذَلكَ مِنْ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم،؟ فيقول : نعَمْ ، فما زال يعِيدُ عَلَيْهِ حتى إِنّى لأَقولُ لَيَبرُكَنَّ على ركْبَتَيْهِ .

قال : فَمَرَّ بِنَا يَوماً آخَرَ ، فقال له أَبُو الدَّرْدَاءِ : كَلِمَةً تَنفَعُنَا ولا تَضُرُّكَ ، قال: قال لَنَا رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « المُنْفِقُ عَلى الخَيْلِ كالبَاسِطِ يَدَهُ بالصَّدَقة لا يَقْبِضُهَا» . ثم مرَّ بِنَا يوماً آخر ، فقال له أَبو الدَّرْدَاءِ : كَلِمَةً تَنْفَعُنَا وَلا تَضرُّكَ ، قال : قال رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « نعْمَ الرَّجُلُ خُرَيْمٌ الأَسَديُّ ، لولا طُولُ جُمته وَإِسْبَالُ إِزَارِه » فبَلغَ ذلك خُرَيماً، فَعجَّلَ فَأَخَذَ شَفرَةً فَقَطَعَ بها جُمتَهُ إِلى أُذنيْه ، ورفعَ إِزَارَهُ إِلى أَنْصَاف سَاقَيْه . ثَمَّ مَرَّ بنَا يَوْماً آخَرَ فَقَالَ لَهُ أَبُو الدَّرْدَاءِ : كَلِمةً تَنْفَعُنَا ولاَ تَضُرُّكَ قَالَ : سَمعْتُ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقُولُ : « إِنَّكُمْ قَادمُونَ عَلى إِخْوانِكُمْ . فَأَصْلِحُوا رِحَالَكمْ ، وأَصْلحوا لبَاسَكُمْ حتى تَكُونُوا كَأَنَّكُمْ شَامَة في النَّاسِ ، فَإِنَّ اللَّه لاَ يُحبُّ الفُحْشَ وَلاَ التَّفَحُش » . رواهُ أَبو داود بإِسنادٍ حسنٍ ، إِلاَّ قَيْسَ بن بشر ، فاخْتَلَفُوا في توثيقِهِ وتَضْعفيه ، وقد روى له مسلم .

799- وعن أبي سعيدٍ الخدْرِيِّ رضيَ اللَّهُ عنه قال: قَالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « إزرَةُ المُسلِمِ إِلى نصْفِ السَّاقِ ، وَلاَ حَرَجَ أَوْ لا جُنَاحَ فيما بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ الكَعْبَيْنِ ، فَمَا كانَ أَسْفَلَ منَ الكعْبَينِ فَهَوُ في النَّارِ ، ومَنْ جَرَّ إِزارهُ بَطَراً لَمْ يَنْظرِ اللَّه إِلَيْهِ» .

رواهُ أَبُو داود بإِسنادٍ صحيح .

800- وعن ابنِ عمر رضيَ اللَّه عنهما قال : مَرَرْتُ عَلى رسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وَفي إِزاري اسْترْخَاءٌ . فَقَالَ : « يا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ ، ارْفَعْ إِزارَكَ » فَرفعتهُ ثُمَّ قَالَ : «زِدْ»، فَزِدْتُ ، فَمَا زِلْتُ أَتَحرَّاها بَعْدُ . فَقَالَ بَعْض القُوْمِ : إِلى أَيْنَ ؟ فَقَالَ : إِلى أَنْصاف السَّاقَيْنِ». رواهُ مسلم .

801- وعنه قال : قالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَنْ جَرَّ ثَوبَه خيلاءَ لَمْ يَنْظُرِ اللَّه إِلَيْهِ يَوْمَ القيامِةِ » فقالَتْ أُمُّ سَلَمَةَ : فَكَيْفَ تَصْنَعُ النِّسَاءُ بِذُيُولِهنَّ ، قالَ : « يُرْخينَ شِبْراً». قَالَتْ: إِذن تَنكَشفُ أَقْدامُهنَّ . قال : « فيُرْخِينَهُ ذِراعاً لاَ يَزِدْنَ » .

رواهُ أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن صحيح .

				 	

		 

باب استحباب ترك الترفع في اللباس تواضعاً

قد سبق في باب فضل الجوع وخشونة العيش جُمَلٌ تتعلق بهذا الباب

802- وعن معاذِ بن أَنسٍ رضي اللَّه عنه أَنَّ رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : «مَنْ تَرَكَ اللِّباس تَواضُعاً للَّه ، وَهُوَ يَقْدِرُ علَيْهِ ، دعاهُ اللَّهُ يَوْمَ القِيامَةِ عَلى رُؤُوسِ الخَلائِقِ حتى يُخيِّره منْ أَيِّ حُلَلِ الإِيمان شَاءَ يلبَسُها » .

رواهُ الترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

		 				 	

باب استحباب التوسط في اللباس

ولا يقتصر على ما يزري به لغير حاجة ولا مقصود شرعي

803- عن عمرو بن شُعْيبٍ عن أَبيه عَنْ جدِّهِ رضيَ اللَّهُ عنه قال : قالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم: « إِن اللَّه يُحِبُّ أَنْ يُرى أَثَرُ نِعْمَتِهِ عَلى عبْده» .

رواهُ الترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حسن .

		 				 	

باب تحريم لباس الحرير على الرجال

وتحريم جلوسهم عليه واستنادهم إليه وجواز لبسه للنساء

804- عن عمر بن الخطَّاب رضيَ اللَّه عنه قال : قالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لاَ تَلْبَسُوا الحرير ، فَإنَّ مَنْ لَبِسهُ في الدُّنْيَا لَمْ يَلْبَسْهُ في الآخرةِ . » متفقٌ عليه .

805- وعنه قال : سمِعتُ رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقولُ : « إنَّما يلبَسُ الحريرَ منْ لا خَلاق لَهُ» متفقٌ عليه .

وفي روايةٍ للبُخاريَ : « مَنْ لاَ خَلاَقَ لَهُ في الآخِرة » .

قولُهُ : « مَنْ لا خَلاَقَ لَهُ » ، أَيْ : لاَ نَصيبَ لَهُ .

806- وعن أنس رضي اللَّه عنه قال : قالَ رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « منْ لَبِسَ الحرير في الدُّنْيا لَمْ يَلْبسْهُ في الآخرَةِ » متفقٌ عليه .

807- وعن عليٍّ رضي اللَّه عنه قال : رأَيْتُ رَسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أَخَذَ حَرِيراً ، فَجَعلَهُ في يَمينه ، وَذَهَباً فَجَعَلَهُ في شِمالِهِ ، ثُمَّ قَالَ : « إنَّ هذَيْنِ حرَامٌ عَلى ذُكُورِ أُمَّتي » .

رواهُ أبو داود بإسنادٍ حسن

808- وعن أبي مُوسى الأشْعريِّ رضي اللَّه عنه أنَّ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « حُرِّم لِبَاسُ الحَرِيرِ وَالذَّهَب على ذُكُورِ أُمَّتي ، وَأُحلَّ لإنَاثِهِم » .

رواهُ الترمذي وقال حديثٌ حسن صحيح .

809- وعن حُذَيْفَة رضي اللَّه عنه قال : نَهَانَا النَّبيُّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أنْ نَشْرب في آنِيةِ الذَّهب وَالفِضَّةِ ، وَأنْ نَأْكُل فِيهَا ، وعَنْ لُبْسِ الحَرِيرِ وَالدِّيبَاج وأنْ نَجْلِس عَلَيّهِ . رواه البخاري.

		 				 	

باب جواز لبس الحرير لمن به حِكّة

810- عن أنس رضي اللَّه عنه قال : رَخَصَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم للزبير وعبْد الرَّحْمنِ بنِ عوْفٍ رضي اللَّه عنهما في لبْسِ الحَرِيرِ لحِكَّةٍ بهما . متفقٌ عليه .

		 				 	

باب النهي عن افتراش جلود النمور والركوب عليها

811- عنْ مُعاويةَ رضي اللَّه عنه قالَ : قال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم:«لاَ تَرْكَبوا الخَزَّ وَلاَ النَّمارَ » .

حديث حسن ، رواهُ أَبو داود وغيره بإسنادٍ حسنٍ .

812- وعن أبي المليح عن أَبيهِ ، رضيَ اللَّه عنه ،أنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم نَهَى عنْ جُلُودِ السِّباعِ.

رواهُ أبو دَاود ، والترمذي ، والنسائي بأَسَانِيد صحاح .

وفي روايةِ الترمذي : نهَى عنْ جُلُودِ السِّباعِ أنْ تُفْتَرَشَ .

		 				 	

باب ما يقول إذا لبس ثوباً جديداً أو نعلاً أو نحوه

813- عن أبي سعيد الخُدْري رضيَ اللَّه عنه قال : كانَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إذا اسْتَجَدَّ ثَوْباً سمَّاهُ باسْمِهِ عِمامَةً ، أَوْ قَمِيصاً ، أَوْ رِدَاءً يقُولُ : « اللَّهُمَّ لكَ الحَمْدُ أَنْتَ كَسَوْتَنِيهِ ، أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهُ وَخَيْرَ ما صُنِع لَهُ ، وأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهِ وشَرِّ ما صُنِعَ لَهُ » .

رواهُ أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

		 				 	

باب استحباب الابتداء باليمين في اللباس

هذا الباب قد تقدم مقصوده وذكرنا الأحاديث الصحيحة فيه . (انظر الباب التاسع والتسعون في استحباب تقديم اليمين في كل ما هو من باب التكريم)

Chapter on the desirability of white clothing

Red, green, yellow, and black are permissible, and cotton, linen, hair, wool, and others are permissible, except silk

God Almighty said: {O children of Adam, We have sent down to you clothing that covers your veils and feathers, and the clothing of piety - that is better}.

And God Almighty said: {And He made for you robes to protect you from heat, and robes to protect you from your heat}. 779- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: Wear some of your white clothes, for they are among the best of your clothes, and shroud your dead in them. “Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good and authentic hadith.

780- On the authority of Samurah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Wear white, for it is purer and more fragrant, and shroud your dead in it.” Narrated by Al-Nasa’i and Al-Hakim, who said: An authentic hadith. . 781- On the authority of Al-Baraa, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was a man of honor, and I saw him in a red suit. I had never seen anything better than him. Agreed upon.

782- On the authority of Abu Juhayfa Wahb bin Abdullah, may God be pleased with him, he said: I saw the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, in Mecca, and he was lying down in a red cloak made of human hair, so Bilal came out. With his ablution, it is pure and succulent, Then the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, came out wearing a red robe, as if I could see the whites of his legs. He performed ablution and Bilal called the call to prayer, so I started to trace his mouth here. Here, he says right and left: Hail to prayer, Hail to success. Then a goat was parked for him, so he came forward and prayed, the dog and the donkey passing between him without being prevented. Agreed upon. “The Goat” with the letter “Nun” in the form of “Al-‘Akaza”.

783- On the authority of Abu Rimtha Rifa’ah al-Tamimi, may God be pleased with him, he said: I saw the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, wearing two green garments. Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi with an authentic chain of transmission.

784- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, entered on the day of the conquest of Mecca wearing a black turban. Narrated by Muslim.

785- On the authority of Abu Saeed Amr bin Harith, may God be pleased with him, he said: It is as if I were looking at the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, wearing a black turban, the ends of which had fallen between his shoulders. Narrated by Muslim.

In his narration: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, addressed the people, wearing a black turban.

786- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was shrouded in three white robes made of celery, without a shirt or turban. Agreed upon.

“Al-Sahhuliyyah” with the opening of the sīn and its ḍammah and ḍammah of the neglected haa: clothes attributed to sahul: a village in Yemen, and “al-Kursuf”: cotton.

787- On her authority, she said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, went out one morning wearing a black hair cap. It was narrated by Muslim.

“Al-Marat” with a kasra on the meem: it is a garment. “And the wanderer” with the neglected h: is the one in which there is an image of camels traveling, which are camels.

788- On the authority of Al-Mughirah bin Shu’bah, may God be pleased with him, he said: I was with the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, on a hike one night, and he said to me: “Do you have water?” I said: Yes, so he got off his camel and walked until he disappeared in the black of the night. Then he came and I finished the treatment on him. He washed his face and was wearing a woolen cloak. He was not able to get his arms out of it until he took them out from under the robe. He washed his arms and wiped his head. Then I went down to remove his socks and said: “Leave them.” So I brought them in pure.” He wiped over them. Agreed upon.

In a narration: He is wearing a Levantine robe with tight sleeves.

In a narration: This story occurred during the Battle of Tabuk. Chapter on the desirability of a shirt

789- On the authority of Umm Salamah, may God be pleased with her, she said: The most beloved garment to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was the shirt. Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith.

		 				 	

Chapter on the description of the length of the shirt, sleeves, and waistcoat

The end of the turban and the prohibition of letting any of that out of pride and detesting it without showing off

790- On the authority of Asma’ bint Yazid al-Ansariyah, may God be pleased with her, she said: The sleeve of the shirt of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, reached the wrist. Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith.

791- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever drags his garment out of arrogance, God will not look at him on the Day of Resurrection.” Then Abu Bakr said: O Messenger of God, my garment is loose. Unless I promise him, then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said to him: “You are not one of those who do this out of arrogance.”

Narrated by Al-Bukhari, and Muslim narrated some of it. 792- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “On the Day of Resurrection, God will not look at the one who pulled his garment in disgrace.” Agreed upon.

793- On the authority of him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, he said: “Whatever is lower than the ankles of the garment is in the Fire.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 794- On the authority of Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “There are three to whom God will not speak on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He look at them, nor will He purify them, and for them will be a painful punishment.” He said: So he recited it. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, three times. Abu Dharr said: They were disappointed and lost. Who are they, O Messenger of God? He said: “The one who gives money, the one who is generous, and the one who spends is spoiled by false oaths.” Narrated by Muslim.

And in his narration: “The one who brings down his garment is his garment.”

795- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Isbaal in the garment, the shirt, and the turban. Whoever drags something out of pride, God will not look at him on the Day of Resurrection.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Nasa’i. With correct attribution. 796- On the authority of Abu Jarry Jabir bin Sulaym, may God be pleased with him, he said: I saw a man whose opinion people turned away from, and he did not say anything without them turning away from him. I said: Who is this? They said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. I said: Peace be upon you, O Messenger of God, twice. He said: “Do not say: Peace be upon you. Peace be upon you. The greeting of the dead says: Peace be upon you.” He said: I said: Are you the Messenger of God? He said: “I am the Messenger of God who, if harm befalls you and you call upon him, he will remove it from you, and if a bad year befalls you and you call upon him, he will cause it to grow for you, and if you are in a barren or desert land, Your camel was lost, so you called him and he returned it to you. He said: I said: Leave it to me. He said: “Do not insult anyone.” He said: “I have not insulted after him a free man, nor a slave, nor a camel, nor a sheep.” “And do not despise any act of kindness, and speak to your brother while you extend your face to him. Indeed, that is from The favor. And raise your garment to half the shin, and if you refuse, then to the ankles, and beware of letting the garment down, for it is from imagination, and God does not like imagination, and if someone curses you and rebukes you for what he knows about you, do not reproach him for what he knows. He learned about it, but the calamity of that was upon him.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi with an authentic chain of transmission, and Al-Tirmidhi said: A good and authentic hadith. 797- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: While a man was praying with his garment hanging down, the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to him: “Go and perform ablution.” So he went and performed ablution, then he came and said: “Go and perform ablution,” so he said to him: “Go and perform ablution.” Man: O Messenger of God. Why did you tell him to perform ablution and then he remained silent about it? He said: “He was praying with his garment hanging down. God does not accept the prayer of a man hanging down.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud with a chain of transmission according to the conditions of Muslim. 798- On the authority of Qais bin Bishr al-Taghlabi, he said: My father, who was a companion of Abu al-Darda’, told me: There was in Damascus a man from the companions of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, called Sahl Ibn al-Hanzaliyya, and he was a solitary man who rarely sat with people. It is only a prayer, so when it is finished, it is only glorification and glorification until its people come. So he passed by us while we were at Abu Darda’, and Abu Darda said to him: A word that will benefit us and will not harm you. He said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, sent a detachment that arrived, and a man from them came and sat in the seat where the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was sitting, and he said to a man next to him: If You saw us when we met the enemy, and so-and-so was picked up and stabbed, so he said: Take it from me. And I am the boy, Al-Ghafari. What do you think of his statement? He said: I do not see him except that his reward has been annulled. Then another man heard about that and said: I don’t see anything wrong with that, so they disputed until the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, heard it and said: “Glory be to God?” There is no harm in being rewarded and praised.” I saw Abu Darda’ being pleased with that, and he started raising his head to him and saying: Did you hear that from the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace? So he says: Yes, and he continues repeating it until I can say that he should kneel on his knees. He said: Then he passed by us another day, and Abu Darda said to him: A word that will benefit us and will not harm you. He said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said to us: “The one who spends on horses is like one who extends his hand in charity. He takes it.” Then he passed by us another day, and Abu Darda said to him: A word that will benefit us and will not harm you. He said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “What an excellent man Khuraym al-Asadi was, had it not been for his long robe and shawl.” his garment.” So that reached Khurraym. So he hurriedly took a blade and with it cut his sleeve to his ears, and raised his garment to the middle of his shins. Then he passed by us another day, and Abu Darda said to him: A word that will benefit us and will not harm you. He said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: “You are coming to... Your brothers. So put your saddlebags in order, and put on your clothes so that you will be as if you are a mole among the people, for God does not like indecency or indecency.” It was narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission, except for Qais bin Bishr, who differed as to whether it was authentic or weak, and Muslim narrated it.

799- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The Muslim’s loincloth extends to half the shin, and there is no awkwardness or gap between it and the ankles, so what If it is lower than the ankles, he will be in Hell, and whoever drags his garment recklessly, God will not look at him.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. 800- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I passed by the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and there was a piece of cloth in my garment. He said: “O Abdullah, raise your garment.” I raised it, then he said: “Increase,” so I increased, and I am still searching for it. Some of the people said: Where to? He said: To the middle of the legs. Narrated by Muslim.

801- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever drags his garment out of arrogance, God will not look at him on the Day of Resurrection.” Umm Salamah said: So how do the women do it? With their tails, he said: “Let them relax by a span.” She said: Then their feet will be uncovered. He said: “They will lengthen it by an arm and not more.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good and authentic hadith.

				 	

		 

Chapter on the desirability of abandoning modesty in clothing

Previously, in the chapter on the virtues of hunger and the hardship of living, there have been sentences related to this chapter

802- On the authority of Muadh bin Anas, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever abandons clothing out of humility for God, while He is able to do it, God will call him on the Day of Resurrection. heads of creation until He gives him the choice of which garment of faith he wishes to wear.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

		 				 	

Chapter on the desirability of mediation in clothing

It is not limited to what is false without need or legitimate purpose

803- On the authority of Amr bin Shuaib, on the authority of his father, on the authority of his grandfather, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “God loves to see the effect of His grace on His servant.”

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith. Chapter on the prohibition of silk clothing for men

It is forbidden for them to sit on it and lean on it, and it is permissible for women to wear it

804- On the authority of Omar bin Al-Khattab, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Do not wear silk, for whoever wears it in this world will not wear it in the hereafter.” “Agreed upon.

805- On his authority, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: “Only someone who has no manners wears silk.” Agreed upon.

And in a narration by Al-Bukhari: “He who has no share will have no share in the Hereafter.”

His saying: “He who has no creation,” meaning: He has no share.

806- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever wears silk in this world will not wear it in the hereafter.” Agreed upon. 807- On the authority of Ali, may God be pleased with him, he said: I saw the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, take silk and place it in his right hand, and gold and place it in his left hand, then he said: “These two are forbidden.” On the remembrance of my nation.

Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission

808- On the authority of Abu Musa Al-Ash’ari, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The clothing of silk and gold was forbidden for the males of my nation, and permissible for their females.”

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a good and authentic hadith. 809- On the authority of Hudhayfah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, forbade us from drinking from vessels of gold and silver, from eating from them, from wearing silk and brocade, and from We sit on it. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

		 				 	

Chapter on the permissibility of wearing silk for those who have itching

810- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, granted permission to Al-Zubayr and Abd al-Rahman bin Awf, may God be pleased with them, to wear silk because of itching. Agreed upon.

		 				 	

Chapter on the prohibition of sleeping on tiger skins and riding on them

811- On the authority of Muawiyah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Do not ride the horse or the camel.”

A good hadith, narrated by Abu Dawud and others with a good chain of transmission.

812- On the authority of Abu Al-Malih, on the authority of his father, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, forbade the skins of wild lions.

Narrated by Abu Dawud, Al-Tirmidhi, and Al-Nasa’i with Sahih chains of narration. وفي روايةِ الترمذي : نهَى عنْ جُلُودِ السِّباعِ أنْ تُفْتَرَشَ .

		 				 	

باب ما يقول إذا لبس ثوباً جديداً أو نعلاً أو نحوه

813- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, he said: Whenever the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would find a piece of clothing, he would name it by its name: a turban, or a shirt, or a robe, and he would say: “O God, praise be to You.” You clothed him, I ask You for his good and the good that was done to him, and I seek refuge in You from his evil and the evil of what was done to him.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith.

		 				 	

Chapter on the desirability of starting with the right hand when dressing

The purpose of this chapter has been mentioned previously, and we have mentioned the authentic hadiths about it. (See Chapter Ninety-Nine on the desirability of offering the oath in everything that is a matter of honor.)
