باب فضل السلام والأمر بإفشائه

قال اللَّه تعالى: { يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تدخلوا بيوتاً غير بيوتكم حتى تستأنسوا وتسلموا على أهلها } .

وقال تعالى: { فإذا دخلتم بيوتاً فسلموا على أنفسكم تحية من عند اللَّه مباركة طيبة } .

وقال تعالى: { وإذا حييتم بتحية فحيوا بأحسن منها أو ردوها } .

وقال تعالى: { هل أتاك حديث ضيف إبراهيم المكرمين إذ دخلوا عليه فقالوا: سلاماً، قال: سلام } .

845- وعن عبد الله بن عمرو بن العاص رضي الله عنهما أن رجلا سأل رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أيُّ الإْسلام خَيْرٌ ؟ قال « تُطْعم الطَّعَامَ ، وَتَقْرأُ السَّلام عَلَىَ مَنْ عَرِفَتَ وَمَنْ لَمْ تَعْرِفْ » . متفق عليه .

846- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه عن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال « لما خَلَقَ الله آدم صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : اذْهَبْ فَسَلِّمْ عَلَى أُولئِكَ نَفَرٍ مِنَ الَمَلاَئكة جُلُوسٌ فاسْتمعْ ايُحَيُّونَكَ فَإنَّها تَحيَّتُكَ وَتَحِيَّةُ ذُرِّيَّتِك. فقال : السَّلام عَلَيْكُمْ، فقالوا : السَّلام ُ عَلَيْكَ وَرَحْمةُ الله ، فَزادُوهُ : وَرَحْمةُ الله » متفق عليه .

847- وعن أبي عُمارة البراء بن عازبٍ رضي الله عنهما قال : أمرنا رسولُ الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم بِسَبعٍ : «بِعَيادَةِ الَمرِيضِ . وَاتِّباع الجَنائز ، وَتشْميت العَاطس ، ونصرِ الضَّعِيف ، وَعَوْن المظلوم، وإفْشاءِ السَّلام ، وإبرارِ المقسم » متفق عليه ، هذا لفظ إحدى روايات البخاري . 

848- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « لا تَدْخُلُوا الجَنَّةَ حَتَّى تُؤْمِنُوا وَلا تُؤمِنوا حَتى تحَابُّوا ، أَوَلا أدُلُّكُمْ عَلَى شَئٍ إذا فَعَلْتُمُوهُ تَحاَبَبْتُم ؟ أفْشُوا السَّلام بَيْنَكُم » رواه مسلم . 

849- وعن أبي يوسف عبد الله بن سلام رضي الله عنه قال : سمعت رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقول « يَا أيُّهَا النّاسُ أفْشُوا السَّلام ، وَأْطعِمُوا الطْعَامَ، وَصِلُوا الأْرحامَ ، وَصَلُّوا والنَّاس نيامٌ ، تَدْخُلوا الجُنَّة بسلام » رواه الترمذي وقال : حديث حسن صحيح .

850- وعن الطفيل بن أبي بن كعب أنه كان يأتي عبد الله بن عمر فيغدو مَعَهُ إلى صاحب بيعَة وَلا مْسكين وَلا أحد إلا سَلّم عَليه ، قال الطُّفيلُ : فَجِئْتُ عبد الله بنَ عُمرَ يَوْماً فاستَْتَبعني إلى السُّوقِ فقُلْت لَهُ : ماتَصْنعُ بالسوقٍ وأنْتَ لا تَقِفُ عَلى البَيْع وَلا تَسْألُ عَن السلع وَلا تَسُومُ بها وَلا تَجلسُ في مجالس السّوق ؟ وأقولُ اجْلسْ بنا ههُنا نَتَحدَّث ، فقال يا أبا بُطْن. وَكانَ الُطُّفَيلُ ذَا بَطْن إنَّما نَغُدو منْ أجْل السَّلام نُسَلِّمُ عَلَى مَنْ لَقِيناهُ ، رواه مالك في الموُطَّإ بإسناد صحيح .

		 				 	

باب كيفية السلام

ستحب أن يقول المبتدئ بالسلام: السلام عليكم ورحمة اللَّه وبركاته. فيأتي بضمير الجمع وإن كان المسلم عليه واحداً، ويقول المجيب: وعليكم السلام ورحمة اللَّه وبركاته. فيأتي بواو العطف في قوله: وعليكم.

851- عن عِمران بن حصين رضي الله عنهما قال : جاءَ رجُل إلى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقال : السَّلامُ عَلَيكُم ، فَرَدَّ عَلَيْهِ ثم جَلَسَ ، فقال النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : «عَشْرٌ» ثم جَاءَ آخَرُ فَقَالَ : السَّلامُ عَلَيكُم وَرَحْمَةُ الله ، فَرَدَّ عليهِ فَجَلَسَ ، فقال : «عِشْرون » ، ثم جَاءَ آخَرُ فَقَالَ : السَّلامُ عَلَيكُم وَرَحْمَةُ الله وَبَرَكَاتُهّ ، فَرَدَّ عليهِ فَجَلَسَ ، فقال : « ثَلاَثُونَ » . رواه أبو داود والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

852- وعن عائشة رضي الله عنها قالتْ : قال لي رسولُ الله صلى الله عليه وسلم :(( هذا جِبرِيلُ يَقرَأُ عَلَيْكِ السَّلَامَ)) قالَتْ : قُلتُ : (وَعَلَيْه السَّلامُ ورحْمَةُ الله وَبَرَكَاتُهُ)) متفقُ عليه.

وهكذا وقع في بعض رواياتِ الصحيحين :((وَبَرَكَاتُهُ)) وفي بعضها بحذفها ، وزيادة الثقة مقبولة .

853- وعن أنسٍ رضي الله عنه أن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كان إذا تكلم بِكَلمة أعَادهَا ثَلاثاً حتَّى تُفَهَم عنه، وإذا أتى على قوْم فَسَلَّمَ عَلَيهم سَلَّم عَلَيهم ثَلاثاَ ، رواه البخاري . وهذا محمُولٌ عَلَى ما إذا كان الجَمْعُ كثيراَ .

854- وعن الْمقْدَاد رضي الله عنه في حَدِيثه الطويل قال : كُنَّا نَرْفَعُ للنبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم نَصِيبهُ مِنَ الَّلبَن فَيَجِيئُ مِنَ اللَّيلِ فَيُسَلِّمُ تسليما ً لايوقظُ نَائِماً وَيُسمِعُ اليَقَظان فَجَاء النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَسَلمَّ كما كان يُسَلمُ ، رواه مسلم.

855- عن أسماء بنتِ يزيد رضي الله عنها أن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مَرَّ في المَسْجِد يوْماً وَعصْبةٌ مِنَ النِّساء قُعوُدٌ فألوْي بِيده بالتسليم .

رواه الترمذي وقال : حديث حسن . وهذا محمول على أنه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم جَمَعَ بَين اللَّفظ والإشارة ، ويُؤيِّدُهُ أن في رِواية أبي داود : « فَسَلَّم عَليْنا » .

856- وعن أبي جُرَيِّ الهجُيْمِيِّ رضي الله عنه قال : أتيت رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقلُت : عَلْيك السَّلامُ يا رَسول الله . فقال : لاتَقُلْ عَلَيْكَ السَّلامُ، فإن عَلَيْكَ السّلامُ تَحيَّةُ الموتى » رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن صحيح . وقد سبق بِطولِه .

		 				 	

باب آداب السلام

857- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه أن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « يُسَلِّمُ الرَّاكبُ عَلَى الْمَاشِي ، وَالْماشي عَلَي القَاعِدِ ، والقليلُ على الكَثِيِرِ » متفق عليه . وفي رواية البخاري : والصغيرُ على الْكَبِيرِ » .

858- وعن أبي أُمامة صُديِّ بن عجلان الباهِلِي رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : «إنَّ أوْلىَ النِّاس بالله مَنْ بَدأهم بالسَّلاَم )).

رواه أبو داود بإسنادٍ جيدٍ ، ورواه الترمذي عن أبي أُمامةَ رضي الله عنهُ قِيلَ يارسولَ الله، الرَّجُلانِ يَلْتَقيان أيُّهُمَا يَبْدأُ بالسَّلامِ ، قال أوْلاهُمَا بالله تعالى ، قال الترمذي : حديث حسن .

		 				 	

باب استحباب إعادة السلام

على من تكرَّر لقاؤه على قرب بأن دخل ثم خرج ثم دخل في الحال ، أو حال بينهما شجرة ونحوها 

859- عن أبي هريرة رضي اللَّه عنه في حديث المسِيءِ صَلاتُه أنَّهُ جاء فَصَلَّى ثُمَّ جاء إلى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَسَلَّمَ عَلَيْهِ فَرَدَّ عَلَيْهِ السَّلام فقال : « ارجع فَصَلِّ فَإنَّكَ لم تُصَلِّ» فَرَجَعَ فَصَلَّى ، ثُمَّ جاء فَسَلَّمَ عَلَى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم حَتّى فَعَل ذلكَ ثَلاثَ مَرَّاتٍ . متفق عليه .

860- وعنه عن رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « إذا لقيَ أَحَدَكُمْ أخاه فَلْيُسَلِّمْ عَلَيْهِ ، فَإنْ حالَتْ بَيْنَهُمَا شَجَرَةٌ أو جِدَارٌ أوْ حَجَرٌ ثُمَّ لَقِيَهُ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ عَلَيْه » رواه أبو داود .

		 				 	

باب استحباب السلام إذا دخل بيته

قال اللَّه تعالى: { فإذا دخلتم بيوتاً فسلموا على أنفسكم تحية من عند اللَّه مباركة طيبة } .

861- وعن أنس رضي الله عنه قال : قال لي رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « يابُنَّي ، إذا دَخَلْتَ عَلى أهْلِكَ فَسَلِّمْ يَكُنْ بَركةً عَلَيْكَ وَعَلَى أهلِ بَيْتِكَ »

رواه الترمذي وقال : حديث حسن صحيح .

		 				 	

باب السلام على الصبيان

862- عن أنس رضي الله عنه أنَّهُ مَرَّ عَلى صِبْيان فَسَلَّمَ عَلَيْهمْ وقال : كانَ رسول لله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَفْعلُهُ . متفق عليه .

		 				 	

باب سلام الرجل على زوجته والمرأة من محارمه 

وعلى أجنبية وأجنبيات لا يخاف الفتنة بهن وسلامهن بهذا الشرط 

863- عن سهل بن سعد رضي الله عنه قال : كانَتْ فينا امْرَأَةٌ وفي رواية : - كانَتْ لَنا عَجُوزٌ تأْخُذُ منْ أَُصُولِ السِّلْقَ فتطْرَحُهُ في القِدْرِ وَتُكَرْكِرُ حَبَّاتٍ منْ شَعِيرٍ ، فإذا صَلَّيْنا الجُمُعَةَ وانْصَرَفْنَا نُسَلِّمُ عَلَيْها فَتُقدِّمُهُ إليْنَا رواه البخاري . قوله « تُكَرْكِرُ » أي تَطحَنُ .

864- وعن أُم هانئ فاخِتَةَ بِنتِ أبي طَالب رضي الله عَنْهَا قَالت : أتيت النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَوْمَ الفَتْح وَهُو يَغْتسِلُ وَفاطِمةُ تَسْتُرهُ بِثَوْبٍ فَسَلَّمْتُ . 

وذَكَرَت الحديث . رواه مسلم . 

865- وعن أسماءَ بنتِ يزيد رضي الله عنها قالت : مر علينا النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم في نِسْوَةٍ فَسَلَّمَ عَلَيْنَا . رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن ، وهذا لفظ أبي داود، و لفظ الترمذي : أن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مَرَّ في المْسْجِدِ يوْماً وعُصْبَةٌ من النِّسَاءِ قُعُود فألوى بِيَدِهِ بالتَّسليمِ .

		 				 	

باب تحريم ابتدائنا الكفار بالسلام وكيفية الرد عليهم

واستحباب السلام على أهل مجلسٍ فيهم مسلمون وكفّار 

866- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه أن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « لاتَبَدَأوا اليَهُودَ ولا النَّصَارى بالسَّلام ، فإذا لَقِيتُم أحَدَهُم في طَرِيق فَاضطّرُّوهُ إلى أضْيَقِهِ » رواه مسلم . 

867- وعن أنس ٍ رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إذَا سَلَّمَ عَلَيكُم أهلُ الكتاب فَقٍُولُوا : وعَلَيْكُمْ » متفق عليه.

868- وعن أُسامه رضي الله عنه أن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مَرَّ عَلَى مَجْلسٍ فيه أخلاطٌ من المُسلِمِينَ والمُشرِكِين عَبَدةِ الأوثَانِ واليَهُودِ فَسَّلمَ عَلَيْهِمْ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم . متفق عليه .

		 				 	

باب استحباب السلام إذا قام منَ المجلس

وفارق جلساءه أو جليسه 

869- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : إذَا انْتَهَى أحَدُكُم إلى المَجْلسِ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ، فَإذَا أرَادَ أنْ يَقُومَ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ ،فَليسْت الأُولى بأَحَقِّ من الآخِرَة» رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

		 				 	

باب الاستئذان وآدابه

قال اللَّه تعالى: { يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تدخلوا بيوتاً غير بيوتكم حتى تستأنسوا وتسلموا على أهلها} .

وقال تعالى : { وإذا بلغ الأطفال منكم الحلم فليستأذنوا كما استأذن الذين من قبلهم } .

870- وعن أبي موسى الأشعري رضي الله عنه قال: قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم: « الاستِئْذاُن ثَلاَثٌ، فَإِنْ أُذِنَ لَكَ وَ إلاَّ فَارْجِع ، متفق عليه .

871- وعن سهلِ بنِ سعد رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « إنَّمَا جُعِلَ الاستئذاُن منْ أَجْلِ البَصَر » متفق عليه . 

872- وعن رِبْعِيِّ بن حِرَاشٍ قال حدَّثّنا رَجُلٌ من بَنِي عَامرٍ أنَّهُ استأذَنَ على النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وهو في بيت فقال : أألِج ؟ فقال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم لخادِمِهِ : «أُخْرُج إلى هذا فَعَلِّمْهُ الإستئذَانَ فَقُل لَهُ قُل : السَّلامُ عَلَيكُم، أأدْخُلُ ؟ » فَسَمِعهُ الرَّجُلُ فقال : السَّلام عَلَيكم ، أأدخُلُ ؟ فَأذن له النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَدَخَلَ . رواه أبو داود بإسناد صحيح .

873- عن كلدة بن الحنبل رضي الله عنه قال: أتيت النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَدَخَلْتُ عَلَيْه ولم أُسَلِّم فقال النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : «ارْجـِعْ فَقُلْ السَّلامُ عَلَيكُم أَأَدْخلُ ؟ » رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

		 				 	

باب بيان أن السنة إذا قيل للمستأذن : من أنت ؟

أن يقول : فلان فيسمي نفسه بما يعرف به من اسم أو كنية وكراهة قوله أنا ونحوها

874- عن أنس رضي الله عنه في حديثه المشهور في الإسراء قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، « ثُمَّ صَعِدَ بي جِبْريلُ إلى السّماء الدُّنيا فاستفتح » فقيل : منْ هذا ؟ قال : جبْريلُ، قِيلَ : وَمَنْ مَعَك ؟ قال : مُحمَّدٌ . ثمَّ صَعِدَ إلى السَّماء الثّانية فاستفتح ، قيل : مَنْ هذا ؟ قال : جبريلُ ، قيل : وَمَنْ مَعَكَ ؟ قال : مُحَمدٌَّ » والثّالثة والرَّابعة وَسَائرهنَّ وَيُقالُ في باب كل سماء : مَنْ هذا ؟ فَيقُولُ : جبريل متفق عليه . 

875- وعن أبي ذرِ رضي الله عنه قال: خَرجَتُ لَيْلة من اللّيالي فإذا رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يمشي وحْدَهُ، فجَعلتُ أمشي في ظلِّ القمَر، فالتفت فرآني فقال : « مَنْ هذا ؟ » فقلت ُ أبو ذَرٍ، متفق عليه

876- وعن أُمَّ هانئ رضي الله عنها قالت: أتيت النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وهو يغتسل وفاطمةُ تسْتُرُهُ فقال : «مَنْ هذه ، » فقلت : أنا أُم هَانئ . متفق عليه . 

877- وعن جابر رضي الله عنه قال : أتَيتُ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَدَقَقْتُ الباب فقال : « من هذا ؟ » فقلت ، أنا ، فقال : « أنا أنا ؟ » كأنهُ كَرهَهَا ، متفق عليه .

		 				 	

باب استحباب تشميت العاطس إذا حمد الله تعالى

142- باب استحباب تشميت العاطس إذا حمد الله تعالى وكراهية تشميته إذا لم يحمد اللَّه تعالى وبيان آداب التشميت والعطاس والتثاؤب

878- عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه أن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إن الله يُحِبُّ الُعطاسَ وَيَكْرَهُ التَّثاُؤبَ ، فَإذَا عَطَس أحَدكُم وحمد الله تعالى كانَ حقَّا على كل مسلم سمعهُ أن يقول له يرحمك الله وأما التّثاوب فإنما هو من الشيطان ، فـإذا تثاءب أحدكم فليردُّهُ ما استطاع ، فإن أحدكم إذا تثاءب ضَحِكَ منه الشيطان » رواه البخاري .

879- وعنه عن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إذا عطس أحدكم فليقل : الحمد لله ، وليقل له أخوه أو صاحبه : يرحمك الله ، فإذا قال له : يرحمك الله فليقل : يهديكم الله ويصلح بالكم » رواه البخاري .

880- وعن أبي موسى رضي الله عنه قال : سمعت رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقولُ « إذا عَطَس أحدُكُم فحمد الله فشمتوه ، فإنْ لم يحمد الله فلا تُشمتوه » رواه مسلم . 

881- وعن أنس رضي الله عنه قال : عطس رجلان عند النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فشمت أحدهما ولم يشمت الآخر ، فقال الذي لم يشمته : عطس فُلانٌ فَشَمَّتهُ وَعطستُ فَلَم تُشَمتني ؟ فقال : « هذا حمد الله ، وإنَك لم تحمد الله » . متفق عليه .

882- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال : كان رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إذَا عَطَسَ وَضَعَ يَدَهُ أوْ ثَوبَهُ عَلى فيهِ وَخَفَضَ أوْ غَضَّ بَها صَوْتَهُ.شك الراوي رواه أبو داود،والترمذي وقال حديث حسن صحيح.

883- وعن أبي موسى رضي الله عنه قال: « كان الْيَهُودُ يَتَعَاطسُونَ عْندَ رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَرْجُونَ أنْ يَقولَ لهْم يَرْحَمُكُم الله ، فيقولُ : يَهدْيكمُ الله ويُصلحُ بالكم » رواه أبو داود، والترمذي وقال حديث حسن صحيح . 

884- وعن أبي سعيد الخدري رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : إذَا تَثاءَبَ أحَدُكُمْ فَلْيُمسكْ بَيده على فيه فإنَّ الشيطان يدْخل» رواه مسلم .

		 				 	

باب استحباب المصافحةِ عندَ اللقاء وبشاشةِ الوجهِ

وتقبيل يد الرجل الصالح وتقبيل ولده شفقة ومعانقة القادم من سفر وكراهية الانحناء

885- عن أبي الخطاب قتادة قال : قلُت لأنس : أكَانتِ المُصافَحةُ في أصْحابِ رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم؟ قال : نَعَمْ . رواه البخاري .

886- وعن أنس رضي الله عنه قال : لَمَّا جَاءَ أهْلُ اليَمنِ قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « قَدْ جَاءَكُمْ أهْلُ الْيَمَنِ ، وَهُمْ أولُ مَنْ جَاءَ بالمُصَافَحَة » رواه أبو داود بإسناد صحيح .

887- وعن البراء رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « ما مِنْ مُسْلِمْيِن يَلْتَقِيَانِ فَيَتَصافَحَانِ إلا غُفر لَهما قبل أن يفترقا » رواه أبو داود .

888- وعن أنس رضي الله عنه قال : قال رجل : يا رسول الله ، الرَّجُلُ مِنَّا يَلْقَى أخَاُه أوْ صَديقَهُ أينْحني لَهُ ؟ قال : « لا » قال : أفَيَلتزمه ويقبله ؟ قال : « لا » قال : فَيَأْخُذُ بِيَده وَيُصَافِحُهُ ؟ قال : « نَعَم َ» رواه الترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

889- وعن صَفْوان بن عَسَّال رضي الله عنه قال : قال يَهُودي لِصَاحبه اذْهب بنا إلى هذا النبي فأتيا رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَسَألاه عن تسْع آيات بَينات فَذَكرَ الْحَديث إلى قَوْله : فقَبَّلا يَدَهُ وَرِجْلَهُ وقالا : نَشْهَدُ أنَّكَ نبي . رواه الترمذي وغيره بأسانيد صحيحة.

890- وعن ابن عمر رضي الله عنهما قصة قال فيها : فَدَنَوْنا من النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقَّبلْنا يده . رواه أبو داود .

891- وعن عائشة رضي الله عنها قالت : قَدم : زَيْدُ بُن حَارثة المدينة ورسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم في بَيْتي فأتَاهُ فَقَرَعَ الباب. فَقَام إليهْ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَجُرُّ ثوْبَهُ فاعتنقه وقبله » رواه الترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

892- وعن أبي ذرٍْ رضي الله عنه قال : قال لي رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم «لاتَحقِرَنَّ مِنَ المعْرُوف شَيْئاً وَلَو أن تلقى أخاك بوجه طليق » رواه مسلم .

893- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال : قبَّل النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم الحسن بن على رضي الله عنهما ، فقال ، الأقْرَعُ بن حَابس : إنَّ لي عَشَرةًَ مِنَ الْوَلَد ماَقَبَّلتُ مِنهُمْ أحَداَ . فقال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم . « مَنْ لاَيَرْحَمْ لا يُرْحَمْ ، َ» متفق عليه .
label-en:
Chapter on the virtue of greeting and the command to reveal it

God Almighty said: {O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own until you have socialized yourself and greeted its inhabitants}.

And God Almighty said: {And when you enter houses, greet yourselves with a blessed and good greeting from God.}

And God Almighty said: {And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet with a better one or return it.}

And God Almighty said: {Has the story of Abraham’s honored guest come to you when they entered upon him and said: Peace? He said: Peace.} 845- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, that a man asked the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, which Islam is best? He said, “You serve food and greet those you know and those you do not know.” Agreed.

846- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “When God created Adam, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, He said: Go and greet those, a group of angels sitting down, so listen. They will greet you, for it is I greet you and your descendants. He said: “Peace be upon you.” They said: “Peace be upon you and God’s mercy,” so they added: “And God’s mercy.” Agreed upon.

847- On the authority of Abu Amara Al-Baraa bin Azib, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, ordered us to do seven things: “To visit the sick person.” And following funerals, and praising the one who sneezes, and supporting the weak, and helping the oppressed, and extending greetings, and upholding the divided.” Agreed upon, this is the wording of one of Al-Bukhari’s narrations. 848- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “You will not enter Paradise until you believe, and you will not believe until you love one another. Shall I direct you to something that if you did it, you would love one another?” Spread peace among yourselves.” Narrated by Muslim. 849- On the authority of Abu Yusuf Abdullah bin Salam, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “O people, spread the greetings, feed the food, maintain the ties of kinship, and pray while the people sleep, you will enter Paradise in peace.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi said: A good and authentic hadith. 850 - On the authority of Al-Tufayl ibn Ubayy ibn Ka’b, that Abdullah ibn Umar used to go with him to the owner of a sale, and there was no poor person or anyone who did not greet him. Al-Tufayl said: I came to Abdullah ibn Umar one day, and he followed me to the market, and I said to him: What are you doing in the market when you do not Do you stand and sell, but do not ask about the goods, do not bargain with them, and do not sit in market gatherings? And I say, “Sit with us here and we will talk.” He said, “O Abu Batn.” Al-Tufayl had a stomach. We go out in the morning for the sake of peace, greeting whomever we meet. Narrated by Malik in Al-Muwatta’ with an authentic chain of transmission.

		 				 	

Chapter on how to make peace

You will love for the beginner to say the greeting: May the peace, mercy, and blessings of God be upon you. He uses the plural pronoun, even if the person being greeted is one, and the respondent says: May the peace, mercy, and blessings of God be upon you. The conjunction waw comes in his saying: And upon you.

851- On the authority of Imran bin Husayn, may God be pleased with them both, he said: A man came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and said: Peace be upon you. He responded to him, then sat down, and the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Ten,” then another came and said: Peace be upon you. And God’s mercy. He responded to him and sat down, saying: “Twenty.” Then another came and said: May God’s peace, mercy, and blessings be upon you. He responded to him, so he sat down and said: “Thirty.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith.

852- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: ((This is Gabriel reciting peace upon you)) She said: I said: (And upon him be peace, and God’s mercy and blessings)) Agreed upon.

This is how it occurred in some of the narrations of the two Sahihs: ((And His blessings)) and in some of them it was deleted, and the increase of trustworthiness is acceptable. 853- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that if the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, spoke a word, he would repeat it three times until it was understood, and if he came to a people and greeted them, he would greet them three times. Narrated by al-Bukhari. This depends on whether the gathering is large.

854- On the authority of Al-Miqdad, may God be pleased with him, in his long hadith, he said: We used to give the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, his share of milk, and he would come in the middle of the night and give the salutation in such a way as not to wake the sleeping person and to hear the one awake, so the Prophet came. May God bless him and grant him peace Then he greeted as he used to greet, narrated by Muslim.

855- On the authority of Asma’ bint Yazid, may God be pleased with her, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, passed through the mosque one day and a group of women were sitting, so he gestured with his hand in greeting.

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith. This is interpreted to mean that he, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, combined the word and the gesture, and it is supported by the fact that in the narration of Abu Dawud: “So he greeted us.” 856- On the authority of Abu Jarry al-Hujaimi, may God be pleased with him, he said: I came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: Peace be upon you, O Messenger of God. He said: Do not say peace be upon you, for peace be upon you is the greeting of the dead. Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith. Its length has already been mentioned.

		 				 	

Chapter on peace etiquette

857- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The rider greets the walking, the walking greets the sitting, and the small greets the large.” Agreed upon. And in Al-Bukhari’s narration: “The smaller is superior to the larger.”

858- On the authority of Abu Umamah Siddi bin Ajlan Al-Bahili, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Indeed, the people closest to God are those who initiate them with greetings of peace.”

It was narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission, and Al-Tirmidhi narrated it on the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him. It was said, O Messenger of God, two men will meet which of them begins with the greeting. The first of them said, “By God Almighty.” Al-Tirmidhi said: A good hadith. Chapter on the desirability of restoring peace

For someone who has repeatedly met him in close proximity, such that he entered, then left, then entered immediately, or a tree and the like came between them 

859- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, in the hadith of the one who prayed badly, that he came and prayed, then he came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and he greeted him, and he returned his greetings and said: “Go back and pray, for you have not prayed,” so he came back and prayed, Then he came and greeted the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, until he did that three times. Agreed.

860- On his authority, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, he said: “If one of you meets his brother, let him greet him. But if a tree, wall, or stone comes between them and he meets him, let him greet him.” “Narrated by Abu Dawud.

		 				 	

Chapter on the desirability of greeting oneself when one enters one’s house

God Almighty said: {And when you enter houses, greet yourselves with a blessed and kind greeting from God.} 861- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “My son, when you enter upon your family, say hello, and it will be a blessing upon you and upon your household.”

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good and authentic hadith.

		 				 	

Chapter: Peace be upon the boys

862- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that he passed by two boys, greeted them, and said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was doing this. Agreed.

		 				 	

Chapter: A man greeting his wife and a woman among his mahrams 

And upon a foreigner, male and female, there is no fear of temptation and their peace is subject to this condition 

863- On the authority of Sahl bin Saad, may God be pleased with him, he said: There was a woman among us, and in a narration: - We had an old woman who would take some of the roots of Swiss chard, throw it in the pot, and break up the grains of barley, so when we prayed Friday We left and greeted her, and she brought him to us. Narrated by Al-Bukhari. His saying “to grind” means to grind.

864- On the authority of Umm Hani’, his sister, daughter of Abu Talib, may God be pleased with her, she said: I came to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, on the day of the conquest while he was bathing and Fatima was covering him with a garment, so I greeted. 

She mentioned the hadith. Narrated by Muslim. 

865- On the authority of Asma’ bint Yazid, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, passed by us with women and greeted us. It was narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith. This is the wording of Abu Dawud, and the wording of Al-Tirmidhi is that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, passed by the mosque one day and a group of women were sitting, so he gestured with his hand in greeting.

		 				 	

Chapter on the prohibition of greeting the disbelievers and how to respond to them

And the desirability of greeting the people of a gathering that includes Muslims and infidels 

866- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Do not initiate the greeting of the Jews or the Christians. If you meet one of them on a road, force him to the narrowest road.” Narrated by Muslim. 

867- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “When the People of the Book greet you, say: And upon you.” Agreed upon.

868- On the authority of Osama, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, passed by a gathering in which there was a mixture of Muslims, idol-worshiping polytheists, and Jews, so the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, greeted them. Agreed.

		 				 	

Chapter on the desirability of greeting one another when he leaves the assembly

He left his companion or his companion 

869- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: When one of you comes to a meeting, let him salute, and if he wants to get up, let him salute, for the first is not more deserving than the last. Narrated by Abu Dawud. Al-Tirmidhi said: It is a good hadith.

		 				 	

Chapter on asking permission and its etiquette

God Almighty said: {O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own until you have socialized yourself and greeted its inhabitants}. And God Almighty said: {And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission as those before them asked permission.}

870- On the authority of Abu Musa Al-Ash’ari, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Seek permission for three things: if you are given permission, otherwise return.” Agreed upon.

871- On the authority of Sahl bin Saad, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The request for permission was only made for the sake of sight.” Agreed upon. 872- On the authority of Rabi’i bin Harash, he said: A man from Banu Amir told us that he asked permission to come to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, while he was in a house, and he said: Should I enter? Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said to his servant: “Go out to this man and teach him to ask for permission, and say to him: ‘Peace be upon you. May I come in?’” The man heard him and said: Peace be upon you. Shall I come in? So the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, gave him permission and he entered. Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission.

873- On the authority of Kalada ibn al-Hanbal, may God be pleased with him, he said: I came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and I entered upon him but did not greet him. Then the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Go back and say peace be upon you. Shall I enter?” “Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith. Chapter: Explaining that the Sunnah is if the one asking for permission is asked: Who are you?

To say: So-and-so and call himself by whatever name or nickname he is known by, and it is disliked to say “I” and the like

874- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, in his famous hadith regarding the Night Journey, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said, “Then Gabriel took me to the lowest heaven and asked for the victory.” It was said: Who is this? He said: Gabriel. It was said: Who is with you? He said: Muhammad. Then he ascended to the second heaven and asked for the opening. It was said: Who is this? He said: Gabriel. It was said: Who is with you? He said: Muhammad, and the third, the fourth, and the rest of them. It is said in the chapter on every heaven: Who is this? He says: Gabriel, agreed upon. 

875- On the authority of Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with him, he said: I went out one night and saw the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, walking alone. So I started walking in the shadow of the moon, and he turned and saw me and said: “Who is this?” » I said: Abu Dharr, agreed upon

876- On the authority of Umm Hani’, may God be pleased with her, she said: I came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, while he was bathing while Fatima was covering him, and he said: “Who is this?” So I said: I am Umm Hani’. Agreed. 

877- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, he said: I came to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and I knocked on the door and he said: “Who is this?” I said, “I am,” and he said, “I am?” » As if he hated her, agreed upon. Chapter on the desirability of the sneezer’s praise if he praises God Almighty

142- Chapter on the desirability of praising God Almighty when he praises God Almighty, and the dislike of praising God Almighty if he does not praise God Almighty, and explaining the etiquette of praising God Almighty, sneezing, and yawning.

878- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him: “God loves sneezing and hates yawning. So when one of you sneezes and praises God Almighty, it is the duty of every Muslim who hears him to say to him, ‘May God have mercy on you.’ As for yawning, it is from Satan. If one of you yawns, let him hold it back as much as he can. If one of you yawns, Satan laughs at him.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

879- And on the authority of him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace: “If one of you sneezes, let him say: Praise be to God, and let his brother or friend say to him: May God have mercy on you, and if he says to him: May God have mercy on you, let him say: May God guide you and put your mind at ease.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

880- On the authority of Abu Musa, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: “If one of you sneezes, praise God, then smell him, but if he does not praise God, do not smell his name.” Narrated by Muslim. 881- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: Two men sneezed in the presence of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and one of them smelled it and the other did not smell it, and the one who did not smell it said: So-and-so sneezed and I smelled him and I sneezed and you did not smell me? He said: “This is the praise of God, but you did not thank God.” Agreed.

882- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: Whenever the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, sneezed, he would put his hand or his garment on his mouth and lower or lower his voice with it. The narrator doubted. It was narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it was a hasan authentic hadith. 883- On the authority of Abu Musa, may God be pleased with him, he said: “The Jews were sneezing with the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, hoping that he would say to them, ‘May God have mercy on you,’ and he would say: ‘May God guide you and set your mind at ease.’” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it was a good and authentic hadith. 

884- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “If one of you yawns, let him hold his hand over his mouth, for Satan will enter.” Narrated by Muslim. Chapter on the desirability of shaking hands when meeting and with a smiling face

Kissing the hand of a righteous man and kissing his child out of compassion, hugging someone coming back from a trip, and hating bowing down

885- On the authority of Abu al-Khattab Qatada, he said: I said to Anas: Was the handshake common among the Companions of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace? He said: Yes. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

886- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: When the people of Yemen came, the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The people of Yemen have come to you, and they are the first to come by shaking hands.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission.

887- On the authority of Al-Baraa, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There is no two Muslims who meet and shake hands without being forgiven before they separate.” Narrated by Abu Dawud. 888- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: A man said: O Messenger of God, a man among us meets his brother or friend, should I bow to him? He said: “No.” He said: Should he adhere to it and accept it? He said: “No.” He said: So he takes his hand and shakes it? He said: “Yes.” Al-Tirmidhi narrated it and said: It is a good hadith. 889 - On the authority of Safwan bin Assal, may God be pleased with him, he said: A Jew said to his friend, “Take us to this Prophet.” So they came to the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and asked him about nine clear signs. He mentioned the hadith until he said: So they kissed his hand and his foot. They said: We bear witness that you are a prophet. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and others with authentic chains of narration.

890- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, a story in which he said: So we approached the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and we kissed his hand. Narrated by Abu Dawud.

891- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: Zaid bin Haritha came to Medina and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, in my house, so he came and knocked on the door. Then the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, stood up to him, dragging his garment, so he embraced him and kissed him.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: a good hadith.

892- On the authority of Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “Do not despise anything that is good, even if it is to meet your brother with an open face.” Narrated by Muslim. 893- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, kissed Al-Hasan bin Ali, may God be pleased with them both, and Al-Aqra’ bin Habis said: I have ten children and I have not kissed any of them. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said. “He who does not have mercy will not be shown mercy.” Agreed upon.

باب آداب النوم والاضطجاع

والقعود والمجلس والجليس والرؤيا

814- عن الْبَراءِ بن عازبٍ رضيَ اللَّه عنهما قال : كَانَ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إذا أَوَى إلى فِرَاشِهِ نَامَ عَلى شِقَّهِ الأَيمنِ ، ثُمَّ قال : « اللَّهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِي إليْكَ ، وَوجَّهْتُ وَجْهي إلَيْكَ ، وفَوَّضْتُ أَمْرِي إلَيْكَ ، وَأَلجَأْتُ ظهْري إلَيْكَ ، رَغْبةً وَرهْبَةً إلَيْكَ ، لا مَلْجأ ولا مَنْجى مِنْكَ إلاَّ إلَيْكَ ، آمَنْتُ بِكتَابكَ الذي أَنْزلتَ ، وَنَبيِّكَ الذي أَرْسَلْتَ » .

رواه البخاري بهذا اللفظ في كتاب الأدب من صحيحه .

815- وعنه قال : قال لي رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إذَا أَتَيْتَ مَضْجَعكَ فَتَوَضَّأْ وُضُوءَكَ لِلصَّلاةِ ، ثُمَّ اضْطَجِعْ عَلى شِقِّكَ الأَيمَنِ ، وَقُلْ .. » وذَكَرَ نَحْوهُ ، وفيه : « واجْعَلْهُنَّ آخِرَ مَا تَقول » متفقٌ عليه .

816- وعن عائشةَ رضيَ اللَّه عنها قالتْ : كَانَ النَّبيُّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَصلِّي مِن اللَّيْلِ إحْدَى عَشَرَةَ رَكْعَةً ، فَإذا طلَع الْفَجْرُ صَلَّى ركْعَتيْنِ خَفِيفتيْنِ ، ثمَّ اضْطَجَعَ على شِقِّهِ الأيمن حَتَّى يَجِيءَ المُؤَذِّنُ فيُوذِنَهُ ، متفق عليه .

817- وعن حُذَيْفَةَ رضي اللَّه عنه قال : : كان النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إذا أَخَذَ مَضْجَعَهُ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ وَضَعَ يَدهُ تَحْتَ خَدِّهِ ، ثمَّ يَقُولُ : « اللَّهُمَّ بِاسْمِكَ أمُوتُ وَ أَحْيَا » وإذا اسْتيْقَظَ قَالَ : «الحَمْدُ للَّهِ اَلَّذي أَحْيَانَا بعْدَ مَا أَمَاتَنَا وإليه النُّشُورُ » . رواه البخاري .

818- وعن يعِيشَ بنِ طخْفَةَ الغِفَارِيَّ رضي الله عنهما قال : قال أبي «بينما أنَا مضُطَجِعٌ في الْمسَجِدِ عَلَى بَطْنِي إذَا رَجُلٌ يُحَرِّكُنِي بِرِجْلهِ فقال « إنَّ هذِهِ ضَجْعَةٌ يُبْغِضُهَا اللهُ » قال : فَنَظرْتُ ، فإذَا رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم رواه أبو داود بإسنادٍ صحيح .

819- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه عن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « مَنْ قَعَدَ مَقْعَداً لَمْ يَذْكُرِ الله تعالى فِيهِ كَانَتْ عَلَيِهِ مِنَ الله تعالى تِرةٌ ، وَمَنِ اضْطَجَعَ مُضْطَجَعاً لاَيَذْكُرُ الله تعالى فِيهِ كَانَتْ عَلْيِه مِن اللهِ تِرةٌ » رواه أبو داود بإسنادِ حسن . « التِّرةُ » بكسر التاء 

		 				 	

باب جواز الاستلقاء على القفا

ووضع إحدى الرجلين على الأخرى إذا لم يَخف انكشاف العورة وجولز القعود متربعاً ومحتبياً 

820- عن عبدِ الله بن يزيد رضي الله عنه أنه رأى رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مُستَلِقياَ في المسَجْدِ وَاضعاً إحْدَى رِجْليْهِ عَلى الأُخْرىَ متفق عليه .

821- وعن جابر بن سمرة رضي الله عنه قال : « كان النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إذَا صَلَّى الْفَجرَ تَرَبَّعَ في مَجْلِسِهِ حتَّى تَطْلُعَ الشَّمسُ حَسْنَاء » حدِيث صحيح ، رواه أبو داود وغيره بأسانيد صحيحة.

822- وعنِ ابن عمر رضي الله عنهما قال : رأيت رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم بفناء الكَعْبِةَ مُحْتَبياً بِيَدَيْهِ هكَذَا ، وَوَصَفَ بِيَدِيِه الاحْتِباء، و َهُوَ القُرفُصَاء رواه البخاري.

823- وعن قَيْلَةَ بِنْت مَخْرمَةَ رضي الله عنها قالت : رأيتُ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وهو قَاعِدٌ القُرَفُصَاءَ فلما رأيتُ رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم المُتَخَشِّعَ في الِجْلسةِ أُرْعِدتُ مِنَ الفَرَقِ . رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي.

824- وعنِ الشَّريد بن سُوَيْدٍ رضي الله عنه قال : مر بي رسولُ الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وَأنا جَالس هكذا ، وَقَدْ وَضَعتُ يَديِ اليُسْرَى خَلْفَ ظَهْرِي وَاتَّكأْتُ عَلَى إليْة يَدِي فقال : أتقْعُدُ قِعْدةَ المَغضُوبِ عَلَيهْمْ ، رواه أبو داود بإسناد صحيح ٍ.

		 				 	

باب في آداب المجلس والجليس

825- عن ابنِ عمر رضي الله عنهما قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « لايُقِيِمَنَّ أحَدُكُمْ رَجُلاً مِنْ مَجْلسهِ ثم يَجْلسُ فِيه ولكِنْ تَوسَعُّوا وتَفَسَّحوا » وَكَان ابنُ عُمَرَ إذا قام َ لهُ رَجُلٌ مِنْ مجْلِسه لَمْ يَجِلسْ فِيه . متفق عليه .

826- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه أن رسول لله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « إذا قاَم أحَدُكُمْ منْ مَجْلسٍ ثُمَّ رَجَعَ إلَيْهِ فَهُوَ أحَقُّ بِه » رواه مسلم .

827- وعن جابر بنِ سَمُرَةَ رضي اللَّه عنهما قال : « كُنَّا إذَا أَتَيْنَا النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم جَلَسَ أَحَدُنَا حَيْثُ يَنْتَهي » . رواه أبو داود . والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

828- وعن أبي عبدِ الله سَلْمان الفارِسي رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم :« لاَ يَغْتَسِلُ رَجُلٌ يَوْمَ الجُمُعة وَيَتَطهّرُ ما اسْتَطاعَ منْ طُهر وَيدَّهنُ منْ دُهْنِهِ أوْ يَمسُّ مِنْ طيب بَيْته ثُمَّ يَخْرُجُ فَلاَ يُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ اثْنينْ ثُمَّ يُصَلّي ما كُتِبَ له ُ ثُمَّ يُنْصِتُ إذَا تَكَلَّمَ الإمامُ إلا غُفِرَ لهُ ما بَيْنَهُ وَبَيَْن الجمُعَةِ الأُخْرَى » رواه البخاري .

829- وعن عمرو بن شُعَيْب عن أبيه عن جده رضي الله عنه أن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال: « لايحَلُّ لِرَجُل أن يُفَرِّقَ بَيْنَ اثْنيْنِ إلا بإذْنِهِمَا » رواه أبو داود، والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

وفي رواية لأبي داود : « لايَجلِسُ بَيْنَ رَجُليْن إلا بإذْنِهمَا ».

830- وعن حذيفة بن اليمان رضي الله عنه أن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم لَعَنَ مَنْ جَلَسَ وَسَطَ الحَلْقَةَ . رواه أبو داود بإسناد حسن .

وروى الترمذي عن أبي مِجْلزٍ أن رَجُلاً قَعَدَ وَسَطَ حَلقْة فقال حُذَيْفَةُ : مُلْعُونٌ عُلَىَ لِسَانِ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أوْ لَعَنَ الله عَلَى لِسَانِ محُمَدٍ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مَنْ جَلَسَ وَسَطَ الْحَلْقةِ. قال الترمذي : حديث حسن صحيح .

831- وعن أبي سعيد الخدريِّ رضي الله عنه قال سمعت رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقول « خَيْرُ الْمَجَالِسِ أوْسَعُهَا » رواه أبو داود بإسناد صحيح على شرطِ البخاري .

832- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَنْ جَلَسَ في مَجْلس فَكثُرَ فيهِ لَغطُهُ فقال قَبْلَ أنْ يَقُومَ منْ مجلْسه ذلك : سبْحانَك اللَّهُمّ وبحَمْدكَ أشْهدُ أنْ لا إله إلا أنْت أسْتغْفِركَ وَأتَوبُ إليْك : إلا غُفِرَ لَهُ ماَ كان َ في مجلسه ذلكَ » رواه الترمذي وقال : حديث حسن صحيح .

833- وعن أبي بَرْزَةَ رضي الله عنه قال : كان رسول صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقولُ بآخرة إذَا أرَادَ أنْ يَقُومَ مِنَ الْمَجِلسِ « سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ وبَحَمْدكَ أشْهدُ أنْ لا إلهَ إلا أنْتَ أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وأتُوبُ إِلَيْكَ » فقال رَجُلٌ يارسول الله إنَّكَ لَتَقُولُ قَوْلاَ مَاكُنْتَ تَقُولُهُ فِيَما مَضَى ؟ قال : «ذلكَ كفَّارَةٌ لِماَ يَكُونُ في الْمجْلِسِ » رواه أبو داود ، ورواه الحاكم أبو عبد الله في المستدرك من رواية عائشة رضي الله عنها وقال :صحيح الإسناد. 

834- وعن ابن عمر رضي الله عنهما قال : قَلَّمَا كان رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقوم من مَجْلس حتى يَدعُوَ بهؤلاَءِ الَّدعَوَاتِ « الَّلهمَّ اقْسِم لَنَا مِنْ خَشْيَتِكَ ما تحُولُ بِه بَيْنَنَا وبَينَ مَعٌصَِيتِك، ومن طَاعَتِكَ ماتُبَلِّغُنَا بِه جَنَّتَكَ، ومِنَ اْليَقيٍن ماتُهِوِّنُ بِه عَلَيْنا مَصَائِبَ الدُّنيَا . الَّلهُمَّ مَتِّعْنا بأسْمَاعِناَ، وأبْصَارناَ، وِقُوّتِنا ما أحييْتَنَا ، واجْعَلْهُ الوَارِثَ منَّا ، وِاجعَل ثَأرَنَا عَلى مَنْ ظَلَمَنَا، وانْصُرْنا عَلى مَنْ عادَانَا ، وَلا تَجْعلْ مُِصيَبتَنا في دينَنا ، وَلا تَجْعلِ الدُّنْيَا أكبَرَ همِّنا ولا مبلغ عِلْمٍنَا ، وَلا تُسَلِّط عَلَيَنَا مَنْ لا يْرْحَمُناَ » رواه الترمذي وقال حديث حسن .

835- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « مَا مِنْ قَوْمٍ يَقومونَ منْ مَجْلسٍ لا يَذكُرُون الله تعالى فيه إلا قَاموا عَنْ مِثلِ جيفَةِ حِمَارٍ وكانَ لَهُمْ حَسْرَةً » رواه أبو داود بإسناد صحيح .

836- وعنه عن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « مَا جَلَسَ قَومٌ مَجْلِساً لم يَذْكرُوا الله تَعَالَى فيه ولَم يُصَُّلوا على نَبِيِّهم فيه إلاَّ كانَ عَلَيّهمْ تِرةٌ ، فإِنْ شاءَ عَذَّبَهُم ، وإنْ شَاءَ غَفَرَ لَهُم » رواه الترمذي وقال حديث حسن .

837- وعنه عن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « مَنْ قعَدَ مَقْعَداً لم يَذْكُرِ الله تعالى فِيهِ كَانَت عليه مِنَ الله ترَة، وَمَن اضطجَعَ مُضْطَجَعاً لايَذْكرُ الله تعالى فيه كَاَنتْ عَليْه مِنَ الله تِرَةٌ َ» رواه أبو داود . وقد سبق قريبا ، وشَرَحْنَا « التِّرَةَ » فِيهِ

		 				 	

باب الرؤيا وما يتعلق بها

قال اللَّه تعالى (الروم 23): { ومن آياته منامكم بالليل والنهار } .

838- وعن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال : سمعت رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقول : « لم يَبْقَ مِنَ النُبُوَّة إلا المبُشِّراتُ » قالوا : وَمَا المُبشِّراتُ ؟ قال : « الُّرؤْيَا الصَّالِحةُ » رواه البخاري .

839- وعنه أن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « إذَا اقتَربَ الزَّمَانُ لَمْ تَكَدْ رُؤْيَا الُمؤْمن تَكذبُ ، وَرُؤْيَا المُؤْمِنِ جُزْءٌ منْ ستَّةٍ وَأرْبَعيَنَ جُزْءًا مِنَ النُبُوةِ » متفق عليه . وفي رواية:« أصْدَقُكُم رُؤْيَا: أصْدُقكُم حَديثاً ».

840- وعنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَنْ رآني في المنَامِ فَسَيَرَانيِ في الَيَقَظَةِ أوْ كأنَّمَا رآني في اليَقَظَةِ لايَتَمثَّلُ الشَّيْطانُ بي » . متفق عليه . 

841- وعن أبي سعيد الخدريِّ رضي الله عنه أنه سمِع النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقول : « إذا رَأى أَحدُكُم رُؤْيَا يُحبُّهَا فَإنَّما هي من الله تعالى فَليَحْمَدِ الله عَلَيهَا وَلْيُحُدِّثْ بِها وفي رواية : فَلا يُحَدِّثْ بَها إلا مَنْ يُحِبُّ وَإذا رأى غَيَر ذَلك مما يَكرَهُ فإنَّمـا هي منَ الشَّيْطانِ فَليَسْتَعِذْ منْ شَرِّهَا وَلا يَذكْرها لأحد فإنها لا تضُُّره » متفق عليه . 

842- وعن أبي قتادة رضي الله عنه قال : قال النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « الرّؤيا الصَّالَحِةُ وفي رواية الرُّؤيَا الحَسَنَةُ منَ الله ، والحُلُم مِنَ الشَّيْطَان ، فَمَن رَأى شَيْئاً يَكرَهُهُ فَلْيَنْفُثْ عَن شِمَاله ثَلاَثاً ، ولْيَتَعَوَّذْ مِنَ الشَْيْطان فَإنَّها لا تَضُرُّهُ » متفق عليه . « النَّفثُ » نَفخٌ لطيفٌ لاريِقَ مَعَهُ.

843- وعن جابر رضي الله عنه عن رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « إذَا رَأى أحَدُكُم الرُّؤيا يَكْرَهُها فلْيبصُقْ عَن يَسَارِهِ ثَلاَثاً ، وْليَسْتَعِذْ بالله مِنَ الشَّيَطانِ ثَلاثاَ ، وليَتَحوَّل عَنْ جَنْبِهِ الذي كان عليه » رواه مسلم .

844- وعن أبي الأسقع واثلة بن الأسقع رضي الله عنه قال : قال رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إنَّ من أعظَم الفَرى أن يَدَّعِي الرَّجُلُ إلى غَيْرِ أبِيه ، أوْ يُري عَيْنهُ مَالم تَرَ ، أوْ يقولَ على رسول الله صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مَا لَمْ يَقُلْ » رواه البخاري .

Chapter on sleeping and lying down etiquette

Sitting, sitting, sitting, and seeing

814- On the authority of Al-Baraa bin Azib, may God be pleased with them both, he said: When the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, went to bed, he would sleep on his right side, then he said: “O God, I surrender myself to you. And I turned my face to You, and I entrusted my affairs to You, and I turned my back to You, out of desire and fear for You. There is no refuge or refuge from You except in You. I believed in Your Book which sent down, and Your Prophet whom You sent. It was narrated by Al-Bukhari with this wording in the book Al-Adab from his Sahih.

815- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said to me: “When you go to bed, perform your ablution for prayer, then lie on your right side, and say...” He mentioned something similar, including: “And make them the last thing you say.” Agreed upon. 816- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to pray eleven rak’ahs at night, so when dawn came he prayed two light rak’ahs, then He lay on his right side until the muezzin comes and calls him to prayer. Agreed upon. 817- On the authority of Hudhayfah, may God be pleased with him, he said: When the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, went to bed at night, he would put his hand under his cheek, then say: “O God, in your name I will die.” He came back to life.” And when he woke up, he said: “Praise be to God who brought us back to life after He caused us to die, and to Him is the resurrection.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

818- On the authority of Ya’ish ibn Takhfa al-Ghifari, may God be pleased with them both, he said: My father said, “While I was lying in the mosque on my stomach, when a man moved me with his foot, he said, ‘This is a position he hates. God. He said: So I looked, and behold, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. 819- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Whoever sits in a seat in which he does not remember God Almighty, there will be a blessing from God Almighty upon him, and whoever lies down He does not mention God Almighty therein. There was a moment of dissatisfaction with God.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission. “Al-Turrah” with a kasra on the ta’ 

		 				 	

Chapter on the permissibility of lying on the back

And placing one leg over the other if there is no fear of exposure of the private parts and one must sit cross-legged and covered 

820- On the authority of Abdullah bin Yazid, may God be pleased with him, that he saw the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, lying in the mosque, placing one of his legs on the other. Agreed upon. 821- On the authority of Jabir bin Samra, may God be pleased with him, he said: “When the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, prayed the dawn prayer, he would sit cross-legged in his seat until the sun rose, beautiful.” An authentic hadith, narrated by Abu Dawud and others with authentic chains of transmission.

822- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I saw the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, in the courtyard of the Kaaba, covering himself with his hands like this, and he described hiding with his hands, which is squatting. Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 823- On the authority of Qayla bint Makhramah, may God be pleased with her, she said: I saw the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, sitting cross-legged, and when I saw the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, who was humbled while sitting, I was terrified by the difference. Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi.

824- On the authority of Al-Sharid bin Suwayd, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, passed by me while I was sitting like this, with my left hand behind my back and leaning on my buttocks, and he said: Sit down. those who are angry with them, Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission.

		 				 	

Chapter on the etiquette of the council and the sitter

825- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “None of you appoints a man to sit in his place and then sits in it, but expand yourselves and make space.” And if Ibn Umar would stand up for him, He did not sit in it. Agreed.

826- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “If one of you gets up from a meeting and then returns to it, then he has more right to it.” Narrated by Muslim.

827- On the authority of Jabir bin Samurah, may God be pleased with them both, he said: “When we came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, one of us would sit wherever he decided.” Narrated by Abu Dawud. Al-Tirmidhi said: A good hadith.

828- On the authority of Abu Abdullah Salman Al-Farisi, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A man should not bathe on Friday and purify himself as much as he can, and apply some ointment, or touch on any of the perfume from his house.” Then he goes out and does not differentiate between the two. Then he prays what was prescribed for him, then he listens when the imam speaks, but he will be forgiven for what happened between him and the next Friday prayer.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 829- On the authority of Amr bin Shuaib, on the authority of his father, on the authority of his grandfather, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “It is not permissible for a man to separate between two people except with their permission.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: a good hadith.

In a narration by Abu Dawud: “He should not sit between two men without their permission.”

830- On the authority of Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, cursed the one who sat in the middle of the circle. Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission.

Al-Tirmidhi narrated on the authority of Abu Majliz that a man sat in the middle of a group and Hudhayfah said: He is cursed on the tongue of Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, or God has cursed on the tongue of Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, whoever sat. The middle of the ring. Al-Tirmidhi said: A good and authentic hadith.

831- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: “The best gatherings are the broadest ones.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission according to Al-Bukhari’s conditions.

832- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever sits in a gathering and there is a lot of confusion in it, then he says before he gets up from that sitting: Glory be to You, O God, and with Your praise I bear witness that there is no god but You.” I seek Your forgiveness and I repent to You: unless he will be forgiven for what he did in that gathering.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good and authentic hadith.

833 - On the authority of Abu Barza, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would say in the afterlife when he wanted to get up from the assembly: “Glory be to You, O God, and with Your praise I bear witness that there is no god but You. I seek Your forgiveness and repent.” To you.” A man said, “O Messenger of God, are you saying something that you did not say in the past?” He said: “That is an expiation for what happens in the gathering.” Narrated by Abu Dawud, and narrated by Al-Hakim Abu Abdullah in Al-Mustadrak from the narration of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, and he said: The chain of transmission is authentic. 

834- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, rarely rose from a gathering to recite these supplications: “O God, distribute to us of your fear what will come between us and your disobedience. And from your obedience is what you bring us to your Paradise, and from certainty is what you make the calamities of this world easy for us. Oh God, grant us enjoyment with our hearing, our sight, and our strength as long as You give us life, and make him an heir from among us, and make our vengeance against those who wronged us, and grant us victory over those who are hostile to us, and do not Make our calamity our religion, and do not make this world our greatest concern or the extent of our knowledge, and do not make over us those who do not have mercy on us.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and who said it was a good hadith. 835- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There is no people who rise from a gathering in which they do not remember God Almighty except that they rise from something like the carcass of a donkey, and it is a sorrow for them.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. .

836- And on the authority of him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “A people does not sit in a gathering in which they do not mention God Almighty and do not pray for their Prophet in it, but there is a burden on them. If He wills, He will punish them, and if He wills, He will forgive.” “For them.” Al-Tirmidhi narrated it and said it was a good hadith. 837- And on his authority, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, “Whoever sits in a seat and does not mention God Almighty in it, there will be a reproach from God upon him, and whoever lies down in a place where he does not mention God Almighty, it will be upon him from God.” “Tira” narrated by Abu Dawud. It was mentioned shortly before, and we explained “the term” in it

		 				 	

Chapter on vision and what is related to it

God Almighty said (Al-Rum 23): {And among His signs is your sleep by night and by day}. 838- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “Nothing remains of the prophethood except the women who bring good tidings.” They said: What are the women who bring good tidings? He said: “A good vision.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

839- On his authority, the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “When time approaches, the believer’s vision will hardly be false, and the believer’s vision is one of forty-six parts of prophecy.” “Agreed upon. And in a narration: “The most truthful of you in a vision: the most truthful of you in a speech.”

840- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever sees me in a dream will see me when he is awake, or as if he saw me when awake, Satan will not imitate me.” Agreed. 

841- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, that he heard the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: “If one of you sees a vision that he likes, then it is from God Almighty, so let him thank God for it and narrate it, and in a narration: Then he should not narrate it except Who loves and if If he sees something other than that, which he dislikes, it is from Satan, so let him seek refuge from its evil and not mention it to anyone, for it will not harm him.” Agreed upon. 

842- On the authority of Abu Qatada, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A good dream, and according to the narration, a good dream is from God, and a dream is from Satan, so whoever sees something that he hates, let him vent it.” To his left three times, and let him seek refuge from Satan, for it will not harm him. Agreed upon. “Blowing” is a gentle blowing with no air.

843- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “If one of you sees a vision that he hates, let him spit on his left three times, and seek refuge with God from Satan three times. And let him turn away from the side he was on.” Narrated by Muslim. 844- On the authority of Abu Al-Asqa’ and Athila bin Al-Asqa’, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “One of the greatest lies is for a man to claim someone other than his father, or to show his eyes what it has not seen, or to say about the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, something that it has not seen.” He says: Narrated by Al-Bukhari.
