Its color is the color of blood, and its smell is the scent of musk, and by the One in whose hand is the soul of Muhammad. With his hand, had I not made it difficult for the Muslims, I would never have stayed behind a company that fights in the way of God, but I do not have the capacity to carry them and they do not find the capacity, and it is difficult for them to lag behind me. By the One in whose hand is Muhammad’s soul, I would like to fight in the way of God and be killed, then I would fight and be killed. Then I invade and kill.” Narrated by Muslim, and Al-Bukhari narrated some of it.

“Speech”: wound.

1295- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “There is no afflicted person who speaks for the sake of God but he will come on the Day of Resurrection, and his words will bleed: the color is the color of blood and the smell is the smell of musk.” Agreed upon.

1296- On the authority of Muadh, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Any Muslim man who fights in the cause of God and hiccups a she-camel will be granted Paradise, and whoever is wounded in the cause of God or suffers a calamity.” A calamity, for it will come on the Day of Resurrection as abundant as ever: its color is saffron, and its scent is like musk.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith.

1297- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: A man from the companions of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, passed by a path in which was a spring of fresh water, and he liked it, so he said: If only I would retire People, so I stayed in this people, and I will not do so until I ask permission from the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. So he mentioned that to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he said: “Do not do it. The position of one of you in the path of God is better than his prayer in his house for seventy years. Would you not like God to forgive you and admit you to Paradise? Fight in the cause of God. Whoever fights in the cause of God and hiccups a she-camel, Paradise is guaranteed for him.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

The hiccup: between the two rings. 1298- On his authority, it was said: O Messenger of God, what is equivalent to jihad in the path of God? He said: “You cannot do it.” So they repeated it to him two or three times, all of which saying: “You cannot do it.” Then he said: “The example of a person who strives in the cause of God is like the example of a fasting person who stands and obeys the signs of God. He does not cease either prayer or fasting, until the struggler returns to the cause of God.” Agreed upon. This is a Muslim word.

In Al-Bukhari’s narration, a man said: O Messenger of God, guide me to an action that is equivalent to jihad? He said: “I can’t find him.” Then he said: “If the mujahideen comes out, will you be able to enter your mosque and stand up and not stop, and fast and not break the fast?” He said: Who can do that?

1299 - And on his authority, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Among the people’s best livelihood is a man who holds the reins of his horse for the sake of God, who flies on board whenever he hears a sound, or a fright. He flies on text, He seeks murder or death as his place, or a man in possession of a spoil, or a handful of these branches, or the depths of one of these valleys, establishes prayer, pays zakat, and worships his Lord until certainty comes to him, not of people except in goodness.” Narrated by Muslim.

1300- On his authority, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Indeed, there are one hundred levels in Paradise that God has prepared for those who strive in the cause of God, and the distance between the two levels is like the distance between the heaven and the earth.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1301- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever is satisfied with God as his Lord, with Islam as his religion, and with Muhammad as his Messenger, it is obligatory for him Paradise.” Abu Saeed was amazed at it, so he said, “Give it back to me, O Messenger of God.” So he returned it to him. Then he said: “And another, by which God will raise the servant one hundred degrees in Paradise, between each Two degrees as between the heaven and the earth.” He said: What is it, O Messenger of God? He said: “Jihad for the sake of God, jihad for the sake of God.” Narrated by Muslim.

1302- On the authority of Abu Bakr bin Abi Musa Al-Ash’ari, he said: I heard my father, may God be pleased with him, while he was in the presence of the enemy, saying: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Indeed, the gates of Paradise Under the shade of swords.” Then a man of shabby appearance stood up and said: O Abu Musa, did you hear the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say this? He said: Yes, so he returned to his companions and said: “I extend my greetings to you.” Then he broke the cover of his sword and threw it. Then he walked with his sword to the enemy and struck with it until he was killed. Narrated by Muslim.

1303- On the authority of Abu Abbas Abdul Rahman bin Jubayr, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “No servant’s feet are covered with dust in the cause of God and the Fire touches him.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1304- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A man who has cried out of fear of God will not enter the Fire until the milk returns in the udder. “Never will the dust of God and the smoke of Hell gather upon a servant of God.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith. 1305- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: “There are two eyes that are not touched by fire: an eye that wept out of fear of God, and an eye that “She is being guarded for the sake of God.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

1306- On the authority of Zaid bin Khaled, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever prepares a fighter for the sake of God has fought, and whoever succeeds a fighter in his family will be well.” He invaded.” Agreed upon.

1307- On the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The best alms are the shelter of a tent for the sake of God, the comfort of a servant for the sake of God, or the comfort of a servant for the sake of God, or the comfort of a servant for the sake of God.” It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: A good and authentic hadith. 1308- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that a young man from Aslam said: O Messenger of God, I want to go on a campaign and I do not have anything to equip myself with. He said: “Come so-and-so, for he was preparing himself and fell ill.” So he came to him. He said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, greets you and says: Give me what you have prepared. He said: O so-and-so, give him what you have prepared, and do not withhold anything from it. By God, do not withhold any of it, lest you be blessed for it. Narrated by Muslim.

1309- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was sent to Banu Lahyan and said: “Let one of them be sent from every two men, and the reward will be between them.” “Narrated by Muslim.

In his narration: “Let a man come out from every two men.” Then he said to the one sitting: “Whichever of you is left behind by the outsider whose family and wealth are well, he will have the equivalent of half the wage of the outsider.” 1310- On the authority of Al-Baraa, may God be pleased with him, he said: A man masked with an iron came to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of God, shall I fight or be delivered? He said: “Convert to Islam, then fight.” So he converted to Islam, then he fought and was killed. Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “He worked a little and was rewarded a lot.” Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Al-Bukhari.

1311- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “No one who enters Paradise would like to return to this world, and he has nothing on earth except a martyr, who wishes to return.” To this world, then he will be killed ten times, because of the dignity he sees.”

And in a narration: “Because he sees the virtue of martyrdom.” Agreed upon.

1312- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “God forgives the martyr everything except debt.” Narrated by Muslim.

In his narration: “Killing in the cause of God expiates everything except religion.” 1313- On the authority of Abu Qatada, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, stood up among them and mentioned that jihad in the path of God and belief in God are the best of deeds. Then a man stood up and said: O Messenger of God, do you think that if I were killed in the name of God, would my sins be expiated from me? Then the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to him: “Yes, if you are killed in the cause of God and you are patient, seeking reward, and approaching, not retreating.” Then the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “How? Did you say? He said: Have you thought that if I were killed in the name of God, would my sins be expiated from me? So the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Yes, and you are patient and seeking reward, coming forward and not retreating, except for debts. Gabriel, peace be upon him, said that to me.” Narrated by Muslim.

1314- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, he said: A man said: Where will I be, O Messenger of God, if I am killed? He said: “In Paradise.” So he threw dates that were in his hand, then fought until he was killed. Narrated by Muslim.

1315- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and his companions set off until they preceded the polytheists to Badr, and the polytheists came. Then the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “None of you will approach anything until I am inferior to him.” So the polytheists approached, and the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Go to Paradise.” Its breadth is the heavens and the earth.” He said: Umair bin Al-Hammam Al-Ansari, may God be pleased with him, said: O Messenger of God, is there a Paradise whose breadth is the heavens and the earth? He said: “Yes.” He said: “Bakh, Bakh.” Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “What makes you say, Bakh, Bakh?” He said, “No, by God, O Messenger of God, except in the hope that I will be one of its people.” He said, “For you are one of its people.” So he took out some dates from his horn and began to eat from them, then he said If I live to eat these dates of mine, it will be a long life.” He threw away the dates he had. Then he fought them until he was killed. Narrated by Muslim.

“Qarn” with a fatḥa qāf and rā’: it is the quiver of an archer.

1316 - On his authority, he said: People came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, asking him to send men with us to teach us the Qur’an and the Sunnah. So he sent to them seventy men from the Ansar, who were called the Qur’an. They would study it at night to learn, and during the day they would bring water and put it in the mosque, and they would collect firewood and sell it, and with it they would buy food for the people of Suffah and for the poor. So the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, sent them, and they attacked them and killed them before they reached the place. They said: Oh God, convey on our behalf our Prophet that we have met you. We were satisfied with you and you were satisfied with us. An unlawful man came to Anas’s uncle. Behind him, he stabbed him with a spear until he killed him, and Haram said: I have won, by the Lord of the Kaaba. Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Your brothers have been killed, and they said: O God, convey the news to our Prophet. We met you and were satisfied with you and you were satisfied with us.” Agreed upon. This is a Muslim word.

1317 - On his authority, he said: My uncle Anas bin Al-Nadr, may God be pleased with him, was absent from the fighting of Badr, so he said: O Messenger of God, I was absent from the first fight in which you fought the polytheists. If God made me witness in the fight of the polytheists, so that God would see what I would do. When it was the day of Uhud, the Muslims were exposed. He said: Oh God, I apologize to you for what these people have done, meaning his companions, and I disavow before you what these people, meaning the polytheists, have done. Then he moved forward and Saad bin Muadh received him and said: O Saad bin Muadh, Paradise and the Lord of doom. I smell its fragrance without anyone else. Saad said: I could not, O Messenger of God, what he did. Anas said: We found on him eighty-odd sword strikes, or spear wounds, or arrow wounds, and we found him killed and mutilated. The polytheists therein, No one knew him except his sister by his fingertips. Anas said: We used to see or think that this verse was revealed about him and those like him: {Among the believers are men who are true to what they covenanted with God, and among them are those whose love has died} and so on. Parties: 23].

Agreed upon, and it was mentioned previously in the section on struggle. 1318- On the authority of Samurah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Tonight I saw two men come to me and take me up the tree and take me into a house that is better and better. I have not seen It has never been better than it. They said: As for this abode, it is the abode of the martyrs.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari, and it is part of a long hadith containing types of knowledge that will come in the chapter on the prohibition of lying, God Almighty willing. 1319- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that Umm al-Rabi’ bint al-Bara’, who was the mother of Harithah ibn Suraqa, came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and said: O Messenger of God, will you not tell me about Harithah, and he was killed on the day Badr, and if it was in Paradise, I would be patient, and if it was other than that, I would strive to cry over him. He said: “O Umm Harithah, it is a paradise in Paradise, and your son has entered the highest Paradise.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1320 - On the authority of Jaber bin Abdullah, may God be pleased with them both, he said: My father was brought to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and he had been mutilated and placed in his hands. So I went to uncover his face, but some people forbade me, so the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said Peace be upon him: “The angels continue to shade him with their wings.” Agreed upon.

1321- On the authority of Sahl bin Hunaif, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever asks God Almighty for testimony truthfully, he will attain the status of martyrs, even if he dies in his bed.” Narrated by Muslim.

1322- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever asks for testimony truthfully, it will be given to him even if it does not prove true to him.” Narrated by Muslim.

1323- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The martyr’s feeling from the touch of killing is no more than what one of you feels from the touch of a sting.” It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: a good and authentic hadith.

1324- On the authority of Abdullah bin Abi Awfa, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, on some of his days in which he encountered the enemy, waited until the sun had set, then he stood up among the people and said: “O people, Do not wish to meet the enemy, and ask God for well-being. If you meet them, be patient, and know that Paradise is under the shade of swords. Then he said: “O God, who sends down the Book and moves the clouds, and defeats them.” Defeat the parties and give us victory over them.” Agreed upon.

1325- On the authority of Sahl bin Saad, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There are two things that are not rejected, or are rarely rejected: supplication at the call and at the time of the battle when it is strong.” each other. Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission.

1326- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: When the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, invaded, he would say: “O God, you are my support and my helper, by you I run, by you I have my roots, and by you I fight.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said. : A good hadith.

1327- On the authority of Abu Musa, may God be pleased with him, that when the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, feared a people, he would say: Oh God, we put you in their midst, and we seek refuge in you from their evils. Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. 1328- On the authority of Ibn Umar, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Horses have goodness tied to their forelocks until the Day of Resurrection.” Agreed upon.

1329- On the authority of Urwat al-Bariqi, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Horses have good things tied to their forelocks until the Day of Resurrection: reward and spoils.” Agreed upon.

1330- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever keeps a horse for the sake of God, out of faith in God, and believing in His promise, will be satisfied with it.” And his urine, his dung, and his urine will be in his scales on the Day of Resurrection.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 1331- On the authority of Abu Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: A man came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, with a camel with a collar, and he said: This is for the sake of God. Then the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “You will have a day with it.” The Day of Resurrection will be seven hundred she-camels, all of them bandaged.” Narrated by Muslim. 1332- On the authority of Abu Hammad, and it is said: Abu Suad, and it is said: Abu Asad, and it is said: Abu Amer, and it is said: Abu Amr, and it is said: Abu Al-Aswad, and it is said: Abu Abbas Uqba bin Amer Al-Juhani, may God be pleased with him, said: I heard the Messenger God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, while he was on the pulpit, said: “And prepare against them whatever force you are able. Indeed, the force is archery. Indeed, the force is archery. Indeed, the force is archery.” Narrated by Muslim. 1333- On his authority, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: “A land will be opened to you, and God is sufficient for you, so none of you will be unable to play with your arrows.” Narrated by Muslim. .

1334- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever is taught to shoot and then abandons it, is not one of us, or he has disobeyed.” Narrated by Muslim. 1335- On his authority, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “Indeed, God admits three people into Paradise with an arrow: the one who made it expects goodness in his work, and the one who shoots it. And Manbulah, and throw and ride, and that you shoot is dearer to me than that you ride. And whoever abandons stoning after being taught, out of his desire to do so. It is a blessing that he neglected,” or he said, “he denied it.” Narrated by Abu Dawud.

1336- On the authority of Salamah bin Al-Akwa’, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, passed by a group of people fighting, and he said: “Shoot at Banu Ismail, for your father was an archer.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1337- On the authority of Amr bin Absa, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “Whoever shoots an arrow for the sake of God, it will be his justice.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith.

1338- On the authority of Abu Yahya Khurraym bin Fatik, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever spends in the cause of God, it will be recorded for him seven hundred times.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and saying : A good hadith. 1339- On the authority of Abu Saeed, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There is no servant who fasts a day for the sake of God but that on that day God will distance his face from the Fire for seventy years.” Agreed upon.

1340- On the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Whoever fasts a day for the sake of God, God will place between him and the Fire a ditch like between the heaven and the earth.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi said: A good and authentic hadith. 1341- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever dies and does not fight, and does not talk to himself about fighting, dies on a branch of hypocrisy.” Narrated by Muslim.

1342- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, he said: We were with the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, on a campaign, and he said: “In Medina there are men whom you have never traveled, nor crossed a valley, but they were with you, and sickness confined them.”

And in a narration: “The excuse imprisoned them.” And in a narration: “Except they will share with you in reward.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari from the narration of Anas, and narrated by Muslim from the narration of Jabir, and the wording is his.

1343- On the authority of Abu Musa, may God be pleased with him, that a Bedouin came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and said: O Messenger of God, a man fights for the grieving, a man fights to be remembered, and a man fights To see where he is?

In a narration: He fights with courage and fights with zeal. And in a narration: And he fights in anger, so who is in the way of God? The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever fights so that the word of God may be supreme is in the cause of God.” Agreed upon.

1344- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There is no guerrilla force, or a company that invades, seizes spoils and is safe, but they have They paid two-thirds of their wages in advance, And there is no invader or expeditionary force that fails or is injured but that they are fully rewarded.” Narrated by Muslim.

1345- On the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him, that a man said: O Messenger of God, give me permission to travel. The Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “My nation’s tourism is jihad for the sake of God Almighty.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission.

1346- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, who said: “A battle is like a battle.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission.

“Qaflah” means returning, and what is meant is: returning from the campaign after completing the campaign. Its meaning is that he will be rewarded for his return after completing the campaign.

1347- On the authority of Al-Sa’ib bin Yazid, may God be pleased with him, he said: When the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, came from the Battle of Tabuk, the people met him, and I met him with the boys on the farewell thaniyat. It was narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission with this wording, and it was narrated by Al-Bukhari who said: We went to meet the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, with the boys to Thaniyat Al-Wada’.

1348- On the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Whoever does not fight, or prepares a fighter, or succeeds a fighter in his family well, may God bless him.” By Qara’ah before the Day of Resurrection.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. 1349- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Strive the polytheists with your wealth, your lives, and your tongues.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission.

1350- On the authority of Abu Amr. It is said: Abu Hakim al-Numan bin Muqrin, may God be pleased with him, said: I witnessed that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, if he did not fight at the beginning of the day, he would delay the fighting until the sun went down and the winds blew. Victory descends. Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good and authentic hadith.

1351- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Do not hope to meet the enemy. If you do meet them, be patient.” Agreed upon.

1352- On the authority of him and Jabir, may God be pleased with them, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “War is a deception.” Agreed upon. Chapter on explaining a group of martyrs in the reward of the afterlife

Chapter on explaining a group of martyrs in the reward of the afterlife

They are washed and a funeral prayer is performed over them, unlike those killed in war with the infidels

1353- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Martyrs are five: the stabbed, the stabbed, the drowned, the one who destroyed it, and the martyr in the cause of death.” “Allah” agreed upon. 1354- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “What do you consider to be the martyrs among you?” They said: O Messenger of God, whoever is killed in the cause of God is a martyr. He said: “The martyrs of my nation, then, are few.” They said: Who, O Messenger of God? He said: “Whoever is killed in the cause of God is a martyr, and whoever dies in the cause of God is a martyr, and whoever dies in the plague is a martyr, and whoever dies in the stomach is a martyr, and a drowning person is a martyr.” Narrated by Muslim. 1355- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever is killed while protecting his property is a martyr.” Agreed upon.

1356- On the authority of Abu Al-A’war Saeed bin Zayd bin Amr bin Nufayl, one of the ten people who were acclaimed for Paradise, may God be pleased with them, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: “Whoever is killed without his money He is a martyr, and whoever is killed for his blood is a martyr, and whoever is killed for his religion is a martyr, And whoever is killed while protecting his family is a martyr.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith.

1357- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: A man came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of God, what if a man comes who wants to take my money? He said: “Then do not give him your money.” He said: What do you think if he fights me? He said: “Fight him.” He said: What do you think if he kills me? He said: “Then you are a martyr.” He said: What do you think if I kill him? He said: “He will be in Hell.” Narrated by Muslim. Chapter on the virtue of emancipation

God Almighty said: {Then do not attack the obstacle, and how do you know what the obstacle is? Loosen the neck} verse.

1358- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “Whoever frees a Muslim slave, God will free every limb of him from Hell until His relief with his relief.” Agreed upon.

1359- On the authority of Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of God, which deed is best? He said: “Belief in God and jihad for the sake of God.” He said: I said: Which of the slaves is better? He said: “It is the most precious to its owners, and the most expensive.” Agreed upon. Chapter on the virtue of being kind to the slaves

God Almighty said: {And worship God, and do not associate anything with Him, and be good to parents, and to relatives, and orphans, and the needy, and the neighbor of a relative, and the neighbor who is a foreigner, the companion by a foreign land, and the wayfarer, and what your right hands possess}.

1360 - On the authority of Al-Ma’roor bin Suwayd, he said: I saw Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with him, wearing a robe, and his boy wearing the same, so I asked him about that, and he mentioned that he had insulted a man during a covenant with The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, taunted him with his mother. Then the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “You are a person of ignorance.” They are your brothers and your brothers. God has placed them under your hands. Whoever has his brother under his hand, let him feed him. Of what he eats, and to clothe him with what he wears, and do not burden them with anything that would be difficult for them. If you charge them, then help them.” Agreed upon. 1361- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him: He said: If one of you brings his servant his food, if he does not make him sit with him, then let him give him a morsel or Two mouthfuls or a meal or two, for he has a cure.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

“The food” with the hamza dhammah means the morsel. Chapter on the virtue of a slave who fulfills the rights of God and the rights of his masters

1362- On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: If a servant is sincere to his master and worships God well, he will have his reward twice. Agreed upon.

label:
بابُ فضل العلم

قال اللَّه تعالى: { وقل رب زدني علماً } .

وقال تعالى: { قل هل يستوي الذين يعلمون والذين لا يعلمون } .

وقال تعالى: { يرفع اللَّه الذين آمنوا منكم والذين أوتوا العلم درجات } .

وقال تعالى: { إنما يخشى اللَّه من عباده العلماء } .

1276- وعَنْ مُعاوِيةَ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، قال : قَال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَنْ يُرِد اللَّه بِهِ خيْراً يُفَقِّهْهُ في الدِّينِ » متفقٌ عليه .

1377- وعنْ ابنِ مسْعُودٍ ، رضي اللَّه عنْه ، قَال : قَال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لا حَسَد إلاَّ في اثْنَتَيْنِ : رَجُلٌ آتَاهُ اللَّه مَالاً فَسلَّطهُ عَلى هلَكَتِهِ في الحَقِّ ، ورَجُلٌ آتاهُ اللَّه الحِكْمَةَ فهُوَ يَقْضِي بِهَا ، وَيُعَلِّمُهَا » مُتَّفَقٌ عَليهِ .

والمرادُ بالحسدِ الْغِبْطَةُ ، وَهُوَ أنْ يتَمنَّى مثْلَهُ .

1378- وعَنْ أبي مُوسى ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، قال : قَالَ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَثَلُ مَا بعثَنِي اللَّه بِهِ مِنَ الهُدى والْعِلْمِ كَمَثَل غَيْثٍ أصاب أرْضاً ، فَكَانَتْ مِنْهَا طَائفَةٌ طَيِّبَةٌ قَبِلَتِ المَاءَ فَأَنْبَتَتِ الْكَلأَ ، وَالْعُشْب الْكَثِيرَ ، وَكَانَ مِنْهَا أجَادِبُ أمسَكَتِ المَاءَ ، فَنَفَعَ اللَّه بِهَا النَّاسَ، فَشَرِبُوا مِنْهَا وَسَقَوْا وزَرَعُوا ، وأَصَاب طَائفَةً مِنْهَا أُخْرى إنَّما هِي قِيعانٌ ، لا تمْسِكُ مَاءً ، وتُنْبِتُ كَلأً ، فَذلكَ مثَلُ منْ فَقُهَ في دِينِ اللَّهِ ، وَنَفَعَهُ ما بَعَثَنِي اللَّه بِهِ فَعلِمَ وَعلَّمَ، وَمَثَلُ منْ لَمْ يَرْفَعْ بِذلكَ رأساً ، وَلَمْ يَقْبَلْ هُدَى اللَّهِ الَّذي أُرْسِلْتُ بِهِ » متفقٌ عليه.

1379- وعَنْ سَهْلِ بن سعدٍ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، أنَّ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ لِعَليًّ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ : « فو اللَّهِ لأنْ يهْدِيَ اللَّه بِكَ رجُلاً واحِداً خَيْرٌ لكَ من حُمْرِ النَّعم » متفقٌ عليهِ.

1380- وعن عبدِ اللَّه بن عمرو بن العاص ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُما ، أنَّ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال: «بلِّغُوا عَنِّي ولَوْ آيَةً ، وحَدِّثُوا عنْ بني إسْرَائيل وَلا حَرجَ ، ومنْ كَذَب علَيَّ مُتَعمِّداً فَلْيتبَوَّأْ مَقْعَدهُ من النَّار » رواه البخاري .

1381- وعنْ أبي هُريرةَ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ ، أنَّ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، قالَ : « .... ومَنْ سلَك طرِيقاً يَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ عِلْماً ، سهَّلَ اللَّه لَهُ بِهِ طَرِيقاً إلى الجَنَّةِ » رواهُ مسلمٌ .

1382- وَعَنهُ ، أيضاً ، رضي اللَّه عنْه أنَّ رَسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « مَنْ دعا إلى هُدىً كانَ لهُ مِنَ الأجْر مِثلُ أُجورِ منْ تَبِعهُ لا ينْقُصُ ذلكَ من أُجُورِهِم شَيْئاً » رواهُ مسلمٌ.

1383- وعنْهُ قال : قَالَ رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إذا ماتَ ابْنُ آدَم انْقَطَع عَملُهُ إلاَّ مِنْ ثَلاثٍ : صَدقَةٍ جارية ، أوْ عِلمٍ يُنْتَفَعُ بِهِ ، أوْ وَلدٍ صالحٍ يدْعُو لَهُ » رواهُ مسلمٌ .

1384- وَعنْهُ قَالَ : سمِعْتُ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَقُولُ : « الدُّنْيَا ملْعُونَةٌ ، ملْعُونٌ ما فِيهَا، إلاَّ ذِكرَ اللَّه تَعَالى ، وما والاَهُ ، وعَالماً ، أوْ مُتَعلِّماً » رواهُ الترمذيُّ وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ.

قولهُ « وَمَا وَالاهُ » أي : طاعةُ اللِّه .

1385- وَعَنْ أنسٍ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قالَ : قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ، صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَن خرَج في طَلَبِ العِلمِ ، فهو في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ حتى يرجِعَ » رواهُ الترْمِذيُّ وقال : حديثٌ حَسنٌ .

1386- وعَنْ أبي سَعيدٍ الخدْرِيِّ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ ، عَنْ رسُولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « لَنْ يَشبَع مُؤمِنٌ مِنْ خَيْرٍ حتى يكون مُنْتَهَاهُ الجَنَّةَ » . رواهُ الترمذيُّ ، وقَالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1387- وعَنْ أبي أُمَامة ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، أنَّ رَسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « فضْلُ الْعالِم على الْعابِدِ كَفَضْلي على أَدْنَاكُمْ » ثُمَّ قال : رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إنَّ اللَّه وملائِكَتَهُ وأَهْلَ السَّمواتِ والأرضِ حتَّى النَّمْلَةَ في جُحْرِهَا وحتى الحُوتَ لَيُصَلُّونَ عَلى مُعلِّمِي النَّاسِ الخَيْرْ» رواهُ الترمذي وقالَ : حَديثٌ حَسنٌ .

1388- وَعَنْ أبي الدَّرْداءِ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَال : سمِعْتُ رَسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، يقولُ: « منْ سلك طَريقاً يَبْتَغِي فِيهِ علْماً سهَّل اللَّه لَه طَريقاً إلى الجنةِ ، وَإنَّ الملائِكَةَ لَتَضَعُ أجْنِحَتَهَا لِطالب الْعِلْمِ رِضاً بِما يَصْنَعُ ، وَإنَّ الْعالِم لَيَسْتَغْفِرُ لَهُ منْ في السَّمَواتِ ومنْ في الأرْضِ حتَّى الحِيتانُ في الماءِ ، وفَضْلُ الْعَالِم على الْعابِدِ كَفَضْلِ الْقَمر عَلى سائر الْكَوَاكِبِ، وإنَّ الْعُلَماءَ وَرَثَةُ الأنْبِياءِ وإنَّ الأنْبِياءَ لَمْ يُورِّثُوا دِينَاراً وَلا دِرْهَماً وإنَّما ورَّثُوا الْعِلْمَ ، فَمنْ أَخَذَهُ أَخَذَ بِحظٍّ وَافِرٍ » . رواهُ أبو داود والترمذيُّ .

1389- وعنِ ابن مسْعُودٍ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، قال : سمِعْتُ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَقُولُ : «نَضَّرَ اللَّه امْرءاً سمِع مِنا شَيْئاً ، فبَلَّغَهُ كما سَمعَهُ فَرُبَّ مُبَلَّغٍ أوْعى مِنْ سَامِع » . رواهُ الترمذيُّ وقال : حديثٌ حَسنٌ صَحيحٌ .

1390- وعن أبي هُريرةَ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، قال : قال رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « منْ سُئِل عنْ عِلمٍ فَكَتَمَهُ ، أُلجِم يَومَ القِيامةِ بِلِجامٍ مِنْ نَارٍ » .

رواهُ أبو داود والترمذي ، وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1391- وعنه قال : قال رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « منْ تَعلَّمَ عِلماً مِما يُبتَغَى بِهِ وَجْهُ اللَّهِ عز وَجَلَّ لا يَتَعلَّمُهُ إلا ليصِيبَ بِهِ عرضاً مِنَ الدُّنْيا لَمْ يجِدْ عَرْفَ الجنَّةِ يوْم القِيامةِ » يعني : ريحها ، رواه أبو داود بإسناد صحيح .

1392- وعنْ عبدِ اللَّه بن عمرو بن العاص رضي اللَّه عَنهُما قال : سمِعتُ رسولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقول : « إنَّ اللَّه لا يقْبِض العِلْم انْتِزَاعاً ينْتزِعُهُ مِنَ النَّاسِ ، ولكِنْ يقْبِضُ العِلْمَ بِقَبْضِ العُلَماءِ حتَّى إذا لمْ يُبْقِ عالماً ، اتَّخَذَ النَّاسُ رُؤوساً جُهَّالاً فَسئِلُوا ، فأفْتَوْا بغَيْرِ علمٍ ، فَضَلُّوا وأَضَلُّوا » متفقٌ عليه .
label-en:
Chapter on the virtue of knowledge

God Almighty said: {And say, “My Lord, increase me in knowledge.”

And God Almighty said: {Say: Are those who know equal to those who do not know?}.

And God Almighty said: {Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who have been given knowledge to degrees.}

And God Almighty said: {Only those who fear Allah among His servants are scholars}.

1276- On the authority of Muawiyah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever God desires good for, He will give him understanding of religion.” Agreed upon. 1377- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There is no envy except in two cases: a man to whom God has given wealth and who has given him the right to destroy it in the truth; And a man to whom God gave wisdom, and he judges by it and teaches it.” Agreed upon.

What is meant by envy is elation, which is to wish for the same. 1378- On the authority of Abu Musa, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The example of what God has sent me with of guidance and knowledge is like a rain that hits the ground, and it leaves it.” A good group accepted the water and produced pasture and abundant grass, and among them were trees that held the water, and God benefited the people through them, so they drank. They irrigated and planted, and they struck another group of them, but they were bottoms that did not hold water and produced pasture. This is the example of one who has understood the religion of God, and what God has sent me with has benefited him, so he learned and taught, and the example of one who has not raised his head in that way, and has not accepted the guidance of God with which I have been sent. “Thereby.” Agreed upon.

1379- On the authority of Sahl bin Saad, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to Ali, may God be pleased with him: “By God, for God to guide one man through you is better for you than red camels.” “Agreed upon. 1380- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Convey even a verse on my behalf, and narrate on the authority of the Children of Israel, and there is no blame, and whoever lies about me intentionally Let him take his seat in the Fire.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1381- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “... And whoever follows a path seeking knowledge, God will make easy for him a path to Paradise thereby.” Narrated by Muslim.

1382- And also on his authority, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever calls to guidance will have a reward similar to the rewards of those who follow him, without that detracting from their rewards in the slightest.” Narrated by Muslim. 1383 - And on his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “If the son of Adam dies, his good deeds come to an end except for three: ongoing charity, knowledge that can be benefited from, or a righteous child who prays for him.” Narrated by Muslim.

1384- And on his authority, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “The world is cursed, cursed is what is in it, unless he remembers God Almighty, and what is near him, or a scholar, or a learner.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

His saying: “And what he has befriended” means: obedience to God. 1385- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever goes out in search of knowledge, he is in the path of God until he returns.” It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: a good hadith.

1386- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “No believer will be satisfied with good until his destination is Paradise.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith.

1387- On the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The superiority of the scholar over the worshiper is like my superiority over the lowest of you.” Then he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him: “ Indeed, God and His angels and the inhabitants of the heavens and the earth, even the ant in its hole and even the fish, send blessings upon those who teach people goodness.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and who said: A good hadith. 1388- On the authority of Abu al-Darda’, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “Whoever follows a path seeking knowledge, God will make easy for him a path to Paradise, and indeed The angels spread their wings to the seeker of knowledge in satisfaction with what he does, and for the knowledgeable person, whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on earth, even the fish in the water, seek forgiveness for him, and the superiority of the knowledgeable person over the worshiper. Like the moon’s superiority over all the other planets, And the scholars are the heirs of the prophets, and the prophets did not leave behind a dinar or a dirham, but rather they inherited knowledge, so whoever takes it will take an abundant share.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi.

1389- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “May God be pleased with someone who heard something from us and conveyed it as he heard it. Listening. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good and authentic hadith.

1390- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever is asked about knowledge and conceals it, will be bridled on the Day of Resurrection with a bridle of fire.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, and he said: A good hadith. 1391 - On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever learns knowledge of what is sought for the pleasure of God Almighty, and does not learn it except to gain by it some benefit from this world, will not find knowledge.” Paradise on the Day of Resurrection” means: its smell. Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. 1392- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: “God does not take away knowledge by snatching it from the people, but He takes away knowledge.” By taking away the scholars until there was no scholar left, the people took ignorant people as their leaders and were questioned. They issued fatwas without knowledge, and they went astray and were led astray. Agreed upon.

label:
بابُ فضل الحمد والشكر

قال اللَّه تعالى: { فاذكروني أذكركم، واشكروا لي ولا تكفرون } .

وقال: { لئن شكرتم لأزيدنكم } .

وقال تعالى: { وقل الحمد لله } .

وقال تعالى : { وآخر دعواهم أن الحمد لله رب العالمين } .

1393- وعن أبي هُرَيْرة ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، أَنَّ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أُتِي لَيْلةَ أُسْرِيَ بِهِ بِقَدَحَيْن مِن خَمْر ولَبن ، فنظَرَ إلَيْهِما فأَخذَ اللَّبنَ ، فَقَالَ جبريلُ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « الحمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذي هَداكَ للفِطْرةِ لوْ أخَذْتَ الخَمْرَ غَوتْ أُمَّتُكَ » رواه مسلم .

1394- وعنْهُ عنْ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « كُلُّ أمْرٍ ذِي بال لا يُبْدأُ فيه بـــ : الحمد للَّه فَهُوَ أقْطُع » حديثٌ حسَنٌ ، رواهُ أبو داود وغيرُهُ .

1395- وعَن أبي مُوسى الأشعريَّ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، أنَّ رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « إذا ماتَ ولَدُ العبْدِ قال اللَّه تعالى لملائِكَتِهِ : قَبضْتُمْ ولَدَ عبْدِي ؟ فيقولُون : نَعمْ ، فَيقولُ : قبضتُم ثَمرةَ فُؤَادِهِ ؟ فيقولون : نَعَمْ ، فيقولُ : فَمَاذَا قال عَبْدي ؟ فيقولون : حمِدكَ واسْتَرْجَع ، فَيقُولُ اللَّه تَعالى : ابْنُوا لِعَبْدِي بيْتاً في الجنَّةِ ، وسَمُّوهُ بَيْتَ الحمْدِ » رواهُ الترمذي وقالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1396- وعنّْ أنَسَ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قال : قال رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إنَّ اللَّه لَيرضي عنِ العبْدِ يَأْكُلُ الأكْلَةَ فَيَحْمَدُهُ عَليْهَا ، وَيَشْرب الشَّرْبَةَ فَيَحْمَدُهُ عَلَيْهَا » رواهُ مسلم .
number-en: A book of praise and thanksgiving to God Almighty
label-en:
Chapter on the virtue of praise and gratitude

God Almighty said: {So remember Me, and I will remember you, and give thanks to Me, and do not disbelieve}.

And he said: “If you are grateful, I will give you more.”

And God Almighty said: {And say, “Praise be to God.”

And God Almighty said: {And their last supplication is: Praise be to God, Lord of the worlds}.

1393- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was brought two glasses of wine and milk to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, on the night he was taken captive. He looked at them and took the milk, and Gabriel, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: He said: “Praise be to God who has guided you to common sense. If you took alcohol, your nation would go astray.” Narrated by Muslim.

1394- And on the authority of him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Every important matter that does not begin with: Praise be to God, it is more definite.” A good hadith, narrated by Abu Dawud and others.

1395- On the authority of Abu Musa Al-Ash’ari, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “When the son of my servant dies, God Almighty says to His angels: Have you taken possession of the son of My servant? They say: Yes, and he says: Have you received the fruit of his heart? They say: Yes, so he says: What did my servant say? They say: Thank you and be restored. Then God Almighty says: Build for My servant a house in Paradise, and they call it the House of Praise. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and who said: A good hadith.

1396- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “God is pleased with a servant who eats food and praises him for it, and drinks a drink and praises him.” upon her.” Narrated by Muslim.

number: كتابُ الصلاة على رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم
label:
باب فضل الصلاة على رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم

قال اللَّه تعالى: {إن اللَّه وملائكته يصلون على النبي، يا أيها الذين آمنوا صلوا عليه وسلموا تسليماً } .

1397- وعنْ عبد اللَّه بن عمرو بن العاص ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُمَا أنَّهُ سمِع رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقُولُ : « من صلَّى عليَّ صلاَةً ، صلَّى اللَّه علَيّهِ بِهَا عشْراً » رواهُ مسلم .

1398- وعن ابن مسْعُودٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ أنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « أَوْلى النَّاسِ بي يوْمَ الْقِيامةِ أَكْثَرُهُم عَليَّ صلاةً » رواه الترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1399- وعن أوس بن أوس ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قالَ رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إنَّ مِن أَفْضلِ أيَّامِكُمْ يَوْمَ الجُمُعةِ ، فَأَكْثِرُوا عليَّ مِنَ الصلاةِ فيه ، فإنَّ صَلاتَكُمْ معْرُوضَةٌ علَيَّ » فقالوا : يا رسول اللَّه ، وكَيْفَ تُعرضُ صلاتُنَا عليْكَ وقدْ أرَمْتَ ؟، يقولُ :بَلِيتَ ،قالَ:«إنَّ اللَّه حَرم على الأرْضِ أجْساد الأنْبِياءِ » .

رواهُ أبو داود بإسنادٍ صحيحِ .

1400- وعنْ أبي هُريْرةَ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قال : قال رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « رَغِم أنْفُ رجُلٍ ذُكِرْتُ عِنْدَهُ فَلَمْ يُصَلِّ علَيَّ » رواهُ الترمذي وقالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1401- وعنهُ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قالَ رَسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لا تَجْعلُوا قَبْرِي عِيداً ، وَصلُّوا عَلَيَّ ، فَإنَّ صَلاتَكُمْ تَبْلُغُني حيْثُ كُنْتُمْ » رواهُ أبو داود بإسناد صحيح .

1402- وعنهُ أنَّ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « ما مِنْ أحد يُسلِّمُ علَيَّ إلاَّ ردَّ اللَّه علَيَّ رُوحي حَتَّى أرُدَّ عَليهِ السَّلامَ » .

رواهُ أبو داود بإسناد صحيحٍ .

1403- وعن علِيٍّ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « الْبخِيلُ من ذُكِرْتُ عِنْدَهُ ، فَلَم يُصَلِّ علَيَّ » .

رواهُ الترمذي وقالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ صحيحٌ .

1404- وعنْ فَضَالَةَ بنِ عُبَيْدٍ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قال : سمِع رسولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم رَجُلاً يدْعُو في صلاتِهِ لَمْ يُمَجِّدِ اللَّه تَعالى ، وَلَمْ يُصلِّ عَلى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، فقال رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « عَجِلَ هذا » ، ثمَّ دعَاهُ فقال لهُ ­ أوْ لِغَيْرِهِ ­ : إذا صلَّى أحَدُكُمْ فليبْدأْ بِتَحْمِيدِ ربِّهِ سُبْحانَهُ والثَّنَاءِ عليهِ ، ثُمَّ يُصلي عَلى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ثُمَّ يدْعُو بَعدُ بِما شاءَ » .

رواهُ أبو داود والترمذي وقالا : حديثٌ حسن صحيحٌ .

1405- وعن أبي محمد كَعب بن عُجرَةَ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، قال : خَرج علَيْنَا النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقُلْنا : يا رسول اللَّه ، قَدْ علِمْنَا كَيْف نُسلِّمُ عليْكَ فَكَيْفَ نُصَلِّي علَيْكَ ؟ قال : «قُولُوا : اللَّهمَّ صَلِّ على مُحمَّدٍ ، وَعَلى آلِ مُحمَّد ، كَمَا صَلَّيْتَ عَلى آلِ إبْرَاهِيمَ ، إنَّكَ حمِيدٌ مجيدٌ . اللهُمَّ بارِكْ عَلى مُحَمَّد ، وَعَلى آلِ مُحَمَّد ، كَما بَاركْتَ على آلِ إبْراهِيم ، إنَّكَ حميدٌ مجيدٌ » .متفقٌ عليهِ .

1406- وعنْ أبي مسْعُود الْبدْريِّ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، قالَ : أَتاناَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، وَنَحْنُ في مَجْلِس سعد بنِ عُبَادَةَ رضي اللَّه عنهُ ، فقالَ لهُ بَشِيرُ بْنُ سعدٍ : أمرَنَا اللَّه أنْ نُصلِّي علَيْكَ يا رسولَ اللَّهِ ، فَكَيْفَ نُصَّلي علَيْكَ ؟ فَسكَتَ رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، حتى تَمنَّيْنَا أنَّه لمْ يَسْأَلْهُ ، ثمَّ قال رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، قولُوا : اللَّهمَّ صلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ ، وَعَلى آلِ مُحمَّدٍ ، كما صليْتَ على آل إبْراهِيم ، وَبارِكْ عَلى مُحَمَّد ، وعَلى آلِ مُحمَّد ، كما بَاركْتَ عَلى آل إبْراهِيم ، إنكَ حمِيدٌ مجِيدٌ ، والسلام كما قد عَلِمتم » رواهُ مسلمٌ .

1407- وعَنْ أبي حُمَيْدٍ السَّاعِديِّ ، رضي اللَّه عنهُ ، قالَ : قَالُوا يا رسول اللَّه كَيْفَ نُصَلِّي عَلَيْكَ ؟ قالَ : « قولُوا : اللَّهُمَّ صلِّ على مُحمِّدٍ ، وعَلى أزْواجِهِ وَذُرِّيَّتِهِ ، كما صَلَّيْتَ على إبْراهِيمَ ، وباركْ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ ، وعَلى أَزْوَاجِهِ وذُرِّيَّتِهِ ، كما بارَكتَ على إبْراهِيم ، إنَّكَ حمِيدٌ مجِيدٌ » متفقٌ عليهِ .
number-en: The book of prayer upon the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace
label-en:
Chapter on the virtue of praying upon the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace

God Almighty said: {Indeed, God and His angels send blessings upon the Prophet. O you who have believed, bless him and grant him peace with complete salutation}.

1397- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, that he heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saying: “Whoever prays a prayer upon me, may God’s blessings be upon him ten times.” Narrated by Muslim. 1398- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The people closest to me on the Day of Resurrection are the ones who pray the most for me.” Al-Tirmidhi narrated it and said: a good hadith.

1399- On the authority of Aws bin Aws, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “One of your best days is Friday, so pray a lot for me on it, for your prayers will be honored.” Ali. They said: O Messenger of God, how can our prayers be presented to you when you have died? He says: Alas! He said: “God has forbidden the bodies of the prophets on earth.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission.

1400 - On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “In spite of a man’s nose in whose presence I was mentioned, he did not pray for me.” It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: a good hadith. 1401- On his authority, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Do not make my grave a feast, but pray for me, for your prayers will reach me wherever you are.” Narrated by Abu Dawud. With a correct chain of transmission.

1402- On his authority, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “No one greets me except that God returns my spirit to me until I return his greeting.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. 1403- On the authority of Ali, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The miser is the one in whose presence I was mentioned, but he did not pray for me.”

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good and authentic hadith.

1404- On the authority of Fadalah bin Ubaid, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, heard a man making supplication in his prayer. He did not glorify God Almighty, nor did he pray for the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him. And peace be upon him. Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “This one hastened.” Then he summoned him and said to him or to someone else: If one of you prays, let him begin by praising his Lord, Glory be to Him, and praising Him, then he prays for the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and then he supplicates after whatever he wants.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good and authentic hadith. 1405- On the authority of Abu Muhammad Ka’b bin Ujrah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, came out to us and we said: O Messenger of God, we have learned how to greet you, so how can we pray for you? He said: “Say: O God, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, as You bless the family of Abraham. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy and Glorious. O God, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, as You blessed the family of Abraham. You are Praiseworthy and Glorious. Agreed upon.

1406- On the authority of Abu Masoud Al-Badri, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, came to us, and we were in the company of Sa’d bin Ubadah, may God be pleased with him, and Bashir bin Sa’d said to him: God has commanded us to pray for you, O Messenger of God, so how can we pray for you? The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, remained silent until we wished he had not asked him. Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: Say: O God, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, as You have bestowed blessings upon the family of Muhammad. Abraham, and bless Muhammad, and the family of Muhammad, as You blessed the family of Abraham. You are Praiseworthy and Glorious, and peace is as you have known.” Narrated by Muslim. 1407- On the authority of Abu Humaid al-Sa’idi, may God be pleased with him, he said: They said, O Messenger of God, how can we pray for you? He said: “Say: O God, bless Muhammad, and his wives, and his descendants, as You blessed Abraham, and bless Muhammad, and his wives, and his descendants, as You blessed Abraham. You are Praiseworthy and Glorious.” Agreed upon.

label:
باب فضل الذكر والحثِّ عليه

قال اللَّه تعالى: { ولذكر اللَّه أكبر } .

وقال تعالى: { فاذكروني أذكركم } .

وقال تعالى:{واذكر ربك في نفسك تضرعاً وخيفة ودون الجهر من القول بالغدو والآصال، ولا تكن من الغافلين } .

وقال تعالى: { واذكروا اللَّه كثيراً لعلكم تفلحون } .

وقال تعالى: { إن المسلمين والمسلمات } إلى قوله تعالى: { والذاكرين اللَّه كثيراً والذاكرات، أعد اللَّه لهم مغفرة وأجراً عظيماً } .

وقال تعالى: { يا أيها الذين آمنوا اذكروا اللَّه ذكراً كثيراً، وسبحوه بكرة وأصيلاً } الآية.

والآيات في الباب كثيرة معلومة.

1408- وعَنْ أبي هُريرةَ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قالَ : قالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « كَلِمتَانِ خَفِيفَتَانِ عَلى اللِّسانِ ، ثَقيِلَتانِ في المِيزَانِ ، حَبِيبَتَانِ إلى الرَّحْمنِ:سُبْحان اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ، سُبحانَ اللَّه العظيمِ»متفقٌ عليهِ.

1409- وعَنْهُ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قالَ رَسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لأن أَقُولَ سبْحانَ اللَّهِ ، وَالحَمْدُ للَّهِ ، ولا إلَه إلاَّ اللَّه ، وَاللَّه أكْبرُ ، أَحبُّ إليَّ مِمَّا طَلَعَت عليهِ الشَّمْسُ » رواه مسلم .

1410- وعنهُ أنَّ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قالَ : « منْ قال لا إله إلاَّ اللَّه وَحْدَهُ لا شرِيكَ لَهُ، لهُ المُلكُ ، وَلهُ الحَمْدُ ، وَهُوَ عَلى كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَدِيرٌ ، في يومٍ مِائةَ مَرَّةٍ كانَتْ لَهُ عَدْل عَشر رقَابٍ وكُتِبَتْ لَهُ مِائَةُ حَسَنةٍ ، وَمُحِيت عنهُ مِائة سيِّئَةٍ ، وكانت له حِرزاً مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ يومَهُ ذلكَ حتى يُمسِي ، ولم يأْتِ أَحدٌ بِأَفضَل مِمَّا جاءَ بِهِ إلاَّ رجُلٌ عَمِلَ أَكثَر مِنه » ، وقالَ : «من قالَ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبحمْدِهِ ، في يوْم مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ ، حُطَّتْ خَطَاياهُ ، وإنْ كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبَدِ البَحْر » متفقٌ عليهِ .

1411- وعَنْ أبي أيوبَ الأنصَاريِّ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ عَن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « مَنْ قالَ لا إله إلاَّ اللَّه وحْدهُ لا شَرِيكَ لهُ ، لَهُ المُلْكُ ، ولَهُ الحمْدُ ، وَهُو على كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَدِيرٌ ، عشْر مرَّاتٍ : كان كَمَنْ أَعْتَقَ أرْبعةَ أَنفُسٍ مِن وَلِد إسْماعِيلَ » متفق عليهِ .

1412- وعنْ أبي ذَرٍّ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قالَ : قالَ لي رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « ألا أُخْبِرُكَ بِأَحبِّ الكَلامِ إلى اللَّهِ ؟ إنَّ أحبَّ الكَلامِ إلى اللَّه : سُبْحانَ اللَّه وبحَمْدِهِ » رواه مسلم .

1413- وعَنْ أبي مالكٍ الأشْعَرِيِّ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قال رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : «الطُّهُورُ شَطْرُ الإيمان ، والحمدُ للَّهِ تَمْلأُ المِيْزانَ ، وسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ والحمْدُ للَّه تمْلآنِ ­ أو تَمْلأُ ­ ما بَيْنَ السَّمَواتِ والأرْضِ » رواهُ مسلم .

1414- وعَنْ سعْدِ بنِ أبي وقَّاصٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : جاءَ أَعْرَابي إلى رسُولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقالَ : علِّمْني كَلاماً أَقُولُهُ . قالَ : « قُل لا إله إلاَّ اللَّه وحدَهُ لا شرِيكَ لهُ ، اللَّه أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً ، والحمْدُ للَّهِ كَثيراً ، وسُبْحانَ اللَّه ربِّ العالمِينَ ، ولا حوْل وَلا قُوَّةَ إلاَّ باللَّهِ العَزيز الحكيمِ » ، قال : فَهؤلاء لِرَبِّي ، فَما لي ؟ قال : « قُل : اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لي وارْحمني. واهْدِني ، وارْزُقْني » رواه مسلم .

1415- وعنْ ثوبانَ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : كان رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إذا انْصَرَف مِنْ صلاتِهِ اسْتَغفَر ثَلاثاً ، وقال : « اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلامُ ، ومِنكَ السَّلامُ ، تباركْتَ يَاذا الجلالِ والإكرام » قِيل للأَوْزاعي وهُوَ أَحَد رُواةِ الحديث : كيفَ الاستِغفَارُ ؟ قال : تقول : أَسْتَغْفرُ اللَّه ، أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّه . رواهُ مسلم .

1416- وعَن المُغِيرةِ بن شُعْبةَ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أنَّ رَسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَان إذا فَرغَ مِنَ الصَّلاة وسلَّم قالَ : « لا إلهَ إلاَّ اللَّه وحْدَهُ لا شَرِيكَ لَهُ ، لهُ المُلْكُ ولَهُ الحَمْدُ ، وهُوَ عَلى كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ . اللَّهُمَّ لا مانِعَ لما أعْطَيْتَ ، وَلا مُعْطيَ لما مَنَعْتَ ، ولا ينْفَعُ ذا الجَدِّ مِنْكَ الجدُّ » متفقٌ عليهِ .

1417- وعَنْ عبد اللَّه بن الزُّبَيْرِ رضي اللَّه تعالى عنْهُما أَنَّهُ كان يقُول دُبُرَ كَلِّ صلاةٍ، حينَ يُسَلِّمُ : لا إلَه إلاَّ اللَّه وَحْدَهُ لا شريكَ لهُ ، لهُ الملكُ ولهُ الحَمْدُ ، وهُوَ عَلى كُلِّ شيءٍ قَديرٌ . لا حوْلَ وَلا قُوَّةَ إلاَّ بِاللَّه ، لا إله إلاَّ اللَّه ، وَلا نَعْبُدُ إلاَّ إيَّاهُ ، لهُ النعمةُ ، ولَهُ الفضْلُ وَلَهُ الثَّنَاءُ الحَسنُ ، لا إله إلاَّ اللَّه مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ ولوْ كَرِه الكَافرُون .قالَ ابْنُ الزُّبَيْر : وكَان رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يُهَلِّلُ بِهِنَّ دُبُرَ كُلِّ صَلاةٍ مكتوبة ، رواه مسلم .

1418- وعنْ أبي هُريرةَ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أنَّ فُقَرَاءَ المُهاجِرِينَ أَتَوْا رَسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقالُوا: ذَهب أهْلُ الدُّثُورِ بالدَّرجَاتِ العُلى ، وَالنِّعِيمِ المُقيمِ : يُصَلُّونَ كَما نُصلِّي ، وَيصُومُونَ كما نَصُومُ ، ولهمُ فَضْلٌ مِنْ أمْوالٍ : يحجُّونَ ، ويَعْتَمِرُونَ ، وَيُجاهِدُونَ ، ويتَصَدَّقُون . فقالَ: « ألا أُعلمُكُمْ شَيْئاً تُدْرِكُونَ بِهِ مَنْ سبَقَكُمْ ، وتَسبِقُونَ بِهِ منْ بَعْدكُمْ . ولا يَكُونُ أَحَدٌ أَفْضلَ مِنْكُمْ إلاَّ مَنْ صَنَعِ مِثلَ ما صَنَعْتُم ؟ » قالُوا : بَلَى يا رسول اللَّه ، قال : «تُسبِّحُونَ ، وتَحْمدُونَ وتُكَبِّرُونَ ، خلْفَ كُلِّ صلاةٍ ثلاثاً وثَلاثينَ » قال أبُو صالحٍ الرَّاوي عنْ أبي هُرَيْرةَ ، لمَّ سئِل عنْ كيْفِيةِ ذِكْرِهنَّ ، قال : يقول : سُبْحان اللَّه ، والحمْدُ للَّه ، واللَّه أكْبرُ ، حتَّى يكُونَ مِنْهُنَّ كُلِّهنَّ ثلاثاً وثلاثين . متفقٌ عليهِ وزاد مُسْلمٌ في روايتِهِ : فَرجع فُقَراءُ المُهَاجِرِينَ إلى رسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، فقالوا : سمِع إخْوانُنا أهلُ الأمْوال بِما فعَلْنَا ، ففعَلُوا مِثْلهُ ؟ فقالَ رَسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « ذلكَ فَضْلُ اللَّه يُؤْتِيهِ منْ يشاءُ » .

« الدُّثُورُ » جمع دَثْرٍ « بفتحِ الدَّالِ وإسكانِ الثاء المثلَّثَةِ » وهو المالُ الكثيرُ .

1419- وعنْهُ عنْ رَسُولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قالَ : « مَنْ سَبَّحَ اللَّه في دُبُرِ كُلِّ صلاةٍ ثَلاثاً وثَلاثينَ ، وَحمِدَ اللَّه ثَلاثاً وثَلاثين ، وكَبَّرَ اللَّه ثَلاثاً وَثَلاثينَ وقال تَمامَ المِائَةِ : لا إلهَ إلاَّ اللَّه وحْدَه لا شَريك لهُ ، لَهُ المُلْكُ وَلَهُ الحمْد ، وهُو على كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَدِيرٌ ، غُفِرتْ خطَاياهُ وإن كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبدِ الْبَحْرَ » رواهُ مسلم .

1420- وعنْ كعْبِ بن عُرْوةَ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ عَنْ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « مُعقِّبَاتٌ لا يَخِيبُ قَائِلُهُنَّ ­ أَو فَاعِلُهُنَّ ­ دُبُرَ كُلِّ صلاةٍُ مكتُوبةٍ : ثَلاثاً وثَلاثينَ تَسْبِيحَةً ، وَثَلاثاً وَثَلاثِينَ تَحْمِيدَةً ، وَأَرْبَعاً وثَلاثِينَ تَكبِيرةً » رواه مسلم .

1421- وعنْ سعدِ بن أبي وقاص رضي عنْهُ أنَّ رَسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كانَ يَتَعوَّذُ دُبُر الصَّلَواتِ بِهؤلاءِ الكلِمات : « اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الجُبْنِ والْبُخلِ وَأَعوذُ بِكَ مِنْ أنْ أُرَدَّ إلى أرْذَل العُمُرِ وَأعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الدُّنْيا ، وأَعوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ القَبر » رواه البخاري.

1422- وعنْ معاذٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أَنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أَخَذَ بيَدِهِ وقال : « يَا مُعَاذُ ، وَاللَّهِ إنِّي لأُحِبُّكَ » فقال : « أُوصِيكَ يَا معاذُ لا تَدعَنَّ في دُبُرِ كُلِّ صَلاةٍ تقُولُ : اللَّهُمَّ أعِنِّي على ذِكْرِكَ ، وشُكْرِكَ ، وَحُسنِ عِبادتِكَ » .

رواهُ أبو داود بإسناد صحيحٍ .

1423- عنْ أبي هُريْرة رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أنَّ رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « إذا تَشَهَّد أَحدُكُمْ فَليسْتَعِذ بِاللَّه مِنْ أرْبَع ، يقولُ : اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عذَابِ جهَنَّمَ ، وَمِنْ عَذَابِ القَبرِ، وَمِنْ فِتْنةِ المحْيَا والمَماتِ ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ فِتْنَةِ المَسِيح الدَّجَّالِ » . رواه مسلم .

1424- وعنْ عَلِيٍّ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : كانَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ إذا قام إلى الصَّلاةِ يكونُ مِنْ آخِر ما يقولُ بينَ التَّشَهُّدِ والتَّسْلِيم : « اللَّهمَّ اغفِرْ لي ما قَدَّمتُ وما أَخَّرْتُ ، وما أَسْرَرْتُ ومَا أعْلَنْتُ ، وما أَسْرفْتُ ، وما أَنتَ أَعْلمُ بِهِ مِنِّي ، أنْتَ المُقَدِّمُ ، وَأنْتَ المُؤَخِّرُ ، لا إله إلاَّ أنْتَ » رواه مسلم .

1425- وعنْ عائشةَ رضي اللَّه عنْهَا قَالَتْ : كانَ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يُكْثِرُ أنْ يقولَ في رُكُوعِهِ وَسُجُودِهِ : سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدك ، اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لي » متفقٌ عليهِ .

1426- وَعَنْهَا أنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كانَ يَقُولُ في رُكوعِهِ وسجودِهِ : « سُبُّوحٌ قدُّوسٌ ربُّ الملائِكةِ وَالرُّوحِ » رواه مسلم .

1427- وعَنِ ابن عَبَّاسٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُما أنَّ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « فَأَمَّا الرُّكوعُ فَعَظِّموا فيهِ الرَّبَّ ، وأمَّا السُّجُودُ فَاجْتَهِدُوا في الدُّعاء فَقَمِنُّ أنْ يُسْتَجَاب لَكُمْ » رواه مسلم.

1428- وعن أبي هريرةَ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أنَّ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « أقربُ ما يَكونُ العبْدُ مِن ربِّهِ وَهَو ساجدٌ ، فَأَكثِرُوا الدُّعاءَ » رواهُ مسلم .

1429- وعنهُ أنَّ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كانَ يقُولُ في سُجُودِهِ اللَّهُمَّ اغفِرْ لي ذَنبي كُلَّهُ : دِقَّه وجِلَّهُ ، وأَوَّله وَآخِرَهُ ، وعلانيته وَسِرَّه » رواهُ مسلم .

1430- وعنْ عائشةَ رضي اللَّه عنْها قالَتْ : افتَقدْتُ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ذَاتَ لَيْلَةٍ ، فَتَحَسَّسْتُ، فَإذَا هُو راكعٌ ­ أوْ سَاجدٌ ­ يقولُ : « سُبْحَانكَ وبحمدِكَ ، لا إلهَ إلاَّ أنْتَ » وفي روايةٍ : فَوقَعَت يَدِي على بَطْنِ قَدميهِ ، وهُوَ في المَسْجِدِ ، وهما منْصُوبتانِ ، وَهُوَ يَقُولُ : « اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أَعُوذُ بِرضَاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِكَ ، وبمُعافاتِكَ مِنْ عُقوبتِكَ ، وَأَعُوذُ بِك مِنْكَ ، لا أُحْصِي ثَنَاءً عليكَ أَنْتَ كما أثنيتَ على نَفْسِكَ » رواهُ مسلم .

1431- وعنْ سعدِ بن أبي وقاصٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : كُنَّا عِنْد رسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقال: « أَيعجِزُ أَحدُكم أنْ يكْسِبَ في كلِّ يوْمٍ أَلف حَسنَة ، » فَسَأَلَهُ سائِلٌ مِنْ جُلَسائِهِ : كيفَ يكسِبُ أَلفَ حَسنَةٍ ؟ قالَ : « يُسَبِّحُ مِائةَ تَسْبِيحة ، فَيُكتَبُ لهُ أَلفُ حسَنَةٍ ، أوْ يُحَطُّ عنْهُ ألفُ خَطِيئَةٍ » رواه مسلم .

قال الحُميدِيُّ : كذا هو في كتاب مسلم : « أوْ يُحَطُّ » قال : البَرْقَانيُّ : ورواهُ شُعْبَةُ، وأبو عوانَةَ ، ويَحيَى القَطَّانُ ، عَنْ مُوسى الذي رواه مسلم مِن جِهتِهِ فقالُوا : « وَيُحَطُّ » بِغَيْرِ أَلفٍ .

1432- وعنْ أبي ذَرٍّ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قالَ : « يُصْبِحُ عَلى كُلِّ سُلامَى مِنْ أَحدِكُمْ صَدَقةٌ : فكُلُّ تَسْبِيحةٍ صدقَةٌ ، وكُلُّ تَحْمِيدَةٍ صَدَقَةٌ ، وَكُلُّ تَهْلِيلَةٍ صَدَقَةٌ ، وكُلُّ تَكْبِيرةٍ صدقَةٌ ، وَأَمْرٌ بِالمعْرُوفِ صَدقَةٌ ، وَنَهْيٌ عَنِ المُنكَرِ صدقَةٌ . وَيُجْزِيءُ مِنْ ذلكَ ركْعتَانِ يَرْكَعُهُما منَ الضُّحَى » رواه مسلم .

1433- وعَنْ أُمِّ المؤمنينَ جُوَيْرِيَةَ بنتِ الحارِثِ رضي اللَّه عَنْها أنَّ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم خَرجَ مِنْ عِنْدِهَا بُكرَةً حِينَ صَلَّى الصُّبْحَ وهِيَ في مسْجِدِهَا ، ثُمَّ رَجع بَعْد أَنْ أَضْحى وهَي جَالِسةٌ فقال : « مازلْتِ على الحال التي فارَقْتُكَ عَلَيْهَا ؟ » قالَتْ : نَعمْ : فَقَالَ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لَقَدْ قُلْتُ بَعْدِكِ أرْبَعَ كَلمَاتٍ ثَلاثَ مرَّاتٍ ، لَوْ وُزِنَتْ بمَا قُلْتِ مُنْذُ الْيَومِ لَوَزَنْتهُنَّ : سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وبحمْدِهِ عَدَدَ خَلْقِهِ ، وَرِضَاءَ نَفْسِهِ ، وَزِنَةَ عرْشِهِ ، ومِداد كَلمَاتِه » رواه مسلم.

وفي روايةٍ لهُ : سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ عددَ خَلْقِهِ ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رِضَاءَ نَفْسِهِ ، سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ زِنَةَ عَرْشِهِ ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ مِداد كَلماتِهِ » .

وفي روايةِ الترمذي : « ألا أُعلِّمُكِ كَلماتٍ تَقُولِينَها ؟ سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ عَدَدَ خلْقِهِ ، سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ عَددَ خَلْقِهِ ، سُبْحانَ اللَّه عدد خَلْقِهِ ، سُبْحانَ اللَّه رضا نَفْسِهِ ، سُبْحان اللَّهِ رضا نَفْسِهِ، سُبْحانَ اللَّه رضا نَفْسِهِ ، سُبحَانَ اللَّه زِنَةَ عرْشِهٍ ، سُبحَانَ اللَّه زِنَةَ عرْشِهٍ ، سُبحَانَ اللَّه زِنَةَ عرْشِهٍ ، سُبحَانَ اللَّهِ مِدادَ كَلماتِهِ ، سُبحَانَ اللَّهِ مِدادَ كَلماتِهِ ، سُبحَانَ اللَّهِ مِدادَ كَلماتِه » .

1434- وعنْ أبي مُوسَى الأشعريِّ ، رضي اللَّه عنهُ ، عن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، قال : «مَثَلُ الذي يَذكُرُ ربَّهُ وَالذي لا يذكُرُهُ ، مَثَل الحيِّ والمَيِّتِ » رواهُ البخاري .

ورواه مسلم فقال :«مَثَلُ البَيْتِ الَّذي يُذْكَرُ اللَّه فِيهِ ، وَالبَيتِ الذي لا يُذْكَرُ اللَّه فِيهِ ، مَثَلُ الحَيِّ والمَيِّتِ » .

1435- وعنْ أبي هُريرةَ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، أنَّ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قالَ : « يقُولُ اللَّه تَعالى : أَنَا عِنْدَ ظَنِّ عبدي بي ، وأنا مَعهُ إذا ذَكَرَني ، فَإن ذَكرَني في نَفْسهِ ، ذَكَرْتُهُ في نَفسي ، وإنْ ذَكَرَني في ملإٍ ، ذكَرتُهُ في ملإٍ خَيْرٍ منْهُمْ » متَّفقٌ عليهِ .

1436- وعَنْهُ قال : قالَ رَسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « سبقَ المُفَرِّدُونَ » قالوا : ومَا المُفَرِّدُونَ يا رسُول اللَّهِ ؟ قال : « الذَّاكِرُونَ اللَّه كَثيراً والذَّاكِراتُ » رواه مسلم .

روي : « المُفَرِّدُونَ » بتشديد الراء وتخفيفها ، والمَشْهُورُ الَّذي قَالَهُ الجمهُورُ : التَّشديدُ.

1437-­ وعن جابر رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قالَ : سمِعْتُ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقولُ : « أَفْضَلُ الذِّكرِ : لا إله إلاَّ اللَّه » .

رواهُ الترمِذيُّ وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1438- وعنْ عبد اللَّه بن بُسْرٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ أنَّ رَجُلاً قال : يا رسُولَ اللَّهِ ، إنَّ شَرائِع الإسْلامِ قَدْ كَثُرتْ علَيَّ ، فَأخبرْني بِشيءٍ أتشَبَّثُ بهِ قال : « لا يَزالُ لِسَانُكَ رَطْباً مِنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ » رواهُ الترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حَسَنٌ .

1439- وعنْ جابرٍ رضي اللَّه عنهُ ، عَنِ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « منْ قال : سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ وبحَمدِهِ ، غُرِستْ لهُ نَخْلَةٌ في الجَنَّةِ » . رواه الترمذي وقال : حديث حسنٌ .

1440- وعن ابن مسْعُودٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قال : قال رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « لَقِيتُ إبراهيمَ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم لَيْلَةَ أُسْرِيَ بي فقال : يا مُحمَّدُ أقرِيءْ أُمَّتَكَ مِنِّي السَّلام ، وأَخبِرْهُمْ أنَّ الجنَّةَ طَيِّبةُ التُّرُبةِ ، عذْبةُ الماءِ ، وأنَّها قِيعانٌ وأنَّ غِرَاسَها : سُبْحانَ اللَّه ، والحمْدُ للَّه ، ولا إله إلاَّ اللَّه واللَّه أكْبَرُ » .

رواه الترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1441- وعنْ أَبي الدِّرداءِ ، رضيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ قالَ : قالَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « أَلا أُنَبِّئُكُم بِخَيْرِ أَعْمَالِكُم ، وأَزْكَاهَا عِند مليكِكم ، وأَرْفعِها في دَرجاتِكم ، وخَيْرٌ لَكُمْ مِنْ إِنْفَاق الذَّهَبِ والفضَّةِ ، وخَيْرٌ لَكُمْ مِنْ أَنْ تَلْقوْا عدُوَّكم ، فَتَضربُوا أَعْنَاقَهُم ، ويضرِبوا أَعْنَاقكُم؟» قالوا : بلَى ، قال:« ذِكُر اللَّهِ تَعالى » .

رواهُ الترمذي ، قالَ الحاكمُ أَبو عبد اللَّهِ : إِسناده صحيح .

1442- وعن سعْدِ بنِ أَبي وقَّاصٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أَنَّهُ دَخَل مع رسولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم على امْرأَةٍ وبيْنَ يديْهَا نَوىً ­ أَوْ حصىً ­ تُسبِّحُ بِه فقال : « أَلا أُخْبِرُك بما هُو أَيْسرُ عَليْكِ مِنْ هذا ­ أَوْ أَفْضَلُ » فقالَ : « سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ عددَ مَا خَلَقَ في السَّماءِ ، وَسُبْحانَ اللَّهِ عددَ ما خَلَقَ في الأَرْضِ ، سُبحانَ اللَّهِ عددَ ما بيْنَ ذلك ، وسبْحانَ اللَّهِ عدد ما هُوَ خَالِقٌ . واللَّه أَكْبرُ مِثْلَ ذلكَ ، والحَمْد للَّهِ مِثْل ذلك ، ولا إِله إِلا اللَّه مِثْل ذلكَ ، ولا حوْل ولا قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ باللَّه مِثْلَ ذلك » .

رواه الترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1443- وعنْ أَبي مُوسى رضي اللَّه عنْه قال : قالَ لي رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « أَلا أَدُلُّك على كَنْزٍ مِنْ كُنُوزِ الجنَّةِ ؟ » فقلت : بلى يا رسول اللَّه ، قال : « لا حول ولا قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ » متفقٌ عليه .

			 				 	

باب ذكر اللَّه تعالى قائماً وقاعداً ومضطجعاً

باب ذكر اللَّه تعالى قائماً وقاعداً ومضطجعاً

ومحدثاً وجُنباً وحائضاً إلا القرآن فلا يحل لجنب ولا حائض

قال اللَّه تعالى: { إن في خلق السماوات والأرض، واختلاف الليل والنهار لآيات لأولي الألباب، الذين يذكرون اللَّه قياماً وقعوداً وعلى جنوبهم } .

1444- وعنْ عائشة رضيَ اللَّه عنْهَا قَالَت : كانَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يذكُرُ اللَّه تَعالى على كُلِّ أَحيانِهِ . رواه مسلم .

1445-­ وعن ابن عبَّاسٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهما عن النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « لو أَنَّ أَحَدكُمْ إِذا أَتَى أَهلَهُ قالَ:بِسْمِ اللَّهِ اللَّهُمَّ جَنِّبْنَا الشَّيطَانَ وَجنِّبِ الشَّيطانَ مارزَقْتَنَا ،فَقُضِي بيْنهُما ولَدٌ ،م يضُرّهُ»متفقٌ عليه. 

			 				 	

باب ما يقوله عند نومه واستيقاظِه

1446- عن حُذَيْفَةَ ، وأَبي ذَرٍّ رضيَ اللَّه عَنْهُمَا قالا : كانَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إِذا أَوَى إِلى فِراشِهِ قال : « بِاسمِكَ اللَّهُمَّ أَحْيَا وَأَمُوتُ » وإِذا اسْتيقَظَ قال : « الحمْدُ للَّهِ الذِي أَحْيَانَا بعد مَا أَماتَنَا وَإِليْهِ النُّشورُ » رواه الترمذي .

			 				 	

باب فضل حِلَقِ الذِّكْر

باب فضل حِلَقِ الذِّكْر

والنَّدب إلى ملازمتها والنهَّي عن مفارقتها لغير عذر

قال اللَّه تعالى: { واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه، ولا تعد عيناك عنهم } .

1447- وعنْ أَبي هُريرةَ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قال : قالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إِنَّ للَّهِ تَعالى ملائِكَةً يَطُوفُونَ في الطُّرُق يَلْتَمِسُونَ أَهْلَ الذِّكْرِ ، فإِذا وَجدُوا قَوْماً يذكُرُونَ اللَّه عَزَّ وَجلَّ، تَـنَادَوْا : هَلُمُّوا إِلى حاجتِكُمْ ، فَيَحُفُّونَهم بِأَجْنِحَتِهم إِلى السَّمَاء الدُّنْيَا ، فَيَسأَلهُم رَبُّهُم ­ وَهُوَ أَعْلم ­ : ما يقولُ عِبَادِي ؟ قال : يَقُولُونَ : يُسبِّحُونَكَ وَيُكَبِّرونَكَ ، ويحْمَدُونَكَ ، ويُمَجِّدُونَكَ ، فيقولُ : هل رأَوْني ؟ فيقولون : لا واللَّهِ ما رأَوْكَ ، فَيَقُولُ : كَيْفَ لو رَأَوْني؟، قال : يقُولُون لو رَأَوْكَ كانُوا أَشَدَّ لكَ عِبادَةً ، وأَشَدَّ لكَ تمْجِيداً ، وأَكثرَ لكَ تَسْبِيحاً . فَيَقُولُ : فماذا يَسأَلُونَ ؟ قال : يَقُولونَ : يسأَلُونَكَ الجنَّةَ . قالَ : يقولُ : وَهل رَأَوْهَا ؟ قالَ : يَقُولُونَ : لا وَاللَّه ياربِّ مَا رأَوْهَا . قَالَ : يَقُولُ : فَكَيْفَ لو رَأَوْهَا ؟، قال: يَقُولُونَ : لو أَنَّهُم رأَوْها كَانُوا أَشَدَّ علَيْهَا حِرْصاً ، وَأَشَدَّ لهَا طَلَباً ، وَأَعْظَم فِيها رغْبة. قَالَ : فَمِمَّ يَتَعَوَّذُونَ ؟ قَالَ : يقولُون يَتعَوَّذُونَ مِنَ النَّارِ ، قال : فَيقُولُ : وهَل رَأَوْهَا ؟ قالَ: يقولونَ: لا واللَّهِ ما رأَوْهَا . فَيقُولُ : كَيْف لو رَأوْها ؟، قال : يقُولُون : لو رَأَوْهَا كانوا أَشَدَّ منها فِراراً ، وأَشَدَّ لها مَخَافَة . قَالَ : فيقُولُ : فَأُشْهدُكم أَنِّي قَد غَفَرْتُ لهم ، قَالَ : يقُولُ مَلَكٌ مِنَ الملائِكَةِ : فِيهم فُلانٌ لَيْس مِنهم ، إِنَّمَا جاءَ لِحاجَةٍ، قال : هُمُ الجُلَسَاءُ لا يَشْقَى بِهم جلِيسهُم » متفقٌ عليه .

وفي روايةٍ لمسلِمٍ عنْ أَبي هُريرةَ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « إِنَّ للَّهِ مَلائِكَةً سَيَّارةً فُضًلاءَ يتَتَبَّعُونَ مجالِس الذِّكرِ ، فَإِذا وجدُوا مَجلِساً فِيهِ ذِكْرٌ ، قَعدُوا معهُم ، وحفَّ بعْضُهُم بعْضاً بِأَجْنِحَتِهِم حتَّى يَمْلأُوا ما بيْنَهُمْ وَبَيْنَ السَّماءِ الدُّنْيَا ، فَإِذا تَفَرَّقُوا عَرجُوا وصعِدوا إِلى السَّماءِ ، فَيسْأَلهُمُ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وجلَّ ­ وهُوَ أَعْلَمُ ­ : مِنْ أَيْنَ جِئْتُمْ ؟ فَيَقُولُون: جِئْنَا مِنْ عِندِ عِبادٍ لَكَ في الأَرْضِ : يُسبحُونَكَ، ويُكَبِّرُونَكَ ، وَيُهَلِّلُونَكَ ، وَيحْمَدُونَكَ ، وَيَسْأَلُونَكَ . قال : وماذا يسْأَلُوني ؟ قَالُوا : يَسْأَلُونَكَ جنَّتَكَ . قال : وهَلْ رَأَوْا جنَّتي ؟ قالُوا : لا ، أَيْ ربِّ : قال : فكَيْفَ لو رأَوْا جنَّتي ؟ قالُوا : ويسْتَجِيرُونَكَ قال : ومِمَّ يسْتَجِيرُوني ؟ قالوا : منْ نَارِكَ ياربِّ . قال : وَهَلْ رَأَوْا نَارِي ؟ قالوا : لا ، قال : فَكَيْفَ لَوْ رَأَوْا نَارِي ؟، قالُوا : ويسْتَغْفِرونَكَ ، فيقول : قَدْ غفَرْتُ لهُمْ ، وأَعطَيْتُهُمْ ما سَأَلُوا ، وأَجرْتُهم مِمَّا اسْتَجارُوا . قال : فَيقُولونَ : ربِّ فيهمْ فُلانٌ عبْدٌ خَطَّاءٌ إِنَّمَا مَرَّ ، فَجلَس معهُمْ ، فيقول : ولهُ غفَرْتُ ، هُمْ القَوْمُ لا يَشْقَى بِهِمْ جَلِيسُهُمْ » .

1448- وعنهُ عنْ أَبي سعيدٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُمَا قالا : قَالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لا يَقْعُدُ قَوْمٌ يذْكُرُونَ اللَّهَ إِلاَّ حفَّتْهُمُ الملائِكة ، وغشِيتهُمُ الرَّحْمةُ ونَزَلَتْ علَيْهِمْ السَّكِينَة ، وذكَرَهُم اللَّه فِيمن عِنْدَهُ » رواه مسلم .

1449- وعن أَبي واقِدٍ الحارِثِ بن عَوْفٍ رضيَ اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم بيْنَما هُو جَالِسٌ في المسْجِدِ ، والنَّاسُ معهُ ، إِذ أَقْبلَ ثَلاثَةُ نَفَرٍ ، فأَقْبَل اثْنَانِ إِلى رسولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وذَهَب واحدٌ، فَوقَفَا على رسول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم . فَأَمَّا أَحدُهُما فرأَى فُرْجَةً في الحلْقَةِ ، فجَلَسَ فيها وأَمَّا الآخَرُ ، فَجَلَس خَلْفَهُمْ ، وأَمَّا الثالثُ فَأَدبر ذاهباً . فَلمَّا فَرَغَ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال: أَلا أُخبِرُكم عن النَّفَرِ الثَّلاثَةِ ، أَمَّا أَحدُهم ، فَأَوى إِلى اللَّهِ فآواه اللَّه وأَمَّا الآخرُ فَاسْتَحْيي فاستحيي اللَّهُ مِنْهُ وَأَمَّا الآخرُ ، فأَعْرضَ ، فأَعْرض اللَّهُ عنْهُ » متفقٌ عليه .

1450- وعن أبي سعيد الخُدْريِّ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : خَرج معاوِيَة رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ علَى حَلْقَةٍ في المسْجِدِ ، فقال : ما أَجْلَسكُمْ ؟ قالُوا : جلَسْنَا نَذْكُرُ اللَّه . قَالَ : آللَّهِ ما أَجْلَسكُم إِلاَّ ذَاكَ ؟ قالوا : ما أَجْلَسنَا إِلاَّ ذَاكَ ، قال : أَما إِنِّي لَمْ أَسْتَحْلِفْكُم تُهْمةً لَكُم وما كانَ أَحدٌ بمنْزِلَتي مِنْ رسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أقلَّ عنْهُ حَدِيثاً مِنِّي : إِنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم خرَج علَى حَلْقَةٍ مِن أَصحابِه فقال : « ما أَجْلَسكُمْ ؟ » قالوا : جلَسْنَا نَذكُرُ اللَّه ، ونحْمدُهُ علَى ماهَدَانَا لِلإِسْلامِ ، ومنَّ بِهِ عليْنا . قَال : « آللَّهِ ما أَجْلَسكُمْ إِلاَّ ذَاكَ ؟ قالوا : واللَّه ما أَجْلَسنا إِلاَّ ذَاكَ . قالَ : « أَما إِنِّي لَمْ أَسْتَحْلِفْكُمْ تُهمةً لكُمْ ، ولِكنَّهُ أَتانِي جبرِيلُ فَأَخْبرني أَنَّ اللَّه يُباهِي بِكُمُ الملائكَةَ » رواهُ مسلمٌ .

			 				 	

باب الذكر عند الصباح والمساء

قال اللَّه تعالى: { واذكر ربك في نفسك تضرعاً وخيفةً ودون الجهر من القول بالغدو والآصال، ولا تكن من الغافلين } .

قال أهل اللغة: { الآصال } جمع أصيل وهو: ما بين العصر والمغرب.

وقال تعالى: { وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها } .

وقال تعالى: { وسبح بحمد ربك بالعشي والإبكار } .

قال أهل اللغة: { العشي } : ما بين زوال الشمس وغروبها.

وقال تعالى: { في بيوت أذن اللَّه أن ترفع ويذكر فيها اسمه، يسبح له فيها بالغدو والآصال رجال لا تلهيهم تجارة ولا بيع عن ذكر اللَّه } الآية.

وقال تعالى: { إنا سخرنا الجبال معه يسبحن بالعشي والإشراق } .

1451- وعنْ أَبي هريرة رضي اللَّه عنهُ قال : قالَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَنْ قال حِينَ يُصْبِحُ وحينَ يُمسِي : سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ وبحمدِهِ مِائَةَ مَرةٍ لَم يأْتِ أَحدٌ يوْم القِيامة بأَفضَلِ مِما جَاءَ بِهِ ، إِلاَّ أَحدٌ قال مِثلَ مَا قال أَوْ زَادَ » رواهُ مسلم .

1452- وعَنهُ قال : جاءَ رجُلٌ إِلى النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، فقال : يا رسُول اللَّهِ ما لَقِيتُ مِنْ عَقْربٍ لَدغَتني البارِحةَ ، قال : « أَما لَو قُلتَ حِينَ أمْسيت : أعُوذُ بِكَلماتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ منْ شَرِّ ما خَلَقَ لم تَضُرَّك » رواه مسلم .

1453- وعنْهُ عن النبيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أَنَّه كان يقول إِذَا أَصْبَحَ : اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَصْبحْنَا وبِكَ أَمسَيْنَا وبِكَ نَحْيا ، وبِكَ نَمُوتُ ، وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُورُ » وإِذا أَمْسى قال : « اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وبِكَ نَحْيا ، وبِك نمُوتُ وإِلَيْكَ المَصِير » .

رواه أَبو داود والترمذي وقال : حديث حسن .

1454- وعنهُ أَنَّ أَبا بَكرٍ الصِّدِّيقَ ، رضيَ اللَّه عنه ، قال : يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مُرْنِي بِكَلمَاتٍ أَقُولُهُنَّ إِذَا أَصْبَحْتُ وإِذَا أَمْسَيتُ ، قال : قُلْ : « اللَّهُمَّ فَاطِرَ السَّمَواتِ والأرضِ عَالمَ الغَيْب وَالشَّهَادةِ ، ربَّ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَمَلِيكَهُ . أَشْهَدُ أَن لاَ إِله إِلاَّ أَنتَ ، أَعُوذُ بكَ منْ شَرِّ نَفسي وشَرِّ الشَّيْطَانِ وَشِرْكهِ » قال : « قُلْها إِذا أَصْبحْتَ ، وَإِذا أَمْسَيْتَ ، وإِذا أَخذْتَ مَضْجِعَكَ » رواه أبو داود والترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ صحيحٌ .
