1455- وعَن ابْن مَسْعُودٍ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قالَ : كانَ نبيُّ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إِذَا أَمسى قال : أَمْسَيْنَا وأَمْسى المُلكُ للَّهِ ، والحمْدُ للَّهِ ، لاَ إِلهَ إِلاَّ اللَّه وحْدَهُ لاَ شَريكَ لَه » قالَ الرواي: أَرَاهُ قال فيهِنَّ : « لهُ المُلكُ وَلَه الحمْدُ وهُوَ عَلى كلِّ شَيءٍ قدِيرٌ ، ربِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا في هذِهِ اللَّيلَةِ ، وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهَا ، وأَعُوذُ بِكَ منْ شَرِّ مَا في هذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وشَرِّ ما بعْدَهَا ، ربِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ من الكَسَلِ ، وَسُوءِ الكِبْرِ ، أعوذُ بِكَ منْ عذَابٍ في النَّار ، وَعَذَابٍ في القبر » وَإِذَا أَصْبحَ قال ذلك أَيْضاً : « أَصْبحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ المُلْك للَّهِ »رواه مسلم .

1456- وعنْ عبدِ اللَّهِ بنِ خُبَيْب ­ بضَمِّ الْخَاءِ المُعْجَمَةِ ­ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قال : قال لي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « اقْرأْ : قُلْ هوَ اللَّه أَحَدٌ ، والمعوِّذَتَيْن حِينَ تُمْسِي وَحِينَ تُصبِحُ ، ثَلاثَ مَرَّاتٍ تَكْفِيكَ مِنْ كلِّ شَيْءٍ » .رواهُ أَبو داود والترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حسن صحيح .

1457- وعنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عَفَانَ رضيَ اللَّه عنهُ قالَ :قالَ رَسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم:«مَا مِنْ عَبْدٍ يَقُولُ في صَبَاحِ كلِّ يَوْمٍ ومَسَاءٍ كلِّ لَيْلَةٍ :بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي لاَ يَضُرُّ مَع اسْمِهِ شيء في الأرضِ ولا في السماءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعلِيمُ ، ثلاثَ مَرَّاتٍ ، إِلاَّ لَمْ يَضُرَّهُ شَيءٌ»رواه أبو داود ، والتِّرمذي وقال:حديث حسن صحيح .

			 				 	

باب ما يقوله عند النوم

قال اللَّه تعالى: { إن في خلق السماوات والأرض، واختلاف الليل والنهار لآيات لأولي الألباب، الذين يذكرون اللَّه قياماً وقعوداً وعلى جنوبهم، ويتفكرون في خلق السموات والأرض } الآيات.

1458- وعنْ حُذيفةَ وأَبي ذرٍّ رضي اللَّه عنْهما أَنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كانَ إِذَا أَوَى إِلَى فِرَاشِهِ قالَ : « باسْمِكَ اللَّهُمَّ أَحْيَا وَأَمُوتُ » . رواه البخاري .

1459- وعَنْ عليٍّ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أَنَّ رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قالَ له وَلِفَاطِمةَ رضيَ اللَّه عنهما: « إِذَا أَوَيْتُمَا إِلى فِراشِكُما ، أَوْ إِذَا أَخَذْتُمَا مَضَاجِعَكُما ­ فَكَبِّرا ثَلاثاً وَثَلاثِينَ ، وَسَبِّحَا ثَلاثاً وثَلاثِينَ ، وَاحْمَدَا ثَلاثاً وَثَلاثِين » وفي روايةٍ : « التَّسْبِيحُ أَرَبعاً وَثَلاثِينَ » وفي روايةٍ : « التَّكبيرُ أَربعاً وَثَلاثِينَ » متفقٌ عليه .

1460- وعن أَبي هُريرةَ رَضِيَ اللَّه عنهُ ، قال : قال رسولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إِذا أَوَى أَحَدُكُم إِلى فِراشِهِ ، فَلْيَنْفُض فِراشَهُ بداخِلَةِ إِزَارِهِ فإِنَّهُ لاَ يَدْرِي مَا خَلَفَهُ عَلَيْهِ ، ثُمَّ يَقُولُ : بِاسْمِكَ رَبِّي وَضَعْتُ جَنْبي ، وَبِكَ أَرْفَعُهُ ، إِنْ أَمْسَكْتَ نَفْسِي فَارْحَمْها ، وإِنْ أَرْسَلْتَهَا ، فَاحْفَظْهَا بِمَا تَحْفَظُ بِه عِبادَكَ الصَّالحِينَ » متفقٌ عليه .

1461- وعنْ عائشةَ رضي اللَّه عنْها ، أَنَّ رسول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كان إِذَا أَخَذَ مضْجعَهُ نَفَثَ في يدَيْهِ ، وَقَرَأَ بالْمُعَوِّذاتِ ومَسح بِهمَا جَسَدَهُ ، متفقٌ عليه .

وفي رواية لهما : أَنَّ النبيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَانَ إِذَا أَوى إِلى فِرَاشِهِ كُلَّ لَيْلةٍ جمَع كَفَّيْهِ ­ ثُمَّ نفَثَ فيهما فَقَرأَ فِيهما : قُلْ هُوَ اللَّه أَحَدٌ ، وقُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الفلَقِ ، وَقُلْ أَعُوذُ بِربِّ النَّاسِ ، ثُمَّ مَسَحَ بِهِمَا ما اسْتطاعَ مِن جسَدِهِ ، يبْدَأُ بِهما عَلَى رَأْسِهِ وَوجهِهِ ، وما أَقبلَ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ ، يَفْعَلُ ذلكَ ثَلاَثَ مرَّات متفقٌ عليه .

قال أَهلُ اللُّغَةِ : « النَّفْثُ » نَفخٌ لَطِيفٌ بِلاَ رِيقٍ .

1462- وَعنِ البرَاءِ بنِ عازِبٍ ، رَضِيَ اللَّه عنْهمَا ، قَالَ : قال لي رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : «إِذَا أَتَيتَ مَضْجَعَكَ فَتَوضَّأْ وضُوءَكَ لِلصَّلاةِ ، ثُمَّ اضْطَجِعْ عَلى شِقِّكَ الأَيمَنِ ، وقلْ : اللَّهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نفِسي إِلَيكَ ، وَوَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِي إِلَيْكَ . وَفَوَّضتُ أَمري إِلَيْكَ ، وَأَلَجَأْتُ ظَهرِي إِلَيْكَ ، رغبةً ورهْبَةً إِلَيْكَ ، لامَلجأَ ولا مَنجي مِنْكَ إِلاَّ إِليكَ ، آمنتُ بِكِتَابِكَ الذِي أَنزَلْت ، وَبِنَبِيِّكَ الذِي أَرسَلتَ ، فإِنْ مِتَّ . مِتَّ على الفِطرةِ ، واجْعَلهُنَّ آخِرَ ما تَقُولُ » مُتَّفقٌ عليهِ .

1463- وَعَنْ أَنَسٍ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَانَ إذا أَوَى إِلى فِرَاشِهِ قَال : «الحمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذي أَطْعَمنَا وسقَانا ، وكفَانَا وآوانَا ، فكمْ مِمَّنْ لا كافيَ لَهُ ولا مُؤْوِيَ » رواهُ مسلمٌ .

1464- وعنْ حُذيْفَةَ ، رضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، أَنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَانَ إِذا أَرَاد أَنْ يرْقُدَ ، وضَع يَدهُ اليُمنَى تَحْتَ خَدِّهِ ، ثُمَّ يقُولُ : « اللَّهمَّ قِني عَذَابكَ يوْمَ تَبْعثُ عِبادَكَ » رواهُ الترمِذيُّ وقال : حديثٌ حَسنٌ .

وَرَواهُ أَبو داودَ مِنْ رِوايةِ حفْصةَ ، رَضِي اللَّه عنْهُا ، وَفيهِ أَنَّهُ كَانَ يقُولهُ ثَلاثَ مَرَّاتٍ .

Chapter on the virtue of remembrance and encouraging it

God Almighty said: {And the remembrance of God is greater}.

And God Almighty said: {So remember Me, and I will remember you}.

And God Almighty said: {And remember your Lord within yourself, with humility and fear, and speaking silently in the mornings and the evenings, and do not be of the heedless.}

And God Almighty said: {And remember God often, that you may succeed.}

And God Almighty said: {Indeed, the Muslim men and women} up to His Almighty saying: {And the men and women who remember Allah often, for them God has prepared forgiveness and a great reward}.

And God Almighty said: {O you who have believed, remember God with abundant remembrance, and glorify Him morning and evening} the verse. The verses in this chapter are many and well known.

1408- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Two words that are light on the tongue, heavy on the scale, two words that are dear to each other.” The Most Gracious: Glory be to God and praise be to Him, Glory be to God the Great. Agreed upon. 1409- On the authority of him, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Because I say, Glory be to God, and praise be to God, and there is no god but God, and God is great, more beloved to me than what I have seen.” The sun is upon him.” Narrated by Muslim.

1410- On his authority, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever says there is no god but God alone, without any partner, to Him belongs dominion, to Him is praise, and He has power over all things. One hundred times in a day, he had freed ten slaves, one hundred good deeds were recorded for him, one hundred bad deeds were erased from him, and it was a protection for him from Satan that day until evening, and no one came. better than what he brought, except for a man who did more than him.” And he said: “Whoever says, ‘Glory be to God and praise be to Him’ a hundred times a day, his sins will be forgiven, even if they are like foam.” Al-Bahr” Agreed upon. 1411- On the authority of Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Whoever says there is no god but God alone, without partners, to Him belongs dominion, to Him is praise, and He is capable of all things. Ten times: It was as if he had freed four people from the descendants of Ishmael. Agreed upon. 1412- On the authority of Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “Shall I not tell you the most beloved speech to God?” The most beloved speech to God is: “Glory be to God and praise be to Him.” Narrated by Muslim.

1413- On the authority of Abu Malik Al-Ash’ari, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Purity is half of faith, and praise be to God fills the scale, and Glory be to God and praise be to God fills the scale or It fills what is between the heavens and the earth.” Narrated by Muslim. 1414- On the authority of Saad bin Abi Waqqas, may God be pleased with him, he said: A Bedouin came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: Teach me something to say. He said: “Say: There is no god but God alone, with no partner. God is most great, and praise be to God abundantly. Glory be to God, Lord of the worlds. There is no power nor strength except in God, the Mighty, the Wise.” He said: So these are For my Lord, what is mine? He said: “Say: O God, forgive me and have mercy on me.” Guide me, and provide for me.” Narrated by Muslim.

1415- And on the authority of Thawban, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to: “When he finished his prayer, he would ask forgiveness three times, and he would say: ‘O God, you are peace, and from you is peace. Blessed are you, O Majesty. And honor.” It was said to Al-Awza’i, who is one of the narrators of the hadith: How to ask for forgiveness? He said: You say: I ask forgiveness from God, I ask forgiveness from God. Narrated by Muslim.

1416- On the authority of Al-Mughirah bin Shu’bah, may God be pleased with him, that when the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, finished praying and said the salutations, he would say: “There is no god but God alone, with no partner, to Him belongs dominion and to Him is praise.” And He has power over all things. Oh God, there is no one who can prevent what You have given, nor can there be a giver of what You have withheld, and no one who is serious can benefit from you. Agreed upon.

1417- On the authority of Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr, may God Almighty be pleased with them both, that he used to say after every prayer, when he said the salutation: There is no god but God alone, with no partner, to Him belongs dominion and to Him is praise, and He is over everything. Almighty. There is no power nor strength except with God, there is no god but God, and we worship none but Him. To Him belongs the blessing, to Him is the bounty, and to Him is the good praise. There is no god but God, sincere in religion to Him, even if the disbelievers hate it. Ibn al-Zubayr said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to chant the halalah with them at the end of every prescribed prayer. Narrated by Muslim. 1418- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the poor emigrants came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: The people of the earth have gone to the highest ranks and lasting bliss: they will pray. Just as we pray, and they fast as we fast, and they have surplus wealth: they perform Hajj, perform Umrah, perform jihad, and give in charity. He said: “Shall I not teach you something by which you will catch up with those who came before you, and with it you will precede those after you?” And no one will be better than you except he who has done what you have done? » They said: Yes, O Messenger of God. He said: «You praise, praise and glorify, behind every prayer thirty-three» Abu Salih the narrator said on the authority of Abu Hurairah, when he was asked about how to mention them, he said: He says: Glory be to Him. God, praise be to God, and God is greatest, until there were thirty-three of them in total. Agreed upon. Muslim added in his narration: So the poor immigrants returned to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: Our brothers who have wealth heard about what we did, so they did the same? The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “This is the grace of God. He gives it to whomever He wishes.”

“Al-Dathur” is the plural of “Dathur” with the opening of the dal and the sikan of the triple tha’, which is a lot of money. 1419- And on the authority of him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, he said: “Whoever exalts God thirty-three times after every prayer, praises God thirty-three times, and glorifies God thirty-three times and says Perfect hundred: There is no god but God alone, with no partner. To Him belongs dominion and to Him is praise, and He is capable of all things. His sins are forgiven, even if they are like the foam of the sea. Narrated by Muslim. 1420- On the authority of Ka’b bin Urwah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “They are followed by the one who says them or the one who does them will not be disappointed. After every obligatory prayer: Three And thirty-three times of praise, thirty-three times of praise, and thirty-four times of greatness.” Narrated by Muslim. 1421- On the authority of Saad bin Abi Waqqas, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to seek refuge after the prayers with these words: “O God, I seek refuge in You from cowardice and stinginess, and I seek refuge in You From being returned to the most miserable life, and I seek refuge in You from the temptation of this world, and I seek refuge in You from the temptation of the grave.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 1422- On the authority of Muadh, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, took him by the hand and said: “O Muadh, by God, I love you,” and he said: “I advise you, O Muadh, not to leave you alone.” Every prayer says: O God, help me to remember You, to thank You, and to worship You well.

Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. 1423- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “If one of you bears witness, let him seek refuge in God from four things. He says: O God, I seek refuge in You from The torment of Hell, and the torment of the grave, and the temptation of life and death, and the evil of the temptation of the Antichrist.” Narrated by Muslim.

1424 - And on the authority of Ali, may God be pleased with him, he said: When the Messenger of God stood up for prayer, one of the last things he would say between the tashahhud and the salutation was: “O God, forgive me for what I have put forward and what I have delayed, and what I have concealed and what I have declared. I have not been extravagant, and you are not more knowledgeable than me. You are the advancer, and you are the delayer. There is no god but You.” Narrated by Muslim. 1425- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would often say in his bowing and prostration: Glory be to You, O God, our Lord, and with Your praise, O God, forgive. Lee » Agreed upon.

1426- On her authority, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to say while bowing and prostrating: “Glory be to the Holy One, the Lord of the angels and the spirit.” Narrated by Muslim. 1427- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “As for bowing, glorify the Lord in it, and as for prostration, strive to supplicate, for it will be answered.” For you.” Narrated by Muslim.

1428- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The closest a servant is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so increase your supplication.” Narrated by Muslim. 1429- On his authority, the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to say during his prostration, “O God, forgive me all my sins: the smallest and most sublime of them, the beginning and the end, the open and the secret.” Narrated by Muslim.

1430- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: I visited the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, one night, and I felt him, when he was kneeling or prostrating, saying: “Glory be to You and with Your praise, there is no god but You.” And in A narration: Then my hand fell on the balls of his feet while he was in the mosque, and they were upright. And he says: “O God, I seek refuge in Your satisfaction from Your wrath, and in Your forgiveness from Your punishment, and I seek refuge in You from You. I do not praise You as You have praised Yourself.” Narrated by Muslim.

1431- On the authority of Saad bin Abi Waqqas, may God be pleased with him, he said: We were with the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and he said: “Is one of you unable to earn a thousand good deeds every day?” A questioner asked him: Those sitting with him: How can he earn a thousand good deeds? He said: “He says Allah a hundred times, and a thousand good deeds are recorded for him, or a thousand sins are erased from him.” Narrated by Muslim.

Al-Humaidi said: This is how it is in the book of Muslim: “or it is put down.” Al-Barqani said: It was narrated by Shu’bah, Abu Awanah, and Yahya al-Qattan, on the authority of Musa, which was narrated by Muslim on his part, and they said: “and it is put down” without an alif. 1432- On the authority of Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Every greeting from one of you becomes a charity: every tasbihah is a charity, and every praise is a charity.” It is a charity, every tahlila is a charity, every takbeer is a charity, enjoining what is right is a charity, and forbidding what is evil is a charity. Two rak'ahs performed in the forenoon prayer are sufficient for this.” Narrated by Muslim.

1433- On the authority of the Mother of the Believers, Juwayriyah bint Al-Harith, may God be pleased with her, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, left her presence early morning when he prayed the morning prayer while she was in her mosque, then he returned after That morning while she was sitting, he said: “Are you still in the same state in which I left you?” She said: Yes. Then the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “I have said four words after you, three times. If they were weighed against what you have said since today, I would weigh them as well: Glory be to God, and praise be to Him according to the number of His creation, the satisfaction of Himself, the weight of His Throne, and the ink of His words.” Narrated by Muslim.

And in his narration: Glory be to God the number of His creation, Glory be to God the satisfaction of Himself, Glory be to God the weight of His Throne, Glory be to God the ink of His words. In Al-Tirmidhi’s narration: “Shall I not teach you words to say?” Glory be to God, the number of His creation, Glory be to God, the number of His creation, Glory be to God, the number of His creation, Glory be to God, the satisfaction of Himself, Glory be to God, the satisfaction of Himself, Glory be to God, the satisfaction of Himself, Glory be to God, the weight of His throne, Glory be to God, the weight of His throne, Glory be to God, the weight of His throne, Glory be to God, the ink of His words, Glory be to God, the ink of His words, Glory be to God The ink of His words. 1434- On the authority of Abu Musa Al-Ash’ari, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “The parable of the one who remembers his Lord and the one who does not remember Him is the parable of the living and the dead.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

It was narrated by Muslim, who said: “The example of a house in which God is remembered, and a house in which God is not remembered, is like the living and the dead.” 1435- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “God Almighty says: I am when my servant thinks of me, and I am with him when he mentions me, and if he mentions me to himself I mentioned him to myself, and if he mentioned me in a gathering, I mentioned him in a better group than them.” Agreed upon. 1436- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The Mufarridoon came before.” They said: What are the Mufarridun, O Messenger of God? He said: “Men and women who remember God often.” Narrated by Muslim.

It was narrated: “Al-Mufarridoon” with the r’a stressed and softened, and what is famously said by the public is: the emphasis.

1437- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: “The best remembrance is: There is no god but God.”

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith. 1438- On the authority of Abdullah bin Busr, may God be pleased with him, that a man said: O Messenger of God, the laws of Islam have become too much for me, so tell me something that I can cling to. He said: “Your tongue continues to be moist.” From the remembrance of God.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

1439- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Whoever says: Glory be to God and praise be to Him, a palm tree will be planted for him in Paradise.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

1440 - On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “I met Ibrahim, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, on the night I was taken on a captivity, and he said: O Muhammad, convey my greetings to your nation, and tell them.” That Paradise has good soil, fresh water, and that it has bottoms, and that its plants are: Glory be to God, and praise be to God, and there is no god but God, and God is great.

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith. 1441- On the authority of Abu al-Darda’, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Shall I not inform you of the best of your deeds, the most pure in the sight of your King, and the highest in your ranks? Is it better for you than to spend gold and silver, and better for you than to meet your enemy and strike their necks, and they strike your necks? They said: Yes, he said: “Remembrance of God Almighty.”

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi. Al-Hakim Abu Abdullah said: Its chain of transmission is authentic. 1442- On the authority of Saad bin Abi Waqqas, may God be pleased with him, that he entered with the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, upon a woman, and in her hands were stones or pebbles with which she was praying, and he said: “Shall I not tell you what it is?” Is it easier for you than this or better?” He said: “Glory be to God, according to the number of what He created in the heavens, and Glory be to God, according to the number of what He created on earth. Glory be to God, according to the number of what is between that, and Glory be to God, according to the number of what He is.” Creator. And God is Greatest, such as that, and praise be to God, such as that, and there is no god but God like that, and there is no power nor strength except in God like that.

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

1443- On the authority of Abu Musa, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “Shall I not direct you to one of the treasures of Paradise?” I said: Yes, O Messenger of God. He said: “There is no power nor strength except in God.” Agreed upon. Chapter: Remembrance of God Almighty while standing, sitting, and lying down

Chapter: Remembrance of God Almighty while standing, sitting, and lying down

And a newlywed, a woman in a state of impurity, or a menstruating woman, except for the Qur’an, which is not permissible for a woman in a state of impurity or a menstruating woman

God Almighty said: {Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, there are signs for those of understanding, those who remember God standing, sitting, and on their sides.}

1444- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to remember God Almighty at all times. Narrated by Muslim.

1445- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “If one of you, when he came to his family, said: In the name of God, O God, spare us Satan and protect Satan.” We were blessed, and a child was decreed between them, which would not harm him.” Agreed upon. Chapter on what he says when he sleeps and wakes up

1446- On the authority of Hudhayfah and Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with them, they said: Whenever the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, went to bed, he would say: “In your name, O God, I live and die.” He woke up and said: “Praise be to God who gave us life after He caused us to die, and to Him is the resurrection.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi. Chapter on the virtue of shaving the penis

Chapter on the virtue of shaving the penis

It is recommended to stay with it and forbidden to leave it without an excuse

God Almighty said: {And be patient with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and evening, seeking His Face, and do not turn your eyes away from them.}

1447- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Indeed, God Almighty has angels who roam the roads, seeking the people of the message, and when they find them A people who remember God Almighty, calling out: Come to what you need. So they will swirl them around with their wings to the lowest heaven, and their Lord will ask them, and He knows best: What do My servants say? He said: They say: They glorify You, glorify You, praise You, and glorify You. So He says: Have they seen me? They say: No, by God, they have not seen you. He says: What if they had seen me? He said: They say that if they had seen you, they would have worshiped you more, glorified you more, and glorified you more. He says: What do they ask? He said: They say: They ask you for Paradise. He said: He says: Did they see it? He said: They say: No, by God, O Lord, they have not seen it. He said: He says: So what if they had seen it? He said: They say: If they had seen it, they would have been more keen on it, more eager for it, and greater in their desire for it. He said: What do they seek refuge in? He said: They say they seek refuge from the Fire. He said: Then he says: And did they see it? He said: They say: No, by God, they did not see it. He says: How would it be if they had seen it? He said: They say: If they had seen it, they would have fled more strongly than it, and feared it more. He said: He says: I bear you as witness that I have forgiven them. He said: One of the angels says: Among them is so-and-so who is not one of them, but he came for a need. He said: They are the ones who sit with them and their companion does not feel miserable. “Agreed upon. And in a narration by Muslim on the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Indeed, God has distinguished, guiding angels who follow the gatherings of the Message, and when they find a gathering therein A male, they sat with them, and they encircled one another with their wings until they filled what was between them and the lower heaven. Then when they dispersed, they ascended and ascended to the heaven. Then God Almighty and He knows best asks them: Where did you come from? They say: We have come from your servants on earth: they glorify you, glorify you, glorify you, praise you, and ask you. He said: What do they ask me? They said: They ask you for your Paradise. He said: Have they seen my Paradise? They said: No, O Lord. He said: So how would it be if they saw My Paradise? They said: They ask you for protection. He said: And from what do they ask me for protection? They said: From your fire, O Lord. He said: Did they see my fire? They said: No. He said: So what if they saw My Fire? They said: And they ask for your forgiveness. He said: I have forgiven them, and I have given them what they asked, and I have rewarded them for what they asked for. He said: Then they say: “O Lord, among them is so-and-so, a sinning servant. He just passed by and sat with them, and he says: ‘And I have forgiven him.’ They are the people whose companions do not feel miserable.” 1448 - And on the authority of Abu Saeed, may God be pleased with them both, they said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A people does not sit remembering God except that the angels surround them and cover them with mercy.” Tranquility descended upon them, and God reminded them of those in His presence.” Narrated by Muslim. 1449- On the authority of Abu Waqid Al-Harith bin Awf, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, while he was sitting in the mosque, and the people were with him, when three people arrived, So two came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and one went and stood over the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. One of them saw a gap in the circle, so he sat in it. The other sat behind them, and the third turned away. When the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, finished, he said: Shall I not tell you about the three people? As for one of them, he sought refuge with God, and God gave him shelter, and as for the other, he was ashamed, so God was ashamed of him. As for the other, he turned away, so God turned away from him.” Agreed upon.

1450- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, he said: Muawiyah, may God be pleased with him, went out to a circle in the mosque, and he said: Why did you sit down? They said: We sat remembering God. He said: By God, no one has sat you down except that one? They said: We did not sit with anyone but that one. He said: I did not make you swear on account of my accusation against you, and no one of my position with regard to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, spoke less about him than me. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, went out to meet a group of his companions and said: “Why did you sit with me?” They said: We sat remembering God and praising Him for guiding us to Islam and for bestowing it upon us. He said: “By God, no one has made you sit except that one?” They said: By God, we did not sit with anyone except that. He said: “I did not make you swear on a charge against you, but Gabriel came to me and told me that God boasts about you to the angels.” Narrated by Muslim.

			 				 	

Chapter on remembrance in the morning and evening

God Almighty said: {And remember your Lord within yourself, humbly and in fear, and speaking silently in the mornings and the evenings, and do not be of the heedless.}

The linguists said: {Al-Aasal} is an authentic plural, which is: what is between the afternoon and the sunset. And God Almighty said: {And glorify the praise of your Lord before the sun rises and before its setting}.

And God Almighty said: {And glorify the praise of your Lord in the evening and the early hours}.

The linguists said: {Al-Ashi}: the period between noon and sunset.

And God Almighty said: {In houses that God has permitted to be raised and His Name to be mentioned in them. Therein glorify Him in the mornings and the evenings - men who are not distracted by trade or sale from the remembrance of God} the verse.

And God Almighty said: {Indeed, We made the mountains subservient to Him, glorifying Him in the evening and the sunrise}. 1451- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever says in the morning and in the evening: Glory be to God and praise be to Him a hundred times, no one will come on the Day of Resurrection better than him.” He brought it, except for someone who said the same as what he said or more.” Narrated by Muslim. 1452- On his authority, he said: A man came to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of God, I did not encounter a scorpion that stung me yesterday. He said: “But if you had said in the evening: I seek refuge in the words of God Complete of the evil of what He created will not harm you.” Narrated by Muslim. 1453- And on the authority of him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, that he used to say when morning came: O God, by You we have entered the morning, and by You we have entered the evening, and by You we live, and by You we die, and to You is the resurrection. In the evening, he said: “O God, by You we live, by You we live, and by You we die, and to You is our return.”

Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good hadith. 1454- And on his authority, that Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may God be pleased with him, said: O Messenger of God, instruct me in words to say in the morning and in the evening. He said: Say: “O God, the Creator.” The heavens and the earth, the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Lord and Sovereign of everything. I bear witness that there is no god but You. I seek refuge in You from the evil of myself and the evil of Satan and his traps.” He said: “Say it in the morning, and in the evening, and when you go to bed.” Narrated by him. Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi said: A good and authentic hadith.

1455- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: When evening came, the Prophet of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would say: “Our evening has arrived,” and the kingdom belongs to God in the evening, and praise be to God. There is no god but God alone, with no partner.” The narrator said: I see him saying in them: “To Him belongs dominion and to Him is praise, and He has power over all things. My Lord, I ask You for the best of this night, and the best of And after that, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and the evil of what comes after it. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and evil arrogance. I seek refuge in You from torment in the Fire. And torment in the grave.” And when morning came, he said that as well: “We have risen and the kingdom belongs to God.” Narrated by Muslim. 1456- On the authority of Abdullah bin Khubayb, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “Recite: Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad, and Al-Mu’awwidhatayn when you come in the evening.” And when morning comes, three times is enough for you of everything.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith. 1457- On the authority of Othman bin Affan, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There is no servant who says in the morning of every day and in the evening of every night: In the name of God who Nothing on earth or in heaven is harmed by His name, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing, three times, except that nothing will harm Him.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith. Chapter on what he says when sleeping

God Almighty said: {Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, there are signs for those with understanding, who remember God standing, sitting, and on their sides, and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth.} The verses.

1458- On the authority of Hudhayfah and Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with them, that when the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would go to bed, he would say: “In your name, O God, I live and I die.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1459- On the authority of Ali, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to him and Fatima, may God be pleased with them: “If you two go to bed, or if you take As you lie down, say “Allahu Akbar” thirty-three times, “Glory be to Him” thirty-three times, and “Allahu Akbar” thirty-three times. Agreed upon. 1460- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “When one of you goes to bed, let him shake off his bed inside his garment, for he does not He knows what he left behind upon him. Then he says: In Your name, my Lord, I have placed myself at my side, and in You I raise it up. If I retain my soul, have mercy on it, and if I send it away, So protect it with the way you protect your righteous servants.” Agreed upon. 1461- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that when the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, went to bed, he would blow his hands, recite the supplications of the exorcists, and wipe his body with them. Agreed upon.

And in their narration: When the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, went to bed every night, he would bring his palms together, then blow on them and recite in them: Say, He is God, One, and Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of creation. And say, “I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind.” Then he wiped his body with them as much as he could. He starts with them on his head and face, and the front of his body, he does that three times, agreed upon.

The people of the language said: “Blowing” is a gentle blowing without saliva.

1462- On the authority of Al-Baraa bin Azib, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said to me: “When you go to bed, perform your ablution for prayer, then Lie on your right side and say: Oh God, I surrender myself to you and turn my face to you. And I entrusted my affairs to you, and I turned my back to you, out of desire and fear for you. There is no refuge or salvation from you except in you. I believed in your book which you sent down, and in your prophet whom you sent. If you die. Die according to nature, and make them the last thing you say.” Agreed upon. 1463- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that when the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would go to bed, he would say: “Praise be to God, who has fed us and given us drink, and sufficed and sheltered us. Of those who have no sufficiency or shelter.” Narrated by Muslim.

1464- On the authority of Hudhayfah, may God be pleased with him, that when the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, wanted to lie down, he would place his right hand under his cheek. Then he says: “Oh God, protect me from Your punishment on the day You resurrect Your servants.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and who said: A good hadith.

Abu Dawud narrated it from the narration of Hafsa, may God be pleased with her, in which he used to say it three times.
