قال اللَّه تعالى: { وقال ربكم ادعوني أستجب لكم } .

وقال تعالى: { ادعوا ربكم تضرعاً وخفية؛ إنه لا يحب المعتدين } .

وقال تعالى: { وإذا سألك عبادي عني فإني قريب؛ أجيب دعوة الداع إذا دعان } الآية.

وقال تعالى: { أمن يجيب المضطر إذا دعاه ويكشف السوء } الآية.

1465- وَعن النُّعْمانِ بْنِ بشيرٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُما ، عَنِ النَّبيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « الدُّعاءُ هوَ العِبَادةُ » . رواه أبو داود والترمذي وقالا حديث حسن صحيح .

1466- وعَنْ عَائِشَةَ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهَا ، قَالَتْ : كَان رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَسْتَحِبُّ الجوامِعَ مِنَ الدُّعاءِ ، ويَدَعُ ما سِوى ذلكَ . رَوَاه أَبو داود بإِسنادٍ جيِّد .

1467- وعَنْ أَنَسٍ رَضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، قَالَ : كانَ أَكْثَرُ دُعَاءِ النبيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « اللَّهُمَّ آتِنَا في الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً ، وفي الآخِرةِ حَسنَةً ، وَقِنَا عَذابَ النَّارِ » مُتَّفَقٌ عليهِ .

زاد مُسلِمٌ في رِوايتِهِ قَال :وكَانَ أَنَسٌ إِذا أَرَاد أَنْ يَدعُوَ بِدعوَةٍ دَعَا بها، وَإِذا أَرَادَ أَن يَدعُو بدُعَاءٍ دَعا بهَا فيه .

1468- وعَن ابنِ مسْعُودٍ رَضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَانَ يَقُولُ : « اللَّهُمَّ إِنِي أَسْأَلُكَ الهُدَى ، وَالتُّقَى ، وَالعفَافَ ، والغنَى » رواهُ مُسْلِمٌ .

1469- وعَنْ طارِقِ بنِ أَشْيَمَ ، رضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قالَ : كَانَ الرَّجلُ إِذا أَسْلَمَ عَلَّمَهُ النَّبيُّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم الصَّلاةَ ، ثُمَّ أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يَدعُوَ بهَؤُلاءِ الكَلِمَاتِ : « اللَّهُمَّ اغفِرْ لي ، وَارْحمْني ، واهْدِني ، وعافِني ، وارْزُقني » رواهُ مسلمٌ .

وفي رِوايَةٍ لَهُ عَنْ طارقٍ أَنَّهُ سَمِعَ النَّبِيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وَأَتاهُ رَجُلٌ ، فَقَالَ : يا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ . كيْفَ أَقُولُ حِينَ أَسْأَلُ رَبِّي ؟ قَالَ : « قُلْ : اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لي ، وَارْحَمْني ، وَعَافِني ، وَارْزُقني ، فَإِنَّ هَؤُلاءِ تَجْمَعُ لَكَ دُنْيَاكَ وَآخِرَتَكَ » .

1470- وَعَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بنِ عمرو بن العاصِ رضيَ اللَّه عنْهُمَا ، قَالَ : قَال رَسُولُ اللَّـهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « اللَّهُمَّ مُصَرِّفَ القُلُوبِ صرِّفْ قُلوبَنَا عَلَى طَاعَتِكَ » رَوَاهُ مُسْلِمٌ .

1471- وَعَنْ أَبي هُريَرةَ رَضيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، عن النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « تَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنْ جَهْدِ الْبَلاءِ ، وَدَرَكِ الشَّقَاءِ ، وَسُوءِ الْقَضَاءِ ، وَشَماتَةِ الأَعْدَاءِ » متفقٌ عليه .

وفي رِوَايةٍ : قالَ سُفْيَانُ : أَشُكُّ أَنِّي زِدْتُ وَاحِدَةً مِنها .

1472- وَعَنْهُ قَالَ : كَانَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقُولُ : « اللَّهمَّ أَصْلِحْ لي دِيني الَّذي هُوَ عِصْمَةُ أَمْرِي ، وأَصْلِحْ لِي دُنْيَايَ التي فِيهَا مَعَاشِي ، وَأَصْلِحْ لي آخِرَتي الَّتي فِيها معادي، وَاجْعلِ الحيَاةَ زِيادَةً لي في كُلِّ خَيْرٍ ، وَاجْعَلِ الموتَ راحَةً لي مِنْ كُلِّ شَرٍ » رَوَاهُ مسلِمٌ .

1473- وَعنْ علي رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَالَ : قال لي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « قُلْ : اللَّهُمَّ اهْدِني ، وَسدِّدْني » .

وَفي رِوَايةٍ : « اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْهُدى ، وَالسَّدَادَ » رواهُ مسلم .

1474- وَعَنْ أَنَسٍ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَالَ : كَانَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : يَقُولُ : اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّـي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْعجْزِ والكَسَلِ وَالجُبْنِ وَالهَرَمِ ، وَالْبُخْلِ ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ القبْرِ ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ المَحْيا وَالمَمَاتِ » .

وفي رِوايةٍ : « وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ » رَوَاهُ مُسْلِمٌ .

1475- وَعن أَبي بكْرٍ الصِّدِّيقِ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْه ، أَنَّه قَالَ لِرَسولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : عَلِّمني دُعَاءً أَدعُو بِهِ في صَلاتي ، قَالَ : قُلْ : اللَّهمَّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي ظُلْماً كثِيراً ، وَلا يَغْفِر الذُّنوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ ، فَاغْفِر لي مغْفِرَةً مِن عِنْدِكَ ، وَارحَمْني ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْغَفور الرَّحِيم » متَّفَقٌ عليهِ .

وفي رِوايةٍ : « وَفي بيْتي » وَرُوِي : « ظُلْماً كَثِيراً » وروِيَ « كَبِيراً » بِالثاءِ المثلثة وبِالباءِ الموحدة ، فَيَنْبغِي أَن يُجْمَعَ بَيْنَهُمَا ، فَيُقَالُ : كَثيراً كَبيراً .

1476- وَعَن أَبي موسَى رضَيَ اللَّه عَنْه ، عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم أَنَّه كَانَ يَدعُو بهَذا الدُّعَاءِ : «اللَّهمَّ اغْفِر لي خَطِيئَتي وجهْلي ، وإِسْرَافي في أَمْري ، وما أَنْتَ أَعلَم بِهِ مِنِّي ، اللَّهمَّ اغفِرْ لي جِدِّي وَهَزْلي ، وَخَطَئي وَعمْدِي ، وَكلُّ ذلِكَ عِنْدِي ، اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لي مَا قَدَّمْتُ وَمَا أَخَّرْتُ ، وَما أَسْررْتُ وَمَا أَعْلَنْتُ ، وَمَا أَنْتَ أَعْلَمُ بِهِ مِنِّي ، أَنْت المقَدِّمُ ، وَأَنْتَ المُؤَخِّرُ، وَأَنْتَ عَلى كلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ » متفقٌ عليه .

1477- وعنْ عَائِشَةَ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنهَا ، أَنَّ النَّبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَانَ يقُولُ في دُعَائِهِ : « اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ ما عمِلْتُ ومِنْ شَرِّ ما لَمْ أَعْمَلْ » .رَوَاهُ مُسْلِم .

1478- وعَنِ ابنِ عُمَر رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُما قَالَ : كانَ مِنْ دُعاءِ رسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم « اللَّهمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ زَوَالِ نِعْمَتِكَ ، وَتَحَوُّلِ عَافِيَتِكَ وَفُجاءَةِ نِقْمَتِكَ ، وَجميعِ سخَطِكَ » روَاهُ مُسْلِمٌ .

1479- وَعَنْ زَيْدِ بنِ أَرْقَم رضَي اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَالَ : كَانَ رَسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقَولُ : «اللهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ العَجْزِ وَالكَسَلِ ، والبُخْلِ وَالهَرم ، وعَذَاب الْقَبْر ، اللَّهُمَّ آتِ نَفْسِي تَقْوَاهَا ، وَزَكِّهَا أَنْتَ خَيرُ مَنْ زَكَّاهَا ، أَنْتَ ولِيُّهَا وَموْلاَهَا ، اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عِلمٍ لا يَنْفَعُ ، ومِنْ قَلْبٍ لاَ يخْشَعُ ، وَمِنْ نَفْسٍ لا تَشبَعُ ، ومِنْ دَعْوةٍ لا يُسْتجابُ لهَا » رواهُ مُسْلِمٌ .

1480- وَعنِ ابنِ عبَّاسٍ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُمَا ، أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَانَ يَقُولُ : « اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ ، وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ ، وعلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْتُ ، وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْتُ وَبِكَ خَاصَمْتُ ، وإِلَيْكَ حَاكَمْتُ . فاغْفِرْ لي ما قَدَّمْتُ ، وما أَخَّرْتُ ، وَمَا أَسْررْتُ ومَا أَعلَنْتُ ، أَنْتَ المُقَدِّمُ ، وَأَنْتَ المُؤَخِّرُ ، لا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ » .

زادَ بعْضُ الرُّوَاةِ : « ولا حَولَ ولا قوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ » متفَقُ عليهِ .

1481- وَعَن عَائِشَةَ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهَا ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَانَ يَدعو بهؤُلاءِ الكَلِمَاتِ : «اللَّهُمَّ إِني أَعوذُ بِكَ مِن فِتنةِ النَّارِ ، وعَذَابِ النَّارِ ، وَمِن شَرِّ الغِنَى وَالفَقْر » .

رَوَاهُ أَبو داوَد ، والترمذيُّ وقال : حديث حسن صحيح ، وهذا لفظُ أَبي داود .

1482- وعَن زيادِ بْن عِلاقَةَ عن عمِّه ، وهو قُطبَةُ بنُ مالِكٍ ، رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَال : كَانَ النَّبيُّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقُولُ : « اللَّهمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِن منْكَرَاتِ الأَخلاقِ ، والأعْمَالِ والأَهْواءِ » رواهُ الترمذي وقال : حديثُ حَسَنٌ .

1483- وعَن شكَلِ بنِ حُمَيْدٍ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ قَال : قُلْتُ يا رَسولَ اللَّهِ : عَلِّمْني دُعاءً. قَالَ : « قُلْ : اللَّهُمَّ إِني أعوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ سَمْعِي ، وَمِن شَرِّ بصَرِي ، وَمِن شَرِّ لسَاني ، وَمِن شَرِّ قَلبي ، وَمِن شَرِّ منِيِّي » رواهُ أبو داودَ ، والترمذيُّ وقالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1484- وَعَن أَنسٍ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَانَ يَقُولُ : « اللَّهمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوُذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبرَصِ ، وَالجُنُونِ ، والجُذَامِ ، وسّيءِ الأَسْقامِ » رَوَاهُ أَبو داود بإِسنادٍ صحيحٍ .

1485- وعَنْ أَبي هُرَيْرَةَ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَالَ : كانَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَقولُ : اللَّهمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الجُوعِ ، فإِنَّهُ بِئْسَ الضَّجيعُ ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ من الخِيانَةِ ، فَإِنَّهَا بئْسَتِ البِطانَةُ » .رواهُ أبو داودَ بإِسنادٍ صحيحٍ .

1486- وَعن عليٍّ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، أَنَّ مُكَاتَباً جاءهُ ، فَقَالَ إِني عجزتُ عَن كتابتي . فَأَعِنِّي . قالَ : أَلا أُعَلِّمُكَ كَلِماتٍ عَلَّمَنيهنَّ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم لَو كانَ عَلَيْكَ مِثْلُ جبلٍ دَيْناً أَدَّاهُ اللَّهُ عنْكَ ؟ قُلْ : « اللَّهمَّ اكْفِني بحلالِكَ عَن حَرَامِكَ ، وَاغْنِني بِفَضلِكَ عَمَّن سِوَاكَ».رواهُ الترمذيُّ وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1487- وعَنْ عِمْرانَ بنِ الحُصينِ رَضي اللَّه عنْهُمَا ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم علَّم أَباهُ حُصيْناً كَلِمتَيْنِ يدعُو بهما : « اللَّهُمَّ أَلهِمْني رُشْدِي ، وأَعِذني مِن شَرِّ نفسي » . رواهُ الترمذيُّ وقَالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1488- وَعَن أَبي الفَضلِ العبَّاسِ بنِ عَبْدِ المُطَّلِبِ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ ، قال : قُلْتُ يارسول اللَّهِ : عَلِّمْني شَيْئاً أَسْأَلُهُ اللَّه تَعَالى ، قَالَ : « سَلُوا اللَّه العافِيةَ » . فَمكَثْتُ أَيَّاماً، ثُمَّ جِئتُ فَقُلْتُ : يا رسولَ اللَّه : علِّمْني شَيْئاً أَسْأَلُهُ اللَّه تعالى ، قَالَ لي : « يَا عبَّاسُ يا عمَّ رَسولِ اللَّهِ ، سَلُوا اللَّه العافيةَ في الدُّنْيا والآخِرةِ » .رَواهُ الترمذيُّ وقَالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ صَحيحٌ .

1489- وعنْ شَهْرِ بْنِ حوشَبٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لأُمِّ سَلَمَةَ ، رَضِي اللَّه عَنْهَا ، يا أُمَّ المؤمِنِين مَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُ دُعَاءِ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إِذا كانَ عِنْدكِ ؟ قَالَتْ : كانَ أَكْثَرُ دُعائِهِ : « يا مُقلبَ القُلوبِ ثَبِّتْ قلْبي علَى دِينِكَ » رَواهُ الترمذيُّ ، وقال حَديثٌ حسنٌ .

1490- وعن أبي الدَّرداءِ رَضيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَالَ : قَالَ رَسولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « كانَ مِن دُعاءِ دَاوُدَ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « اللَّهمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ حُبَّكَ ، وَحُبَّ من يُحِبُّكَ ، وَالعمَل الذي يُبَلِّغُني حُبَّكَ اللَّهُمَّ اجْعل حُبَّكَ أَحَبَّ إِلَيَّ مِن نَفسي ، وأَهْلي ، ومِن الماءِ البارد » روَاهُ الترمذيُّ وَقَالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1491- وعن أَنَسٍ رضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَالَ : قال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « أَلِظُّوا بِياذا الجَلالِ وَالإِكرامِ » .رواه الترمذي وروَاهُ النَّسَائيُّ مِن رِوايةِ ربيعةَ بنِ عامِرٍ الصَّحابيِّ . قَالَ الحاكم : حديثٌ صحيحُ الإِسْنَادِ .

« أَلِظُّوا » بكسر الَّلام وتشديد الظاءِ المعجمةِ معْنَاه : الْزَمُوا هذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ وأَكْثِرُوا مِنها .

1492- وعن أَبي أُمامةَ رضيَ اللَّه عنْهُ قَالَ : دَعا رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم بِدُعَاءٍ كَثيرٍ ، لم نَحْفَظْ مِنْهُ شَيْئاً ، قُلْنا يا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ دعوت بِدُعاءٍ كَثِيرٍ لم نَحْفَظ منْهُ شَيْئاً ، فقَالَ : « أَلا أَدُلُّكُم على ما يَجْمَعُ ذَلكَ كُلَّهُ ؟ تَقُولُ : « اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُك مِن خَيرِ ما سأَلَكَ مِنْهُ نبيُّكَ مُحَمَّدٌ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، وأَعُوذُ بِكَ من شَرِّ ما اسْتَعاذَ مِنْهُ نَبيُّكَ مُحمَّدٌ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، وَأَنْتَ المُسْتَعَانُ ، وعليْكَ البلاغُ ، ولا حَوْلَ ولا قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ » رواهُ الترمذيُّ وقَالَ : حديثٌ حَسَنٌ .
1493- وَعَن ابْنِ مسْعُودٍ ، رضِيَ اللَّه عنْهُ ، قَالَ : كَانَ مِن دُعَاء رَسُولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مُوجِباتِ رحْمتِكَ ، وَعزَائمَ مغفِرتِكَ ، والسَّلامَةَ مِن كُلِّ إِثمٍ ، والغَنِيمَةَ مِن كُلِّ بِرٍ ، وَالفَوْزَ بالجَنَّةِ ، وَالنَّجاةَ مِنَ النَّارِ » .

رواهُ الحاكِم أبو عبد اللَّهِ ، وقال : حديثٌ صحيحٌ على شرط مسلِمٍ .

			 				 	

باب فضل الدُّعاء بظهر الغيب

قال اللَّه تعالى: { والذين جاءوا من بعدهم يقولون ربنا اغفر لنا ولإخواننا الذين سبقونا بالإيمان } .

وقال تعالى: { واستغفر لذنبك وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات } .

وقال تعالى إخباراً عن إبراهيم صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيهِ وَسَلَّم: { ربنا اغفر لي ولوالدي وللمؤمنين يوم يقوم الحساب } .

1494- وَعَن أَبي الدَّردَاءِ رَضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّهُ سمِعَ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَقُولُ : « ما مِن عبْدٍ مُسْلِمٍ يَدعُو لأَخِيهِ بِظَهرِ الغَيْبِ إِلاَّ قَالَ المَلكُ ولَكَ بمِثْلٍ » رواه مسلم .

1495- وعَنْهُ أَنَّ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كانَ يقُولُ : « دَعْوةُ المرءِ المُسْلِمِ لأَخيهِ بِظَهْرِ الغَيْبِ مُسْتَجَابةٌ ، عِنْد رأْسِهِ ملَكٌ مُوكَّلٌ كلَّمَا دعا لأَخِيهِ بخيرٍ قَال المَلَكُ المُوكَّلُ بِهِ : آمِينَ ، ولَكَ بمِثْلٍ » رواه مسلم .

			 				 	

باب في مسائل من الدعاء

1496- عنْ أُسامَةَ بْنِ زيْدٍ رضِيَ اللَّه عنْهُما قالَ : قالَ رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَنْ صُنِعَ إَلَيْهِ معْرُوفٌ ، فقالَ لِفَاعِلِهِ : جزَاك اللَّه خَيْراً ، فَقَد أَبْلَغَ في الثَّنَاءِ » .

رواه الترمذي وقَالَ : حَدِيثٌ حسنٌ صَحِيحٌ .

1497- وَعَن جَابرٍ رَضِيَ اللَّه عَنْه قال : قَال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لا تَدعُوا عَلى أَنْفُسِكُم ، وَلا تدْعُوا عَلى أَولادِكُم ، ولا تَدْعُوا على أَمْوَالِكُم ، لا تُوافِقُوا مِنَ اللَّهِ ساعة يُسأَلُ فِيهَا عَطاءً ، فيَسْتَجيبَ لَكُم » رواه مسلم .

1498- وعن أَبي هُريرةَ رضي اللَّه عنهُ أَنَّ رَسولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « أَقْرَبُ ما يَكُونُ العَبْدُ مِن ربِّهِ وَهُوَ سَاجِدٌ ، فَأَكْثِرُوا الدُّعَاءَ » رواه مسلم .

1499- وَعَنْهُ أَنَّ رَسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : يُسْتجَابُ لأَحَدِكُم ما لَم يعْجلْ : يقُولُ قَد دَعوتُ رَبِّي ، فَلم يسْتَجبْ لي » . متفقٌ عليه .

وفي رِوَايَةٍ لمُسْلِمٍ : « لا يزَالُ يُسْتَجَابُ لِلعَبْدِ مَا لَم يدعُ بإِثمٍ ، أَوْ قَطِيعةِ رَحِمٍ ، ما لَمْ يَسْتعْجِلْ » قِيلَ : يا رسُولَ اللَّهِ مَا الاسْتِعْجَالُ ؟ قَالَ : « يَقُولُ : قَدْ دعَوْتُ ، وَقَدْ دَعَوْتُ فَلَم أَرَ يَسْتَجِيبُ لي ، فَيَسْتَحْسِرُ عِنْد ذلك ، ويَدَعُ الدُّعَاءَ » .

1500- وَعَنْ أَبي أُمامَةَ رَضيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ قَالَ : قِيلَ لِرَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : أَيُّ الدُّعَاءِ أَسْمعُ؟ قَالَ : « جوْفَ اللَّيْلِ الآخِرِ ، وَدُبُرَ الصَّلَوَاتِ المكْتُوباتِ » رواه الترمذي وقالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1501- وَعَنْ عُبَادَةَ بْنِ الصَّامِتِ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « مَا عَلى الأَرْضِ مُسْلِمٌ يَدْعُو اللَّه تَعالى بِدَعْوَةٍ إِلاَّ آتَاهُ اللَّه إِيَّاهَا ، أَوْ صَرَف عنْهُ مِنَ السُّوءِ مِثْلَهَا . ما لَم يدْعُ بإِثْم ، أَوْ قَطِيعَةِ رحِمٍ » فَقَالَ رَجُلٌ مِنَ القَوْمِ : إِذاً نُكْثِرُ . قَالَ : « اللَّه أَكْثَرُ».

رواه الترمذي وقال حَدِيثٌ حَسنٌ صَحِيحٌ : وَرَواهُ الحاكِمُ مِنْ رِوايةِ أَبي سعيِدٍ وَزَاد فِيهِ: « أَوْ يَدَّخر لهُ مِنَ الأَجْرِ مِثْلَها » .

1502- وعَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُما أَنَّ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم كَان يقُولُ عِنْد الكرْبِ : « لا إِلَه إِلاَّ اللَّه العظِيمُ الحلِيمُ ، لا إِله إِلاَّ اللَّه رَبُّ العَرْشِ العظِيمِ ، لا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّه رَبُّ السمَواتِ ، وربُّ الأَرْض ، ورَبُّ العرشِ الكريمِ » متفقٌ عليه .

			 				 	

باب كرامات الأولياء وفضلهم

قال اللَّه تعالى: { ألا إن أولياء اللَّه لا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون، الذين آمنوا وكانوا يتقون، لهم البشرى في الحياة الدنيا وفي الآخرة، لا تبديل لكلمات اللَّه؛ ذلك هو الفوز العظيم } .

وقال تعالى: { وهزي إليك بجذع النخلة تساقط عليك رطباً جنياً فكلي واشربي } الآية.

وقال تعالى: { كلما دخل عليها زكريا المحراب وجد عندها رزقاً، قال: يا مريم أني لك هذا؟ قالت هو من عند اللَّه؛ إن اللَّه يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب } .

وقال تعالى: { وإذ اعتزلتموهم وما يعبدون إلا اللَّه فأووا إلى الكهف ينشر لكم ربكم من رحمته ويهيِّء لكم من أمركم مرفقاً، وترى الشمس إذا طلعت تزاور عن كهفهم ذات اليمين وإذا غربت تقرضهم ذات الشمال } الآية.

1503- وعنْ أبي مُحَمَّدٍ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمن بنِ أبي بكر الصِّدِّيقِ رضي اللَّه عنْهُما أنَّ أصْحاب الصُّفَّةِ كانُوا أُنَاساً فُقَرَاءَ وأنَّ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ مرَّةً « منْ كانَ عِنْدَهُ طَعامُ اثنَينِ ، فَلْيذْهَبْ بِثَالث ، ومَنْ كَانَ عِنْدهُ طعامُ أرْبَعَةٍ ، فَلْيَذْهَبْ بخَامِسٍ وبِسَادِسٍ » أوْ كَما قَالَ ، وأنَّ أبَا بَكْرٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ جاءَ بثَلاثَةٍ ، وَانْطَلَقَ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم بِعَشرَةٍ ، وَأنَّ أبَا بَكْرٍ تَعَشَّى عِنْد النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، ثُّمَّ لَبِثَ حَتَّى صلَّى العِشَاءَ ، ثُمَّ رَجَعَ ، فَجَاءَ بَعْدَ ما مَضَى من اللَّيلِ مَا شاءَ اللَّه . قَالَتْ امْرَأَتُهُ : ما حبسَكَ عَنْ أضْيافِكَ ؟ قَالَ : أوَ ما عَشَّيتِهمْ ؟ قَالَتْ : أبوْا حَتَّى تَجِيءَ وَقدْ عرَضُوا عَلَيْهِم قَال : فَذَهَبْتُ أنَا ، فَاختبأْتُ ، فَقَالَ : يَا غُنْثَرُ ، فجدَّعَ وَسَبَّ وَقَالَ : كُلُوا هَنِيئاً ، واللَّه لا أَطْعمُهُ أبَداًِ ، قال : وايمُ اللَّهِ ما كُنَّا نَأْخذُ منْ لُقْمةٍ إلاَّ ربا مِنْ أَسْفَلِهَا أكْثَرُ مِنْهَا حتَّى شَبِعُوا ، وصَارَتْ أكثَرَ مِمَّا كَانَتْ قَبْلَ ذلكَ ، فَنَظَرَ إلَيْهَا أبُو بكْرٍ فَقَال لا مْرَأَتِهِ : يَا أُخْتَ بني فِرَاسٍ مَا هَذا ؟ قَالَتْ : لا وَقُرّةِ عَيني لهي الآنَ أَكثَرُ مِنْهَا قَبْلَ ذَلكَ بِثَلاثِ مرَّاتٍ ، فَأَكَل مِنْهَا أبُو بكْرٍ وَقَال : إنَّمَا كَانَ ذلكَ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ ، يَعني يَمينَهُ ، ثُمَّ أَكَلَ مِنهَا لٍقمةً ، ثُمَّ حَمَلَهَا إلى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَأَصْبَحَت عِنْدَهُ . وكانَ بَيْننَا وبَيْنَ قَومٍ عهْدٌ ، فَمَضَى الأجَلُ ، فَتَفَرَّقنَا اثني عشَرَ رَجُلاً ، مَعَ كُلِّ رَجُلٍ مِنْهُم أُنَاسٌ ، اللَّه أعْلَم كَمْ مَعَ كُلِّ رَجُلٍ فَأَكَلُوا مِنْهَا أَجْمَعُونَ .

وفي روايَة : فَحَلَفَ أبُو بَكْرٍ لا يَطْعمُه ، فَحَلَفَتِ المرأَةُ لا تَطْعِمَه ، فَحَلَفَ الضِّيفُ ­ أوِ الأَضْيَافُ ­ أن لا يَطعَمَه ، أوْ يطعَمُوه حَتَّى يَطعَمه ، فَقَالَ أبُو بَكْرٍ : هذِهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ ، فَدَعا بالطَّعامِ فَأَكَلَ وَأَكَلُوا ، فَجَعَلُوا لا يَرْفَعُونَ لُقْمَةً إلاَّ ربَتْ مِنْ أَسْفَلِهَا أَكْثَرَ مِنْهَا ، فَقَال: يَا أُخْتَ بَني فِرَاس ، ما هَذا ؟ فَقالَتْ : وَقُرَّةِ عَيْني إنهَا الآنَ لأَكْثَرُ مِنْهَا قَبْلَ أنْ نَأْكُلَ ، فَأَكَلُوا ، وبَعَثَ بهَا إلى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فذَكَرَ أَنَّه أَكَلَ مِنهَا .

وفي روايةٍ : إنَّ أبَا بَكْرٍ قَالَ لِعَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ : دُونَكَ أَضْيافَكَ ، فَإنِّي مُنْطَلِقٌ إلى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، فَافْرُغْ مِنْ قِراهُم قَبْلَ أنْ أجِيءَ ، فَانْطَلَقَ عبْدُ الرَّحمَن ، فَأَتَاهم بمَا عِنْدهُ . فَقَال : اطْعَمُوا ، فقَالُوا : أيْنَ رَبُّ مَنزِلَنَا ؟ قال : اطعموا ، قَالُوا : مَا نَحْنُ بآكِلِين حتَى يَجِيىء ربُ مَنْزِلَنا ، قَال : اقْبَلُوا عَنَّا قِرَاكُم ، فإنَّه إنْ جَاءَ ولَمْ تَطْعَمُوا لَنَلقَيَنَّ مِنْهُ ، فَأَبَوْا ، فَعَرَفْتُ أنَّه يَجِد عَلَيَّ ، فَلَمَّا جاءَ تَنَحَّيْتُ عَنْهُ ، فَقالَ : ماصنعتم ؟ فأَخْبَروهُ ، فقالَ يَا عَبْدَ الرَّحمَنِ فَسَكَتُّ ثم قال : يا عبد الرحمن. فسكت ، فَقَالَ : يا غُنثَرُ أَقْسَمْتُ عَلَيْكَ إن كُنْتَ تَسمَعُ صوتي لما جِئْتَ ، فَخَرَجتُ ، فَقُلْتُ : سلْ أَضْيَافِكَ ، فَقَالُوا : صَدقَ ، أتَانَا بِهِ . فَقَالَ: إنَّمَا انْتَظَرْتُموني وَاللَّه لا أَطعَمُه اللَّيْلَةَ ، فَقالَ الآخَرون : وَاللَّهِ لا نَطعَمُه حَتَّى تَطعمه ، فَقَالَ : وَيْلَكُم مَالَكُمْ لا تَقْبَلُونَ عنَّا قِرَاكُم ؟ هَاتِ طَعَامَكَ ، فَجاءَ بِهِ ، فَوَضَعَ يَدَه ، فَقَالَ: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ ، الأولى مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ فَأَكَلَ وَأَكَلُوا . متفقٌ عليه .

قوله : « غُنْثَر » بغين معجمةٍ مضمومةٍ ، ثم نونٍ ساكِنةٍ ، ثُمَّ ثاءٍ مثلثةٍ وهو : الغَبيُّ الجَاهٍلُ ، وقوله : « فجدَّع » أي شَتَمه وَالجَدْع : القَطع . قوله : « يجِدُ عليَّ » هو بكسر الجيمِ ، أيْ : يَغْضَبُ .

1504- وعنْ أبي هُرَيْرَة رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قَالَ : قال رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لَقَدْ كَان فِيما قَبْلَكُمْ مِنَ الأُممِ نَاسٌ محدَّثونَ ، فإن يَكُ في أُمَّتي أَحَدٌ ، فإنَّهُ عُمَرُ » رواه البخاري ، ورواه مسلم من روايةِ عائشةَ ، وفي رِوايتِهما قالَ ابنُ وَهْبٍ : « محدَّثُونَ » أَي : مُلهَمُون.

1505- وعنْ جَابِر بن سمُرَةَ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُمَا . قَالَ : شَكَا أهْلُ الكُوفَةِ سَعْداً ، يَعْنِي : ابْنِ أبي وَقَّاصٍ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ ، إلى عُمَرَ بنِ الخَطَّابِ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ ، فَعزَلَه وَاسْتَعْمَلَ عَلَيْهِمْ عمَّاراً ، فَشَكَوْا حَتَّى ذكَرُوا أَنَّهُ لا يُحْسِنُ يُصَلِّي ، فَأْرسَلَ إلَيْهِ ، فَقَالَ: ياأَبا إسْحاقَ ، إنَّ هؤُلاءِ يزْعُمُونَ أنَّكَ لا تُحْسِنُ تُصَلِّي. فَقَالَ : أمَّا أَنَا واللَّهِ فَإنِّي كُنْتُ أُصَلِّي بِهمْ صَلاةَ رَسُولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم لا أَخْرِمُ عَنْهَا أُصَلِّي صَلاةَ العِشَاءِ فَأَرْكُدُ في الأُولَيَيَنِ ، وَأُخِفُّ في الأُخْرَييْنِ ، قال : ذَلِكَ الظَنُّ بكَ يَا أبَا إسْحاقَ ، وأَرسلَ مَعَهُ رَجُلاً ­ أَوْ رجَالاً ­ إلَى الكُوفَةِ يَسْأَلُ عَنْهُ أَهْلَ الكُوفَةِ ، فَلَمْ يَدَعْ مَسْجِداً إلاَّ سَأَلَ عَنْهُ ، وَيُثْنُونَ مَعْرُوفاً، حَتَّى دَخَلَ مَسْجِداً لِبَني عَبْسٍ ، فَقَامَ رَجُلٌ مِنْهُمْ ، يُقَالُ لَهُ أُسامةُ بنُ قَتَادَةَ ، يُكَنَّى أبا سَعْدَةَ، فَقَالَ : أَمَا إذْ نَشَدْتَنَا فَإنَّ سَعْداً كانَ لا يسِيرُ بِالسَّرِيّةِ ولا يَقْسِمُ بِالسَّويَّةِ ، وَلا يعْدِلُ في القَضِيَّةِ ، قَالَ سعْدٌ : أَمَا وَاللَّهِ لأدْعُوَنَّ بِثَلاثٍ : اللَّهُمَّ إنْ كَانَ عبْدكَ هذا كَاذِباً ، قَام رِيَآءً ، وسُمْعَةً ، فَأَطِلْ عُمُرَهُ ، وَأَطِلْ فَقْرَهُ ، وَعَرِّضْهُ للفِتَنِ ، وَكَانَ بَعْدَ ذلكَ إذا سُئِلَ يَقُولُ : شَيْخٌ كَبِيرٌ مَفْتُون ، أصَابتْني دَعْوةُ سعْدٍ .

قَالَ عَبْدُ الملِكِ بنُ عُميْرٍ الرَّاوِي عنْ جَابرِ بنِ سَمُرَةَ فَأَنا رَأَيْتُهُ بَعْدَ قَدْ سَقَط حَاجِبَاهُ عَلى عيْنيْهِ مِنَ الكِبَرِ ، وَإنَّهُ لَيَتَعَرَّضُ للجوارِي في الطُّرقِ فَيغْمِزُهُنَّ . متفقٌ عليهِ .

1506- وعنْ عُرْوَةَ بن الزُّبيْر أنَّ سعِيدَ بنَ زَيْدٍِ بْنِ عمْرو بْنِ نُفَيْلِ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ خَاصَمتْهُ أرْوَى بِنْتُ أوْسٍ إلى مَرْوَانَ بْنِ الحَكَم ، وَادَّعَتْ أنَّهُ أَخَذَ شَيْئاً مِنْ أرْضِهَا ، فَقَالَ سَعِيدٌ : أنَا كُنْتُ آخُذُ مِنْ أرْضِها شَيْئاً بعْدَ الذي سمِعْتُ مِنْ رَسُولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ،؟ قَالَ : مَاذا سمِعْتَ مِنْ رَسُولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ؟ قَالَ : سَمِعْتُ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقُولُ : « مَنْ أَخَذَ شِبْراً مِنَ الأرْضِ ظُلْماً ، طُوِّقَهُ إلى سبْعِ أرضينَ » فَقَالَ لَهُ مرْوَانٌ : لا أسْأَلُكَ بَيِّنَةً بعْد هذا ، فَقَال سعيدٌ : اللَّهُمَّ إنْ كانَتْ كاذبِةً ، فَأَعْمِ بصرهَا ، وَاقْتُلْهَا في أرْضِهَا ، قَالَ : فَمَا ماتَتْ حَتَّى ذَهَبَ بَصَرُهَا ، وبيْنَما هِي تمْشي في أرْضِهَا إذ وَقَعَتْ في حُفْرةٍ فَمَاتتْ . متفقٌ عليه .

وفي روايةٍ لمسلِمٍ عنْ مُحمَّدِ بن زَيْد بن عبد اللَّه بن عُمَر بمَعْنَاهُ وأَنَّهُ رآهَا عَمْياءَ تَلْتَمِسُ الجُدُرَ تَقُولُ : أصَابَتْني دعْوَةُ سعًيدٍ ، وَأَنَّها مرَّتْ عَلى بِئْرٍ في الدَّارِ التي خَاصَمَتْهُ فِيهَا ، فَوقَعتْ فِيها ، وَكانَتْ قَبْرهَا .

1507- وَعَنْ جَابِرِ بنِ عبْدِ اللَّهِ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُما قَال : لمَّا حَضَرَتْ أُحُدٌ دَعاني أبي مِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَقَال : مَا أُرَاني إلاَّ مَقْتُولا في أوَّل مَنْ يُقْتَلُ مِنْ أصْحابِ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، وَإنِّي لا أَتْرُكُ بعْدِي أعزَّ عَلَيَّ مِنْكَ غَيْرِ نَفْسِ رسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، وإنَّ علَيَّ دَيْناً فَاقْضِ ، واسْتَوْصِ بِأَخَوَاتِكَ خَيْراً : فأَصْبَحْنَا ، فَكَانَ أوَّل قَتِيلٍ ، ودَفَنْتُ مَعهُ آخَرَ في قَبْرِهِ ، ثُمَّ لَمْ تَطِبْ نفسي أنْ أتْرُكهُ مع آخَرَ ، فَاسْتَخْرَجته بعْدَ سِتَّةِ أشْهُرٍ ، فَإذا هُو كَيَوْمِ وَضَعْتُهُ غَيْر أُذُنِهِ ، فَجَعَلتُهُ في قَبْرٍ عَلى حٍدَةٍ . رواه البخاري .

1508- وَعَنْ أنَسٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أنَّ رَجُلَيْنِ مِنْ أصْحابِ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم خَرَجا مِنْ عِنْدِ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم في لَيْلَةٍ مُظْلِمَةَ ومَعهُمَا مِثْلُ المِصْبَاحَينِ بيْنَ أيديهِما ، فَلَمَّا افتَرَقَا ، صارَ مَعَ كلِّ واحِدٍ مِنهما وَاحِدٌ حَتى أتَى أهْلَهُ .

رواه البخاري مِنْ طرُقٍ ، وفي بعْضِها أنَّ الرَّجُلَيْنِ أُسيْدُ بنُ حُضيرٍُ ، وعبَّادُ بنُ بِشْرٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُما .

1509- وعنْ أبي هُرَيْرةَ ، رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ ، قَال : بَعثَ رَسُولُ اللِّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم عَشَرَةَ رهْطٍ عَيْناً سَريَّةً ، وأمَّرَ عليْهِم عَاصِمَ بنَ ثابِتٍ الأنصاريَّ ، رضي اللَّه عنْهُ ، فَانطَلَقُوا حتَّى إذا كانُوا بالهَدْاةِ ، بيْنَ عُسْفانَ ومكَّةَ ، ذُكِرُوا لَحِيِّ منْ هُذَيْلٍ يُقالُ لهُمْ : بنُوا لِحيَانَ ، فَنَفَرُوا لهمْ بقَريب منْ مِائِةِ رجُلٍ رَامٍ فَاقْتَصُّوا آثَارَهُمْ ، فَلَمَّا أحَسَّ بهِمْ عاصِمٌ ؤَأصحابُهُ ، لجَأوا إلى مَوْضِعٍ ، فَأحاطَ بهمُ القَوْمُ ، فَقَالُوا انْزلوا ، فَأَعْطُوا بأيْدِيكُمْ ولكُم العَهْدُ والمِيثاقَ أنْ لا نَقْتُل مِنْكُم أحداً ، فَقَالَ عاصم بن ثابت : أيها القومُ ، أَمَّا أَنَا فلا أَنْزِلُ عَلَى ذِمةِ كَافرٍ . اللهمَّ أخْبِرْ عَنَّا نَبِيَّكَ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَرمَوْهُمْ بِالنَّبْلِ فَقَتَلُوا عَاصِماً ، ونَزَل إلَيْهِمْ ثَلاثَةُ نَفَرٍ على العهدِ والمِيثاقِ ، مِنْهُمْ خُبيْبٌ ، وزَيْدُ بنُ الدَّثِنِة ورَجُلٌ آخَرُ ، فَلَمَّا اسْتَمْكَنُوا مِنْهُمْ أطْلَقُوا أوْتَار قِسِيِّهمْ ، فرَبطُوهُمْ بِها ، قَال الرَّجلُ الثَّالِثُ : هذا أوَّلُ الغَدْرِ واللَّهِ لا أصحبُكمْ إنَّ لي بهؤلاءِ أُسْوةً ، يُريدُ القَتْلى ، فَجرُّوهُ وعالجوه ، فَأبي أنْ يَصْحبَهُمْ ، فَقَتَلُوهُ ، وانْطَلَقُوا بخُبَيْبٍ ، وَزيْدِ بنِ الدَّثِنَةِ ، حتى بَاعُوهُما بمكَّةَ بَعْد وَقْعةِ بدرٍ ، فَابتَاعَ بَنُو الحارِثِ ابنِ عامِرِ بن نوْفَلِ بنِ عَبْدِ مَنَافٍ خُبَيْباً ، وكانَ خُبَيبُ هُوَ قَتَل الحَارِثَ يَوْمَ بَدْرٍ ، فلَبِثَ خُبيْبٌ عِنْدهُم أسِيراً حَتى أجْمَعُوا على قَتْلِهِ ، فَاسْتَعارَ مِنْ بعْضِ بنَاتِ الحارِثِ مُوسَى يَسْتحِدُّ بهَا فَأَعَارَتْهُ ، فَدَرَجَ بُنَيُّ لهَا وَهِي غَافِلةٌ حَتى أَتَاهُ ، فَوَجَدْتُه مُجْلِسَهُ عَلى فَخذِهِ وَالمُوسَى بِيده ، فَفَزِعتْ فَزْعَةً عَرَفَهَا خُبَيْبٌ ، فَقَال : أتَخْشيْنَ أن أقْتُلَهُ ما كُنْتُ لأفْعل ذلكَ ، قَالَتْ : وَاللَّهِ ما رأيْتُ أسِيراً خَيْراً مِنْ خُبيبٍ ، فواللَّهِ لَقَدْ وَجدْتُهُ يوْماً يأَكُلُ قِطْفاً مِنْ عِنبٍ في يدِهِ ، وإنَّهُ لمُوثَقٌ بِالحديدِ وَما بمَكَّةَ مِنْ ثمَرَةٍ ، وَكَانَتْ تقُولُ: إنَّهُ لَرزقٌ رَزقَهُ اللَّه خُبَيباً ، فَلَمَّا خَرجُوا بِهِ مِنَ الحَرمِ لِيقْتُلُوهُ في الحِلِّ ، قَال لهُم خُبيبُ : دعُوني أُصلي ركعتَيْنِ ، فتَرَكُوهُ ، فَركعَ رَكْعَتَيْنِ، فقالَ : واللَّهِ لَوْلا أنْ تَحسَبُوا أنَّ مابي جزَعٌ لَزِدْتُ : اللَّهُمَّ أحْصِهمْ عدداً ، واقْتُلهمْ بَدَداً ، ولا تُبْقِ مِنْهُم أحداً . وقال:

فلَسْتُ أُبالي حينَ أُقْتلُ مُسْلِماً على أيِّ جنْبٍ كَانَ للَّهِ مصْرعِي

وذلِكَ في ذَاتِ الإلَهِ وإنْ يشَأْ يُبَارِكْ عَلَى أوْصالِ شِلْوٍ مُمَزَّعِ 

وكانَ خُبيْبٌ هُو سَنَّ لِكُلِّ مُسْلِمٍ قُتِلَ صبْراً الصَّلاةَ وأخْبَر ­ يعني النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم . أصْحَابهُ يوْمَ أُصِيبُوا خبرهُمْ ، وبعَثَ نَاسٌ مِنْ قُريْشٍ إلى عاصِم بن ثابتٍ حينَ حُدِّثُوا أنَّهُ قُتِل أنْ يُؤْتَوا بشَيءٍ مِنْهُ يُعْرفُ . وكَانَ قتَل رَجُلاً مِنْ عُظَمائِهِمْ ، فبَعثَ اللَّه لِعَاصِمٍ مِثْلَ الظُّلَّةِ مِنَ الدَّبْرِ ، فَحَمَتْهُ مِنْ رُسُلِهِمْ ، فَلَمْ يقْدِرُوا أنْ يَقْطَعُوا مِنهُ شَيْئاً . رواه البخاري .

قولُهُ : الهَدْاَةُ : مَوْضِعٌ ، وَالظُّلَّةُ : السحاب ، والدَّبْرُ : النَّحْلُ . وقَوْلُهُ : « اقْتُلْهُمْ بِدَداً » بِكسرِ الباءِ وفتحهَا ، فمن كسر ، قال هو جمعٍ بِدَّةٍ بكسر الباءِ ، وهو النصِيب ، ومعناه اقْتُلْهُـمْ حِصَصاً مُنْقَسِمَةً لِكلِّ واحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ نصيبٌ ، ومن فَتَح ، قَالَ : مَعْنَاهُ : مُتَفَرِّقِينَ في القَتْلِ واحِداً بَعْدَ وَاحِد مِنَ التّبْدِيدِ .

وفي الباب أحاديثٌ كَثِيرَةٌ صحِيحَةُ سبقت في مواضِعها مِنْ هذا الكتاب مِنها حديثُ الغُلام الذي كانَ يأتي الرَّاهِبَ والسَّاحِرَ ومِنْهَا حَديثُ جُرَيجٍ ، وحديثُ أصحَابِ الغار الذين أَطْبقَتْ علَيْهمُ الصَّخْرةُ ، وحديثُ الرَّجُلِ الذي سَمِعَ صَوتاً في السَّحاب يقولُ : اسْقِ حدِيقة فلانٍ ، وغيرُ ذلك والدَّلائِلُ في الباب كثيرةٌ مَشْهُورةٌ ، وبِاللَّهِ التَّوْفِيقُ .

1510- وعَن ابْنِ عُمر رضي اللَّه عنْهُما قال : ما سمِعْتُ عُمرَ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ يَقُولُ لِشَيءٍ قطُّ : إنِّي لأظُنَّهُ كَذا إلاَّ كَانَ كَمَا يَظُنُّ ، رواهُ البُخَاري .
label-en:
Chapter on the virtue of supplication

God Almighty said: {And your Lord said: Call upon Me, I will respond to you}.

And God Almighty said: {Call upon your Lord in humility and in secret; He does not like aggressors.

And the Almighty said: {And when My servants ask you about Me, then I am near; I respond to the call of the supplicant when he calls upon me} the verse.

And God Almighty said: {Who responds to the distressed person when he calls upon him and removes evil?} The verse.

1465- On the authority of Al-Nu’man bin Bashir, may God be pleased with them both, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, who said: “Supplication is worship.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it was a good and authentic hadith.

1466- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, considered it desirable to perform prayers in congregational prayers, and he abandoned anything else. Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of transmission.

1467- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The most frequent supplication of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was: “O God, give us good in this world, and good in the Hereafter, and protect us from the torment of the Fire.” Agreed upon. Muslim added in his narration, saying: If Anas wanted to say a supplication, he would say it, and if he wanted to say a supplication, he would say it in it.

1468- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to say: “O God, I ask You for guidance, piety, chastity, and wealth.” Narrated by Muslim. 1469- On the authority of Tariq bin Ashaym, may God be pleased with him, he said: When a man converted to Islam, the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, taught him the prayer, then ordered him to call for these people. The words: “O God, forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, keep me well, and provide for me.” Narrated by Muslim.

In his narration on the authority of Tariq, he heard the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and a man came to him and said: O Messenger of God. How do I say when I ask my Lord? He said: “Say: O God, forgive me, have mercy on me, keep me safe, and provide for me, for these will bring together your world and the hereafter.”

1470- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “O God, the Converter of Hearts, direct our hearts to obey You.” Narrated by Muslim. 1471- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Seek refuge in God from the endurance of affliction, the enduring misery, and the evil of Judgment, and the gloating of enemies.” Agreed upon.

In a narration: Sufyan said: I doubt that I added one of them. 1472- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to say: “O God, make right for me my religion, which is the protection of my affairs, and make right for me my world that is in it.” My livelihood, and make good for me my hereafter in which is my return, and make life an addition to all goodness for me, and make death a relief for me from all evil.” Narrated by Muslim.

1473- On the authority of Ali, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said to me: “Say: O God, guide me and guide me.” In a narration: “O God, I ask you for guidance and payment,” narrated by Muslim.

1474- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to say: O God, I seek refuge in You from inability, laziness, and cowardice. And senility, and miserliness, and I seek refuge in You from the torment of the grave, and I seek refuge in You from the trials of life and death.”

In a narration: “And the rib of debt and the predominance of men,” narrated by Muslim. 1475- On the authority of Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may God be pleased with him, that he said to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace: Teach me a supplication that I may pray with in my prayers. He said: Say: Oh God, I have been wronged. I have wronged myself greatly, and no one can forgive sins except You, so forgive me with Your forgiveness, and have mercy on me. Indeed, You are the Forgiving, the Merciful. Agreed upon. In one narration: “And in my house” and it was narrated: “a great deal of injustice” and it was narrated “a great deal” with the triple tha’ and the unified ba, so they should be combined, so it is said: a great deal.

1476- On the authority of Abu Musa, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, that he used to pray with this supplication: “O God, forgive me my sin and my ignorance, and my extravagance in my affairs, and what you I know it better than I do. O God, forgive me for my seriousness and my jest, my mistake and my intentionality, and all of that with me. Oh God, forgive me for what I have done and what I have delayed, and what I have concealed and what I have announced, and what You know better than me. You are the one who brings forward, and you are the one who delays, and you He has power over all things.” Agreed upon.

1477- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to say in his supplication: “O God, I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done and from the evil of what I have not done.” “Narrated by Muslim. 1478- On the authority of Ibn Umar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: One of the supplications of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was: “O God, I seek refuge in You from the disappearance of Your grace.” Your well-being, the suddenness of your vengeance, and all your anger.” Narrated by Muslim. 1479- On the authority of Zayd bin Arqam, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to say: “O God, I seek refuge in You from inability and laziness. And stinginess and senility, and the torment of the grave. Oh God, give my soul its strength, and purify it. You are the best of those who purify it. You are its guardian and protector. Oh God, I I seek refuge in You from knowledge that is not beneficial, from a heart that is not humble, from a soul that is not satisfied, and from a supplication that is not answered.” Narrated by Muslim. 1480- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to say: “O God, I have submitted to You, and in You I have believed, and upon You I put my trust, and to you I turn, and in you I dispute, and to you I judge. So forgive me for what I have put forward, and what I have delayed, and what I have concealed and what I have announced. You are the one who brings forward, and you are the one who delays, there is no god but You.”

Some narrators added: “There is no power nor strength except in God.” Agreed upon. 1481- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to pray with these words: “O God, I seek refuge in You from the temptation of Hell and the torment of Hell.” Fire, and from the evil of wealth and poverty.

Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good and authentic hadith, and this is the wording of Abu Dawud. 1482- On the authority of Ziyad bin Ulaqah, on the authority of his uncle, Qutbah bin Malik, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, used to say: “O God, I seek refuge in You from evils.” Morals, deeds and desires.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

1483- On the authority of Shikal bin Humaid, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of God: Teach me a supplication. He said: “Say: O God, I seek refuge in You from the evil of my hearing, from the evil of my sight, from the evil of my tongue, from the evil of my heart, and from the evil of my semen.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith.

1484- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to say: “O God, I seek refuge in You from leprosy, madness, leprosy, and bad Illnesses” Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission. 1485- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to say: O God, I seek refuge in You from hunger, for it is miserable to sleep. I seek refuge in You from betrayal, for it is a wretched trait.” Narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of transmission.

1486- On the authority of Ali, may God be pleased with him, that a letter came to him and he said that I was unable to write it. So I mean. He said: Shall I not teach you words that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, taught me, even if you owed a debt like a mountain that God paid on your behalf? Say: “O God, protect me from what is forbidden with your lawful deeds, and enrich me with your grace from those other than you.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: a good hadith.

1487- On the authority of Imran bin Al-Hussein, may God be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, taught his father Hussein two words with which to pray: “O God, inspire me with guidance, and protect me from the evil of myself.” “. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

1488- On the authority of Abu al-Fadl al-Abbas bin Abdul Muttalib, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of God: Teach me something that I may ask God Almighty for. He said: “Ask God for well-being.” So I stayed for a few days, then I came and said: O Messenger of God, teach me something that I may ask God Almighty for. He said to me: “O Abbas, uncle of the Messenger of God, ask God for well-being in this world and the hereafter.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good and authentic hadith. 1489- On the authority of Shahr bin Hawshab, he said: I said to Umm Salamah, may God be pleased with her, O Mother of the Believers, what was the most frequent supplication of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, if he Do you have it? She said: His most frequent supplication was: “O converter of hearts, make my heart steadfast in your religion.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, and he said it is a good hadith. 1490- On the authority of Abu al-Darda’, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “It was one of the supplications of David, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him: “Oh God, I ask you for your love. And the love of those who love You, and the deeds that make me realize Your love. Oh God, make Your love more beloved to me than myself, my family, and cold water.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: a good hadith. 1491- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Show glory and honor.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and narrated by Al-Nasa’i from the narration of Rabi’ah bin Amir Al-Sahabi. . Al-Hakim said: A hadith with an authentic chain of narration.

“Alaazawa” with a kasra on the lam and an emphasis on the dhaa in the dictionary means: Commit to this call and multiply it. 1492- On the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, prayed with many supplications, of which we have not memorized anything. We said, O Messenger of God, I prayed with many supplications that did not We memorized something from it, and he said: “Shall I not guide you to what brings it all together?” She says: “O God, I ask You for the good of which Your Prophet Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, asked You, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of which Your Prophet Muhammad, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, sought refuge from. And you are the one who is being helped, and upon you is the conveyance of the message, and there is no power nor strength except in God.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: a good hadith. 1493- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: One of the supplications of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was: Oh God, I ask you for the reasons for your mercy and for the Your forgiveness, safety from every sin, the spoils of every righteousness, the victory in Paradise, and salvation from Hell.

It was narrated by Al-Hakim Abu Abdullah, and he said: It is an authentic hadith according to the conditions of Muslim. Chapter on the virtue of supplication in the back of the unseen

God Almighty said: {And those who came after them say, “Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith.”

And God Almighty said: {And ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women}.

And God Almighty said, reporting on the authority of Abraham, may God bless him and grant him peace: {Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers on the Day when the reckoning is established}. 1494- On the authority of Abu al-Darda’, may God be pleased with him, that he heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: “There is no Muslim servant who supplicates for his brother in his absence except that the king says: And you have an example.” Narrated by Muslim.

1495- On his authority, the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to say: “A Muslim’s supplication for his brother in the back of his life will be answered. At his head is an entrusted angel whenever he prays for good for his brother.” The angel entrusted with him said: Amen, and you can do the same.” Narrated by Muslim. Chapter on issues of supplication

1496- On the authority of Osama bin Zaid, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever is shown a kindness and says to the one who did it: May God reward you with good, then he has conveyed the message.” In praise.

Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good and authentic hadith. 1497- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Do not supplicate against yourselves, do not supplicate against your children, and do not supplicate against your wealth. Get permission from God for an hour in which He will ask for a gift and He will respond to you.” Narrated by Muslim.

1498- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The closest a servant is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so supplicate often.” Narrated by Muslim. 1499- And on his authority, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “One of you will be answered unless he is in a hurry: he says, ‘I called upon my Lord, but He did not respond to me.’” Agreed upon.

In a narration by Muslim: “The servant will continue to be answered as long as he does not supplicate for sin or severing family ties, as long as he is not in a hurry.” It was said: O Messenger of God, what is haste? He said: “He says: I have supplicated, and I have supplicated, but I did not see him answering me. Then he becomes saddened at that, and abandons the supplication.” 1500- On the authority of Abu Umamah, may God be pleased with him, he said: It was said to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace: Which supplication should I hear? He said: “The middle of the night, and after the obligatory prayers.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good hadith.

1501- On the authority of Ubadah ibn al-Samit, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “There is not a Muslim on earth who supplicates to God Almighty with a supplication but He gives it to him.” May God protect her from her, or turn away from him an evil like her. Unless he calls for sin or severing family ties. Then a man from the people said: Then we will increase. He said: “God is greater.”

It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan and authentic hadith: Al-Hakim narrated it from the narration of Abu Sa’id and added to it: “Or an equivalent reward shall be stored up for him.” 1502- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, used to say when distressed: “There is no god but God, the Great, the Forbearing. There is no god but God, Lord of the Throne.” The Great, there is no god but Allah, Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, and Lord of the Noble Throne.” Agreed upon. Chapter on the virtues and virtues of saints

God Almighty said: {Indeed, the friends of God have no fear nor will they grieve. Those who believe and fear God, for them is good news in the life of this world and in the hereafter. There is no altering the words of God. That is the great victory.

And God Almighty said: {And shake the trunk of the palm tree at you, and it will cause fresh, fresh fruits to fall upon you, so eat and drink} the verse.

And God Almighty said: {Whenever Zechariah entered the sanctuary to her, he found by her provision. He said: O Mary, can I have this for you? She said, “It is from God.” God provides for whomever He wills without reckoning. And God Almighty said: {And when you isolated yourself from them and that which they worship except Allah, then take refuge in the cave. Your Lord will spread for you of His mercy and prepare for you ease in your affairs. And you will see the sun, when it rises, turning away from their cave to the right, and when it sets, approaching them to the left.} The verse.

1503- On the authority of Abu Muhammad Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Bakr al-Siddiq, may God be pleased with them, that the people of Suffah were poor people, and that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, once said, “Whoever has food for two, Let him go with a third, and whoever has food for four, So let him go with a fifth and a sixth.” Or as he said, and that Abu Bakr, may God be pleased with him, brought three, and the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, set off with ten, and that Abu Bakr He had dinner with the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, then he stayed until he prayed the evening prayer, then he came back and came after the night had passed, as God wished. His wife said: What has kept you away from your guests? He said: Or what was their evening meal? She said: They refused until you came, and they were presented to them. He said: So I went and hid. He said: O Ghunther. Then he became angry and cursed and said: Eat in peace, by God, no. I will never feed him. He said: By God, we would not take from a morsel except usury from the bottom of it in excess of it until they were satisfied and it became more than it was before. Then Abu Bakr looked at her and said, “No, his wife: O sister of Banu Firas, what is this?” She said: No, the apple of my eye is now three times larger than it was before. So Abu Bakr ate from it and said: That was only from Satan, meaning his right hand. Then He ate a bite of it, then carried it to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and it remained with him in the morning. And there was a covenant between us and my people, so the time passed, so twelve men separated, with each man having some people, God knows how many each man had, and they ate from it. Everyone.

And in a narration: Abu Bakr swore not to feed him, so the woman swore not to feed him, so the guest or guests swore not to feed him, or to feed him until he fed him, so Abu Bakr said: This is from Satan, so he called for food and it ate and they ate. So they did not lift a morsel except that there was more dust from the bottom than it. He said: O sister of Banu Firas, what is this? She said: “By the apple of my eye, it is now more than it was before we ate.” So they ate, and he sent it to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he mentioned that he had eaten from it. And in a narration: Abu Bakr said to Abd al-Rahman: Leave your guests alone, for I am going to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, so empty their villages before I come. So Abdul Rahman set off and brought them what he had. He said: Feed them. They said: Where is the master of our house? He said: Feed. They said: We will not eat until the master of our house comes. He said: Accept your villages on our behalf, for if he comes and you do not feed, we will meet with him. They refused. So I knew that he was angry with me, so when he came, I moved away from him, and he said: What did you do? So they told him, and he said, O Abdul-Rahman, but I remained silent, then he said: O Abdul-Rahman. He remained silent, then he said: O Ghunther, I swore to you if you could hear my voice when I came, so I left, and I said: Ask your guests, and they said: He spoke the truth, he brought it to us. He said: You are just waiting for me, and by God I will not feed him tonight. The others said: By God, we will not feed him until you feed him. He said: Woe to you, why do you not accept your villages from us? Bring your food. He brought it, put his hand down and said: In the name of God. The first is from Satan. So he ate and they ate. Agreed upon.

His saying: “Ghunther” is a grammatical baghain, then a silent nun, then a triple tha’, which means the stupid, ignorant person. And his saying: “So he cursed” means cursing him, and “al-jada” means cutting. His saying: “He is angry with me” is with a kasra in the jiem, meaning: he becomes angry.

1504- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Indeed, among the nations before you, there were people of hadith, so if there is anyone in my nation, then he will Omar.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari, and narrated by Muslim from the narration of Aisha. In their narration, Ibn Wahb said: “Muhaddithun” meaning: inspired.

1505- On the authority of Jabir bin Samra, may God be pleased with them both. He said: The people of Kufa complained about Sa`d, meaning: Ibn Abi Waqqas, may God be pleased with him, to Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, may God be pleased with him, so he dismissed him and appointed them as an Ammar. They complained to the point that they said that he did not pray well, so he sent for him and said: O Abu Ishaq, these people claim that you do not pray well. He said: As for me, by God, I used to pray with them the prayer of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and I did not hesitate to pray the evening prayer, so I stood in the first two places. And he was more subtle about the other two. He said: That is the suspicion of you, O Abu Ishaq. He sent a man or men with him to Kufa to ask the people of Kufa about him, but he did not let him. A mosque except that he asked about it, and they showed kindness, until he entered a mosque belonging to Banu Abs, and a man from them stood up, He was called Osama bin Qatada, nicknamed Abu Sa’dah. He said: If you ask us, Sa’d did not act in secret, did not swear properly, and was not fair in the matter. Saad said: By God, I will pray for three things: O God, if this servant of yours is a liar and rises up out of hypocrisy and disrepute, then prolong his life and prolong his poverty. And he exposed him to temptations, and after that, when he was asked, he would say: An old man who is tempted, I was struck by Saad’s invitation. Abd al-Malik ibn Umair, the narrator, said on the authority of Jabir ibn Samurah, “I saw him after his eyebrows had fallen over his eyes due to old age, and he was running into slave girls on the roads.” So he winks at them. Agreed upon.

1506- On the authority of Urwa bin Al-Zubayr, that Saeed bin Zaid bin Amr bin Nufayl, may God be pleased with him, brought his opponent Arwa bint Aws to Marwan bin Al-Hakam, and she claimed that he He took something from her land, Saeed said: I was taking something from its land after what I heard from the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. He said: What did you hear from the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace? He said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: “Whoever takes a span of land unjustly, he will be surrounded by seven lands.” Then Marwan said to him: I do not ask you. After this, Saeed said: Oh God, if she is lying, blind her sight and kill her in her land. He said: She did not die until her sight went away, and while she was walking in her land, she fell into a hole and died. Agreed upon.

And in a narration by Muslim on the authority of Muhammad bin Zaid bin Abdullah bin Omar, with the meaning that he saw her blind touching the walls, she says: Saeed’s call befell me, and that she passed by a well in the house where She quarreled with him over it, and she fell into it, and it became her grave. 1507- On the authority of Jabir bin Abdullah, may God be pleased with them both, he said: When I attended Uhud, my father called me at night and said: He only saw me killed, among the first of the Companions of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, to be killed. And I will not leave after me anyone dearer to me than you other than the soul of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. I owe a debt and pay it off. Treat your sisters well: In the morning, he was the first to be killed, and I buried another with him in his grave. Then I did not want to leave him with someone else, so I took him out after six months, and he was like the day I put him in, except for his ear, so I put him in a grave by itself. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1508- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, that two men from the companions of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, left the presence of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, on a dark night, carrying with them something like The two lamps were in their hands, and when they separated, each one of them had one of them until his family came. It was narrated by Al-Bukhari in a number of ways, and in some of them it mentions the two men Usayd bin Hudayr and Abbad bin Bishr, may God be pleased with them.

1509- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, sent ten detachments of secret guards, and Asim bin Thabit al-Ansari, may God be pleased with him, sent over them. On the authority of him, they set off until, when they were guided, between Usfan and Mecca, they mentioned Lahiyya from Hudhayl, and it was said to them: They built Lahyan. So they sent out to them about a hundred archer men, and they tracked them down. When Asim and his companions sensed them, they took refuge in a place, and the people surrounded them, so they said, “Get down.” So give with your hands, and to you is the covenant and covenant that we will not kill any of you. Then Asim bin Thabit said: O people, as for me, I will not descend under the protection of an infidel. Oh God, tell your Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, about us. They shot them with arrows and killed Asim, and three people descended upon them in accordance with the covenant and covenant, among them Khubayb and Zayd ibn Al-Dathna and another man. When they were able to overpower them, they released the strings of their bows and tied them to them. The third man said: This is the beginning of treachery. By God, I will not be friends with you. I have an example in these people. He wanted to kill him, so they dragged him and treated him, but he refused to accompany them, so they killed him, and set off with Khubayb. And Zaid bin Al-Dathna, until they sold them in Mecca after the Battle of Badr, so Banu Al-Harith bought Ibn Amir bin Nawfal bin Abd Manaf Khubayb, and it was Khubayb who killed Al-Harith. On the day of Badr, Khubayb stayed with them as a captive until they agreed to kill him. So he borrowed from some of Al-Harith’s daughters Musa to use her as a companion, and she lent him, so Bani She was unaware of it until he came to him, and she found him sitting on his thigh and the razor in his hand. She was terrified in a way that Khubayb knew. He said: Are you afraid that I will kill him? I would not do that. She said: By God, I have never seen a better prisoner than Khubayb. By God, I found him one day eating a bunch of grapes in his hand. And he was bound with iron and there was no fruit in Mecca, and she used to say: This is a provision that God had bestowed on Khubayb. So when they brought him out of the Sacred Mosque to kill him in the law, he said to them. Khubayb: Let me pray two rak’ahs. They left him, so he prayed two rak’ahs. He said: By God, had you not thought that I was not afraid, I would have added: Oh God, count them in number, kill them as a swarm, and do not leave any of them alive. And he said:

I do not care when I kill a Muslim on which side my death was for God.

This is in the essence of God, and if He wills, He blesses the limbs of a torn garment. 

Khubayb was the one who prescribed prayer for every Muslim who was killed patiently, meaning the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace. On the day his companions were afflicted with news, people from the Quraysh sent to Asim bin Thabit when they reported that he had been killed to bring something of him that would be known. He had killed one of their great men, so God sent for Asim something like a shadow from the back, and it protected him from their messengers, but they were not able to cut off anything from him. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

His saying: guidance means a place, canopy means clouds, and rain means bees. And his saying: “Kill them in a biddah” by breaking the b and opening it, so whoever broke it, he said it is the plural of biddah by breaking the b, which is the share, and its meaning is to kill them in divided portions, each one of them having a share, and who Fatah, he said: It means: dispersed in killing, one after another of dispersal. In this chapter there are many authentic hadiths that have been previously mentioned in their places in this book, including the hadith of the boy who used to come to the monk and the magician, and among them is the hadith of Jurayj, and the hadith of the people of the cave who were covered by the rock, and the hadith of the man who heard A voice in the clouds saying: Water so-and-so’s garden, and other than that, and the evidence in the door is many and well-known, and by God, success. 1510- On the authority of Ibn Umar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I never heard Umar, may God be pleased with him, say about something: I think it is such and such, unless it is as he thinks. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.
