باب تحريم الغيبة والأمر بحفظ اللسان

قال اللَّه تعالى: { ولا يغتب بعضكم بعضاً، أيحب أحدكم أن يأكل لحم أخيه ميتاً فكرهتموه! واتقوا اللَّه إن اللَّه تواب رحيم } .

وقال تعالى:{ ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم؛ إن السمع والبصر والفؤاد كل أولئك كان عنه مسئولاً } .

وقال تعالى: { ما يلفظ من قول إلا لديه رقيب عتيد } .

اعلم أنه ينبغي لكل مكلف أن يحفظ لسانه عن جميع الكلام إلا كلاماً ظهرت فيه المصلحة، ومتى استوى الكلام وتركه في المصلحة فالسنة الإمساك عنه؛ لأنه قد ينجر الكلام المباح إلى حرام أو مكروه وذلك كثير في العادة والسلامة لا يعدلها شيء.

1511- وَعنْ أبي هُريْرَةَ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ عَنِ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَاليَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَليقُلْ خَيْراً ، أوْ ليَصْمُتْ » متفقٌ عليه .

وَهذا الحَديثُ صَرِيحٌ في أَنَّهُ يَنْبغي أن لا يتَكَلَّم إلاَّ إذا كَان الكَلامُ خَيْراً ، وَهُو الَّذي ظَهَرَتْ مصْلحَتُهُ ، وَمَتى شَكَّ في ظُهُورِ المَصْلَحةِ ، فَلا يَتَكَلَّمُ .

1512- وعَنْ أبي مُوسَى رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قَال : قُلْتُ يا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ أيُّ المُسْلِمِينَ أفْضَلُ؟ قال : « مَنْ سَلِمَ المُسْلِمُونَ مِن لِسَانِهِ وَيَدِهِ » . متفق عليه .

1513- وَعَنْ سَهْلِ بنِ سعْدٍ قَال : قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَنْ يَضْمَنْ لي ما بيْنَ لَحْيَيْهِ وَمَا بيْنَ رِجْلَيْهِ أضْمنْ لهُ الجَنَّة » . متفقٌ عليهِ .

1514- وَعَنْ أبي هُرَيْرَةَ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أَنَّهُ سَمِعَ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَقُولُ : إنَّ الْعَبْد لَيَتَكَلَّمُ بِالكَلِمةِ مَا يَتَبيَّنُ فيهَا يَزِلُّ بهَا إلى النَّارِ أبْعَدَ مِمَّا بيْنَ المشْرِقِ والمغْرِبِ » . متفقٌ عليهِ .

ومعنى : « يَتَبَيَّنُ » يَتَفَكَّرُ أنَّهَا خَيْرٌ أمْ لا .

1515- وَعَنْهُ عن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « إنَّ الْعَبْدَ لَيَتَكَلَّمُ بِالكَلِمةِ مِنْ رِضْوَانِ اللَّهِ تَعَالى مَا يُلقِي لهَا بَالاً يَرْفَعُهُ اللَّه بهَا دَرَجاتٍ ، وَإنَّ الْعبْدَ لَيَتَكلَّمُ بالْكَلِمَةِ مِنْ سَخَطِ اللَّهِ تَعالى لا يُلْقي لهَا بالاً يهِوي بهَا في جَهَنَّم » رواه البخاري .

1516- وعَنْ أبي عَبْدِ الرَّحمنِ بِلال بنِ الحارثِ المُزنيِّ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ أنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قالَ : « إنَّ الرَّجُلَ ليَتَكَلَّمُ بالْكَلِمَةِ مِنْ رِضْوانِ اللَّهِ تَعالى ما كَانَ يَظُنُّ أنْ تَبْلُغَ مَا بلَغَتْ يكْتُبُ اللَّه اللَّه بهَا رِضْوَانَهُ إلى يَوْمِ يلْقَاهُ ، وَإنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَيَتَكَلَّمُ بالكَلِمةِ مِنْ سَخَطِ اللَّه مَا كَانَ يظُنُّ أن تَبْلُغَ ما بلَغَتْ يكْتُبُ اللَّه لَهُ بهَا سَخَطَهُ إلى يَوْمِ يلْقَاهُ ».رواهُ مالك في « المُوطَّإِ » والترمذي وقال :حديثٌ حسنٌ صحيحٌ .

1517- وعَنْ سُفْيان بنِ عبْدِ اللَّهِ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قَال : قُلْتُ يا رسُولَ اللَّهِ حَدِّثني بأمْرٍ أعْتَصِمُ بِهِ قالَ : « قُلْ ربِّي اللَّه ، ثُمَّ اسْتَقِمْ » قُلْتُ : يا رسُول اللَّهِ ما أَخْوفُ مَا تَخَافُ عَلَيَّ ؟ فَأَخَذَ بِلِسَانِ نَفْسِهِ ، ثُمَّ قَال : « هذا » . رواه الترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ صحيحٌ .

1518- وَعَن ابنِ عُمَر رضي اللَّه عنْهُمَا قَالَ : قَالَ رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لا تُكْثِرُوا الكَلامَ بغَيْرِ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ ، فَإنَّ كَثْرَة الكَلامِ بِغَيْرِ ذِكْرِ اللَّه تَعالَى قَسْوةٌ لِلْقَلْبِ ، وإنَّ أبْعَدَ النَّاسِ مِنَ اللَّهِ القَلبُ القَاسي » . رواه الترمذي .

1519- وعنْ أبي هُريرَة رضي اللَّه عَنهُ قَالَ : قال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَنْ وَقَاهُ اللَّه شَرَّ مَا بيْنَ لَحْييْهِ ، وشَرَّ مَا بَيْنَ رِجْلَيْهِ دَخَلَ الجنَّةَ » رَوَاه التِّرمِذي وقال : حديث حسنٌ.

1520- وَعَنْ عُقْبةَ بنِ عامِرٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ يا رَسول اللَّهِ مَا النَّجاةُ ؟ قَال : « أمْسِكْ عَلَيْكَ لِسانَكَ ، وَلْيَسَعْكَ بيْتُكَ ، وابْكِ على خَطِيئَتِكَ » رواه الترمذي وقالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1521- وعن أبي سَعيدٍ الخُدْرِيِّ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ عن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « إذا أَصْبح ابْنُ آدم ، فَإنَّ الأعْضَاءَ كُلَّهَا تُكَفِّرُ اللِّسانَ ، تَقُولُ : اتِّقِ اللَّه فينَا ، فَإنَّما نحنُ بِكًَ : فَإنِ اسْتَقَمْتَ اسَتقَمْنا وإنِ اعْوججت اعْوَججْنَا » رواه الترمذي .

معنى « تُكَفِّرُ اللِّسَان » : أَي تَذِلُّ وتَخْضعُ لَهُ .

1522- وعنْ مُعاذ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قال : قُلْتُ يا رسُول اللَّهِ أخبرني بِعَمَلٍ يُدْخِلُني الجَنَّة ، ويُبَاعِدُني عن النَّارِ ؟ قَال : « لَقدْ سَأَلْتَ عنْ عَظِيمٍ ، وإنَّهُ لَيَسِيرٌ عَلى منْ يَسَّرَهُ اللَّه تَعَالى علَيهِ : تَعْبُد اللَّه لا تُشْركُ بِهِ شَيْئاً ، وتُقِيمُ الصَّلاةَ ، وتُؤتي الزَّكَاةَ ، وتصُومُ رمضَانَ وتَحُجُّ البَيْتَ إن استطعت إِلَيْهِ سَبِيْلاً، ثُمَّ قَال : « ألا أدُلُّك عَلى أبْوابِ الخَيْرِ ؟ الصَّوْمُ جُنَّةٌ . ،َالصَّدَقةٌ تطْفِيءُ الخَطِيئة كما يُطْفِيءُ المَاءُ النَّار ، وصلاةُ الرَّجُلِ منْ جوْفِ اللَّيْلِ » ثُمَّ تَلا : {تتجافى جُنُوبهُمْ عَنِ المَضَاجِعِ } حتَّى بلَغَ { يعْمَلُونَ } [ السجدة : 16 ] . ثُمَّ قال: « ألا أُخْبِرُكَ بِرَأسِ الأمْرِ ، وعمودِهِ ، وذِرْوةِ سَنامِهِ » قُلتُ : بَلى يا رسول اللَّهِ : قَالَ : « رأْسُ الأمْرِ الإسْلامُ ، وعَمُودُهُ الصَّلاةُ . وذروةُ سنامِهِ الجِهَادُ » ثُمَّ قال : « ألا أُخْبِرُكَ بـِمِلاكِ ذلكَ كله ؟» قُلْتُ : بَلى يا رسُولَ اللَّهِ . فَأَخذَ بِلِسَانِهِ قالَ : « كُفَّ علَيْكَ هذا » قُلْتُ: يا رسُولَ اللَّهِ وإنَّا لمُؤَاخَذون بمَا نَتَكلَّمُ بِهِ ؟ فقَال : ثَكِلتْكَ أُمُّكَ ، وهَلْ يَكُبُّ النَّاسَ في النَّارِ على وَجُوهِهِم إلاَّ حصَائِدُ ألْسِنَتِهِمْ ؟ » .رواه الترمذي وقال : حدِيثٌ حسنٌ صحيحٌ ، وقد سبق شرحه .

1523- وعنْ أبي هُرَيرةَ رضي اللَّه عنهُ أنَّ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « أَتَدْرُونَ ما الغِيبةُ؟» قَالُوا : اللَّه ورسُولُهُ أَعْلَمُ . قال : « ذِكرُكَ أَخَاكَ بما يكْرَهُ » قِيل : أَفرأيْتَ إن كان في أخِي ما أَقُولُ ؟ قَالَ : « إنْ كانَ فِيهِ ما تقُولُ فَقَدِ اغْتَبْته ، وإنْ لَمْ يكُن فِيهِ ما تَقُولُ فَقَدْ بهتَّهُ » رواه مسلم .

1524- وعنْ أبي بكْرةَ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ أنَّ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال في خُطْبتِهِ يوْم النَّحر بِمنىً في حجَّةِ الودَاعِ : « إنَّ دِماءَكُم ، وأمْوالَكم وأعْراضَكُم حرامٌ عَلَيْكُم كَحُرْمة يومِكُم هذا ، في شهرِكُمْ هذا ، في بلَدِكُم هذا ، ألا هَلْ بلَّغْت » متفقٌ عليه .

1525- وعنْ عائِشة رضِي اللَّه عنْها قَالَتْ : قُلْتُ للنبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم حسْبُك مِنْ صفِيَّة كذا وكَذَا قَال بعْضُ الرُّواةِ : تعْني قَصِيرةٌ ، فقال : « لقَدْ قُلْتِ كَلِمةً لو مُزجتّ بماءِ البحْر لمَزَجتْه ، » قَالَتْ : وحكَيْتُ له إنساناً فقال : « ما أحِبُّ أني حكَيْتُ إنْساناً وإنَّ لي كذا وَكَذَا » رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي وقال : حديثٌ حسنٌ صحيحٌ . 

ومعنى : « مزَجَتْهُ » خَالطته مُخَالَطة يَتغَيَّرُ بهَا طَعْمُهُ ، أوْ رِيحُهُ لِشِدةِ نتنها وقبحها ، وهَذا مِنْ أبلغَ الزَّواجِرِ عنِ الغِيبَةِ ، قَال اللَّهُ تَعالى : { وما ينْطِقُ عنِ الهَوى ، إن هُوَ إلا وحْيٌّ يوحَى } [ النجم : 4 ] .

1526- وَعَنْ أنَسٍ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قالَ : قَالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لمَّا عُرِجَ بي مررْتُ بِقَوْمٍ لهُمْ أظْفَارٌ مِن نُحاسٍ يَخمِشُونَ بهَا وجُوهَهُمُ وَصُدُورَهُم ، فَقُلْتُ : منْ هؤلاءِ يَا جِبْرِيل ؟ قَال : هؤلاءِ الَّذِينَ يَأْكُلُونَ لُحُوم النَّاسِ ، ويَقَعُون في أعْراضِهمْ ، » رواهُ أبو داود.

1527- وعن أبي هُريْرة رضي اللَّه عنْهُ أنَّ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « كُلُّ المُسلِمِ عَلى المُسْلِمِ حرَامٌ : دَمُهُ وعِرْضُهُ وَمَالُهُ » رواهُ مسلم .

			 				 	

باب تحريم سماع الغيبة

باب تحريم سماع الغيبة

وأمر من سمع غيبة محرَّمة بردِّها ، والإِنكار على قائلها 

فإن عجز أو لم يقبل منه فارق ذلك المجلس إن أمكنه 

قال اللَّه تعالى: { وإذا سمعوا اللغو أعرضوا عنه } .

وقال تعالى: { والذين هم عن اللغو معرضون } .

وقال تعالى: { إن السمع والبصر والفؤاد كل أولئك كان عنه مسئولاً } .

وقال تعالى: { وإذا رأيت الذين يخوضون في آياتنا فأعرض عنهم حتى يخوضوا في حديث غيره، وإما ينسينك الشيطان فلا تقعد بعد الذكرى مع القوم الظالمين } .

1528- وعنْ أبي الدَّرْداءِ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ عنِ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قالَ : « منْ ردَّ عَنْ عِرْضِ أخيهِ، ردَّ اللَّه عنْ وجْههِ النَّارَ يوْمَ القِيَامَةِ » رواه الترمذي وقالَ : حديثٌ حسنٌ .

1529- وعنْ عِتْبَانَ بنِ مالِكٍ رضي اللَّهُ عنْهُ في حدِيثِهِ الطَّويلِ المشْهورِ الَّذي تقدَّم في باب الرَّجاءِ قَالَ : قامَ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يُصلِّي فَقال : « أيْنَ مالِكُ بنُ الدُّخْشُمِ ؟ » فَقَال رجل: ذلكَ مُنافِقٌ لا يُحِبُّ اللَّه ورسُولَهُ ، فَقَال النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لا تقُلْ ذلكَ ، ألا تَراه قد قَال : لا إلهَ إلاَّ اللًه يُريدُ بذلك وجْه اللَّه ، وإن اللَّه قدْ حَرَّمَ على النَّارِ منْ قال : لا إله إلاَّ اللَّه يبْتَغِي بِذلكَ وجْهَ اللَّه » متفقٌ عليه .

« وعِتبانُ » بكسر العين على المشهور ، وحُكِي ضمُّها ، وبعدها تاء مثناةٌ مِنْ فوق ، ثُمَّ باء موحدةٌ . و « الدُّخْشُمُ » بضم الدال وإسكان الخاءِ وضمِّ الشين المعجمتين .

1530- وعَنْ كعْبِ بنِ مالكٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ في حدِيثِهِ الطَّويلِ في قصَّةِ توْبَتِهِ وقد سبقَ في باب التَّوْبةِ . قال : قال النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم وهُو جَالِسٌ في القَوْم بِتبُوكَ : « ما فعل كَعْبُ بنُ مالك ؟ » فقالَ رجُلٌ مِنْ بَني سلِمَةَ : يا رسُولَ اللَّه حبسهُ بُرْداهُ ، والنَّظَرُ في عِطْفيْهِ . فقَال لَهُ معاذُ بنُ جبلٍ رضي اللَّه عنْه : بِئس ما قُلْتَ ، واللَّهِ يا رسُولَ اللَّهِ ما عَلِمْنا علَيْهِ إلاَّ خيْراً ، فَسكَتَ رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم .متفق عليه .

« عِطْفَاهُ » جانِباهُ ، وهو إشارةٌ إلى إعجابه بنفسهِ .

			 				 	

باب بيان ما يُباح من الغيبة

باب بيان ما يُباح من الغيبة

اعلم أن الغيبة تباح لغرض صحيح شرعي لا يمكن الوصول إليه إلا بها وهو ستة أسباب:

الأول التظلم فيجوز للمظلوم أن يتظلم إلى السلطان والقاضي وغيرهما ممن له ولاية أو قدرة على إنصافه من ظالمه، فيقول: ظلمني فلان بكذا.

الثاني الاستعانة على تغيير المنكر ورد العاصي إلى الصواب، فيقول لمن يرجو قدرته على إزالة المنكر: فلان يعمل كذا فازجره عنه، ونحو ذلك، ويكون مقصوده التوصل إلى إزالة المنكر، فإن لم يقصد ذلك كان حراماً.

الثالث الاستفتاء، فيقول للمفتي: ظلمني أبي أو أخي أو زوجي أو فلان بكذا فهل له ذلك؟ وما طريقي في الخلاص منه وتحصيل حقي ودفع الظلم؟ ونحو ذلك فهذا جائز للحاجة، ولكن الأحوط والأفضل أن يقول: ما تقول في رجل أو شخص أو زوج كان من أمره كذا؟ فإنه يحصل به الغرض من غير تعيين، ومع ذلك فالتعيين جائز كما سنذكره في حديث هند (انظر الحديث رقم 1532) إن شاء اللَّه تعالى.

الرابع تحذير المسلمين من الشر ونصيحتهم، وذلك من وجوه؛ منها جرح المجروحين من الرواة والشهود، وذلك جائز بإجماع المسلمين بل واجب للحاجة. ومنها المشاورة في مصاهرة إنسان أو مشاركته أو إيداعه أو معاملته أو غير ذلك أو مجاورته، ويجب على المشاوَر أن لا يخفي حاله بل يذكر المساوئ التي فيه بنية النصيحة. ومنها إذا رأى متفقهاً يتردد إلى مبتدع أو فاسق يأخذ عنه العلم وخاف أن يتضرر المتفقه بذلك، فعليه نصيحته ببيان حاله بشرط أن يقصد النصيحة، وهذا مما يُغلط فيه، وقد يحمل المتكلم بذلك الحسد ويلبِّس الشيطان عليه ذلك ويخيل إليه أنه نصيحة فليُتَفطن لذلك. ومنها أن يكون له ولاية لا يقوم بها على وجهها، إما بأن لا يكون صالحاً لها، وإما بأن يكون فاسقاً أو مغفلاً ونحو ذلك، فيجب ذكر ذلك لمن له عليه ولاية عامة ليزيله ويولي من يصلح، أو يعلم ذلك منه ليعامله بمقتضى حاله ولا يغتر به، وأن يسعى في أن يحثه على الاستقامة أو يستبدل به.

الخامس أن يكون مجاهراً بفسقه أو بدعته كالمجاهر بشرب الخمر، ومصادرة الناس وأخذ المكس وجباية الأموال ظلماً وتولي الأمور الباطلة، فيجوز ذكره بما يجاهر به، ويحرم ذكره بغيره من العيوب إلا أن يكون لجوازه سبب آخر مما ذكرناه.

السادس التعريف، فإذا كان الإنسان معروفاً بلقب كالأعمش والأعرج والأصم والأعمى والأحول وغيرهم جاز تعريفهم بذلك، ويحرم إطلاقه على جهة التنقص، ولو أمكن تعريفه بغير ذلك كان أولى.

فهذه ستة أسباب ذكرها العلماء وأكثرها مجمع عليه. ودلائلها من الأحاديث الصحيحة المشهورة؛ فمن ذلك:

1531- عَنْ عَائِشَةَ رضي اللَّه عَنْهَا أن رَجُلاً استأْذَن عَلى النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فقَالَ : « ائذَنُوا لهُ، بئس أخو العشِيرَةِ ؟ » متفقٌ عليه .

احْتَجَّ بهِ البخاري في جَوازِ غيبةِ أهلِ الفسادِ وأهلِ الرِّيبِ .

1532- وعنْهَا قَالَتْ : قَالَ رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « مَا أَظُن فُلاناً وفُلاناً يعرِفَانِ مِنْ ديننا شَيْئاً » رواه البخاريُّ . قال الليثُ بنُ سعْدٍ أحدُ رُواةِ هذا الحَدِيثِ : هذَانِ الرَّجُلانِ كَانَا مِنَ المُنَافِقِينَ .

1533- وعنْ فَاطِمةَ بنْتِ قَيْسٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْها قَالَتْ : أَتيْتُ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، فقلت : إنَّ أبا الجَهْمِ ومُعاوِيةَ خَطباني ؟ فقال رسول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « أمَّا مُعَاوِيةُ ، فَصُعْلُوكٌ لا مالَ له ، وأمَّا أبو الجَهْمِ فلا يضَعُ العَصا عنْ عاتِقِهِ » متفقٌ عليه .

وفي روايةٍ لمسلمٍ : « وأمَّا أبُو الجَهْمِ فضَرَّابُ للنِّساءِ » وهو تفسير لرواية : « لا يَضَعُ العَصا عَنْ عاتِقِهِ » وقيل : معناه : كثيرُ الأسفارِ .

1534- وعن زيْد بنِ أرْقَمَ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قال : خَرجْنَا مع رسولِ اللِّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم في سفَرٍ أصاب النَّاس فيهِ شِدةٌ ، فقال عبدُ اللَّه بنُ أبي : لا تُنْفِقُوا على منْ عِنْد رسُولِ اللَّه حتى ينْفَضُّوا وقال : لَئِنْ رجعْنَا إلى المدِينَةِ ليُخرِجنَّ الأعزُّ مِنْها الأذَلَّ ، فَأَتَيْتُ رسول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم، فَأَخْبرْتُهُ بِذلكَ ، فأرسلَ إلى عبد اللَّه بن أبي فَاجْتَهَد يمِينَهُ : ما فَعَل ، فقالوا : كَذَب زيدٌ رسولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، فَوقَع في نَفْسِي مِمَّا قالوهُ شِدَّةٌ حتى أنْزَل اللَّه تعالى تَصْدِيقي: { إذا جاءَك المُنَافِقُون } ثم دعاهم النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، لِيَسْتغْفِرَ لهم فلَوَّوْا رُؤُوسَهُمْ . متفقٌ عليه .

1535- وعنْ عائشةَ رضي اللَّه عنها قالتْ : قالت هِنْدُ امْرأَةُ أبي سُفْيانَ للنبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : إنَّ أبا سُفيانَ رجُلٌ شَحِيحُ ولَيْس يُعْطِيني ما يَكْفِيني وولَدِي إلاَّ ما أخَذْتُ مِنه ، وهَو لا يعْلَمُ ؟ قال : « خُذِي ما يكْفِيكِ ووَلَدَكِ بالمعْرُوفِ » متفقٌ عليه .

			 				 	

باب تحريم النميمة

وهي نقل الكلام بين الناس على جهة الإِفساد

قال اللَّه تعالى:{ هماز مشاء بنميم } .

وقال تعالى: { ما يلفظ من قول إلا لديه رقيب عتيد }.

1536- وعَنْ حذَيْفَةَ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قالَ : قال رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لا يَدْخُلُ الجنةَ نمَّامٌ» متفقٌ عليه .

1537- وعَنْ ابن عَباسٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُمَا أنَّ رَسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : مرَّ بِقَبريْنِ فقال : «إنَّهُمَا يُعَذَّبان ، وَمَا يُعَذَّبَانِ في كَبيرٍ ، بَلى إنَّهُ كَبيرٌ : أمَّا أحَدُهمَا ، فَكَانَ يمشِي بالنَّمِيمَةِ، وأمَّا الآخرُ فَكَانَ لا يسْتَتِرُ مِنْ بولِه » .

متفقٌ عليه ، وهذا لفظ إحدى روايات البخاري .

قالَ العُلَماءُ : معْنَى: «وما يُعَذَّبَانِ في كَبيرٍ» أيْ كبير في زَعْمِهما وقيلَ: كَبِيرٌ تَرْكُهُ عَلَيهما.

1538- وعن ابن مسْعُودٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ أنَّ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « ألا أُنَبِّئكُم ما العَضْهُ ؟ هي النَّمِيمةُ ، القَالَةُ بيْنَ النَّاسِ » رواه مسلم .

« العَضْهُ » : بفَتْح العين المُهْمَلَةِ ، وإسْكان الضَّادِ المُعْجَمَةِ ، وبالهاءِ على وزنِ الوجهِ، ورُوي : « العِضَةُ » بِكسْرِ العَيْنِ و فَتْحِ الضَّادِ المُعْجَمَةِ عَلى وَزْنِ العِدَةِ ، وهِي : الكذِبُ والبُهتانُ ، وعَلى الرِّواية الأولى : العَضْهُ مصدرٌ ، يقال : عَضَهَهُ عَضْهاً ، أي : رماهُ بالعَضْهِ .

			 				 	

باب النهي عن نَقْل الحديثِ وكلام الناس

باب النهي عن نَقْل الحديثِ وكلام الناس

إلى ولاة الأمورِ إذا لم تدْعُ إليه حاجةٌ كَخَوفِ مفسدةٍ ونحوها

قال اللَّه تعالى: { ولا تعاونوا على الإثم والعدوان } .

وفي الباب الأحاديث السابقة في الباب قبله.

1539- وعن ابن مَسْعُودٍ رضي اللَّه عنهُ قالَ : قالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « لا يُبَلِّغْني أحدٌ من أصْحابي عنْ أحَدٍ شَيْئاً ، فَإنِّي أُحِبُّ أنْ أَخْرُجَ إِليْكُمْ وأنا سليمُ الصَّدْرِ » رواه أبو داود والترمذي .

			 				 	

باب ذم ذي الوجهين

قال اللَّه تعالى: { يستخفون من الناس ولا يستخفون من اللَّه وهو معهم، إذ يبيتون ما لا يرضى من القول، وكان اللَّه بما يعملون محيطاً } الآيتين.

1540- وعن أبي هُريرةًَ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قالَ : قالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « تَجدُونَ النَّاسَ معادِنَ : خِيارُهُم في الجاهِليَّةِ خيارُهُم في الإسْلامِ إذا فَقُهُوا ، وتجدُونَ خِيارَ النَّاسِ في هذا الشَّأنِ أشدَّهُمْ لهُ كَراهِيةً ، وتَجدُونَ شَرَّ النَّاسِ ذا الوجْهيْنِ ، الذي يأتي هؤلاءِ بِوجْهِ وَهؤلاءِ بِوَجْهِ » متفقٌ عليه .

1541- وعنْ محمدِ بن زَيْدٍ أنَّ نَاسًا قَالُوا لجَدِّهِ عبدِ اللَّه بنِ عُمْرو رضي اللَّه عنْهما : إنَّا نَدْخُلُ عَلَى سَلاطِيننا فنقولُ لهُمْ بِخلافِ ما نتكلَّمُ إذَا خَرَجْنَا مِنْ عِندِهِمْ قال : كُنًا نعُدُّ هذا نِفَاقاً عَلى عَهْدِ رسولِ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم . رواه البخاري .

			 				 	

باب تحريم الكذب

قال اللَّه تعالى: { ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم } .

وقال تعالى: { ما يلفظ من قول إلا لديه رقيب عتيد } .

1542- وعنْ ابنِ مسعود رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قالَ رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إنًَّ الصِّدْقَ يهْدِي إلى الْبِرِّ وَإنَّ البرِّ يهْدِي إلى الجنَّةِ ، وإنَّ الرَّجُل ليَصْدُقُ حتَّى يُكتَبَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ صِدّيقاً، وإنَّ الْكَذِبَ يَهْدِي إلى الفُجُورِ وإنَّ الفُجُورًَ يهْدِي إلى النارِ ، وإن الرجلَ ليكذبَ حَتى يُكْتبَ عنْدَ اللَّهِ كَذَّاباً » متفقٌ عليه .

1543- وعن عبدِ اللَّهِ بنِ عَمْرو بنِ العاص رضي اللَّه عنْهُما ، أنَّ النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : «أَرْبعٌ منْ كُنَّ فِيهِ ، كان مُنافِقاً خالِصاً ، ومنْ كَانتْ فيهِ خَصْلَةٌ مِنْهُنَّ ، كَانتْ فِيهِ خَصْلةٌ مِنْ نِفاقٍ حتَّى يَدعَهَا : إذا اؤتُمِنَ خَانَ ، وَإذا حدَّثَ كَذَبَ ، وإذا عاهَدَ غَدَرَ ، وإذا خَاصمَ فجَرَ » متفقٌ عليه .

وقد سبقَ بيانه مع حديثِ أبي هُرَيْرَةَ بنحوهِ في « باب الوفاءِ بالعهد » .

1544- وعن ابن عباسٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُما عن النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ، قالَ : « مَنْ تَحَلَّمَ بِحُلْمٍ لمْ يرَهُ ، كُلِّفَ أنْ يَعْقِدَ بيْن شَعِيرتينِ ، ولَنْ يفْعَلَ ، ومِنِ اسْتَمَع إلى حديثِ قَوْم وهُمْ لهُ كارِهُونَ، صُبَّ في أُذُنَيْهِ الآنُكُ يَوْمَ القِيامَةِ ، ومَنْ صوَّر صُورةً ، عُذِّبَ وَكُلِّفَ أنْ ينفُخَ فيها الرُّوحَ وَليْس بِنافخٍ » رواه البخاري .

« تَحلَّم » أي : قالَ أنهُ حَلم في نَوْمِهِ ورَأى كَذا وكَذا ، وهو كاذبٌ و « الآنك » بالمدِّ وضمِّ النونِ وتخفيفِ الكاف : وهو الرَّصَاصُ المذابُ .

1545- وعن ابنِ عُمرَ رضي اللَّه عنْهُما قالَ : قال النبي صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « أفْرَى الفِرَى أنْ يُرِيَ الرجُلُ عيْنَيْهِ ما لَمْ تَرَيا » .

رواهُ البخاري . ومعناه : يقولُ : رأيتُ فيما لم يره .

1546- وعن سَمُرَةَ بنِ جُنْدُبٍ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قالَ : كانَ رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مِما يُكْثِرُ أنْ يقولَ لأصحابهِ : « هَلْ رَأَى أحدٌّ مِنكُمْ مِن رؤيا؟» فيقُصُّ عليهِ منْ شَاءَ اللَّه أنْ يقُصَّ . وَإنَّهُ قال لنا ذات غَدَاةٍ : « إنَّهُ أتَاني اللَّيْلَةَ آتيانِ ، وإنَّهُما قالا لي : انطَلقْ ، وإنِّي انْطلَقْتُ معهُما ، وإنَّا أتَيْنَا عَلى رجُلٍ مُضْطَجِعٌ ، وإِذَا آَخَرُ قَائِمٌ عَلَيْهِ بِصَخْرَةٍ ، وإِذَا هُوَ يَهْوي بالصَّخْرَةِ لِرَأْسِهِ ، فَيثْلَغُ رَأْسهُ ، فَيَتَدَهْدهُُ الحَجَرُ هَاهُنَا . فيتبعُ الحَجَرَ فيأْخُـذُهُ ، فلا يَرجِعُ إلَيْه حَتَّى يَصِحَّ رَأْسُهُ كما كان ، ثُمَّ يَعُودُ عَلَيْهِ ، فَيفْعلُ بهِ مِثْلَ ما فَعَل المَرَّةَ الأولى،» قال : قلتُ لهما : سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ ، ما هذانِ ؟ قالا لي : انْطَلِقْ انْطَلِقْ، فانْطَلَقْنا. فأَتيْنَا عَلى رَجُل مُسْتَلْقٍ لقَفَاه وَإذا آخَرُ قائمٌ عليهِ بكَلُّوبٍ مِنْ حَديدٍ ، وإذا هُوَ يَأْتى أحَد شِقَّيْ وَجْهِهِ فيُشَرْشِرُ شِدْقَهُ إلى قَفاهُ ، ومنْخِرهُ إلى قَفَاهُ ، وَعينَهُ إلى قَفاهُ ، ثُمَّ يتَحوَّل إلى الجانبِ الآخرِ فَيَفْعَل بهِ مثْلَ ما فعلًَ بالجانب الأول ، فَما يَفْرُغُ مِنْ ذلكَ الجانب حتَّى يصِحَّ ذلكَ الجانِبُ كما كانَ ، ثُمَّ يَعُودُ عليْهِ ، فَيَفْعَل مِثْلَ ما فَعلَ في المَرَّةِ الأولى . قال : قلتُ: سُبْحَانَ اللَّه ، ما هذان ؟ قالا لي : انْطلِقْ انْطَلِقْ ، فَانْطَلَقْنَا . فَأتَيْنا عَلى مِثْل التَّنُّورِ فَأَحْسِبُ أنهُ قال : فإذا فيهِ لَغَطٌ ، وأصْواتٌ ، فَاطَّلَعْنا فيهِ فَإِذَا فِيهِ رجالٌ ونِساء عُرَاةٌ ، وإذا هُمْ يأتِيهمْ لَهَبٌ مِنْ أَسْفلِ مِنْهُمْ ، فإذا أتَاهُمْ ذلكَ اللَّهَبُ ضَوْضَؤُوا ، قلتُ ما هؤلاءِ ؟ قالا لي : انْطَلِقْ انْطَلِقْ ،فَانْطَلقْنَا. فَأَتيْنَا على نهرٍ حسِبْتُ أَنهُ كانَ يقُولُ : « أَحْمرُ مِثْلُ الدًَّمِ ، وإذا في النَّهْرِ رَجُلٌ سابِحٌ يَسْبحُ ، وَإذا على شَطِّ النَّهْرِ رجُلٌ قَد جَمَعَ عِندَهُ حِجارةً كَثِيرَة ، وإذا ذلكَ السَّابِحُ يسبح ما يَسْبَحُ، ثُمَّ يَأتيْ ذلكَ الذي قَدْ جمَعَ عِنْدهُ الحِجارةًَ ، فَيَفْغَرُ لهَ فاهُ ، فَيُلْقِمُهُ حجراً ، فَيَنْطَلِقُ فَيَسْبَحُ ، ثُمًَّ يَرْجِعُ إليهِ ، كُلَّمَا رجع إليْهِ ، فَغَر فاهُ لهُ ، فَألْقمهُ حَجَراً ، قلت لهما : ما هذانِ ؟ قالا لي : انْطلِقْ انطلِق ، فانْطَلَقنا . فَأَتَيْنَا على رَجُلٍ كرِيِه المَرْآةِ ، أوْ كأَكرَهِ ما أنت رَاءٍ رجُلاً مَرْأَى ، فإذا هو عِندَه نارٌ يحشُّها وَيسْعى حَوْلَهَا ، قلتُ لهما : ما هذا ؟ قالا لي : انْطَلِقْ انْطلِقْ ، فَانْطَلقنا . فَأتَينا على روْضةٍ مُعْتَمَّةٍ فِيها مِنْ كلِّ نَوْرِ الرَّبيعِ ، وإذا بيْنَ ظهْرِي الرَّوضَةِ رَجلٌ طويلٌ لا أكادُ أرى رأسَهُ طُولاً في السَّماءِ ، وإذا حوْلَ الرجلِ منْ أكثر ولدان ما رَأَيْتُهُمْ قطُّ ، قُلتُ: ما هذا ؟ وما هؤلاءِ ؟ قالا لي : انطَلقْ انْطَلِقْ فَاَنْطَلقنا . فَأتيْنَا إلى دَوْحةٍ عظِيمَة لَمْ أر دَوْحةً قطُّ أعظمَ مِنها ، ولا أحْسنَ ، قالا لي : ارْقَ فيها، فَارتَقينا فيها ، إلى مدِينةٍ مَبْنِيَّةٍ بِلَبِنٍ ذَهبٍ ولبنٍ فضَّةٍ ، فأتَينَا باب المَدينة فَاسْتفتَحْنَا، فَفُتحَ لَنا، فَدَخَلناهَا ، فَتَلَقَّانَا رجالٌ شَطْرٌ مِن خَلْقِهِم كأحْسنِ ما أنت راءٍ ، وشَطرٌ مِنهم كأَقْبحِ ما أنتَ راءِ ، قالا لهم : اذهبوا فقَعُوا في ذلك النًّهْر ، وإذا هُوَ نَهرٌ معتَرِضٌ يجْرِي كأن ماءَهُ المحضُ في البياض ، فذَهبُوا فوقعُوا فيه ، ثُمَّ رجعُوا إلينا قد ذَهَب ذلكَ السُّوءُ عَنهمْ ، فَصارُوا في أحسن صُورةٍ .قال : قالا لي : هذه جَنَّةُ عدْن ، وهذاك منزلُكَ ، فسمَا بصَرِي صُعداً ، فإذا قصر مِثلُ الرَّبابة البيضاءِ . قالا لي : هذاك منزِلُكَ . قلتُ لهما : بارك اللَّه فيكُما، فَذراني فأدخُلْه . قالا : أما الآن فلا ، وأنتَ داخلُهُ . قلت لهُما : فَإنِّي رأَيتُ مُنْذُ اللَّيلة عجباً ؟ فما هذا الذي رأيت ؟ قالا لي : إنَا سَنخبِرُك. أمَّا الرجُلُ الأوَّلُ الذي أتَيتَ عَليه يُثلَغُ رأسُهُ بالحَجَرِ ، فإنَّهُ الرَّجُلُ يأخُذُ القُرْآنَ فيرفُضُه ، وينامُ عن الصَّلاةِ الكتُوبةِ . وأمَّا الذي أتَيتَ عَليْهِ يُشرْشرُ شِدْقُه إلى قَفاهُ ، ومَنْخِرُه إلى قَفاهُ ، وعَيْنهُ إلى قفاهُ ، فإنه الرَّجُلُ يَغْدو مِنْ بَيْتِه فَيكذبُ الكذبةَ تبلُغُ الآفاقَ . وأمَّا الرِّجالُ والنِّساءُ العُراةُ الذين هُمْ في مِثل بِناءِ التَّنُّورِ ، فإنَّهم الزُّناةُ والزَّواني . وأما الرجُلُ الَّذي أتَيْت عليْهِ يسْبَحُ في النَهْرِ ، ويلْقمُ الحِجارة ، فإنَّهُ آكِلُ الرِّبا. وأمَّا الرَّجُلُ الكَريهُ المَرآةِ الذي عندَ النَّارِ يَحُشُّها ويسْعى حَوْلَها فإنَّهُ مالِكُ خازنُ جَهنَّمَ. وأما الرَّجُلُ الطَّويلُ الَّذي في الرَّوْضةِ ، فإنه إبراهيم ، وأما الوِلدانُ الذينَ حوْله ، فكلُّ مُوْلود ماتَ على الفِطْرَةِ » وفي رواية البَرْقَانِي : « وُلِد على الفِطْرَةِ » . فقال بعض المسلمينَ : يا رسول اللَّه ، وأولادُ المشرِكينَ ؟ فقال رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : «وأولادُ المشركينَ » . وأما القوم الذين كانوا شطر منهم حسن وشطر منهم قبيح فإنهم قوم خلطوا عملاً صالحاً وآخر سيئاً تجاوز الله عنهم . رواه البخاري .

وفي رواية له : « رأيتُ اللَّيلَةَ رجُلَين أتَياني فأخْرجاني إلى أرْضِ مُقدَّسةِ » ثم ذكَره . وقال : « فانطَلَقْنَا إلى نَقبٍ مثل التنُّورِ ، أعْلاهُ ضَيِّقٌ وأسْفَلُهُ وَاسعٌ ، يَتَوَقَّدُ تَحتهُ ناراً، فإذا ارتَفَعت ارْتَفَعُوا حَتى كادُوا أنْ يَخْرُجوا ، وإذا خَمَدت ، رَجَعوا فيها ، وفيها رجالٌ ونساء عراةٌ . وفيها : حتى أتَينَا على نَهرٍ من دًَم ، ولم يشك ­ فيه رجُلٌ قائمٌ على وسط النًَّهرِ ، وعلى شطِّ النَّهر رجُلٌ ، وبيْنَ يديهِ حجارةٌ ، فأقبل الرَّجُلُ الذي في النَّهرِ ، فَإذا أراد أنْ يخْرُجَ ، رمَى الرَّجُلُ بِحجرٍ في فِيه ، فردَّهُ حيْثُ كانَ ، فجعلَ كُلَّمَا جاءَ ليخْرج جَعَلَ يَرْمي في فيه بحجرٍ ، فيرْجِعُ كما كانَ .وفيهَا : « فصعدا بي الشَّجَرةَ ، فَأدْخلاني داراً لَمْ أر قَطُّ أحْسنَ منْهَا ، فيها رجالٌ شُيُوخٌ وَشَباب » . وفِيهَا : « الَّذي رأيْتهُ يُشَقُّ شِدْقُهُ فكَذَّابٌ ، يُحدِّثُ بالْكذبةِ فَتُحْملُ عنْهَ حتَّى تَبْلُغَ الآفاق، فيصْنَعُ بهِ ما رأيْتَ إلى يوْم الْقِيامةِ » . وفيها : « الَّذي رأيْتهُ يُشْدَخُ رأسُهُ فرجُلُ علَّمهُ اللَّه الْقُرآنَ ، فنام عنهُ بِاللَّيْلِ ، ولَمْ يعْملْ فيه بِالنَّهَارِ ، فيُفْعلُ بِه إلى يوم الْقِيامةِ » . والدَّارُ الأولى التي دخَلْتَ دارُ عامَّةِ المُؤمنينَ ، وأمَّا هذه الدَّارُ فدَارُ الشُّهَداءِ ، وأنا جِبْريلُ ، وهذا مِيكائيلُ ، فارْفع رأسَك ، فرفعتُ رأْسي ، فإذا فوقي مِثلُ السَّحابِ ، قالا: ذاكَ منزلُكَ ، قلتُ : دَعاني أدْخُلْ منزلي ، قالا : إنَّهُ بَقي لَكَ عُمُرٌ لَم تَستكمِلْهُ ، فلَوْ اسْتَكْملته ، أتيت منْزِلَكَ » رواه البخاري .

قوله : « يَثْلَغ رَأْسهُ » وهو يالثاءِ المثلثة والغينِ المعجمة ، أي : يشدخُهُ ويَشُقُّه . قوله: « يَتَدهْده » أي : يتدحرجُ ، و « الكَلُّوبُ » بفتح الكاف ، وضم اللام المشددة ، وهو معروف . قوله : « فيُشَرشِرُ » أي : يُقَطَّعُ . قوله : « ضوْضَوؤوا » وهو بضادين معجمتين ، أي صاحوا . قوله : « فيفْغَرُ » هو بالفاءِ والغين المعجمة ، أي : يفتحُ . قوله: « المرآةِ » هو بفتح الميم ، أي : المنْظَر . قوله : « يحُشُّها » هو بفتح الياء وضم الحاءِ المهملة والشين المعجمة ، أي : يوقدها ، قوله : « روْضَةٍ مُعْتَمَّةِ » هو بضم الميم وإسكان العين وفتح التاء وتشديد الميم ، أي : وافيةِ النَّبات طويلَته . قَولُهُ : « دوْحَةٌ » وهي بفتح الدال ، وإسكان الواو وبالحاءِ المهملة : وهِي الشَّجرَةُ الْكبيرةُ ، قولُهُ : «المَحْضُ » هو بفتح الميم وإسكان الحاءِ المهملة وبالضَّاد المعجمة : وهُوَ اللَّبَنُ . قولُهُ : «فَسَما بصرِي » أي : ارْتَفَعَ . « وَصُعُداً » : بضم الصاد والعين : أيْ : مُرْتَفِعاً . «وَالرَّبابةُ » : بفتح الراءِ وبالباءِ الموحدة مُكررة ، وهي السَّحابة .

			 				 	

باب بيان ما يجوز من الكذب

إْعْلَمْ أنَّ الْكَذب، وَإنْ كَانَ أصْلُهُ مُحرَّماً، فيَجُوزُ في بعْض الأحْوالِ بشرُوطٍ قد أوْضَحْتُهَا في كتاب: «الأذْكارِ» ومُخْتَصَرُ ذلك أنَّ الكلامَ وسيلةٌ إلى المقاصدِ ، فَكُلُّ مَقْصُودٍ محْمُودٍ يُمْكِن تحْصيلُهُ بغَيْر الْكَذِبِ يَحْرُمُ الْكذِبُ فيه، وإنْ لَمْ يُمكِنْ تحصيله إلاَّ بالكذبِ جاز الْكذِبُ. ثُمَّ إن كانَ تَحْصِيلُ ذلك المقْصُودِ مُباحاً كَانَ الْكَذِبُ مُباحاً ، وإنْ كانَ واجِباً ، كان الكَذِبُ واجِباً ، فإذا اخْتَفي مُسْلمٌ مِن ظالمٍ يريد قَتلَه ، أوْ أخْذَ مالِه ، وأخَفي مالَه ، وسُئِل إنسانٌ عنه ، وجب الكَذبُ بإخفائِه ، وكذا لو كانَ عِندهُ وديعة ، وأراد ظالِمٌ أخذَها، وجب الْكَذِبُ بإخفائها ، والأحْوطُ في هذا كُلِّه أنْ يُوَرِّي ، ومعْنَى التَّوْرِيةِ : أن يقْصِد بِعبارَتِه مَقْصُوداً صَحيحاً ليْسَ هو كاذِباً بالنِّسّبةِ إلَيْهِ ، وإنْ كانَ كاذِباً في ظاهِرِ اللًّفظِ ، وبِالنِّسْبةِ إلى ما يفهَمهُ المُخَاطَبُ ولَوْ تَركَ التَّوْرِيةَ وَأطْلَق عِبارةَ الكذِبِ ، فليْس بِحرَامٍ في هذا الحَالِ .

واسْتَدلَّ الْعُلَماءُ بجَوازِ الكَذِب في هذا الحَال بحدِيث أمِّ كُلْثومٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهَا أنَّها سَمِعَتْ رسول اللَْه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقولُ : « لَيْس الكَذَّابُ الَّذي يُصلحُ بيْنَ النَّاسِ ، فينمِي خَيْراً أو يقولُ خَيْراً » متفقٌ عليه .

زاد مسلم في رواية : « قالت : أمُّ كُلْثُومٍ : ولَم أسْمعْهُ يُرْخِّصُ في شَيءٍ مِمَّا يقُولُ النَّاسُ إلاَّ في ثلاثٍ : تَعْني : الحَرْبَ ، والإصْلاحَ بيْن النَّاسِ ، وحديثَ الرَّجُلَ امْرَأَتَهُ ، وحديث المرْأَةِ زوْجَهَا .

			 				 	

باب الحثَّ على التثُّبت فيما يقوله ويحكيه

قال اللَّه تعالى : { ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم } .

وقال تعالى: { ما يلفظ من قول إلا لديه رقيب عتيد } .

1547- وعنْ أبي هُريْرة رضي اللَّه عنْهُ أنَّ النبيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قال : « كفي بالمَرءِ كَذِباً أنْ يُحَدِّثَ بِكُلِّ ما سمعِ » رواه مسلم .

1548- وعن سمُرة رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قال رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « منْ حدَّث عنِّي بِحَدِيثٍ يرَى أنَّهُ كذِبٌ ، فَهُو أحدُ الكَاذِبين » رواه مسلم .

1549- وعنْ أسماءَ رضي اللَّه عنْها أن امْرأة قالَتْ : يا رَسُول اللَّه إنَّ لي ضرَّةَ فهل علَيَّ جناحٌ إنْ تَشبعْتُ من زوجي غيْرَ الذي يُعطِيني ؟ فقال النبيُّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « المُتشبِّعُ بِما لـم يُعْطَ كَلابِس ثَوْبَي زُورٍ » متفقٌ عليه .

المُتشبِّعُ : هو الذي يُظهرُ الشَّبع وليس بشبعان ، ومعناها هُنا : أنَّهُ يُظهرُ أنه حَصلَ له فضِيلةٌ وليْستْ حاصِلة . « ولابِس ثَوْبي زورٍ » أي : ذِي زُورٍ ، وهو الذي يزَوِّرُ على النَّاس ، بأن يَتَزَيَّى بِزيِّ أهل الزُّهدِ أو العِلم أو الثرْوةِ ، ليغْترَّ بِهِ النَّاسُ وليْس هو بِتِلك الصِّفةِ ، وقيل غَيْرُ ذلك واللَّه أعلم .

			 				 	

باب بيان غلظ تحريم شهادة الزور

قال اللَّه تعالى: { واجتنبوا قول الزور}.

قال اللَّه تعالى: { ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم }

وقال تعالى : { ما يلفظ من قول إلا لديه رقيب عتيد }

وقال تعالى: { إن ربك لبالمرصاد }

وقال تعالى: { والذين لا يشهدون الزور }

1550- وعن أبي بكْرةَ رضي اللَّه عَنْهُ قال : قالَ رسولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « ألا أُنبِّئكُم بأكبر الكَبائِر ؟ قُلنَا : بَلَى يا رسول اللَّهِ . قَالَ : « الإشراكُ باللَّه ، وعُقُوقُ الوالِديْنِ » وكان مُتَّكِئا فَجلَس ، فقال : « ألا وقَوْلُ الزُّورِ ، وشهادةُ الزورِ » فما زال يُكَرِّرُهَا حتى قلنا : لَيْتَهُ سكَت . متفق عليه .

1551- عن أبي زيْدٍ ثابتِ بنِ الضَّحاكِ الأنصاريِّ رضي اللَّه عنهُ ، وهو من أهْل بيْعةِ الرِّضوانِ قال : قَالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « من حَلَف عَلى يمِينٍ بِملَّةٍ غيْرٍ الإسْلامِ كاذباً مُتَعَمِّداً، فهُو كما قَالَ ، ومنْ قَتَل نَفسهُ بشيءٍ ، عُذِّب بِهِ يوْم القِيامةِ ، وَليْس على رجُلٍ نَذْرٌ فِيما لا يَملِكهُ ، ولعنُ المُؤْمِنِ كَقَتْلِهِ » متفقٌ عليه .

Chapter on the prohibition of backbiting and the command to guard one’s tongue

God Almighty said: {And do not backbite one another. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother, but you hated him! And fear God. Indeed, God is Forgiving and Merciful.

And God Almighty said: {And do not refrain from that of which you have no knowledge; Hearing, sight, and heart - all of these are responsible for Him.}

And God Almighty said: {Not a word does he utter but there is a watcher by him, ever present.} Know that every accountable person should guard his tongue from all speech except speech in which interest appears, and when speech is leveled and left out of interest, then the Sunnah is to abstain from it; Because permissible speech may lead to something forbidden or objectionable, and this is usually common, and safety is not equal to anything.

1511- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Whoever believes in God and the Last Day, let him speak good, or remain silent.” Agreed upon. This hadith is clear in that he should not speak unless the speech is good and his interest has become apparent, and if he doubts whether the interest will emerge, then he should not speak.

1512- On the authority of Abu Musa, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of God, which of the Muslims is better? He said: “He from whose tongue and hand the Muslims are safe.” Agreed.

1513- On the authority of Sahl bin Saad, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever guarantees for me what is between his two jaws and what is between his feet, I guarantee him Paradise.” Agreed upon.

1514- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that he heard the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: The servant utters a word as long as he is clear about it, he slides further into Hell. From what is between the East and the West.” Agreed upon.

The meaning of: “it becomes clear” is to consider whether it is good or not.

1515- And on his authority, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “The servant speaks a word that pleases God Almighty, whatever he attaches importance to it, God raises him in degrees for it, and if If a servant utters a word out of God Almighty’s displeasure, not paying attention to it, he will fall with it into Hell.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 1516- On the authority of Abu Abdul Rahman Bilal bin Al-Harith Al-Muzani, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A man speaks a word from the pleasure of God Almighty whatever he may be.” He thinks that she will attain what she has attained. God will record His satisfaction with her until the day he meets him. And a man utters a word out of God’s displeasure. He did not think that it would reach what it did. God records for him His displeasure with it until the day he meets him. Narrated by Malik in “Al-Muwatta’.” Al-Tirmidhi said: A good and authentic hadith.

1517- On the authority of Sufyan bin Abdullah, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of God, tell me something that I will adhere to. He said: “Say, ‘My Lord is God,’ then be upright.” I said: O Messenger of God, what Am I afraid of what you fear for me? So he took hold of himself, then said: “This.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good and authentic hadith.

1518- On the authority of Ibn Umar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Do not talk a lot without mentioning God, for too much talk without mentioning God Almighty hardens the heart, and the farthest people from God is the hard heart. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi.

1519- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever God protects from the evil between his two jaws and the evil between his two feet will enter Paradise.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: A good hadith.

1520- On the authority of Uqba bin Amer, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of God, what is salvation? He said: “Keep your tongue, and let your home be spacious for you, and cry over your sin.” Al-Tirmidhi narrated it and said: a good hadith. 1521- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “When the son of Adam wakes up in the morning, all the limbs will disbelieve the tongue, saying: Fear God regarding us. We are only in you: if you are upright, we will be upright, and if you are crooked, we will be crooked.” Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi.

The meaning of “to disbelieve the tongue”: that is, to humble yourself and submit to it. 1522- On the authority of Muadh, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of God, tell me about a deed that will bring me into Paradise and keep me away from Hell? He said: “You have asked about a great matter, and it is easy for whomever God Almighty has made easy for him: You worship God, not associating anything with Him, establishing prayer, paying zakat, and fasting.” Ramadan, and perform Hajj to the House if you are able to reach it. Then he said: “Shall I not guide you to the gates of goodness?” Fasting is a shield. “Charity extinguishes sin just as water extinguishes fire, and a man’s prayer in the middle of the night.” Then he recited: “Their sides should distance themselves from their beds” until it reached “they do” [prostration: 16]. Then he said: “Shall I not inform you of the head of the matter, its pillar, and the top of its hump?” I said: Yes, O Messenger of God. He said: “The head of the matter is Islam, and its pillar is prayer.” And the pinnacle of his hump is jihad.” Then he said: “Shall I not tell you the reason for all of that?” I said: Yes, O Messenger of God. So he took hold of his tongue and said: “Stop this.” I said: O Messenger of God, will we be held accountable for what we say? He said: May your mother be bereaved of you. Is there anything that throws people into Hell on their faces other than the jest of their tongues? “Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a good and authentic hadith, and it has been explained previously.

1523- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Do you know what backbiting is?” They said: God and His Messenger know best. He said: “He mentioned your brother in a way he disliked.” It was said: Have you seen what I say about my brother? He said: “If there is what you say, then you have backbited him, and if there is not what you say, then you have slandered him.” Narrated by Muslim.

1524- On the authority of Abu Bakra, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said in his sermon on the Day of Sacrifice in Mina during the Farewell Pilgrimage: “Your blood, your property and your honor are as sacred to you as they are on this day.” This, in this month of yours, in this country of yours, have you not conveyed the message? Agreed upon. 1525- And on the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: I said to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, “Suffice me from Safiyya so-and-so.” Some of the narrators said: It means short, so he said: “You said a word if it were mixed with water.” “I mixed the sea with it,” she said: “And I told him about a person, and he said: “I do not like to talk to someone, even though I have such-and-such.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A good and authentic hadith. The meaning of: “I mixed it” is to mix it in a mixture by which its taste or smell changes due to the intensity of its stench and ugliness. This is one of the most eloquent of backbiting of marriages. God Almighty said: {And he does not speak out of inclination. It is nothing but a revelation revealed.} [An-Najm: 4].

1526- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “When he was taken with me, I passed by people who had nails made of brass with which they scratched their faces and chests.” So I said: Who are these, O Gabriel? He said: These are the ones who eat people’s meat and treat their honor.” Narrated by Abu Dawud.

1527- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Everything of a Muslim is sacred to another Muslim: his blood, his honor, and his property.” Narrated by Muslim.

			 				 	

Chapter on the prohibition of hearing backbiting

Chapter on the prohibition of hearing backbiting

Anyone who hears forbidden backbiting is commanded to refute it and denounce the person who said it 

If he is unable or does not accept it, leave that gathering if possible 

God Almighty said: {And when they hear idle talk, they turn away from it.} And God Almighty said: {And those who turn away from idle talk}.

And God Almighty said: {Indeed, the hearing, the sight, and the heart - all of these are responsible for Him.}

And God Almighty said: {And when you see those who engage in Our verses, turn away from them until they engage in a different conversation, or Satan makes you forget, so do not sit after the remembrance with the wrongdoing people.}

1528- On the authority of Abu Al-Darda’, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Whoever averts the honor of his brother, God will avert the Fire from his face on the Day of Resurrection.” It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: a good hadith. 1529- On the authority of Itban bin Malik, may God be pleased with him, in his long and famous hadith mentioned above in the chapter on hope, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, stood up to pray and said: “Where is Malik bin Al-Dakhsham?” “A man said: That is a hypocrite who does not love God and His Messenger. Then the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Do not say that. Do you not see that he said: There is no god but God, meaning by that the face of God? And God has forbidden from Hellfire anyone who says: There is no god but God, seeking thereby the Face of God.” Agreed upon.

“And itban” with the well-known kasra of ‘ayn, and it was reported to be a dhammah, and after it there is a double ta’ from above, then a unified ba. And “Al-Dakhsham” with the dhammah of the dal, the housing of the khaa, and the dhammah of the two lexical shin.

1530- On the authority of Ka’b bin Malik, may God be pleased with him, in his long hadith in the story of his repentance, which he previously mentioned in the chapter on repentance. He said: The Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, said while he was sitting among the people in Tabuk: “What did Ka’b bin Malik do?” A man from Banu Salamah said: O Messenger of God, imprison him with his cloak and look into his clothes. So Muadh bin Jabal, may God be pleased with him, said to him: What you said was miserable, by God, O Messenger of God, we have only learned good about him, so the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, remained silent. Agreed upon.

“His kindness” is on his side, which is an indication of his admiration for himself. Chapter: Explaining what is permissible in backbiting

Chapter: Explaining what is permissible in backbiting

Know that backbiting is permitted for a valid, legitimate purpose that cannot be achieved without it, which are for six reasons:

The first is to file a grievance. It is permissible for the oppressed person to file a grievance with the ruler, the judge, and others who have authority or the ability to bring justice to him from his oppressor, and say: So-and-so has wronged me with such-and-such.

The second is to seek help in changing the evil and returning the sinner to the right path, so he says to someone who hopes to be able to remove the evil: So-and-so does such-and-such, so rebuke him for it, and so on, and his goal is to achieve the removal of the evil, and if he does not intend that, it is forbidden. The third is the fatwa, so he says to the mufti: My father, my brother, my husband, or so-and-so has wronged me with such-and-such, so does he have that right? What is my way to get rid of it, obtain my rights, and repel injustice? And so on, this is permissible out of necessity, but it is more prudent and better to say: What do you say about a man, person, or husband who was in such and such a situation? It achieves the purpose without specifying it. However, specifying it is permissible, as we will mention in the hadith of Hind (see Hadith No. 1532), God willing.

The fourth is to warn Muslims against evil and advise them, in many ways: Among them is criticizing narrators and witnesses, and this is permissible according to Muslim consensus, but rather obligatory due to need. This includes consultation regarding marriage with a person, sharing with him, depositing him, dealing with him, etc., or being close to him. The person being consulted must not hide his condition, but rather mention the disadvantages that he has with the intention of offering advice. Among them is if he sees a scholar who frequents an innovator or a sinner to take knowledge from him and is afraid that the scholar will be harmed by that, then he must advise him by explaining his situation on the condition that he intends advice, and this is something that is mistaken in it. The one who speaks of that may harbor envy and the devil will confuse it and make him think that it is advice, so he should be aware of that. Among them is that he has a guardianship that he does not fulfill in its proper form, either because he is not fit for it, or because he is a sinner or a fool, and so on. This must be mentioned to the one who has general guardianship over him so that he can remove him and appoint someone who is fit for it, or he learns of this from him so that he can treat him according to his condition and not be deceived by him, and that he should strive to encourage him to be upright or replace him.

The fifth is that he is open about his immorality or heresy, such as openly drinking alcohol, confiscating people, taking royalties, unjustly collecting money, and undertaking false matters. So it is permissible to mention him for what he is open about, and it is forbidden to mention him with other faults unless there is another reason for it being permissible than what we have mentioned. Sixth: Definition. If a person is known by a title such as the blind, the lame, the deaf, the blind, the cross-eyed, and others, it is permissible to identify them with that, and it is forbidden to use it in a derogatory way, and if it is possible to define it otherwise, it would be better.

These are six reasons mentioned by scholars, most of which are unanimously agreed upon. Its evidence is from the well-known authentic hadiths. It includes:

1531- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that a man asked permission to come to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: “Permit him, how miserable is the brother of the clan?” “Agreed upon. Al-Bukhari used it as evidence in the permissibility of the backbiting of corrupt people and people of doubt.

1532- On her authority, she said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “I do not think that so-and-so and so-and-so knows anything of our religion.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. Al-Layth bin Saad, one of the narrators of this hadith, said: These two men were hypocrites. 1533- On the authority of Fatima bint Qais, may God be pleased with her, she said: I came to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: Did Abu Al-Jahm and Muawiyah propose to me? Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “As for Muawiyah, he is a tramp who has no money, and as for Abu Al-Jahm, he does not bear the stick from his shoulders.” Agreed upon.

And in a narration by Muslim: “As for Abu al-Jahm, he is a beater for women,” which is an interpretation of the narration: “He does not take the staff from his shoulder,” and it was said that it means: he travels a lot. 1534 - On the authority of Zaid bin Arqam, may God be pleased with him, he said: We went out with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, on a journey during which the people were distressed, so Abdullah bin Ubayy said: Do not spend on those with the Messenger of God until they disperse, and he said: If We returned to Medina so that the more honorable would expel the weaker from it. So I went to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and informed him of that. He sent for Abdullah bin Ubayy, and he made every effort to swear an oath, saying what he did. They said: Zayd, the Messenger of God, lied. God, may God bless him and grant him peace, What they said became distressing to me until God Almighty revealed my belief: {When the hypocrites come to you} Then the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, called them to ask forgiveness for them, so they turned their heads. Agreed upon.

1535 - On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: Hind, Abu Sufyan’s wife, said to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace: Indeed, Abu Sufyan is a stingy man and he does not give me what is sufficient for me and my children except what I take from him, and he does not know? He said: “Take what is sufficient for you and your child on a reasonable basis.” Agreed upon. Chapter on the prohibition of gossip

It is the transmission of words between people about corruption

God Almighty said: {a gossipy gossip}.

And God Almighty said: {Not a word does he utter but there is a watcher by him, ever present.}

1536- On the authority of Hudhayfah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A slanderer will not enter Paradise.” Agreed upon. 1537- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, passed by two graves and said: “They are being tortured, and they are not being tortured for a major one. Indeed, it is a major one: as for one of them “He used to gossip, but the other one did not protect himself from his urine.”

Agreed upon, and this is the wording of one of Bukhari’s narrations.

The scholars said: Meaning: “And they will not be punished for anything major,” meaning it is major according to their claim, and it was said: It is major that he left it upon them. 1538- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Shall I not inform you what a bite is?” It is gossip and gossip among people.” Narrated by Muslim.

“Al-Adha”: by opening the neglected eye and making the diacritical dha’d silent, and with a ha’ according to the weight of the face. It was narrated: “al-adha” by breaking the eye and opening the dictionary dha’ according to the weight of the iddah, and it is: Lying and slander. According to the first narration: Al-adh is a noun. It is said: He bit him by biting him, meaning: He killed him by biting him. Chapter on the prohibition of transmitting hadiths and people’s speech

Chapter on the prohibition of transmitting hadiths and people’s speech

To those in charge if there is no need for it, such as fear of corruption and the like

God Almighty said: {And do not cooperate in sin and transgression}.

In the previous chapter, there are hadiths in the chapter before it.

1539- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “None of my companions inform me of anything about anyone, for I like to go out to you while I am of sound mind.” Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi. A two-faced chapter on slander

God Almighty said: {They make light of the people, but they do not make light of God, and He is with them, when they spend the night with what He does not approve of, and God is encompassing of what they do.} The two verses.

1540- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “You will find that people are diverse: the best of them in pre-Islamic times are the best of them in Islam if they understand jurisprudence, and you will find the best of the people in This is the matter they hate the most, and you will find that the evil of people is two-faced. Who comes to these with one face and to those with another.” Agreed upon.

1541 - And on the authority of Muhammad bin Zaid that people said to his grandfather Abdullah bin Amr, may God be pleased with them both: We go to our sultans and say to them the opposite of what we say when we leave them. He said: We used to count this. Hypocrisy against the covenant of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

			 				 	

Chapter on the prohibition of lying

God Almighty said: {And do not refrain from that of which you have no knowledge}.

And God Almighty said: {Not a word does he utter but there is a watcher by him, ever present.}

1542- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Indeed, honesty leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise, and a man speaks the truth until he is recorded with God.” truthful, and lying leads to immorality, and immorality leads to Hell. And a man will lie until he is written before God as a liar.” Agreed upon.

1543- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever has four qualities, is a pure hypocrite, and whoever has one of them, it is A characteristic of hypocrisy until he abandons it: If he is trusted, he betrays, when he speaks, he lies, when he makes a covenant, he betrays, and when he quarrels, he is ungrateful. Agreed upon.

We have previously explained it with the hadith of Abu Hurairah in a similar manner in “Chapter on Fulfilling the Covenant.” 1544- On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “Whoever has a dream that he has not seen, will be required to tie the knot between two rituals, and he will not do it, and whoever listens to the hadith of a people And they hated him. Anime will be poured into his ears on the Day of Resurrection, and whoever makes a picture will be tortured and asked to blow the spirit into it, but he is not one to blow it.’ Narrated by Al-Bukhari. “He dreamed” meaning: he said that he had a dream in his sleep and saw such-and-such, and he is a liar. “An-anak” is pluralized with the ḍammad, ḍammah of the ḍūn, and diminution of the kaf: which is melted lead.

1545- On the authority of Ibn Umar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “It is most likely that a man will show his eyes what they have not seen.”

Narrated by Al-Bukhari. Its meaning is: He says: I saw what he did not see.

1546- On the authority of Samurah ibn Jundub, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, would often say to his companions: “Has any of you seen a vision?” Then he can be told by whomever God wishes to be told. And he said to us one morning: “Two people came to me tonight, and they said to me: ‘Go,’ and I went with them. We came to a man who was lying down, and behold, another was standing over him. With a rock, and behold, he fell with the rock on his head, and his head was crushed, so the stone threatened him here. He follows the stone and takes it, and does not return to it until his head is healthy as it was, then he returns to it and does to it the same as he did the first time. He said: I said to them: Glory be to God, what are these two? They said to me: Go, go, so we set off. Then we came upon a man lying down on his back, and another man was standing over him with an iron collar, and he was approaching one of the two parts of his face, and his nostrils were splitting towards the back of his face, and his nostrils were spreading towards the back of his face. And his eye to the back of his head, Then he turns to the other side and does with it the same as he did with the first side. He does not finish that side until that side becomes healthy as it was, then he returns to it and does the same as what he did the first time. He said: I said: Glory be to God, what are these? They said to me: Go, go, so we set off. So we came to something like an oven, and I think he said: There was a murmur in it and noises. So we looked into it and, lo, there were naked men and women in it, and lo and behold, a flame came to them from below them, so lo! That flame came to them and they became silent. I said, “Who are these?” They said to me: Go, go, so we set off. So we came to a river. I thought he was saying: “Red like blood. And behold, in the river there was a man swimming. And behold, on the bank of the river there was a man who had gathered many stones. That swimmer swims as long as he swims, then the one who has gathered stones comes and opens his mouth to him, and he throws a stone at him, and he goes off and swims, then returns to him, whenever He returned to him, opened his mouth to him, and he threw a stone at him. I said to them: What are these two? They said to me: Go, go, so we set off. So we came across a man who hates the mirror, or you hate seeing a man who hates sight, and he had a fire burning it and running around it. I said to them: What is this? They said to me: Go, go, so we set off. So we came to a dark meadow with all the spring light in it, and behold, between the backs of the meadow was a tall man whose head I could hardly see as tall as it was in the sky. And when the man appeared, there were more than two boys I had ever seen. I said: What is this? What are these? They said to me: Go, go, so we went. So we came to a great city. I had never seen a city greater or better. They said to me: “Come up in it.” So we ascended in it, to a city built of bricks of gold and bricks of silver, so we came to the gate of the city. So we opened, and it was opened for us, so we entered it, and men met us: half of their creation was like the best of what you are seeing, and half of them was like the ugliest of what you are seeing. They said to them: Go and fall into that river, and behold, it was A stormy river flowed as if its pure water was white, so they went and fell into it. Then they returned to us, and that bad had gone from them, and they became in the best shape. He said: They said to me: This is the Garden of Eden, and this is your abode, so my sight went up, and when it became short, it was like a white cloud. They told me: This is your home. I said to them: May God bless you both, so he left me and let him in. They said: As for now, no, and you are inside it. I said to them: Have I seen something strange since tonight? What is this that you saw? They told me: We will tell you. As for the first man whom you came to who had his head cut off with a stone, he was the man who took the Qur’an and rejected it, and fell asleep without praying the obligatory prayer. As for the one whom you came to, his nose to the back of his mouth, his nostril to the back of his mouth, and his eyes to the back of his head, he is a man who goes out in the morning from his house and tells a lie that reaches far and wide. As for the naked men and women who are like the construction of an oven, they are adulterers and adulteresses. As for the man whom I came upon who was swimming in the river and throwing stones, he is a usurer. As for the man who hates the mirror, who is near the fire, stuffing it and running around it, then he is Malik, the keeper of Hell. As for the tall man in the garden, he is Abraham, and as for the children around him, every newborn died according to the fitrah. In Al-Barqani’s narration: “He was born according to the fitrah.” Some Muslims said: O Messenger of God, and the children of the polytheists? The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “And the children of the polytheists.” As for the people who were half good and half ugly, they are a people who mixed good deeds with bad deeds, and God overlooked them. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

In his narration: “Tonight I saw two men who came to me and took me out to a holy land,” then he mentioned it. He said: “So we went to a pit like an oven, the top of which was narrow and the bottom was wide, underneath which a fire was burning. When it rose, they rose until they almost came out, and when it died down, they returned to it, and there were men and women in it. Naked. And in it: Until we came upon a river of blood, and a man standing in the middle of the river had no doubt about it, and on the bank of the river was a man, with stones in his hands. Then the man in the river approached, and when he wanted to come out, the man threw a stone into his mouth, and it sent him back where he was. was, So, whenever he came to go out, he would throw a stone in its mouth, and it would return as it was. And in it: “So they took me up the tree and took me into a better house than I had never seen, in which there were old men and young men.” It contains: “The one whom I saw having his mouth torn open is a liar. He tells a lie and it is carried away from him until it reaches the horizons, and what you saw will be done to him until the Day of Resurrection.” It includes: “The one whom I saw having his head cut off was a man to whom God taught the Qur’an, but he slept without it at night and did not work on it during the day. This will be done to him until the Day of Resurrection.” The first house you entered was the house of the common believers, and as for this house, it is the house of the martyrs. I am Gabriel, and this is Michael, so raise your head. So I raised my head, and suddenly something like clouds appeared above me. They said: That is your house. I said: Let me enter my house. They said: You have a lifetime remaining that you have not completed. If you had completed it, I came to your house.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

His saying: “He makes his head triangular,” which is the triangular tha’a and the diagrammed ghayn, meaning: he makes it shorn and split open. His saying: “Yadhadhuh” means: he rolls over, and “Al-Kalub” is opened with the Kaf, and the stressed Lām is included, and it is well-known. His saying: “It will be split open” meaning: it will be cut off. His saying: “They made noise” is two lexical opposites, meaning they shouted. His saying: “And it is opened” is with the dictionary fa’ and ghayn, meaning: it opens. His saying: “the mirror” is with the opening of the meem, meaning: the view. His saying: “He fills it” is by opening the yā’ and adding the neglected haā and the accented shīn, meaning: he kindles it. His saying: “a dark garden” is by adding the mīm and placing the ayān in it, opening the ta’ and tightening the mīm, i.e.: the long plant is sufficient. His saying: “Doha” is with a fatḥah on the dal and a sukka for the waw and with the neglected haa: it is the big tree. His saying: “The pure” is with a fatḥah on the meem and a sukka with the neglected haa and with a dictionary dād: which is the milk. His saying: “So my sight increased,” meaning: it rose. “And ascending”: by including the “sad” and “ayn” meaning: ascending. “And the rababah”: with the rā’ opened and with the unified ba repeated, and it is the cloud.

			 				 	

Chapter: Explaining what is permissible to lie

Know that lying, even if its origin is forbidden, is permissible in some circumstances under conditions that I have explained in the book: “Al-Adhkār.” The brief of this is that speech is a means to achieving goals, so every goal is praiseworthy. It is possible to obtain it without lying, it is forbidden to lie about it, and if it is not possible to obtain it except by lying, it is permissible to lie. Then, if achieving that goal is permissible, then lying is permissible, and if it is obligatory, then lying is obligatory. If a Muslim hides from an oppressor who wants to kill him, or takes his money, hides his money, and is asked It is obligatory to lie in order to hide it, and likewise if he has a deposit and an unjust person wants to take it, he must lie in order to hide it. The safest thing in all of this is to make a deception, and the meaning of the pun is to mean by his statement a true purpose. He is not a liar in relation to him, even if he is a liar on the surface of the word. With regard to what the addressee understands, even if he abandons the pun and uses the phrase lying, it is not forbidden in this case.

The scholars cited the permissibility of lying in this case as evidence from the hadith of Umm Kulthum, may God be pleased with her, in which she heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: “The liar is not the one who reconciles with people, who promotes good or says good deeds.” “Good.” Agreed upon. Muslim added in a narration: “Umm Kulthum said: And I have not heard him give permission for anything that people say except for three: meaning: war, reconciliation between people, a man’s conversation with his wife, and a woman’s conversation with her husband.” .

			 				 	

Chapter: Encouragement to verify what he says and narrates

God Almighty said: {And do not refrain from that of which you have no knowledge}.

And God Almighty said: {Not a word does he utter but there is a watcher by him, ever present.} 1547- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “It is enough of a lie for a man to narrate everything he hears.” Narrated by Muslim.

1548- On the authority of Samurah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever narrates a hadith from me that he believes is a lie, then he is one of the liars.” Narrated by Muslim. 1549- And on the authority of Asmaa, may God be pleased with her, that a woman said: O Messenger of God, I have a wife, so is there any blame on me if I am satisfied with my husband other than what he gives me? The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The one who is satiated with what he was not given is like someone wearing false clothing.” Agreed upon.

The one who is satisfied: he is the one who appears to be full but is not full, and its meaning here is: he shows that he has attained a virtue but he has not achieved it. “And he who wears false clothing” means: he who is false, and he is the one who deceives people, by dressing up in the garb of people of asceticism, knowledge, or wealth, so that people may be deceived by him, but he is not of that quality, and it has been said otherwise, and God knows best.

			 				 	

Chapter: Explaining the severity of the prohibition of false testimony

God Almighty said: {And avoid false speech}. God Almighty said: {And do not refrain from that of which you have no knowledge}

And God Almighty said: {Not a word does he utter except that there is a watcher by him, ever present.}

And God Almighty said: {Indeed, your Lord is on the lookout}

And God Almighty said: {And those who do not bear witness to falsehood}

1550- On the authority of Abu Bakra, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Shall I not inform you of the greatest of the great sins?” We said: Yes, O Messenger of God. He said: “Associating partners with God and being disobedient to one’s parents.” He was reclining and sat up, so he said: “Except false speech and false witness.” He kept repeating it until we said: I wish he had kept silent. Agreed.

			 				 	

Chapter on the prohibition of cursing a person or an animal

1551- On the authority of Abu Zaid Thabit bin Al-Dahhak Al-Ansari, may God be pleased with him, who is one of the people of the Pledge of Allegiance of Al-Ridwan, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Whoever swears an oath to a religion other than Islam is a liar intentionally, It is as he said, And whoever kills himself with something, he will be punished for it on the Day of Resurrection, and no man is required to make a vow regarding what he does not own, and the curse of a believer is like killing him.” Agreed upon.

1552- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A friend should not be a curser.” Narrated by Muslim.
