Chapter on scattered things and salt

1808- On the authority of Al-Nawas bin Sam’an, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, mentioned the Antichrist one morning, and he was lowered and raised to the point that we thought he was in a group. The palm trees. When we went to him, he recognized that about us and said: “What is the matter with you? We said: O Messenger of God, you mentioned the Antichrist in the morning, so you lowered it and raised it, until we thought it was in a group of palm trees. He said: “It is someone other than the Antichrist who scares me about you. He comes out and I am among you, then I am his plea on behalf of you, and if he comes out and I am not among you, then every person is his own plea, and God is my successor over every Muslim. He is a young man with swollen eyes, as if I liken him to Abd al-Uzza ibn Qattan. Whoever of you recognizes him, let him recite the openings of Surat al-Kahf to him. He is Coming out of a desert between the Levant and Iraq, he moved to the right and to the left. O servants of God, be steadfast.” We said, O Messenger of God, why did he stay on earth? He said: “Forty days: one day like a year, one day like a month, one day like a Friday, and the rest of its days are like your days.” We said: O Messenger of God, on that day which was like a year, is one day’s prayer sufficient for us? He said: “No, give him what he deserves.” We said: O Messenger of God, what is his speed in the land? He said: “Like a rain that is driven back by the wind, so it comes upon the people, and they call upon them, and they believe in him, and they respond to him. So he commands the sky and it rains, and the earth to bring forth crops. So I will go upon them, making them as long as they have ever been, and as long as they are of udders, and as long as they are of loins. Then the people will come and call them, and they will respond to what he said, so he will leave them, and they will become deserted, with nothing of their wealth in their hands, and desolation will pass by. So he says to her: Bring out your treasures, and she follows him. Her treasures are like the bees’ dragonflies. Then he calls a man full of youth and strikes him with a sword, cutting him off. He shot the target twice, then they invited him, and he accepted, and his face lit up with laughter. While he was in this state, God Almighty sent the Messiah, the son of Mary, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he would camp at the white minaret east of Damascus, between Mahroudatin. He placed his palms on the wings of two angels. When he lowered his head, it dripped, and when he raised it, two pearls poured from it. It is not permissible for an infidel to smell the scent of his breath unless he dies. His breath ends where his limb ends, so he pursues him until he overtakes him at the gate of Lydda and kills him. Then Jesus, may God bless him and grant him peace, comes to a people whom God has protected from him, and he wipes their faces and tells them about their ranks in Paradise. While he was like this, God Almighty revealed to Jesus, may God bless him and grant him peace, that I had brought out my servants and no one would be blamed for fighting them, so bring my servants to the stage, and God will resurrect them. Gog and Magog, and they are descending from every direction, and the first of them will pass by Lake Tiberias and drink what is in it. The last of them will pass by and say: This time there was water. The Prophet of God Jesus, may God bless him and grant him peace, and his companions will be besieged until the head of a bull for one of them is better than a hundred dinars for one of you today, so the Prophet of God Jesus, may God bless him and grant him peace, desires May God bless him and grant him peace and his companions, may God be pleased with them, to God Almighty, and God Almighty will send upon them the plague on their necks, and they will become like the death of a single soul. Then the Prophet of God Jesus, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and his companions, may God be pleased with them, descend to the earth, and they will not find a place on the earth an inch apart that is not filled with their scum and their stench. Then the Prophet of God Jesus, may God bless him and grant him peace, and his companions, may God be pleased with them, wish to go to God Almighty, so God Almighty sends birds like the necks of a camel, and they carry them. So you throw them away as long as God wills, then God Almighty sends rain from which there will not be a house of mud or dander. He washes the ground until he leaves it slippery. Then it will be said to the earth: Grow your fruit, and return your blessing. On that day, the group will eat from the pomegranate, and they will take shade from its bark, and the messengers will be blessed until A flock of camels is sufficient for a group of people, a flock of cows is sufficient for a tribe of people, and a flock of sheep is sufficient for a thigh of people. They are like that when God Almighty sent a pleasant wind. Then it will seize them under their armpits, and will seize the soul of every believer and every Muslim, and the worst of people will remain therein cloying like redheads, and upon them the Hour will come.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Muslim. Muslim. His saying: “A path between the Levant and Iraq” means: a path between them. And his saying: “he wreaks havoc” refers to the neglected eye and the triangular thā’, and he wreaks: the most severe of corruption. “And the offspring”: including the abbreviated hump, which is the tops of the humps. It is the plural of a peak with a dhamal and a kasra. “And dragonflies”: male bees. “And two pieces,” meaning: two pieces, “and the target”: the target at which the crossbow is aimed, meaning: he throws it with a shot like an archer shoots at the target. “And the mahrudah” with the neglected lexical signifier, which is: the dyed garment. His saying: “He will not be judged” means: There will be no strength. “And nagf”: worm. “And my horse”: the plural of faris, which is the killed one: and “al-Zalqa” with the opening of the za’i and the lam and the endowments, and “al-Zalfa” was narrated with the dhammah of the za’i and the saknah of the lam and with the fa’, which is the mirror. “And the gang”: the group, “and the messengers” with a kasra on the rā’: the laban, “and the lāḥah”: the labun, “and the fa’am” with a kasra on the fa’ and followed by a hamza: the group. “And the thigh” is from the people: not the tribe.

1809 - On the authority of Rab’i bin Harash, he said: I set out with Abu Masoud Al Ansari to Hudhayfah bin Al Yaman, may God be pleased with them, and Abu Masoud said to him, “Tell me what you heard from the Messenger of God.” God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said about the Antichrist: “The Antichrist will emerge and with him are water and fire. As for what people see as water, it will burn as fire. As for what people see as fire, fresh cold water, So whoever of you reaches it, let him fall into what he sees as fire, for it is fresh and good water.” Abu Masoud said: And I heard him. Agreed upon.

1810- On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The Antichrist will emerge among my nation and stay for forty. I do not know for forty.” A day, or forty months, or forty years, Then God Almighty will send Jesus, son of Mary, may God bless him and grant him peace, and search for him and destroy him. Then the people will remain for seven years, with no enmity between the two.

Then God, Almighty and Majestic, will send a cold wind from the Levant, and not a single person will remain on the face of the earth who has an atom’s weight of goodness or faith in his heart, but it will take hold of him, until If one of you were to enter the heart of a mountain, you would enter it until you took it. So the worst of people remain in the fear of birds and the dreams of wild beasts. They do not recognize what is right, nor do they deny what is wrong. Then Satan appears to them and says: Will you not respond? They say: What do you command us to do? So he commands them to worship idols, and in that they are provided with a good source of livelihood. Then the trumpet is blown, and no one hears it except one who listens a litte and raises a litte, and the first to hear it is a man who strokes his camel’s pelvis, and he is shocked and stuns the people around him. Then God sends or said : God sends down rain as if it were dew or shadow, and the bodies of the people grow from it. Then He blows upon it another, and lo, they are standing and looking. Then it will be said, O people, come to your Lord, and stop them. They will be questioned. Then it will be said: Bring out the fire-breathing, and it will be said: From how many? It is said: Out of every thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine. That is a day when children will turn grey, and that is a day when a shin will be uncovered. Narrated by Muslim.

“Al-Layt” is the neck, which means: He places the neck of his neck and raises the other. 1811- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There is no land that the Antichrist will not trample except Mecca and Medina, and not one of their necks can be broken.” Except that the angels will stand guard over him, and he will descend upon the marsh, and the city will shake with three tremors, and God will expel from it every infidel and hypocrite.” Narrated by Muslim. 1812- And on the authority of him, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Seventy thousand of the Jews of Isfahan will follow the Antichrist, wearing talayas.” Narrated by Muslim.

1813- On the authority of Umm Sharik, may God be pleased with her, that she heard the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: “The people will flee from the Antichrist in the mountains.” Narrated by Muslim. 1814- On the authority of Imran bin Husayn, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: “Whatever comes between the creation of Adam and the arrival of the Hour is a matter greater than the Antichrist.” Narrated by Muslim. .

1815- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “The Antichrist will emerge, and a man from among the believers will go before him, and Al-Maslih will meet him: the Antichrist’s weapons. They say to him: Where are you going? He says: Go to this one who came out. They say to him: Do you not believe in our Lord? He says: Our Lord is not secret. They say: Kill him. Then some of them say to one another: Has not your Lord forbidden you from killing anyone besides Him? So they take him to the Antichrist. When the believer sees him, he says: O you. The people: This is the antichrist that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, mentioned. The antichrist will order him to go and make him ghost, and say: Take him and stab him, so his back and stomach will expand. beaten, He says: Do you not believe in me? Then he will say: You are the false Messiah. He will be ordered to do so, and he will be pointed with a saw at the two sides until his legs are separated. Then the Antichrist will walk between the two pieces, then He says to him: Stand up, and he stands upright. Then he says to him: Do you believe in me? He will say: I have only increased your insight. Then he will say: O people, this will not be done to any of the people after me. Then the Antichrist takes him to slaughter him, and makes God has copper between his neck and his collarbone, but he cannot find a way to it, so he takes it with his hands and feet and throws it, and the people think that he has thrown him into the fire. Rather, he was thrown into Paradise. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “This is the person with the greatest testimony before the Lord of the Worlds.” Narrated by Muslim.

Al-Bukhari narrated some of it with its meaning. “The Armed Forces”: They are the sentries and the vanguards.

1816- On the authority of Al-Mughirah bin Shu’bah, may God be pleased with him, he said: No one asked the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, about the Antichrist more than I asked him, and he said to me: “What will harm you?” “I said: They say: He has with him a mountain of bread and a river of water. He said: “It is easier for God than that.” Agreed upon.

1817- On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: There is no prophet but that he warned his nation about the one-eyed liar. Indeed, he is one-eyed, and indeed your Lord. The Almighty is not one-eyed. Between his eyes is written “K F R.” Agreed upon. 1818- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Shall I not tell you a story about the Antichrist that a prophet told his people about? He is one-eyed. And he brings with him an example of heaven and hell, for what he says is heaven is hell. Agreed upon.

1819- On the authority of Ibn Umar, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, mentioned the Antichrist in the presence of people, and said: “God is not one-eyed, but the Antichrist is the Messiah.” He is blind in his right eye, as if his eye were a floating grape. Agreed upon. 1820- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The Hour will not come until the Muslims fight the Jews, until the Jew hides from Behind the stone and the tree, and the stone and the tree say: O Muslim, this is a Jew behind me, come and kill him. Except for the girqad, for it is one of the trees of the Jews. Agreed upon. 1821- On the authority of him, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, the world will not pass away until a man passes by the grave and wallows in it. And he says: “I wish I were in the place of the owner of this grave, who has no religion and nothing but affliction.” Agreed upon.

1822- On his authority, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The Hour will not come until the Euphrates reveals a mountain of gold to be fought over. Then ninety-nine out of every hundred will be killed, and every man among them will say: Perhaps I will be saved.”

And in a narration: “The Euphrates is about to reveal a treasure of gold, so whoever is present at it should not take anything from it.” Agreed upon. 1823- On his authority, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: “They will leave Medina as good as it was, and only the wild animals will cover it.” He means: the wild beasts’ wild animals. The bird and the last to be gathered are two shepherds from Muzina who go to the city to croak at its sheep, but find them to be beasts. Until when they reached the farewell fold, they fell on their faces.” Agreed upon.

1824- On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There will be a caliph from your caliphs at the end of time who will scramble for money and not count it.” Narrated by Muslim. 1825- On the authority of Abu Musa Al-Ash’ari, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A time will come upon the people in which a man will go around giving alms of gold, but he will not find anyone.” He takes it from him, and sees one man followed by forty women, who take pleasure in him due to the scarcity of men and the large number of women.” Narrated by Muslim. 1826- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, he said: “A man bought a property from another man, and the one who bought the property found in his property a jar in it.” Gold. The one who bought the property said to him: Take your gold. I only bought the land from you, and I did not buy the gold. The one who had the land said: I sold you the land and everything in it. So they spoke to a man, and the one to whom they had referred to said: Do you have a child? One of them said: I have a boy. The other said: I have a slave girl. He said, “They married the boy to the slave girl, and they spent on themselves from him and gave in charity.” Agreed upon.

1827- On his authority, may God be pleased with him, he heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, saying: “There were two women with their sons. The wolf came and took the son of one of them, so she said To her friend: He only took your son, and the other said: He only took your son. So they took the case to David, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he was judged by the elder. So they went out to Suleiman bin Dawud, may God bless him and grant him peace, and told him, and he said: Bring me a knife and I will cut it between them. The younger one said: Do not do that, may God have mercy on you. He is her son, so a ruling was given to him for the younger one. Agreed upon.

1828 - On the authority of Mirdas Al-Aslami, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The first righteous will go away, then the first, and scum will remain like the scum of barley or dates. God cares about them.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 1829- On the authority of Rifa’ah bin Rafi’ al-Zarqi, may God be pleased with him, he said: Gabriel came to the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, and said: What do you consider the people of Badr to be among you? He said: “One of the best Muslims” or something similar. He said: “And likewise one of the angels who witnessed a full moon.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1830 - On the authority of Ibn Umar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “If God Almighty sends down a torment upon a people, the torment will befall whoever is among them.” Then they were sent to do their work.” Agreed upon.

1831- On the authority of Jabir, may God be pleased with him, he said: There was a log to which the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was standing, meaning during the sermon. When the pulpit was set, we heard the log like the voice of a tax collector. Until the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, came down and put his hand on him and he calmed down.

And in a narration: When it was Friday, the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, sat on the pulpit, and the palm tree by which he was delivering his sermon shouted until it almost burst. And in a narration: She shouted like a boy. Then the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, came down and took her and held her to him, so she began to moan like the boy’s moans that were silenced until she settled down. He said: “She cried over what she was hearing from the remembrance.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 1832- On the authority of Abu Tha’labah al-Khushani, Jurthum ibn Nashir, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, who said: God Almighty has imposed obligations, so do not neglect them. He has set limits, so do not You transgress it, and He forbids certain things, so do not transgress them, and He remains silent about certain things out of mercy for you, not out of forgetfulness, so do not search for them.” A good hadith, narrated by Al-Daraqutni and others. 1833- On the authority of Abdullah bin Abi Awfi, may God be pleased with them, he said: We fought seven battles with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, eating locusts. And in a narration: We eat locusts with him, agreed upon.

1834- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “A believer is not stung from a hole twice.” Agreed upon. 1835- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “There are three to whom God will not speak on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He look at them, nor will He purify them, and for them will be a painful punishment: A man owed a surplus of water in the desert, which prevented him from traveling, and a man sold a commodity to a man after the hardship, so he swore to God that he would get it for such-and-such, and he believed him. He is on a different path than that, and a man who pledged allegiance to an imam does not pledge allegiance to him except for a worldly life. If he gives him some of it, he will fulfill it. And if he does not give him some of it, he will not fulfill it.” Agreed upon.

1836- On his authority, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, he said: “There are forty days between the two blasts.” They said, “O Abu Hurairah, forty days?” He said: I refused. They said: Forty years? He said: I refused. They said: Forty months? He said: I refuse. “And everything of man will be destroyed except the tailbone, in which creation will be put together. Then God will send down water from the sky, and they will grow as it grows.” Al-Baqul” Agreed upon.

1837- On his authority, he said: While the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, was in a gathering speaking to the people, a Bedouin came to him and said: When is the hour? So the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, went on to speak, and some of the people said: He heard what he said, but he disliked what he said, and some of them said: Rather, he did not listen, even when he decided His hadith said: “Where is the one who asked about the Hour? He said: Here I am, O Messenger of God. He said: If the trust is lost, wait for the Hour. He said: How was it lost? He said: If the matter is entrusted to people other than those who deserve it, then wait for the Hour.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. 1838- On his authority, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “They will pray for you. If they are correct, then it is yours, and if they make a mistake, then it is for you and against them.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1839- And on the authority of him, may God be pleased with him: {You are the best nation ever brought forth for mankind}. He said: The best people for people are those who bring them in chains around their necks until they enter Islam. 1840- And on his authority, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, he said: “God Almighty is astonished at a people who enter Paradise in chains.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari. It means they will be captured and tied, then they will be delivered and enter Paradise.

1841- On the authority of him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, he said: “The most beloved of the countries to God are its mosques, and the most hated of the countries to God are its markets.” Narrated by Muslim. 1842- On the authority of Salman Al-Farisi, may God be pleased with him, who said: If you are able, do not be the first to enter the market, nor the last to leave it, for it is The battle of Satan, and in it he sets up his banner. Narrated by Muslim like this.

It was narrated by Al-Barqani in his Sahih on the authority of Salman, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Do not be the first to enter the market, nor the last to leave it, for there is whiteness in it.” Satan and his spawn. 1843- On the authority of Asim Al-Ahwal, on the authority of Abdullah bin Sarjis, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace: O Messenger of God, may God forgive you. He said: “And to you.” » Asim said: So I said to him: Has the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, asked forgiveness for you? He said: Yes, and for you, then he recited this verse: {And ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women} [Muhammad: 19], narrated by Muslim. 1844- On the authority of Abu Masoud Al-Ansari, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “One of the things people have learned from the words of the first prophecy is: If you are not ashamed, then do… Whatever you want.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1845- On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The first thing that will be judged among the people on the Day of Resurrection will be bloodshed.” Agreed upon. 1846- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “The angels were created from light, and the jinn were created from a spark of fire. Adam was created from what was described to you.” Narrated by Muslim.

1847- On her authority, may God be pleased with her, she said: “The character of the Prophet of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was the Qur’an.” Narrated by Muslim in a long hadith. 1848- On her authority, she said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever loves meeting God, God will love meeting Him, and whoever hates meeting God, God hates meeting Him.” So I said: O Messenger of God, the hatred of death? We all hate death. He said: “It is not like that, but when the believer is given good news of God’s mercy, His contentment, and His Paradise, he loves meeting God. So God loves meeting Him, even though When the infidel is given good news of God’s punishment and wrath, He hated meeting God, and God hated meeting him.” Narrated by Muslim.

1849- On the authority of the Mother of the Believers, Safiya bint Huyayy, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was in seclusion, so I came to visit him at night. So I spoke to him, then I got up to turn around, so he stood with me to turn me around, and two men from the Ansar, may God be pleased with them, passed by, and when they saw the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, they hurried. Then he, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “On your messengers. She is Safiya bint Huyay.” They said: Glory be to God, O Messenger of God. He said: “Indeed, Satan runs from the son of Adam.” The flow of blood, and I feared that he might throw evil into your hearts or say something.” Agreed upon. 1850- On the authority of Abu al-Fadl al-Abbas bin Abdul Muttalib, may God be pleased with him, he said: I witnessed with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, on the day of Hunayn, so I and Abu Sufyan bin al-Harith joined forces. Ibn Abd al-Muttalib, the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, we did not leave him, and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was on a white mule of his. When the Muslims and the polytheists met, the Muslims turned away, then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, began running his mule ahead of the infidels, while I was holding the reins. The mule of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was holding its hands, wanting it not to speed up, and Abu Sufyan was riding the riders of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace. Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Abbas, call the people of the Samura.” Al-Abbas said, and he was a man of good reputation. So I said at the top of my voice: Where are the people of the Samura? By God, it was as if they had compassion when they heard my two voices, the compassion of cows for their young, and they said: O Lord, O Lord, so they and the infidels fought. And the supplication among the Ansar is that they say: O community of Ansar, O community of Ansar, Then the call was limited to Banu Al-Harith bin Al-Khazraj.

Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, looked at their fighting as he was riding his mule like it was being attacked and said: “This is when the battle became heated.” Then the Messenger of God took God, may God bless him and grant him peace, threw pebbles and threw them in the faces of the infidels, then said: “They have been defeated, by the Lord of Muhammad.” So I went to look and saw the fighting in what it looked like. I see, by God, he only threw his pebbles at them. I still see their borders as blunt, and their affairs as turning away. Narrated by Muslim.

“Al-Watis” is the oven. It means: The war has intensified. And his saying: “He defined them” is with the neglected H, meaning: with their arrows.

1851- On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “O people, God is good and does not accept anything but that which is good, and God has commanded the believers to do what He has commanded.” Through it the messengers, Then God Almighty said: {O you messengers, eat of the good things and do righteousness} And God Almighty said: {O you who have believed, eat of the good things We have provided for you} Then He mentioned A man who travels for a long time, disheveled and dusty, extends his hands to the sky saying, “O Lord, O Lord,” and his food is forbidden, his drink is forbidden, his clothing is forbidden, and he is fed with forbidden things. How will he be answered? So,? “Narrated by Muslim. 1852- On the authority of him, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “There are three to whom God will not speak on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them, nor will He look at them.” And for them is a painful punishment: an adulterous old man, a lying king, and an arrogant breadwinner.” Narrated by Muslim. “The breadwinner”: the poor person.

1853- On the authority of him, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Sihan, Jihan, the Euphrates, and the Nile are all of the rivers of Paradise.” Narrated by Muslim.

1854- On his authority, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, took my hand and said: “God created the soil on Saturday, and created the mountains in it on Sunday, and created the trees on Monday, and created the hateful thing on Tuesday, He created light on Wednesday, and He spread the animals in it on Thursday, and He created Adam, may God bless him and grant him peace, after the afternoon prayer on Friday, at the end of creation, at the end of creation. “An hour of the day between the afternoon and the night.” Narrated by Muslim.

1855- On the authority of Abu Suleiman Khalid bin Al-Walid, may God be pleased with him, he said: “Nine swords were cut off from my hand on the day of Mu’tah, so all that remained in my hand was a Yemeni plate.” Narrated by him. Bukhari. 1856- On the authority of Amr ibn Al-Aas, may God be pleased with him, that he heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, say: “If the ruler makes a ruling, and he strives hard, and then he is correct, then he will have two rewards, even if he rules.” He worked hard, but made a mistake, so he will have a reward.” Agreed upon. 1857- On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that the Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, said: “Fever is from the breath of Hell, so cool it with water.” Agreed upon.

1858- On the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, he said: “Whoever dies and is obligated to fast, his guardian will fast on his behalf.” Agreed upon.

What is chosen is that it is permissible to fast on behalf of one who has died and is required to fast, according to this hadith. What is meant by a guardian is a relative, whether heir or not. 1859- On the authority of Awf bin Malik bin Al-Tufayl that Aisha, may God be pleased with her, narrated that Abdullah Ibn Al-Zubair, may God be pleased with them, said regarding a sale or a gift, she gave him Aisha, may God Almighty be pleased with her: By God, Aisha will stop, or I will be quarantined. She said: Did he say this? They said: Yes, she said: He is, to God I have made a vow never to speak to Ibn al-Zubayr, so Ibn al-Zubayr sought intercession for her when the migration took a long time. She said: No, by God, I will never intercede on his behalf, nor will I break my vow. When this took a long time for Ibn al-Zubayr, he spoke to al-Miswar ibn Makhramah and Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Aswad ibn Abd Yaghuth and said to them: I adjure you by God when you brought me into Aisha, may God be pleased with her, for it is not permissible for her to break my oath, so Al-Miswar and Abd Al-Rahman accepted it and asked for permission from Aisha, and they said: May God’s peace, mercy, and blessings be upon you. Shall we enter? Aisha said: Come in. They said: All of us? She said: Yes, all of you, enter, and you do not know that Ibn al-Zubayr is with them. When they entered, Ibn al-Zubayr entered the veil and embraced Aisha, may God be pleased with her. He began pleading with her and crying, and Al-Miswar and Abd al-Rahman began pleading with her unless she spoke to him and she accepted from him, and they said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, forbade what she had learned from Immigration. It is not permissible for a Muslim to abandon his brother for more than three nights. When they made a lot of mention and embarrassment to Aisha, she began to remember them and cry, saying: I made a vow and the vow was severe, and they did not stop her until she spoke. Ibn al-Zubayr. She freed forty slaves as part of her vow, and she would remember her vow after that and cry until her tears wet her veil. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

1860- On the authority of Uqba bin Aamir, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, went out to kill Uhud. He prayed over them after eight years, like one bidding farewell to the living and the dead, then he went out to the pulpit and said: I am in your presence and I am a witness over you, and your appointment is the basin, and I am looking at it from This is my position, and I do not fear that you will associate others with others. But I fear for you the world, lest you compete with it.” He said: “It was the last look I took at the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace.” Agreed upon.

And in a narration: “But I fear for you in this world, that you will compete in it and fight each other and perish as those before you perished.” Uqba said: That was the last I saw the Messenger of God. May God bless him and grant him peace on the pulpit. In a narration, he said: “I am in need of you and I am a witness over you. By God, I am looking at my pool now. Indeed, I have been given the keys to the treasures of the earth, or the keys of the earth. By God, I have not “I fear for you to join others after me, but I fear for you to compete in it.”

What is meant by praying for someone who has been killed is praying for them, not the proper prayer. 1861- On the authority of Abu Zaid Amr bin Akhtab Al-Ansari, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, led us in the dawn prayer, and ascended the pulpit, and addressed us until It was noon, so he went down and prayed. Then he ascended the pulpit and delivered a sermon

label:
باب الاستغفار

قال اللَّه تعالى: { واستغفر لذنبك وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات}

وقال تعالى: { واستغفر اللَّه إن اللَّه كان غفوراً رحيماً }

وقال تعالى: { فسبح بحمد ربك واستغفره إنه كان تواباً }

وقال تعالى: { للذين اتقوا عند ربهم جنات } إلى قوله عز وجل { والمستغفرين بالأسحار }

وقال تعالى: { ومن يعمل سوءاً أو يظلم نفسه ثم يستغفر اللَّه يجد اللَّه غفوراً رحيماً }

وقال تعالى: { وما كان اللَّه ليعذبهم وأنت فيهم، وما كان اللَّه معذبهم وهم يستغفرون }

وقال تعالى: { والذين إذا فعلوا فاحشة أو ظلموا أنفسهم ذكروا اللَّه فاستغفروا لذنوبهم، ومن يغفر الذنوب إلا اللَّه ولم يصروا على ما فعلوا وهم يعلمون }

والآيات في الباب كثيرة معلومة.

1869 وَعن الأَغَرِّ المُزَنيِّ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « إِنَّهُ لَيُغَانُ على قَلْبي ، وَإِني لأَسْتغْفِرُ اللَّه في الْيوْمِ مِئَةَ مرَّةٍ » رواهُ مُسلِم .

1870- وعنْ أَبي هُريْرة رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ قَال : سمِعْتُ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يقُولُ : « واللَّهِ إِنِّي لأَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّه وأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ في الْيَوْمِ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سبْعِينَ مَرَّةً » رواه البخاري .

1871- وعنْهُ رَضِي اللَّه عنْهُ قَال : قَال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « والَّذي نَفْسِي بِيدِهِ لَوْ لَمْ تُذْنِبُوا ، لَذَهَب اللَّه تَعَالى بِكُمْ ، ولجاءَ بقَوْمٍ يُذْنِبُونَ فَيَسْتَغْفِرُونَ اللَّه تَعالى فَيغْفِرُ لهمْ » رواه مسلم .

1872- وعَنِ ابْنِ عُمر رضِي اللَّه عَنْهُما قَال : كُنَّا نَعُدُّ لِرَسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم في المجلِس الْواحِدِ مائَةَ مرَّةٍ : « ربِّ اغْفِرْ لي ، وتُبْ عليَ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوابُ الرَّحِيمُ » رواه أبو داود ، والترمذي ، وقال : حديث صحيح .

1873- وعنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُما قَال : قالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « منْ لَزِم الاسْتِغْفَار ، جعل اللَّه لَهُ مِنْ كُلِّ ضِيقٍ مخْرجاً ، ومنْ كُلِّ هَمٍّ فَرجاً ، وَرَزَقَهُ مِنْ حيْثُ لا يَحْتَسِبُ » رواه أبو داود .

1874- وعنِ ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قال رسُولُ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « منْ قال : أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّه الذي لا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُو الحيَّ الْقَيُّومَ وأَتُوبُ إِلَيهِ ، غُفِرَتْ ذُنُوبُهُ وإِنْ كَانَ قَدْ فَرَّ مِنَ الزَّحْفِ » رواه أبو داود والترمذي والحاكِمُ ، وقال : حدِيثٌ صحيحٌ على شَرْطِ البُخَارِيِّ ومُسلمٍ .

1875- وعنْ شَدَّادِ بْنِ أَوْسٍ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ عن النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قالَ : « سيِّدُ الاسْتِغْفار أَنْ يقُول الْعبْدُ : اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي ، لا إِلَه إِلاَّ أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَني وأَنَا عَبْدُكَ ، وأَنَا على عهْدِكَ ووعْدِكَ ما اسْتَطَعْتُ ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ ما صنَعْتُ ، أَبوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمتِكَ علَيَ ، وأَبُوءُ بذَنْبي فَاغْفِرْ لي ، فَإِنَّهُ لا يغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبِ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ . منْ قَالَهَا مِنَ النَّهَارِ مُوقِناً بِهَا ، فَمـاتَ مِنْ يوْمِهِ قَبْل أَنْ يُمْسِيَ ، فَهُو مِنْ أَهْلِ الجنَّةِ ، ومَنْ قَالَهَا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ وهُو مُوقِنٌ بها فَمَاتَ قَبل أَنْ يُصْبِح ، فهُو مِنْ أَهْلِ الجنَّةِ » رواه البخاري .

« أَبُوءُ » : بباءٍ مضْمومةٍ ثُمَّ واوٍ وهمزَةٍ مضمومة ، ومَعْنَاهُ : أَقِرُّ وَأَعترِفُ .

1876- وعنْ ثوْبانَ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ قَال : كَانَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم إِذا انْصرفَ مِنْ صلاتِهِ، استَغْفَر اللَّه ثَلاثاً وقَالَ : « اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلامُ ، ومِنْكَ السَّلامُ ، تَباركْتَ ياذَا الجلالِ والإِكْرامِ » قيلَ لِلأوزاعِيِّ ­ وهُوَ أَحدُ رُوَاتِهِ ­ : كَيْفَ الاسْتِغْفَارُ ؟ قَال : يقُولُ : أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّه ، أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّه . رواه مسلم .

1877- وعَنْ عَائِشَةَ رَضي اللَّه عنْهَا قَالَتْ : كَانَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يُكْثِرُ أَنْ يَقُولَ قَبْل موْتِهِ : « سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ وبحمْدِهِ ، أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّه وأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ » متفقٌ عليه .

1878- وَعَنْ أَنسٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ قالَ : سمِعْتُ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم يَقُولُ : « قالَ اللَّه تَعَالى : يا ابْنَ آدَمَ إِنَّكَ ما دَعَوْتَني ورجوْتَني غفرتُ لَكَ على ما كَانَ منْكَ وَلا أُبَالِي ، يا ابْنَ آدم لَوْ بلَغَتْ ذُنُوبُك عَنَانَ السَّماءِ ثُم اسْتَغْفَرْتَني غَفرْتُ لَكَ وَلا أُبالي ، يا ابْنَ آدم إِنَّكَ لَوْ أَتَيْتَني بِقُرابٍ الأَرْضِ خطايَا ، ثُمَّ لَقِيتَني لا تُشْرِكُ بي شَيْئاً ، لأَتَيْتُكَ بِقُرابِها مَغْفِرَةً » رواه الترمذي وقَالَ : حَدِيثٌ حَسَنٌ .

« عنان السَّمَاءِ » بِفَتْحِ العيْنِ : قِيل : هُو السَّحَابُ ، وقِيل : هُوَ مَا عنَّ لَكَ مِنْها ، أَيْ: ظَهَرَ ، و « قُرَابُ الأَرْضِ » بِضَمِّ القافِ ، ورُويَ بِكَسْرِهَا ، والضَّمُّ أَشْهَرُ ، وهُو ما يُقَاربُ مِلْئَهَا .

1879- وَعنِ ابنِ عُمَرَ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُما أَنَّ النَّبيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَال : « يا معْشَرَ النِّساءِ تَصَدَّقْنَ، وأَكْثِرْنَ مِنَ الاسْتِغْفَارِ ، فَإِنِّي رَأَيْتُكُنَّ أَكْثَرَ أَهْلِ النَّارِ » قالَتِ امْرَأَةٌ مِنْهُنَّ : مالَنَا أَكْثَرَ أَهْلِ النَّارِ ؟ قَالَ : « تُكْثِرْنَ اللَّعْنَ ، وتَكْفُرْنَ العشِيرَ مَا رأَيْتُ مِنْ نَاقِصَاتِ عقْلٍ ودِينٍ أَغْلبَ لِذِي لُبٍّ مِنْكُنَّ » قَالَتْ : ما نُقْصانُ الْعقْل والدِّينِ ؟ قال : « شَهَادَةُ امرأَتَيْنِ بِشهَادةِ رجُلٍ ، وتَمْكُثُ الأَيَّامَ لا تُصَلِّي » رواه مسلم .

	 		 	

باب بيان ما أعدّ الله تعالى للمؤمنين في الجنة

قال اللَّه تعالى:{ إن المتقين في جنات وعيون، ادخلوها بسلام آمنين، ونزعنا ما في صدورهم من غل، إخواناً على سرر متقابلين، لا يمسهم فيها نصب وما هم منها بمخرجين }

وقال تعالى: { يا عباد لا خوف عليكم اليوم ولا أنتم تحزنون، الذين آمنوا بآياتنا وكانوا مسلمين، ادخلوا الجنة أنتم وأزواجكم تحبرون، يطاف عليهم بصحاف من ذهب وأكواب، وفيها ما تشتهيه الأنفس وتلذ الأعين وأنتم فيها خالدون، وتلك الجنة التي أورثتموها بما كنتم تعملون، لكم فيها فاكهة كثيرة منها تأكلون } 

وقال تعالى: { إن المتقين في مقام أمين، في جنات وعيون، يلبسون من سندس وإستبرق متقابلين، كذلك وزوجناهم بحور عين، يدعون فيها بكل فاكهة آمنين، لا يذوقون فيها الموت إلا الموتة الأولي، ووقاهم عذاب الجحيم، فضلاً من ربك؛ ذلك هو الفوز العظيم }

وقال تعالى: { إن الأبرار لفي نعيم، على الأرائك ينظرون، تعرف في وجوههم نضرة النعيم، يسقون من رحيق مختوم، ختامه مسك وفي ذلك فليتنافس المتنافسون، ومزاجه من تسنيم، عيناً يشرب بها المقربون}

والآيات في الباب كثيرة معلومة.

1880- وعنْ جَابِرٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ قَالَ : قَالَ رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « يَأْكُلُ أَهْلُ الجنَّةِ فِيهَا ويشْرَبُونُ ، ولا يَتَغَوَّطُونَ ، ولا يمْتَخِطُونَ ، ولا يبُولُونَ ، ولكِنْ طَعامُهُمْ ذلكَ جُشَاء كَرشْحِ المِسْكِ يُلهَمُونَ التَّسبِيح وَالتكْبِير ، كَما يُلْهَمُونَ النَّفَسَ » رواه مسلم .

1881- وعَنْ أَبي هُريْرةَ رضِيَ اللَّه عنْهُ قَال : قَال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « قَال اللَّه تَعالَى: أَعْددْتُ لعِبادِيَ الصَّالحِينَ مَا لاَ عيْنٌ رَأَتْ ، ولاَ أُذُنٌ سَمِعتْ ولاَ خَطَرَ علَى قَلْبِ بَشَرٍ ، واقْرؤُوا إِنْ شِئتُمْ : { فَلا تَعْلَمُ نَفْسٌ ما أُخْفِيَ لَهُمْ مِنْ قُرَّةِ أَعْيُنٍ جزَاءً بِما كَانُوا يعْملُونَ } [ السجدة : 17 ] متفقٌ عليه .

1882- وعَنْهُ قَالَ : قال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « أَوَّلُ زُمْرَةٍ يدْخُلُونَ الْجنَّةَ على صُورَةِ الْقَمرِ لَيْلَةَ الْبدْرِ . ثُمَّ الَّذِينَ يلُونَهُمْ علَى أَشَدِّ كَوْكَبٍ دُرِّيٍّ في السَّمَاءِ إِضَاءَةً : لاَ يُبولُونَ ولاَ يتَغَوَّطُونَ ، ولاَ يتْفُلُونَ ، ولاَ يمْتَخِطُون . أمْشاطُهُمُ الذَّهَبُ ، ورشْحهُمُ المِسْكُ ، ومجامِرُهُمُ الأُلُوَّةُ ­ عُودُ الطِّيبِ ­ أَزْواجُهُم الْحُورُ الْعِينُ ، علَى خَلْقِ رجُلٍ واحِد ، علَى صُورَةِ أَبِيهِمْ آدم سِتُّونَ ذِراعاً في السَّماءِ » متفقٌ عليه .

وفي روايةٍ للبُخَارِيِّ ومُسْلِمٍ : آنيتُهُمْ فِيهَا الذَّهَبُ ، ورشْحُهُمْ المِسْكُ ، ولِكُلِّ واحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ زَوْجَتَانِ يُرَى مُخُّ سُوقِهما مِنْ وراءِ اللَّحْمِ مِنَ الْحُسْنِ ، لاَ اخْتِلاَفَ بينَهُمْ ، ولا تَبَاغُضَ : قُلُوبهُمْ قَلْبُ رَجُلٍ واحِدٍ ، يُسَبِّحُونَ اللَّه بُكْرةَ وَعَشِيّاً » .

قَوْلُهُ : « عَلَى خَلْقِ رجُلٍ واحِد » رواهُ بَعْضُهُمْ بِفَتْحِ الخَاءِ وإِسْكَانِ اللاَّمِ ، وبعْضُهُمْ بِضَمِّهِما ، وكِلاَهُما صَحِيحٌ .

1883- وَعَن المُغِيرَةِ بْن شُعْبَة رَضِي اللَّه عَنْهُ عنْ رسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « سأَل مُوسَى صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ربَّهُ ، ما أَدْنَى أَهْلِ الْجنَّةِ مَنْزلَةً ؟ قَالَ : هُو رَجُلٌ يجِيءُ بعْدَ ما أُدْخِل أَهْلُ الْجنَّةِ الْجَنَّةَ، فَيُقَالُ لَهُ : ادْخِلِ الْجنَّة . فَيقُولُ : أَيْ رَبِّ كَيْفَ وقَدْ نَزَل النَّاسُ منَازِلَهُمْ ، وأَخَذُوا أَخَذاتِهِم ؟ فَيُقَالُ لهُ : أَتَرضي أَنْ يكُونَ لَكَ مِثْلُ مُلْكِ مَلِكٍ مِنْ مُلُوكِ الدُّنْيا ؟ فَيقُولُ : رضِيتُ ربِّ ، فَيقُولُ : لَكَ ذَلِكَ ومِثْلُهُ ومِثْلُهُ ومِثْلُهُ ومِثْلُهُ ، فَيقُولُ في الْخَامِسَةِ: رضِيتُ ربِّ ، فَيَقُولُ : هَذَا لَكَ وعشَرةُ أَمْثَالِهِ ، ولَكَ ما اشْتَهَتْ نَفْسُكَ ، ولَذَّتْ عَيْنُكَ. فَيَقُولُ : رضِيتُ ربِّ ، قَالَ : ربِّ فَأَعْلاَهُمْ منْزِلَةً ؟ قال : أُولَئِك الَّذِينَ أَردْتُ ، غَرسْتُ كَرامتَهُمْ بِيدِي وخَتَمْتُ علَيْهَا ، فَلَمْ تَر عيْنُ ، ولَمْ تَسْمعْ أُذُنٌ ، ولَمْ يخْطُرْ عَلَى قَلْبِ بشَرٍ » رواهُ مُسْلم .

1884-­ وعن ابْنِ مسْعُودٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : قَال رسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم : « إِنِّي لأَعْلَمُ آخِرَ أَهْل النَّار خُرُوجاً مِنهَا ، وَآخِرَ أَهْل الْجنَّةِ دُخُولاً الْجنَّة . رجُلٌ يخْرُجُ مِنَ النَّارِ حبْواً ، فَيقُولُ اللَّه عزَّ وجَلَّ لَهُ : اذْهَبْ فَادخُلِ الْجنَّةَ ، فَيأْتِيهَا ، فيُخيَّلُ إِلَيْهِ أَنَّهَا مَلأَى ، فيَرْجِعُ ، فَيقُولُ : ياربِّ وجدْتُهَا مَلأى ، يَقُولُ اللَّه عزَّ وجلَّ لهُ : اذْهَبْ فَادْخُلِ الجنَّةَ ، فيأْتِيها ، فَيُخَيَّل إِلَيْهِ أَنَّهَا ملأى ، فَيرْجِعُ . فيَقُولُ : ياربِّ وجدْتُهَا مَلأى ، ، فَيقُولُ اللَّه عزَّ وجلَّ لهُ : اذْهَبْ فَادْخُلِ الْجَنَّةَ . فإِنَّ لَكَ مِثْلَ الدُّنْيا وعشَرةَ أَمْثَالِها ، أَوْ إِنَّ لَكَ مِثْل عَشرَةِ أَمْثَالِ الدُّنْيا ، فَيقُولُ : أَتَسْخَرُ بِي ، أَوَ أَتَضحكُ بِي وأَنْتَ الملِكُ » قَال : فَلَقَدْ رأَيْتُ رَسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم ضَحِكَ حَتَّى بدت نَوَاجذُهُ فَكَانَ يقُولُ : « ذَلِكَ أَدْنَى أَهْلِ الْجَنَّةِ منْزِلَةً » متفقٌ عليه .

1885- وَعَنْ أَبي مُوسَى رَضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « إِنَّ للْمُؤْمِنِ في الْجَنَّةِ لَخَيْمةً مِنْ لُؤْلُؤةٍ وَاحِدةٍ مُجوَّفَةٍ طُولُهَا في السَّماءِ سِتُّونَ ميلاً . للْمُؤْمِنِ فِيهَا أَهْلُونَ ، يَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمُ المُؤْمِنُ فَلاَ يَرى بعْضُهُمْ بَعْضاً» .

متَّفقٌ علَيْهِ : « المِيلُ » سِتَّة آلافِ ذِرَاعٍ .

1886- وَعَنْ أَبِي سَعِيدٍ الْخُدْرِيِّ رضِيَ اللَّه عَنْهُ عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَال : « إِنَّ في الْجنَّةِ لَشَجرَةً يسِيرُ الرَّاكِبُ الْجوادَ المُضَمَّرَ السَّرِيعَ ماِئَةَ سنَةٍ مَا يَقْطَعُهَا » متفقٌ عليه .

وَرَوَياهُ في « الصَّحِيحَيْنِ » أَيْضاً مِنْ روَايَةِ أَبِي هُريْرَةَ رَضِي اللَّه عنه قالَ : « يَسِيرُ الرَّاكِبُ في ظِلِّهَا ماِئَةَ سَنَةٍ مَا يَقْطَعُهَا » .

1887- وَعَنْهُ عَن النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « إنَّ أَهْلَ الْجنَّةِ لَيَتَرَاءُوْنَ أَهْلَ الْغُرَفِ مِنْ فَوْقِهِمْ كَمَا تَتَرَاءَوْنَ الكَوْكَبَ الدُّرَّيَّ الْغَابِرَ في الأُفُقِ مِنَ المشْرِقِ أَوِ المَغْربِ لتَفَاضُلِ ما بَيْنَهُمْ » قَالُوا : يَا رَسُولَ اللَّه ، تلْكَ مَنَازلُ الأَنْبِيَاءِ لاَ يبْلُغُهَا غَيْرُهُمْ ؟ قَالَ : « بلَى وَالَّذِي نَفْسِي بِيَدِهِ رجَالٌ أَمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وصَدَّقُوا المُرْسلِينَ » متفقٌ عليه .

1888- وعنْ أَبي هُريْرةَ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَال : « لَقَابُ قَوْسٍ في الْجَنَّةِ خَيْرٌ مِمَّا تَطْلُعُ علَيْهِ الشمْسُ أَوْ تَغْربُ » متفقٌ عليهِ .

1889- وعنْ أَنَسٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « إِنَّ في الْجنَّةِ سُوقاً يأْتُونَهَا كُلَّ جُمُعةٍ . فتَهُبُّ رِيحُ الشَّمالِ ، فَتحثُو في وُجُوهِهِمْ وثِيَابِهِمْ ، فَيزْدادُونَ حُسْناً وجَمالاً . فَيَرْجِعُونَ إِلَى أَهْلِيهِمْ ، وقَدْ ازْدَادُوا حُسْناً وجمالاً ، فَيقُولُ لَهُمْ أَهْلُوهُمْ : وَاللَّهِ لَقَدِ ازْدَدْتُمْ حُسْناً وجمالاً ، فَيقُولُونَ : وأَنْتُمْ وَاللَّهِ لَقَدِ ازْددْتُمْ بعْدَنَا حُسناً وَجمالاً ،» رواهُ مُسلِمٌ .

1890- وعنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ سعْدٍ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رسُولَ اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « إِنَّ أَهْلَ الْجنَّةِ لَيَتَراءَوْنَ الْغُرفَ في الْجنَّةِ كَمَا تَتَرَاءَوْنَ الْكَوْكَبَ في السَّماءِ » متفقٌ عليه .

1891- وَعنْهُ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ قَال : شَهِدْتُ مِنَ النَّبِيِّ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم مجْلِساً وَصفَ فِيهِ الْجَنَّةَ حتَّى انْتَهَى ، ثُمَّ قَال في آخِرِ حدِيثِهِ : « فِيهَا ما لاَ عيْنٌ رأَتْ ، ولا أُذُنٌ سمِعَتْ ، ولاَ خَطَر عَلى قَلْبِ بشَرٍ ، ثُمَّ قَرأَ { تتجافى جُنُوبُهُمْ عَنِ المضَاجِعِ } إِلى قَوْلِهِ تَعالَى : {فَلاَ تعْلَمُ نَفْسٌ ما أُخْفِيَ لَهُمْ مِنْ قُرَّةِ أَعْينٍ} .

رواهُ البخاري .

1892- وعنْ أَبِي سعِيدٍ وأَبي هُريْرةَ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُما أَنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَال : « إِذَا دخَلَ أَهْلُ الْجنَّةِ الجنَّةَ يُنَادِي مُنَادٍ : إِنَّ لَكُمْ أَنْ تَحْيَوْا ، فَلا تَمُوتُوا أَبداً وإِنَّ لكُمْ أَنْ تَصِحُّوا ، فَلاَ تَسْقَمُوا أَبداً ، وإِنَّ لَكُمْ أَنْ تَشِبُّوا فَلا تهْرَمُوا أَبداً وإِنَّ لَكُمْ أَن تَنْعمُوا ، فَلا تبؤسوا أَبَداً » رواهُ مسلم .

1893- وعَنْ أَبي هُريْرَةَ رضِي اللَّه عَنْهُ أَنَّ رَسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَالَ : « إِنَّ أَدْنَى مقْعَدِ أَحدِكُمْ مِنَ الْجنَّةِ أَنْ يقولَ لَهُ : تَمنَّ فَيَتَمنَّي ويتَمنَّي . فَيَقُولُ لَهُ : هلْ تَمنَّيْتَ ؟ فَيَقُولُ : نَعمْ فَيقُولُ لَهُ : فَإِنَّ لَكَ ما تَمنَّيْتَ ومِثْلَهُ معهُ » رَواهُ مُسْلِمٌ .

1894- وعنْ أَبِي سعِيدٍ الْخُدْرِيِّ رضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رسُول اللَّه صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَال : « إِنَّ اللَّه عزَّ وجلَّ يقُولُ لأهْل الْجنَّةِ : يا أَهْلَ الْجنَّة ، فَيقُولُونَ : لَبَّيْكَ ربَّنَا وسعْديْكَ ، والْخيرُ في يديْك فَيقُولُ : هَلْ رَضِيتُمْ ؟ فَيقُولُونَ : وما لَنَا لاَ نَرْضَيِ يا رَبَّنَا وقَدْ أَعْطَيْتَنَا ما لمْ تُعْطِ أَحداً مِنْ خَلْقِكَ ، فَيقُولُ : أَلاَ أُعْطِيكُمْ أَفْضَلَ مِنْ ذَلَكَ ؟ فَيقُولُونَ : وأَيُّ شَيْءِ أَفْضلُ مِنْ ذلِكَ ؟ فيقُولُ : أُحِلُّ عليْكُمْ رضْوانِي ، فَلا أَسْخَطُ عليْكُمْ بَعْدَهُ أَبَداً » متفق عليه .

1895- وعنْ جرِيرِ بْنِ عبْدِ اللَّهِ رضي اللَّه عنْهُ قال : كُنَّا عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم فَنَظَرَ إِلَى الْقَمرِ لَيْلَةَ الْبدْرِ ، وقَال :«إِنَّكُمْ ستَرَوْنَ رَبَّكُمْ عِياناً كما تَرَوْنَ هَذَا الْقَمرَ ، لاَ تُضامُونَ في رُؤْيتِهِ مُتَّفَقٌ علَيْهِ .

1896- وعنْ صُهَيْب رَضِي اللَّه عنْهُ أَنَّ رسُول اللَّهِ صَلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وسَلَّم قَال : « إِذَا دَخَل أَهْلَ الْجنَّةِ الجنَّةَ يقُولُ اللَّه تَباركَ وتَعالَى : تُرِيدُونَ شَيْئاً أَزِيدُكُمْ ؟ فَيقُولُونَ : أَلَمْ تُبيِّضْ وُجُوهَنَا ؟ أَلَمْ تُدْخِلْنَا الْجَنَّةَ وتُنَجِّنَا مِنَ النَّارِ ؟ فَيكْشِفُ الْحِجابَ ، فَما أُعْطُوا شَيْئاً أَحبَّ إِلَيهِمْ مِنَ النَّظَرِ إِلَى رَبِّهِمْ » رواهُ مُسْلِمٌ .

قَالَ تَعالَى:{ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمنُوا وعمِلُوا الصَّالِحاتِ يهْدِيهِمْ ربُّهُمْ بِإِيمانِهِمْ تَجْري مِنْ تَحْتِهِمُ الأَنْهَارُ في جنَّاتِ النَّعِيم ، دعْوَاهُمْ فِيهَا : سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ ، وتَحِيَّتُهُمْ فِيهَا سلامٌ وآخِرُ دعْواهُمْ أَنِ الْحمْدُ للَّهِ رَبِّ العالمِينَ } [يونس : 9].

الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذِي هَدانا لَهَذَا وما كُنَّا لنَهْتَدِيَ لَوْلاَ أَنْ هَدَانَا اللَّه : اللَّهُمَّ صلِّ عَلَى سيدِنَا مُحَمَّدٍ وعلَى آلِ مُحمَّدٍ، كَمَا صلَّيْتَ عَلَى إِبْراهِيم وعلَى آلِ إِبْراهِيمَ . وبارِكْ علَى مُحَمَّدٍ وعلَى آلِ مُحمَّدٍ ، كَمَا باركْتَ علَى إِبْرَاهِيمَ وعلَى آل إِبْراهِيمَ ، إِنَّكَ حمِيدٌ مجِيدٌ.

قَال مُؤلِّفُهُ يحيى النوَاوِيُّ غَفَر اللَّه لَهُ : « فَرغْتُ مِنْهُ يوْمَ الاثْنَيْن رابِعَ عَشرَ شهر رمضَانَ سَنَةَ سبْعينَ وَستِّمائة بدمشق » .
